Name: Emily McMath
Professional Bio: Emily joined the Kauffman Fellows team in December 2024 after three years of collaborating with the organization as a Project Manager at RockIt Events. During that time, she supported key Kauffman events—like Summits, Modules, and Treks—through speaker coordination, content planning, and behind-the-scenes support.Now as Network Manager, Emily works closely with the Head of Network to foster meaningful connections across the Kauffman community, both in person and online. With her creative flair, genuine enthusiasm, and passion for building relationships, she’s excited to be part of the team helping Kauffman Fellows thrive.

Name: Madeleine Light
Professional Bio:
Madeleine Light is the Pathways Program Manager at Kauffman Fellows, where she leads the design and delivery of the Pathways Program—tactical learning tracks that Fellows select for virtual learning as a complement to their two-year core curriculum. Each track helps Fellows deepen expertise in fundraising, firm building, or investment strategy.

Prior to Kauffman Fellows, Madeleine was a Program Manager at Techstars, where she led accelerator programs supporting pre-seed founders as they built and scaled high-growth startups. She also directed entrepreneurship initiatives at the University of Colorado Boulder’s Deming Center for Entrepreneurship, and previously founded a clothing company focused on custom design for touring musicians and artists.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | LPs,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Bailey Farrell
Professional Bio:
Bailey is the Program Manager at Kauffman Fellows. She manages the logistics and delivery of the core Kauffman Fellows two-year leadership program. This program includes venture capitalists who are shaping the future of the industry. She delivers impeccable customer service, leadership, administration, logistics, exceptional communication, and organization to her team and the Fellows. 
Prior, she worked at Meta, colleges in Ireland, and other educational programs. 
She has a master's degree in Psychology from Trinity College Dublin; she is a friendly, loyal, and ambitious individual who loves working with people, building relationships, and helping others reach their goals.

Name: Kirsten Owens
Professional Bio: blah blah
Education/Personal Bio:
Raised in the San Francisco Bay Area, Kirsten graduated cum laude with a BS in industrial/organizational psychology from California State University, East Bay.

Kirsten now lives in beautiful Bainbridge Island, WA with her husband and daughter. She has a passion for traveling both locally and internationally, loves fitness (especially weight lifting), and enjoys finding new places to enjoy a great meal.

Name: Dani Terminel
Professional Bio: Dani is all about entrepreneurship. She spent over a decade supporting entrepreneurs at Endeavor, where she was a key architect of the network experience for over 2,000 high-impact entrepreneurs from multiple industries and scaled the organization to more than 30 markets. After more than ten years at Endeavor, Dani jumped into entrepreneurship herself, co-founding and leading Elephant in a Box, a material science company specializing in honeycomb-inspired structures for furniture and beyond. Throughout her extensive career, Daniela has recognized the pivotal role of robust networks in driving sustainable global change. Now, as the VP of Network at Kauffman, she brings her entrepreneurial experience, strategic thinking, and a sincere dedication to fostering meaningful connections in the entrepreneurial landscape.

Name: Lisa Doherty
Education/Personal Bio: She graduated from St. Mary’s College of California and earned her CPA at a firm in San Francisco. Lisa lives part of the year in Lake Tahoe enjoying the outdoor adventures available but truthfully happiest lounging with a book or playing cards with the family.

Name: Trish Costello
Professional Bio: Trish is the co-founder, first CEO and CEO Emeritus of the Kauffman Fellows Program, beginning with its founding in 1993 at the Kauffman Foundation. She was the first President of the Kauffman Fellows Fund of Funds Holding Corp.  Trish was on the start-up team of the Kauffman Foundation’s Center for Entrepreneurship.  She is the founder and General Partner of Portfolia, ventures funds designed for sophisticated women limited partners. Trish created the first venture capital funds focused on women’s health and Portfolia is the most active investor in the sector with 54 investments.  Its 14 funds invest from seed to pre-IPO, in women’s health, longevity, sustainability, and companies that over-index for people of color, with over 2,000 limited partners throughout the US and globally. Notable investments among its 110+ portfolio companies, include Maven Clinic, Everly Health, Madison Reed, Canela Media and GrubMarket. Trish advises various non-profits  and governmental entities, serving on the National Science Foundation SBIR AdCom, The Motley Fool Foundation, The SBA Advisory Board, Springboard Enterprises, and the NVCA Education Committee.  Trish lives in Tiburon, CA.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Chloe LeValley
Professional Bio: Chloe joined the Kauffman Fellows team in August 2024 and manages the newsletter and social media for the network, spotlighting venture-backed investments, community milestones, and leadership insights. She plays a key role in amplifying the network’s impact and strengthening connections through strategic storytelling. She brings journalism and digital storytelling experience, having reported for The Seattle Times Affiliate Newspapers and helped businesses grow through podcasting. She earned a BA in Media Communications from San Francisco State University and studied at the Danish School of Media and Journalism. Chloe is also building Melo, an AI-powered tool for video podcast search and recommendations. In her free time, she enjoys surfing and spending time with her husband.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: ABDULAZIZ SHIKH AL SAGHA
Professional Bio: Abdulaziz is a General Partner and leads the investments team. He has been an active investor in the venture space since 2012 and is also a co-founder and managing partner at Oryx Ventures, a firm focused on growth-stage venture investing in the US that has backed companies including Cohesity, DataRobot, Palantir, and Versa Networks.
Education/Personal Bio: BSc in Business Management from Kings College London.

Name: Alan Feld
Professional Bio:
Alan Feld is the Founder and Managing Partner of Vintage Investment Partners. Vintage Investment Partners is Israel’s leading venture fund of funds, secondary fund and late stage co-investment team. The firm today manages $2.3 billion through 13 funds and a managed account. Vintage tracks over 500 venture funds and more than 8,500 private technology companies.
Prior to founding Vintage in 2002, Alan Feld was a general partner at Israel Seed Partners and at Vertex Ventures. Prior to Vertex, Alan was the Managing Director of Evergreen Capital Markets/Robertson Stephens Israel. Before moving to Israel in 1994, Alan was at Goodman’s (Toronto), one of Canada’s leading corporate law firms.
Education/Personal Bio:
Alan is the Founding Chairman of the PowerInDiversityIsrael Initiative (www.powerindiversityisrael.com), focused on bringing more women and minorities into the Israeli high tech industry. He was also Founding Chairman of StartUp Jerusalem, a non-profit organization run by Israeli and Palestinian businesspeople helping to foster job growth in Jerusalem. He served as Chairman of the Steering Committee of the Be’eri project, an initiative of the Hartman Institute, and is also a former board member of the Israel Democracy Institute and the Jewish Funders Network (US). Alan also served as Associate Chairman of the Canadian Jewish Congress, President of the North American Jewish Students Network and a board member of the Canada Israel Committee and Kolot (Jerusalem), a pluralistic adult Jewish education program.
Alan received an MBA from York University in Toronto, an L.L.B. from Osgoode Hall Law School in Toronto and a B.A. in Commerce and Finance from the University of Toronto.
Alan is married to Dr. LeeOna Fisher Feld, has five children and two grandchildren and lives in Caesarea Israel.

Name: Alex Bard
Professional Bio: Alex is a career technology entrepreneur, executive and angel investor. Prior to joining Redpoint Ventures in 2017 as Managing Director, Alex co-founded eShare technologies, eAssist Global Solutions, and Goowy Media. Alex served as Chief Executive Officer at Campaign Monitor and has also served as Executive Vice President & General Manager of the Service Cloud business at Salesforce.com, which acquired Assistly, Inc., where Alex served as Founder and Chief Executive Officer. He currently serves as a member of the board of directors of several companies including AppZen, hims, Kustomer and Qualified.

Name: Alison Davis
Professional Bio:
Alison Davis is Chairman and Managing Partner of Blockchain Coinvestors, the leading blockchain venture fund of funds with investments in 600+ blockchain companies and projects and approximately 60% of all blockchain unicorns. She is an experienced corporate executive, public company board director, an active investor in growth companies and a best-selling author on the topics of technology and innovation. She 
is currently serving as a Managing Partner of Blockchain Coinvestors Acquisition Corp. 1 (SPAC).
Alison is currently a non-executive director of Silicon ValleyBank (“SIVB”), Fiserv (“FISV”), Janus Henderson Group (“JHG”), Collibra and Pacaso. She is the Chairman of the Advisory Board for Blockchain Capital, and an advisor to Bitwise.
She is a former director of RBS (“RBS”), City National Bank (“CYC”), Diamond Foods (“DMND”), First Data Corporation (“FDC”), Ooma (“OOMA”), Unisys (“UIS”) Xoom (“XOOM”), and many private companies and was the Chairman of LECG (“XPRT”) until its sale in 2011. Alison is a frequent speaker on corporate 
governance.
Alison was previously the Managing Partner of Belvedere Capital, a regulated bank holding company and private equity firm focused on investing in US banks and financial services firms where she worked closely with the Federal Reserve, The OCC, the FDIC and various state banking regulators. 

Prior to this, Alison was the Chief Financial Officer of Barclays Global Investors (now BlackRock), the world’s largest institutional investment firm with more than $1.5 trillion of assets under management. Earlier in her career, Alison spent 14 years as a strategy consultant and advisor to Fortune 500 CEOs, boards and executive teams with McKinsey & Company, and as a practice leader with A.T. Kearney where she built and led the global Financial Services Practice. She is a bestselling author (The Intelligent Investor –Silicon Valley, Blockchain Competitive Advantage, Corporate Innovation in the Fifth Era, Build your Fortune in the Fifth Era).

Alison is active in the community supporting non-profits and social enterprises as a board director, 
fundraiser and volunteer. She has been frequently named a “Most Influential Women in Business” by 
the San Francisco Business Times.
Education/Personal Bio:
Alison received a B.A. Honors and a Master’s in Economics from Cambridge University in England, and an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business after completing the first-year at Harvard. 

Alison was born in Sheffield, England, is now a dual US/UK citizen and has lived for the last 25 years in the San Francisco Bay Area where she raised her family with her husband, Matthew C. Le Merle.MBA - Stanford GSB 1988

Name: Amish Jani
Professional Bio:
Amish Jani is a Co-Founder and Partner at FirstMark, where he focuses on investments across the cloud landscape, including Enterprise Applications, Commerce Infrastructure, Vertical Software and more.

He has led early investments in industry-defining companies including Shopify (NASDAQ:SHOP), Frame.io (acquired by Adobe), Zilla Security (acquired by CyberArk), Pendo, Tracelink, Gravie, Loop, IMImobile (LSE: IMO, acquired by Cisco), Schoology (acquired by PowerSchool), Boomi (acquired by Dell), Aveksa (acquired by EMC), and more.

Amish has been recognized by CB Insights and the New York Times as a Top 100 Venture Capitalist globally, and named to Business Insider’s The Seed 100 (best early-stage investors) and 50 Most Important VCs in New York lists multiple times. He is Co-Founder of CloudNY, New York’s preeminent annual summit for the world’s top Cloud CEOs, and leads the FirstMark Founders Guild — a private community for New York’s most promising seed-stage Founders.

Prior to founding FirstMark, Amish served as a Partner with Pequot Ventures. Amish holds both a B.S. and an M.B.A. from the Wharton School of Business at the University of Pennsylvania. He also serves on the Undergraduate Executive Board of Wharton.

Name: Andy Weissman
Professional Bio: Andy Weissman is a managing partner at Union Square Ventures. Andy began his career in the Internet in the mid-90s. Prior to joining USV, in 2007 he co-founded betaworks, which both created and invested in social, real-time applications and services. Andy was born in New York City and has a BA from Wesleyan University and a JD from Georgetown.
Education/Personal Bio: see above

Name: Andy Wheeler
Professional Bio:
As an engineer who got his start in the MIT Media Lab, Andy Wheeler specializes in helping early-stage companies build technologies from concept to commercial launch. He leads GV’s investments in frontier technology and has backed breakthrough companies across manufacturing, agriculture, robotics, logistics, and food. Andy’s investments include Bowery Farming, Farmers Business Network, and Zipline.

Before joining GV in 2012, Andy served as the Chief Technology Officer for two companies in the smart energy space, Tendril Networks and Adura. He also co-founded Ember Corporation, which made software and chips for wireless mesh networks used in millions of smart meters worldwide. Andy began his career at Zipcar, where he developed the embedded wireless technology that powers the car-sharing service.   

Andy received a Bachelor of Science and Master of Engineering in electrical engineering and computer science from MIT. He was selected for the Technology Review 100 Top Innovators Under 35 award and holds multiple patents in wireless networking and energy management.
Education/Personal Bio: Andy is an instrument rated private pilot who enjoys flying to go backpacking and skiing.

Name: Ankur Jain
Professional Bio: Ankur is a Founding Partner at Emergent Ventures. Prior to Emergent, Ankur has been a venture investor across US, India and Israel at Nexus Venture Partners and Blumberg Capital. Prior to that, Ankur led product teams at Andiamo Systems and later Cisco which acquired Andiamo in 2004. Prior to that, Ankur held engineering roles at Softaware Networks and later at Digital Island, which acquired Softaware Networks in 2000. Ankur’s investments include Observe.ai, Accel Data, BoostUp, SupportLogic, Talview, UptimeAI, Rocketium, Braze (IPO), Arcion Labs (acquired by Databricks), Minjar (acquired by Nutanix), Bitfusion (acquired by VMWare), Orkus (Acquired by Sailpoint), Arkin (acquired by VMware) and Cyvera (acquired by Palo Alto Networks).
Education/Personal Bio: Ankur holds a Bachelors in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT Delhi, a Masters in Computer Science from UCLA, and an MBA in Management from the Wharton School where he graduated as a Palmer Scholar. Ankur is also a co-inventor for five technology patents. Ankur has been a frequent speaker in conferences and forums such as TedX on investing, personal growth & consciousness and is a keen practitioner of yoga and meditation.

Name: Dame Anne Glover
Professional Bio:
Anne co-founded Amadeus in 1997 with Hermann Hauser. Building on her scientific training and operating experience, Anne has been a venture capitalist for over 30 years.
 
Early in her career Anne lived in the US, working in manufacturing with Cummins Engine Company and in strategy consulting with Bain & Co, before returning to the UK to join Apax Partners in 1989 to
invest in Early Stage companies. She became COO of one of her investee companies, Virtuality Group, after it listed on the London Stock Exchange in 1993, and then returned to investing as a business angel before co-founding Amadeus in 1997.
 
A former Chairman of the British Private Equity and Venture Capital Association and Invest Europe, Anne was appointed Non-Executive Director of the Court of the Bank of England in 2018 and in 2019 became a member of the Investment Committee of Yale Corporation, which is responsible for oversight of the Yale University Endowment. In 2021, Anne was appointed as an external member of the Venture Capital Investment Committee of British International Investment, the UK’s development finance institution.
Education/Personal Bio: Anne holds an MA degree in Metallurgy & Materials Science from University of Cambridge and a Master’s degree in Public and Private Management from Yale School of Management. She was awarded a CBE in 2006 for services to business; and in 2008 made an Honorary Fellow of the Royal Academy of Engineering; in 2021 she became a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh; and in 2023 became an Honorary Fellow of Clare College, Cambridge.

Name: Ashish Shastry
Job Title: Partner, Co-Head of Asia Pacific Private Equity and Head of Southeast Asia
Professional Bio: Ashish Shastry joined KKR in 2016 as a Partner and serves as the Co-Head of Private Equity for KKR Asia Pacific, and the Head of Southeast Asia. Prior to joining KKR, Mr. Shastry served as a managing partner of Northstar Group for five years, which at the time managed over $2 billion in private equity and venture capital funds with a focus on Southeast Asia. Prior to joining Northstar, he worked at TPG Capital for 13 years, ultimately running TPG’s Southeast Asia business. Mr. Shastry also previously worked as an investment banker at Lehman Brothers in New York. He currently serves or has previously served on the boards of Goodpack, PropertyGuru, Voyager Innovations (parent company of Maya Bank), Bank BTPN, Metro Pacific Hospital Holdings, Parkway Holdings and Parkway Trust Management (manager of Parkway Life REIT).
Education/Personal Bio: Ashish Shastry graduated from Princeton University with an A.B. degree in economics (with honors) and currently serves on the advisory board of the Princeton Institute for International and Regional Studies.

Name: Beezer Clarkson
Professional Bio:
Beezer is Co-founder & Partner at Sapphire Partners, the LP arm of Sapphire Ventures, where she aims to invest in exceptional early-stage venture funds in the U.S., Europe and Israel – both emerging and established/franchise VCs. She has worked in venture as a direct and indirect investor as well as in the technology ecosystem since 2001. She holds a BA from Wesleyan University where she currently advises the endowment, has an MBA from Harvard Business School and serves on the board of the NVCA.
Recognizing early on that LPs operate in an opaque corner of the ecosystem, Beezer co-founded OpenLP to demystify the LP perspective and share wisdom and insights not taught elsewhere.  
As part of this initiative, she also co-hosts the Origins Podcast with Nick Chirls, partner of Asylum Ventures – the only podcast hosted by both a GP and an LP. Together, they talk to top thought leaders across the venture ecosystem to share how the best investors do what they do.

Name: Bernard Dalle
Professional Bio:
Bernard is Special Advisor to Index Ventures, a venture capital firm based in London, San Francisco and Geneva, helping entrepreneurs turn bold ideas into transformative global businesses. 

Bernard joined Index in 1997 as a member of the firm’s founding team and stepped down as the firm’s General Partner and Operating Partner at the end of 2021. Mr. Dallé spent the first 13 years with Index as an investment partner with a focus on enterprise software, and led investments in and was a director of numerous cloud computing, security and open source companies, among them Datadog, Mimecast and Pentaho (IBM). He was promoted to the firm’s sole Operating Partner in 2012. In his role as the firm’s Operating Partner, Bernard chaired the Investment Committee and oversaw portfolio construction and liquidity management for Index’s entire family of funds, including seed, venture and growth. He steered firm governance and partnership dynamics. He was also responsible for all aspects of the firm’s operations, including talent and compensation, capital raising, investor relations, legal and compliance, finance, as well as technology. 

Prior to joining Index, Bernard was a management consultant for McKinsey’s Swiss office, focusing on retail banking.Prior to McKinsey, Bernard was first a systems analyst/ IT project manager and then a financial analyst at Procter & Gamble, where he spent four years. 

Bernard is a member of the Investment Committee of Paul Hamlyn Foundation, one of the largest independent grant-making foundations in the UK. Bernard is also a member of the Global Advisory Board of the Kellogg school of Management as well as a trustee of the Northwestern University (USA) Foundation Limited. He also serves as an Advisor to Memcyco, an Israeli cyber-security company, and P1 Venture Partners, an early-stage venture capital firm focused on Africa.
Education/Personal Bio: Bernard received a BS/MS in Electrical Engineering from EPFL (École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne) and an MBA from Northwestern University - Kellogg School of Management. He resides in London with his wife and three children.

Name: Bill Maris
Professional Bio:
Bill Maris is the founder of Section 32, a venture capital fund investing at the frontiers of technology and healthcare. Bill’s investments have to date resulted in over 150 exits and more than 50 companies that have grown to over $1B in value.
Prior to Section 32, Bill spent almost a decade at Google / Alphabet as the founder and first CEO of Google Ventures and served as Vice President of Special Projects. He worked closely with the Google founders, helped incubate and launch Google X, Waymo, and Verily, and led global investment activities for Google and Alphabet. During his tenure at Google, Bill was involved with the panoply of cutting-edge technologies and projects at Google, ranging from cybersecurity to cloud infrastructure, aviation, renewable energy, and robotics.
A lifelong entrepreneur — Bill previously founded one of the world’s first web-hosting companies, and while at Google founded Calico, a multi-billion dollar company focused on life extension and the genetic basis of aging. Bill was a board member of Nest and recruited the CEOs of Verily, Chronicle, and Calico.
Bill previously worked at Sweden’s Investor AB, and in the mid-2000s, he partnered with entrepreneur David Green to transfer a novel hydrophobic acrylic lens to Aurolab to treat and cure cataract blindness in the developing world. It has since helped prevent or cure cataract blindness in more than 40 million people worldwide.
Bill has a degree in neuroscience from Middlebury College, and his background includes research at the Duke University School of Medicine, Department of Neurobiology.
Education/Personal Bio:
Bill Maris is the founder of Section 32, a venture capital fund investing at the frontiers of technology and healthcare. Bill’s investments have to date resulted in over 150 exits and more than 50 companies that have grown to over $1B in value.
Prior to Section 32, Bill spent almost a decade at Google / Alphabet as the founder and first CEO of Google Ventures and served as Vice President of Special Projects. He worked closely with the Google founders, helped incubate and launch Google X, Waymo, and Verily, and led global investment activities for Google and Alphabet. During his tenure at Google, Bill was involved with the panoply of cutting-edge technologies and projects at Google, ranging from cybersecurity to cloud infrastructure, aviation, renewable energy, and robotics.
A lifelong entrepreneur — Bill previously founded one of the world’s first web-hosting companies, and while at Google founded Calico, a multi-billion dollar company focused on life extension and the genetic basis of aging. Bill was a board member of Nest and recruited the CEOs of Verily, Chronicle, and Calico.

It has since helped prevent or cure cataract blindness in more than 40 million people worldwide.
Bill has a degree in neuroscience from Middlebury College, and his background includes research at the Duke University School of Medicine, Department of Neurobiology.

Name: Boris Golden
Professional Bio: Boris is a Seed VC and Partner at Partech, passionate about working with Founders from the very beginning of their entrepreneurial journey. Based in Paris, he is a former entrepreneur, startup mentor, product guy & computer scientist.

Name: Boris Wertz
Professional Bio:
Boris Wertz is founding partner of Version One Ventures and one of the top early-stage tech investors in North America. Born in Germany and based in Vancouver, Boris takes a wide-angle view to find great companies regardless of location, backing mission-driven founders in the earliest stages. 

Today, the Version One portfolio includes more than 100 startups across crypto/web 3, climate/energy, marketplaces and SaaS with incredible companies like Ada, Coinbase, Dapper Labs, Jobber, Outreach, Shippo and Uniswap changing the way we live and work. 
 
Before becoming an investor, Boris built an online marketplace for used and out-of-print books in 1999, selling the business to AbeBooks.com where he became COO and led a team of 60 people. After AbeBooks.com was sold to Amazon, he moved into investing, first as an angel and now with Version One. With this deep operational experience, Boris helps other entrepreneurs scale their companies and navigate each stage of the startup journey.
Education/Personal Bio: Boris completed his PhD at the Graduate School of Management (WHU) Koblenz, majoring in Business Economics & Business Management. In 2005, he was named the Pacific Ernst & Young Entrepreneur of the Year. Boris is passionate about science, technology and entrepreneurship and sits on the board of Canada Learning Code. He is also involved as a mentor with the Creative Destructive Lab in Toronto and Vancouver.

Name: Brett Brewer
Professional Bio:
Brett Brewer is a Co-Founder and Managing Director of Crosscut, with a long track record of building, operating, and selling successful companies. He started his career as an early internet pioneer, co-founding Intermix Media in 1997, just two years after graduating from UCLA. Under his leadership, Intermix Media launched several successful businesses, including Myspace, Skilljam.com, and Alena. MySpace was sold to News Corporation in 2005.
After his time at Intermix Media, Brett became President of Adknowledge, where he oversaw operations for the online advertising company. During his tenure, Adknowledge grew to over 350 employees across the globe and achieved annual revenues exceeding $300 million. Brett now serves as Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors.
In addition to his successful career as an entrepreneur and executive, Brett is also an accomplished angel investor. His passion for investing and mentoring start-ups ultimately led to his co-founding of Crosscut.
Education/Personal Bio:
Brett has also dedicated his time and philanthropy to bringing education and technology to underserved and vulnerable communities. He has served on the boards of Alliance and After School All Stars, which brings high-quality after-school programming to tens of thousands of young people across the nation. During the Covid-19 pandemic, Brett founded the LA Tech Cares initiative to bring internet connection and WiFi to Alliance Scholars to keep them on their path to college through the hardest days of the pandemic.
Brett is a sought-after international speaker, with numerous industry event appearances, including Sydney's Social-Con, the Goldman Sachs Internet Conference, the Gridley Conference, and the ThinkEquity Growth Conference, among others. He has also spoken at prestigious events such as the Red Herring, the Venice Festival of Media, the Dow Jones VentureWire, and the Montgomery Technology Conference.
Brett was recently recognized with the Frank E. Baxter Heroes Award, named after Alliance founding board member Frank E. Baxter.

Name: Brett Hurt
Professional Bio:
Brett Hurt is the CEO and co-founder of data.world, an Austin-based Certified B Corporation and public benefit corporation. data.world makes it easy for everyone—not just the "data people"—to get clear, accurate, fast answers to any business question. data.world's cloud-native data catalog maps its customers siloed, distributed data to familiar and consistent business concepts, creating a unified body of knowledge anyone can find, understand, and use. data.world is also home to the world’s largest collaborative open data community, including public COVID-19 datasets. In 2017, 2018, and 2019, data.world was honored on the “Best for the World” list by B Lab that recognizes the top 10% of all B Corps globally. And in 2020, data.world was named by the Austin Business Journal as one of the top-three companies to work for. Brett is also the co-owner of Hurt Family Investments (HFI), alongside his wife, Debra. HFI are involved in 123 startups, 40 VC funds, and multiple philanthropic endeavors. 

Brett co-founded and led Bazaarvoice as CEO, through its IPO, follow-on offering, and two acquisitions. Bazaarvoice became the largest public SaaS (Software as a Service) business in social commerce and was named by the WSJ as one of the top IPOs of 2012. Brett also founded and led Coremetrics, which was rated the #1 Web analytics solution by Forrester Research and, like Bazaarvoice, expanded into a global company and leader. Coremetrics was acquired by IBM in 2010 for around $300m. 

In 2017, Brett was given the Best CEO Legacy Award by the Austin Business Journal. He is a Henry Crown Fellow and Braddock Scholar at the Aspen Institute. Brett began programming at age seven and doing so on the Internet at age eighteen.  He finished his book, “The Entrepreneur’s Essentials”, in August 2019 (available at databrett.medium.com for free).
Education/Personal Bio: Brett received his BBA in Management Information Systems from the University of Texas at Austin in 1994 and his MBA in High-Tech Entrepreneurship from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania in 1999.

Name: Brian Jacobs
Professional Bio:
When Brian founded Emergence Capital with Jason Green and Gordon Ritter, he wanted to build a culture of that combined winning BIG with humility. “We knew that we would compete with other strong venture firms in Silicon Valley who had established brands and really smart people. Our competitive advantage is our tight focus and our coordinated teamwork.” Intacct was a tiny company with less than $2 million of revenue when Brian recognized its potential to be a leader in the massive accounting software category. As the lead investor, he coached the management team as it established a scalable sales and marketing process, raised almost $100 million and sold the company to Sage Group in 2017.

Brian was named to the Forbes Midas List in 2006 and 2007. He is a board member of Bill.com, Impartner, Drivewyze, Eversight and InsideView and AASCEND (the Autism Aspergers Spectrum Coalition for Education, Networking and Development.)

In 2019, Brian was named to the faculty at Stanford Graduate School of Management were he co-teaches a course on angel and venture capital financing. Brian is also the founder of Moai Capital, a seed capital firm that makes early stage investments in areas outside of Emergence Capital’s focus.

Prior to Emergence Capital, Brian had help to launch another venture capital firm. He was an early general partner at St. Paul Venture Capital (funded by Traveler’s Insurance) where he led the Silicon Valley office and helped to grow the firm to over $3 billion under management. Previously, Brian worked as a product development engineer for the Raychem Corporation, where he developed advanced software and electronic systems for military aircraft. He also has engineering and product development experience with RCA, Westinghouse, and Polaroid, and he holds several patents. Brian has a MS and BS in mechanical engineering from M.I.T. and an MBA from Stanford.

He is happily married with two children, and enjoys international travel, ancient stone structures, cycling and cross-country skiing.

Name: Carlos Aiza
Professional Bio:
Carlos Aiza has worked on the most innovative capital markets and corporate finance transactions in Mexican history, including the first and second-ever Special Purpose Acquisition Company (SPAC) IPOs, the first, second and third-ever Master Limited Partnership (FIBRA E) IPOs, the three largest Real Estate Investment Trust (FIBRA) IPOs and the first-ever telecom tower FIBRA IPO, the first, second and third-ever international CERPI public listings, the first-ever public listing of equity development certificates known as CKDs, the first-ever Mexican cross-border whole loan, domestic mortgage-backed and domestic auto loan securitizations, the first asset-backed commercial paper conduit, the largest-ever Debtor-in-Possession financing, and many of the largest Mexican workouts in recent history.
In 2018, the Financial Times recognized Mr. Aiza as one of the “10 Most Innovative Lawyers in North America”, the first Mexican lawyer to be so recognized. In 2022, has was recognized as an Eminent Practitioner by Chambers and Partners and included in The Legal 500’s Hall of Fame for both Banking & Finance and Capital Markets.
Best Lawyers named Mr. Aiza “Lawyer of the Year” in Mexico for Structured Finance in 2020, 2018, 2014 and 2010, for Capital Markets in 2015 and for Banking and Finance in 2012. In 2014, Lawyer Monthly Magazine recognized him as one of the “World’s 100 Leading Capital Markets Lawyers” in its Leading Lawyer 100-Capital Markets, the only Mexican lawyer to be so recognized. In 2010, Latin Business Chronicle named Mr. Aiza one of the Top 50 Lawyers in Latin America, and LatinLawyer named him “Law Firm Leader of the Year 2010”.
Education/Personal Bio: Mr. Aiza obtained his law degree (JD) from the Universidad Iberoamericana School of Law in 1991, and his Masters in Law in 1993 from Georgetown University Law Center, where he is currently a member of the Latin America Alumni Board and of the CAROLA Leadership Counsel. Mr. Aiza is an Adjunct Professor of Securities Law at the TEC de Monterrey in Mexico City.

Name: Carlos Quiros
Professional Bio:
Committed with empowering people to help them achieve their full potential in building a better world.
After a successful career of 20 years in consulting with KPMG in Costa Rica and Central America , he co-founded Solutions to Business (S2B) in 2000 and in 2002 was granted the EY franchise for Central America, Panama and Dominican Republic (EYCA), of which he is currently Chairman and CEO. EYCA currently employs close to 2000 professionals and provides integrated solutions to a wide range of multilatinas, multinationals and family businesses in all industry sectors in the region in the fields such as: Tax Advisory, Transactions, Legal Services, Strategy, Technology Consulting (including robotics, blockchain, data analytics, cybersecurity, artificial intelligences, ERP implementations, among others) and Assurance. EYCA’s success is closely associated to its strategy of building long lasting relationships aimed at potentiating, in a sustainable manner, the growth and profitability of its clients.
Member of the Presidential Advisory Council (PAC) of INCAE Business School. Member of Young President’s Organization (YPO) chapters in Costa Rica and Euro-Latam. And member of the board of directors of Carao Ventures, among others. Married with 3 children and 3 grandchildren. Enjoys practicing Chi Kung, Tennis, Scuba Diving. He lives in San Jose, Costa Rica.
Education/Personal Bio: MBA

Name: Charles Hudson
Professional Bio:
Charles Hudson is the Managing Partner and Founder of Precursor Ventures, an early­ stage venture capital firm focused on investing in the first institutional round of investment for the most promising software and hardware companies. Under his leadership, Precursor Ventures has raised four funds and has over $175 million under management. He has invested in 250 companies and supported more than 400 founders, including the teams behind Clearco, Juniper Square, The Athletic, Incredible Health, Carrot, and Pair Eyewear. 
Prior to founding Precursor Ventures, Charles was a Partner at Uncork Capital and Co­Founder and CEO of Bionic Panda Games. He holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a B.A. in Economics and Spanish from Stanford University. 
Charles maintains close connections with his alma mater through volunteer service and teaching at GSB. He is an active member of the VC community, serving on several advisory boards and as a mentor to a number of emerging managers. Charles also serves on the Advisory Board for the San Francisco Opera Association.

Name: Chris Fralic
Professional Bio:
Chris has over 35 years of technology industry experience, with significant Internet business development roles since 1996. He was VP of Business Development at social bookmarking and tagging company del.icio.us through the Yahoo! acquisition. He was also an early employee and VP of Business Development at Half.com starting in 1999, and after the eBay acquisition spent six years at eBay in a variety of business development, media, and entertainment roles.

Chris has attended the TED Conference for over 25 years and worked with them in 2006 to help launch TEDTalks, which have now been viewed over 10 billion times. He teaches and guest lectures widely and is involved with several non-profits and museums.

Several of his First Round investments became public companies, including Roblox, Warby Parker, and Double Verify. Some of his investments have been acquired, including Ring (Amazon), Hotel Tonight (AirBnB), Flurry (Yahoo!), Invite Media (Google), Demdex (Adobe), Adaptly (Accenture), Yapta (Coupa), CoTweet (ExactTarget then Salesforce), Troops and Clipboard (Salesforce), and Arbor.io and Circulate (Axciom).
Education/Personal Bio: Villanova undergrad and St. Joseph's University MBA

Name: chris majer
Professional Bio:
Mr. Majer is the Founder and CEO of the Human Potential Project, a Seattle based firm that specializes in building contemporary corporate cultures and leadership in enterprises of all sizes. He has worked with a number of start-ups to put in place scalable practices to enable rapid and sustainable growth and worked with some of the top tier companies like Microsoft, Intel, Capital One, Amgen, Cargill and a host of others to revitalize stale cultures. 

His firm began in the early 80's working exclusively with athletes and soldiers, people who are under constant pressure to perform.  Early clients included U.S. National and Olympic teams, professional teams, and elite military units including the Army Special Forces and Marines.  He turned his attention to the corporate world in the late 80's and has been designing and delivery high impact programs since. 

He is the author of 20 while papers, numerous published articles and his book, the Power to Transform is on its third publishing run.  He has been featured on the Today Show, McNeil Lerher, People, Mens Health, GQ, and innumerable news paper, radio shows and pod casts.
Education/Personal Bio:
Chris was born and raised in Spokane Wa, where he was tagged to be the third generation owner of the family Ford Dealership.  Breaking with that tradition (and telling his father that he just couldn't see himself wearing a white belt, white shoes and selling Pintos) he went to the University of Washington where he earned a BA, an MPA and captained the Rugby team.  

He worked in the King County Executives' office long enough to determine that Government wasn't for him and left to spend 2 years community to Alaska where he traveled around South East putting together village corporations to help implement the Native Claims Settlement Act. 

He started his own company in 1982 and in 85 put together a business plan and raised $500k to launch the firm into the corporate world.  He still keeps his hands in working with athletes and has been through the ups and downs of running a firm that has ranged from 2 to 125 team members.

Name: Christian Dargnat
Professional Bio:
Christian Dargnat founded Alphee Consulting, a Finance boutique, in 2016. Operating worldwide, the firm was founded with a view to combine financial expertise, strategic advisory and communication and geopolitical advice under the same roof.
With over 30 years of experience in the field of investment strategy and asset management and a strong recognition as one of France’s most prominent bankers in his generation, Christian Dargnat also has a strong background in economics and geopolitics. 
Prior to setting up Alphée Consulting, he served as Chief Executive Officer of BNP Paribas Asset Management from 2006 to 2016 and as head of influential asset management trade body EFAMA from 2011 to 2015. Since leaving BNPP in 2016, Christian has served as an independent advisor to various organizations worldwide.
Education/Personal Bio:
Christian Dargnat graduated with Master’s degree in Economics and Finance from the University of Paris Dauphine (DEA), Paris, France in 1988. 
He is fluent in English and Italian. 
He was athlete in the French national team of Marathon.
He is lecturer at Sciences Po and HEC

Name: Cristiano Souza
Professional Bio: Senior Partner at Dynamo, an investment partnership founded in 1993 in Brazil that manages US$ 4 billion globally  in long term equity investment strategies.
Education/Personal Bio: BA in Economics from Universidade Candido Mendes.  Born in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, 48 years old.  Residing in London for the past 7 years.

Name: Dasha Maggio
Professional Bio:
Dasha is a Partner at Felicis. She has been with the firm for ten years and leads the Founder Success team and investment operations. In 2018, she launched the 1% founder development pledge, a pioneering initiative that directly support the founders building the companies Felicis backs.

Prior to Felicis, Dasha worked at sweetgreen when it was a small startup, and started her career as a management consultant.
Education/Personal Bio: A native Russian, Dasha is a graduate of the University of Pennsylvania. She is passionate about mental health, and has volunteered with Crisis Text Line and Bring Chang to Mind. She lives in San Francisco with her husband and daughter.

Name: Dave Geary
Job Title: Senior Vice President, Marketing & Business Development

Name: Dave Welsh
Job Title: Member & Head of TMT Growth Equity

Name: David Cohen
Professional Bio:
David Cohen is the Founder and Chairman at Techstars, the worldwide network that helps entrepreneurs succeed. David has been an entrepreneur and investor for his entire life. He has only had one job interview in his career, successfully got that job but then quit shortly thereafter to start his first company. Since then, he has founded several companies and has invested in more than 3,000 startups including dozens of unicorns. These investments have gone on to create more than $210B in enterprise value.

Prior to Techstars, David was a co-founder of Pinpoint Technologies which was acquired by ZOLL Medical Corporation (NASDAQ: ZOLL) in 1999. You can read about it in No Vision, All Drive. Later, David was the founder and CEO of earFeeder, a music service that was sold to SonicSwap. He also had what he likes to think of as a “graceful failure” in between.

David is active with several non-profit organizations, including his work as a founding Board Member of Endeavor Colorado. David is also a co-founder and Advisory Board Member of the Techstars Foundation.

David is the co-author (with Brad Feld) of Do More Faster; Techstars Lessons to Accelerate Your Startup.
Education/Personal Bio: David enjoys reading non-fiction books and playing tennis. He is married to the coolest girl he’s ever met and has three amazing kids who always seem to be teaching him something new.

Name: David Cowan
Professional Bio: During David's 30 years at Bessemer, he has invested in over 30 startups that went on to IPO, including LinkedIn, Lifelock, Rocket Lab and Twitch. David co-founded VeriSign and two other successful cybersecurity companies. He has been named to the Forbes Midas List 14 times. He currently focuses on deep tech investments such as Forever Oceans, Rigetti Computing, Spire Global and Xanadu.
Education/Personal Bio:
As a science philanthropist, David serves on the boards of Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics and the Center For Inquiry. CFI promotes a secular society through educational training programs, legal action, conferences, magazines and international relief. David partnered with CFI to create AfghanRescueFund.org which supports the evacuation and resettlement of imperiled Afghans.
Through his film production company Pale Blue Dot Films, David produces documentaries. Afghan Dreamers, winner of the Best Human Rights Film award at the Galway Film festival and soon to be released by Viacom MTV, follows the journey of six brave girls in Afghanistan who formed a robotics team, competed internationally, and ultimately fled their homeland.  Blech Effect (iTunes and Amazon Prime) chronicles the rags-to-riches-to-rags journey of a biotech investor with bipolar disorder. Bubbleproof and Bubble Report (free to watch at Bubbleproof.tv) are mockumentaries about Silicon Valley culture. 
Prior, David wrote and directed a musical production in San Jose titled Lies In The Attic. 
David earned both his Computer Science / Mathematics degree and MBA from Harvard University.

Name: David Hite
Professional Bio:
My daily mission is to help unleash the potential that makes a difference to one or many. As a VC that's through value creation for entrepreneurs and investors. Making a difference personally is by becoming deeply involved. 
I'm a Managing Partner and co-founder of B37 Ventures. For the past nine years B37 has partnered with seven multi-national corporations to invest in Silicon Valley technology, implement transformative innovation in their operations, and generate strategic and financial returns. I am a Silicon Valley native with deep roots in technology including global organizations, developing early stage technology startups, and investing with the best of the venture capital ecosystem. I spent 23 years with Intel Corporation in Asia, Latin America, and the USA and lead large and global multi-disciplinary teams generating $2 billion of revenue annually. I later was the co-founder and CEO of a technology startup that eventually joint ventured with a global life sciences corporation. I've created 15 startup teams in 11 countries and I'm a multi-cultural leader who has lived in eight countries and worked in 26. I understand the nuances of emerging markets business and culture based on 30 years immersed in countries outside the USA. I intend to instill habits in teams that are indicator-lead and that lead to results. My functional experience spans the manufacturing line to the brand, engineering development to CEO, channel development and sales to Chairman of the Board. I do or have served on Boards as a Director and/or Observer and enjoy being involved with as many of our fund's portfolio companies as possible as a business partner and stakeholder in success.
I set the pace. I'm a strategist. I love to synthesize. I am enthusiastically optimistic! I speak Spanish, Brasilian Portuguese (good enough) & English (native language).

Name: David Voon
Professional Bio:
Mr. David Voon had an 18-year career at Goldman Sachs (Asia) L.L.C. in Hong Kong, where he was a Partner from 2004 to 2011. At Goldman Sachs, he was the firm’s Head of Asia Private Wealth Management and served on the firm’s Asia Management Committee from 2006. Mr. Voon has broad and extensive management experience in Goldman Sachs, having led businesses in the firm’s Equities and Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities divisions, as well as serving as an Executive Director in the firm’s Legal Department. Prior to joining Goldman Sachs, Mr. Voon was an attorney at Shearman & Sterling in New York from 1991-1993.

Since leaving the corporate world in 2011, Mr. Voon co-founded and serves as Chairman of Oski Capital Partners Limited, a firm that actively co-invests with entrepreneurs in early-stage business opportunities. In 2018, Mr. Voon invested in, and currently serves as Vice Chairman for, LabyRx Immuno-Oncology Limited, a clinical stage biotech venture focused on developing anti-cancer treatments and diagnostics relating to the company’s work on a proprietary marker found on adenocarcinoma cells. 

Mr. Voon earned a B.A. in Economics from the University of California, Berkeley in 1988 and a J.D. from Harvard Law School in 1991.
Education/Personal Bio: Mr. Voon earned a B.A. in Economics from the University of California, Berkeley in 1988 and a J.D. from Harvard Law School in 1991.

Name: Dean Banks
Professional Bio:
Dean most recently served as President and CEO at Tyson Foods where he was responsible for charting the long-term vision for the company including steering integration of advanced technologies like artificial intelligence, robotics, and development of alternative proteins throughout its operations. During his four-year tenure with the company, he also served on the Board and executive leadership team. He joined Tyson from the high-tech incubator X at Alphabet, the company formerly known as Google, where he served on the leadership team and led moonshot projects across multiple industries including sustainable food (as co-founder of Tidal) and robotics (as co-founder of Intrinsic). 

Dean was previously managing partner of SEED Ventures, a group investing in and developing early stage healthcare technologies. He also has served as a consultant to Cleveland Clinic Innovations, CEO of Occelerator, SVP of Business Development and Strategic Marketing at OrthoHelix, co‐founder and CEO of Connective Orthopedics, and Vice President at Highland Capital Partners. He currently serves on the Board of biotechnology company Vergent Bioscience, which develops molecular imaging probes for life science research and development, where he was previously CEO.
Education/Personal Bio: Dean is a former platoon sergeant and squad leader in the U.S. Marine Corps. He holds a Bachelor of Arts in Marketing and Public Relations from Miami University and a Master of Business Administration from the Harvard Business School.

Name: Debbie Brackeen
Professional Bio:
Debbie Brackeen is the executive vice president, and chief strategy & innovation officer for CSAA Insurance Group, which has offered automobile, homeowners and other personal lines of insurance to AAA members for more than 100 years. CSAA is one of the top property and casualty personal lines insurers in the United States. 
 
Ms. Brackeen leads the company's organization in strategy, partnerships, innovation and venture investing. She has more than 25 years of experience and senior leadership at innovative high-tech companies, including Apple, Sun, HP, eBay, two venture-backed startups. Prior to joining CSAA IG, served as the global head of innovation at Citigroup. 
 
Ms. Brackeen currently serves as board observer to Kin Insurance, a member of the advisory board for The Institutes RiskStream Collaborative, and a board director for the non-profits Legacy Youth Leadership and Thirst Project. She previously served as director and past chair of Silicon Valley Forum, an adviser to the Astia Technology Committee, and adviser on the corporate board of the National Venture Capital Association. 

Ms. Brackeen holds a bachelor’s degree from Stanford University. She has completed executive education programs at the Northwestern Kellogg School of Management, INSEAD, and Stanford Law School.
Education/Personal Bio:
After completing my first year of pre-med as a Stanford undergrad, I realized medicine wasn't for me! I subsequently purchased my first Macintosh computer and became so obsessed with it that it landed me a contract job with Apple doing user testing of third-party software programs. This ultimately led to 10 years at Apple and launched my career at numerous tech companies in Silicon Valley. 
 
I’ve always gravitated toward ‘the next new thing.’ I love that tech is constantly evolving, and frequently disruptive with the ability to change the economics of different business models. While at HP, I realized it was possible for me to focus my career on corporate innovation and venture. I am fortunate to have been able to do that for the past 15+ years, initially at HP, then at Citibank, and now at CSAA.

Name: Dennis Kavelman
Professional Bio:
Dennis Kavelman joined Inovia Capital in 2018 to launch the firm's Growth Fund out of the Toronto office. Dennis currently sits on the boards of AlayaCare, Symend, WorkJam, BenchSci, Guesty and Vidyard.

After beginning his career at KPMG, Dennis joined the startup RIM in 1995; as CFO and COO, he helped RIM create the global smartphone industry as it grew to over 14,000 employees by his departure in 2010. During his tenure at RIM, he managed the scaling of a global software, hardware and services business while overseeing all financing activities, including the IPO and over $1.8 Billion in equity raises. Following RIM, Dennis became a prolific angel investor and worked with D2L, a global education platform company, as its COO before joining Inovia.  Dennis is also a director of the Golf Canada Foundation.
Education/Personal Bio: n.a.

Name: Deric Emry
Professional Bio: Deric has extensive experience working with high growth, expansion stage private companies as an investor, board member and advisor.  He spent 14 years as a General Partner with ABS Capital Partners and then 7 years with Greenspring Associates until its acquisition by StepStone Group last year.   Currently Deric is Senior Managing Director, Private Equity at StepStone Group.
Education/Personal Bio:
Columbia Business School, MBA, 1996
The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, BSE, 1991

Name: Didac Lee
Professional Bio:
Previous to co-founding Galdana Ventures in 2015, Dídac has been an entrepreneur for over 20 years, founding several tech companies (among others: Inspirit, TradeInn, Fhios, Peninsula, Threepoints – Planeta, Safe365), today they account for 800 employees and 300M in turnover annually. 
 
Dídac is well known in the start-up world as Business Angel. He invested in some of the top Spanish start-ups (some of them are Vicio, Housfy, Exoticca, Paack, Glovo, LingoKids) and he currently serves as mentor and Board Member to many of them.
 
Dídac is Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Galdana Ventures. With 1B USD fund invested in Silicon Valley (50%), China (30%) and Europe (20%), Galdana Ventures is considered one of the best performing Venture Capital Fund of Funds globally.
Dídac is a former Board Member of FC Barcelona, he served on the Board for 10 years from 2010 to 2020. Since 2018, he was Head of Digital, an internationally recognized reference in its field, with 370M followers in social media and more than 100M Euros in annual turnover. Among Lee´s achievements at FCB, one of the biggest is the leading of the digitalization of the Club, creating Barça Digital, Barça Studios and Barça Merch (BLM); his legacy is applauded by many. 
 
Throughout his career he received remarkable honors for his work, among them Doctor Honoris Causa from the Universidad del Siglo 21 (in 2018), Entrepreneur of the Year (PIMEC 2019), Best Business Angel (AEBAN 2019), Best European Mentor (Founder Institute, 2013 ) and Best Tech Entrepreneur (Cambridge University 2005).
 
Dídac is a proud figuerenç (Figueres is a small town located 140km North East of Barcelona). When he is not traveling between China and the Silicon Valley, he lives in Barcelona and Figueres; he loves practicing adventure sports like quad and buggy racing, advanced scuba diving (SSI Divemaster y CMAS 3*) and skateboarding.
His parents emigrated from Taiwan to Spain more than 50 years ago, he is fluent in 5 languages including Mandarin Chinese.
Education/Personal Bio:
Previous to co-founding Galdana Ventures in 2015, Dídac has been an entrepreneur for over 20 years, founding several tech companies (among others: Inspirit, TradeInn, Fhios, Peninsula, Threepoints – Planeta, Safe365), today they account for 800 employees and 300M in turnover annually. 
 
Dídac is well known in the start-up world as Business Angel. He invested in some of the top Spanish start-ups (some of them are Vicio, Housfy, Exoticca, Paack, Glovo, LingoKids) and he currently serves as mentor and Board Member to many of them.

His parents emigrated from Taiwan to Spain more than 50 years ago, he is fluent in 5 languages including Mandarin Chinese.

Name: Diego Piacentini
Job Title: Government Commissioner for the Digital Agenda

Name: Douglas McNeely
Professional Bio: Carlyle Group - Partner responsible for Platinum Account coverage across all investor segments. Formerly Head of Strategic Client Coverage at BlackRock.
Education/Personal Bio: BA - Duke University

Name: Duane Kuang
Professional Bio: I started my career as a software engineer in Silicon Valley and spent more than a decade in the data networking industry before becoming a venture capitalist in 2000.  Have been investing in technology companies for the last 20+ years, primarily in China.
Education/Personal Bio: Computer Science Master's degree, and MBA.

Name: Ed Hutchinson
Professional Bio: Founder and managing partner of Golden Bell Partners, which is a small multi-family office focused exclusively on private investments.  Previously oversaw the private investments for DUMAC (Duke University's endowment).
Education/Personal Bio:
Stanford MBA
University of Virginia BA

Name: Edward Grefenstette
Professional Bio: Edward J. Grefenstette serves as President/CEO and Chief Investment Officer of The Dietrich Foundation, a charitable foundation formed following the passing of William S. Dietrich II in October 2011.  The Foundation primarily supports higher education institutions and other civic/charitable organizations in Western Pennsylvania.  Ed previously served as Treasurer/CIO of Carnegie Mellon University (CMU), where he managed its endowment and treasury functions.  Prior to CMU, he co-founded a small-cap private equity fund, following seven years in investment banking and law.  He currently serves on several boards, including: trustee and investment committee (IC) member of CMU; University of Pittsburgh; The Hillman Family Foundations (IC chair); director of The Hillman Company; and an ad hoc IC member of the University of Pittsburgh Medical Center.  He speaks frequently on topics related to venture capital, including guest lecturing at CMU, University of Notre Dame, and Yale University.
Education/Personal Bio: Ed, who lives in his hometown of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, earned his AB in Economics and Juris Doctor with honors from Georgetown University and an MBA in Finance and Strategy from Carnegie Mellon University.  He is married with three children and two grandchildren (so far).

Name: Emilio Umeoka
Professional Bio:
Emilio Umeoka is a global executive with a track record of distinguished leadership in the technology industry. He was VP of Enterprise Sales and US Education Sales at Apple. Emilio, a vibrant diversity and inclusion advocate, served in Microsoft’s leadership positions leading multicultural teams as VP of APAC in Singapore and President of Microsoft Brazil. His agile career spans from start-ups to leading significant divisions in large companies with broad P&L responsibilities. Emilio held global and regional executive roles at Splunk, Juniper Networks, and Compaq. His inclusive approach to leadership has been key to his high-performance teams’ successes.

He has demonstrated a strong commitment to social responsibility by improving the use of technology in education, increasing digital inclusion, and fostering local developer and start-up ecosystems.
Education/Personal Bio:
Emilio is a member of the Ascend CEI (Corporate Executive Initiative). This advisory board drives initiatives that enhance current and future Pan-Asian leaders’ influence. He was also the executive sponsor for the Apple Asian Association. He has been a YPO (Young President’s Organization) member since 2001 and is currently in the YPO Gold NorCal Chapter.
Emilio grew up in Sao Paulo, Brazil, and attended Texas A&M, where he graduated with a BS degree in Petroleum Engineering. He is currently a Fellow at the Stanford DCI (Distinguished Careers Institute). He is fluent in Portuguese and Spanish.

Name: Eric Sippel
Professional Bio: Eric Sippel currently runs his family office and is an active investor in and adviser to many venture capital, hedge and real estate funds.   He is a member of the RAISE selection committee and often speaks to emerging venture manager groups. Previously, Eric was the COO of Eastbourne Capital Management, a multi-billion dollar hedge fund firm, and a Partner at Shartsis, Friese & Ginsburg, where he was a nationally recognized hedge fund and venture capital lawyer. Eric has served on many nonprofit boards, including his current role as Chair of SF Bay Area Goodwill.
Education/Personal Bio:
Stanford Law School (JD) '86
Wesleyan University (BA) '83

Name: Erik Hawkins
Professional Bio:
Erik is the VP of Government and Social Impact at Meta, where his team helps governments and nonprofits use Meta platforms to empower people, create community, and drive positive social impact. Before this, Erik was Meta’s VP of Product Marketing for Ads and Business Products and brought innovative advertising and business solutions to life across Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, and WhatsApp. Erik also led Facebook’s US sales efforts across several industries including Retail, Technology, Travel, Telecommunications, Health Care, and Financial Services.
 
Prior to joining Meta, Erik was the co-founder and CEO of Grind Media, a leading action and adventure sports publisher. He also co-founded PureVideo, an innovative digital video platform, built local search technology as SVP of Product at IAC’s Citysearch, and produced music marketing programs at Yahoo! Music.

Prior to his career in media and technology, Erik was a Russian interpreter in the U.S. Army, where he was recognized for both military intelligence and humanitarian aid contributions.
 
When he’s not busy at Meta, Erik is an active angel investor who enjoys helping passionate entrepreneurs build great teams to solve worthwhile problems.
Education/Personal Bio: Build great teams. Make things better. Repeat.

Name: Erin Harkless Moore
Professional Bio:
Erin leads the fund and direct investment program for Pivotal Ventures, an investment and incubation company created by Melinda French Gates to advance social progress in the United States. With over a decade and a half of investment experience, building and managing customized portfolios for endowed institutions and family offices, Erin is responsible for identifying, investing and overseeing a diverse portfolio of investments that drive breakthrough innovations and advance women’s power and influence. On a day-to-day basis, Erin is deeply involved in discovering and cultivating relationships with leaders, entrepreneurs, investors and founders. She has sourced and conducted diligence on investment managers across asset classes, with a particular focus and expertise in the private markets and early-stage venture capital. 

Prior to joining Pivotal, Erin spent 8 years at Cambridge Associates, most recently as a Managing Director. She has extensive experience developing strategies for impact and mission-aligned investments and advising on investment governance best practices and also writes and speaks frequently on the topics of investing with a social equity/gender equity lens and investing in diverse/emerging managers. Erin has spoken at industry events sponsored by organizations such as SOCAP, RAISE Global, PEWIN, Confluence Philanthropy and others. Earlier in her career, she held positions at the Princeton University Investment Company, Summit Rock Advisors and Goldman Sachs. Erin received her MBA from the Harvard Business School as a Robert Toigo Foundation Fellow and her BSBA magna cum laude from Washington University in St. Louis as a John B. Ervin Scholar. She is also a CFA charterholder and member of the CFA Society of Washington, DC.
Education/Personal Bio: Erin serves on the Board of the DC Public Library Foundation and is also a member of the investment committee for Builders Initiative, a family foundation dedicated to social and environmental change in pursuit of a humane and healthy planet. A native Texan, she resides on Capitol Hill in Washington, DC with her husband and two children. When not chasing after her kids, she enjoys exploring new restaurants, spending time with friends, travel, reading and fiction writing.

Name: Fadi Ghandour
Mentees Are:: Khaldoon Tabaza,Areije Al Shakar,Aly El Shalakany

Name: Felipe Vilá
Professional Bio:
Felipe Vilá is the Chief Executive Officer of Corporación Mexicana de Inversiones de Capital, S.A. de C.V., also known as “Fondo de Fondos” (“Fund of Funds”) since 2009.  Fondo de Fondos is an investment vehicle created by four Mexican development banks (Nacional Financiera, Focir, Bancomext and Banobras). Fondo de Fondos is a company with over 1,100 million dollars in assets under management, with capital commitments in 96 funds (mainly growth capital and venture capital strategies), with accumulated participation in more than 1,000 companies in Mexico and Latin America.

Felipe has more than 30 years of experience in the financial industry, including project finance, mergers and acquisitions, privatizations and capital markets. During its experience in project finance, he has been responsible of bids from international and national consortiums on projects of power generation centrals, high ways, ports, water treatment plants, water distribution reds, and other infrastructure projects. Additionally, Felipe leaded investment teams responsible for the privatization of more than 100 government owned companies and participated in more than 20 mergers in Mexico, Colombia and Venezuela, as well as acquisitions of various companies in Mexico.  He has served in boards of directors for more than 30 companies.

Before joining in Fondo de Fondos in 2009, Felipe was Head of the HSBC Investment Bank and CEO of HSBC Securities in Mexico.

Previously, he assumed various C-level positions, between others:
	Head of investment projects, Fonlyser, Banca Serfin. 
	Head of economic analysis, Mexican presidency.
	CEO, CESTUR, ministry of tourism.
	Economic assessor of the ministry of tourism, 
	Vice-president of projects INEGI, ministry of budget.
Education/Personal Bio:
BS Economics,  Universidad Autónoma de Guadalajara, Mexico
MBA,  Universidad Autónoma de Guadalajara, Mexico, and 
PhD in Economics,  the University of Texas (Austin, USA).

Name: Frederic Court
Professional Bio:
Frederic is Founder and Managing Partner at Felix Capital, a London-based venture capital firm for the Creative Class. Felix is a thematically focused firm, operating at the intersection of technology and creativity, with over $1.2 billion in venture and growth capital. Felix invests in fast-growing digital consumer brands, platforms and related enabling-technologies, with a focus on Europe and North America.
 
At Felix, Frederic works closely with portfolio companies across the firm’s B2C and B2B focus areas, including Mejuri, a modern jewellery brand;  Mirakl, a SaaS platform for marketplaces; Yoobic, a frontline SaaS solution; Effy, an energy renovation business; and AMI Paris, a contemporary luxury apparel brand. Recent exits for Felix include Peloton, a digital fitness business (IPO in 2020); Moonbug, a children’s entertainment platform, acquired by Candle Media in 2021; Highsnobiety, a digital media and lifestyle brand, acquired by Zalando in 2022; and in 2023, Felix exited its investment in Yfood to Nestlé.
 
Frederic has worked in the technology industry for over 20 years, previously as a VC-backed tech entrepreneur, and as General Partner with Advent Venture Partners in London, where he was the first investor in global online fashion and luxury marketplace Farfetch. Farfetch IPO-ed at a $6 billion valuation in 2018 (NYSE: FTCH).
 
Frederic was named “Investor of the Year” in Europe by his peers at the 2012 and 2019 Investor All Stars events. He has been on Forbes’ Midas List Europe every year since 2017
Education/Personal Bio: Born in Nice (France), lived in Paris, London, NYC and Milan. Frederic speaks French, English, Italian and Spanish. He graduated from ESSEC business school and Bocconi University. He has two daughters aged 19 and 17 who make fun of his French accent. He loves tennis, the Mediterranean sea, his hometown in Nice, the creative industries in general (art, fashion, and design in particular), travel, food & cooking, and spending quality time with friends.

Name: Gavin Christensen
Professional Bio: After almost a decade in the venture, Gavin founded Kickstart in 2008 to create the first seed-stage VC in the region. As the founder of Kickstart, and, after working withhundreds of startups, Gavin has real empathy and expertise for the startup journey. Outside of Kickstart, Gavin spends time with his family, multitasking while riding his Onewheel, fine-tuning his VR gaming skills, and playing tennis.

Name: Greg Waldorf
Professional Bio:
Greg has had a passion for technology and entrepreneurship ever since he started a software development company at age thirteen. Throughout his career, as a CEO, board member, founder and investor, he has helped leading brands become global leaders in their respective industries.
Greg most recently served as CEO of Invoice2go (acquired by Bill.com), where his team revolutionized how the world’s smallest businesses work. Greg also spent more than eleven years working with eHarmony including serving as CEO and leading the company through an extended period of global growth.
Greg currently serves as a Senior Advisor at Sixth Street Partners and Concrete Rose Capital. He also sits on the board of Virta Health. He has served on the boards of Grupo ZAP and VTS, in addition to 11 years combined on the boards of Zillow and Trulia, where he served as lead director.
Education/Personal Bio:
BA, UCLA
MBA, Stanford University

Name: Haymo Meran
Professional Bio: In 2000 I founded my first business with 4 partners. It was sold to the Austrian Press Agency in 2013. I founded my next business right away and it was sold in 2014 to Atlassian. I moved to Sydney and I worked the following years in the Confluence management team. At this time I startet investing in startups and I have done about 20 investment until today. In 2018 invested in Usersnap and helped the company to become profitable as head of product. In 2022 I joined Miro's product leader ship team as a Group Product Manager.
Education/Personal Bio: I grew up in Italy lived in Austria, US and Australia. Today I am living in Vienna with my family and enjoy the city and my remote work in a hyper growth company. I like  spending time with my kids and family in nature. I prioritise mental and physical health, personal growth through feedback and spending time with my friends over other things.

Name: Heath Butler
Professional Bio:
Heath Butler is venture investor, a serial entrepreneur and seasoned corporate executive with over 20 years of experience as a transformational leader with a proven ability to define a vision, execute strategy and deliver accelerated business impact.  As a Venture Partner at Mercury Fund, Heath focuses on Work-Tech, Fin-Tech and Sport-Tech investment themes within B2B Software, B2B2C Marketplaces, and Data Platforms.  He also manages the firms proprietary venture studio and network platform, The Mercury Method, which provides operational support to help portfolio companies achieve sustainable, long-term growth.  Heath is also currently serving in an executive role for Mercury portfolio company, Televet.

Prior to joining Mercury, Heath co-founded Gestalt Theory Venture Partners, a venture studio for early-stage companies, held leadership roles as a fin-tech division president, and served as a corporate development executive and at Insperity (NYSE: NSP), the nation’s leading HR outsourcing services provider.  led business development for EnergyWorkspace.com; co-founded a fin-tech startup; and developed his foundational management skills at UPS.
Education/Personal Bio: Heath received an MBA in Marketing from Texas Southern University’s Jesse H. Jones School of Business and a B.S. in Finance from the University of New Orleans.

Name: Heidi Patel
Professional Bio: Managing Partner at Rethink Impact, LP, the largest VC fund in the country dedicated to investing in female leaders using tech to solve the world’s greatest challenges.   She is a board director for OnCue, Ketos, Culina Health, and Icon Savings Plan and is a Board Observer for Binti, Full Harvest, Angaza, and Univfy.   Former President of New Island Capital Management, a mission-focused investment advisor to a single ultra-high net worth family. Previously, Heidi worked in India D.light as an Acumen Fund Fellow and was a Director at Pacific Community Ventures, an impact-focused private equity investor. Previously, she worked with AOL Time Warner Ventures, Deutsche Bank, and Credit Suisse First Boston.
Education/Personal Bio: Heidi Patel co-created and teaches the “Investing for Good” course at the Stanford University Graduate School of Business, and she serves on the Investment Committee for the Stanford GSB Student Impact Fund. Heidi serves on the External Advisory Council for Innovation and Entrepreneurship under the Dean of Research at Princeton University and is an active member of All Raise, co-leading their VC Cohorts program to help close the gap for women in venture capital. Heidi earned an AB from Princeton and an MBA from the Graduate School of Business at Stanford University. Follow her on Twitter at @HeidiPatelSF.

Name: Hunter Walk
Professional Bio: Before Homebrew, I led consumer product management at YouTube, starting when it was acquired by Google. I originally joined Google in 2003, managing product and sales efforts for AdSense, Google‘s contextual advertising business. My first job in Silicon Valley was as the founding product and marketing guy at Linden Lab. Before graduate school, I was a management consultant and also spent a year at Late Night with Conan O‘ Brien. My parents are proud of my BA in History from Vassar and MBA from Stanford University.

Name: Inaki Berenguer
Professional Bio:
Inaki is the Managing Parter of LifeX.vc
Inaki has been a 3x CEO/entrepreneur in NYC: Pixable, acquired by SingTel in 2012 for $30M; Contactive, acquired by Fuze; and CoverWallet, which raised $60M, with over 500 employees and close to $1B in premium revenue, and acquired by Aon in 2020. He has worked at McKinsey & Company and Microsoft Corporate Strategy. He is a Crown Fellow of the Aspen Institute and has personally invested in over 100 startups, cofounding Agentero and iPronics. He is a 14x marathon finisher (7x NYC).
Education/Personal Bio: Inaki earned Master and PhD degrees in Engineering from the University of Cambridge, and an MBA from MIT. He was also a two-year Fulbright Scholar at Columbia University and a postdoc at the Cambridge-MIT Institute

Name: Javier Villamizar
Professional Bio:
Javier is an Operating Partner at SoftBank Investment Advisers. He has been a leader in the global technology industry for more almost three decades. and brings enormous expertise in scaling businesses to his work with the portfolio companies of the SoftBank Vision Funds. He is focused on delivering operational support to help portfolio companies accelerate growth, scale up, and expand globally
 
Javier started his career as an entrepreneur, developing software platforms for call canters in his native Colombia. After a successful exit, he was retained by Motorola, Inc. To lead multiple business development activities in Latin America. Later on, he became a managing director for Motorola Ventures, working on identifying and investing in tech start-ups that were synergistic with Motorola’s product lines.  In 2004, Javier joined Brightstar, a global player in the telecom supply chain and logistics sector as Chief Strategy Officer, helping expand the company’s presence into 30+ new markets in Asia, Australia and MEA. Prior to joining SoftBank, he helped Greensill grow its technology and telecom practice globally and co-developed the data-driven handset receivable financing product offering.
Education/Personal Bio:
University of Miami Herbert Business School, International Business MBA - 2002 - 2004 graduated 1st of class. “Valedictorian”

Pontificia Universidad Javeriana (Colombia), Electronics Engineering B.S.,  1988 - 1993

Colegio Calasanz Bogotá (Colombia) - High School 1976 - 1987

Name: Jeff Bussgang
Professional Bio:
Jeff Bussgang is a Senior Lecturer in the Entrepreneurial Management Unit at the Harvard Business School as well as Co-Founder and General Partner at Flybridge Capital Partners, an early-stage venture capital firm with offices in Boston and New York City and over $1 billion under management across six seed funds and nine network funds. “Unicorn” portfolio companies include BitSight, Bowery, Chief, FalconX, Habi, MadeiraMadeira, and MongoDB.

At HBS, he has taught 2000 students over 13 years on the faculty and written over 50 case studies and teaching notes. He teaches three second year elective courses: Launching Technology Ventures (focused on pre product-market fit startups), Scaling Minority Businesses (BIPOC founders), and Venture Capital Journey (for aspiring VCs).

Bussgang has authored two books: one for startup joiners, Entering Startupland, and one on VC and entrepreneurship, Mastering the VC Game, to provide entrepreneurs an insider’s guide to financing and company-building.

Bussgang is an active community member, serving as board chair and co-founder of Hack.Diversity, a talent development program for Black and LatinX technologists, as well as board chair and co-founder of LEADS, an economic and leadership development program for diverse Gateway City Leaders.
Education/Personal Bio:
Bussgang holds a BA in Computer Science from Harvard University where he graduated magna cum laude.and an MBA from Harvard Business School where he was a Baker Scholar and a Ford Scholar.

Bussgang is married to his college sweetheart and has three 20-something children.
