Name: Daniel Kirchleitner
Professional Bio:
Daniel is a Venture Capital investor, founder and engineer based in Europe. He has over 15 years of experience in building fast growing global B2B businesses in areas like enterprise software, industrial tech and renewable energy. His passion is about working with founders who are driving a sustainable change in their industry through technology.

Daniel has invested early in some category leading companies and served on their boards. E.g., Sennder, the leading digital road freight forwarder in Europe or Wandelbots, creating the category of no-code for industrial robots. Some others include joinbllink.com [http://joinbllink.com], Cargo.one, Scoutbee, Alaiko and Varjo. In one of his last roles he has helped Siemens in building Next47, a state of the art Corporate Venture Capital platform as a Managing Director and Partner for Europe.

Some of the businesses he has founded and scaled are a solar power company and an AdTech software company.
Education/Personal Bio: Daniel has a Diploma and PhD in engineering from the Technical University of Ingolstadt and the University of Luebeck. He is a fellow of the Foundation of German Business.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Ambar Amleh
Professional Bio:
Ambar is a Founding Partner at Ibtikar Fund, a fund that she championed and helped design, structure, and fundraise. Ibtikar fills a critical funding gap faced by Palestinian entrepreneurs between seed and VC. 

For the past six years, Ambar has been directly involved in supporting Palestinian entrepreneurs. As the program manager for Palestine for a New Beginning (PNB), a Palestinian nonprofit focused on entrepreneurial development, Ambar grew PNB from an idea and a loose and small board leadership to an established Palestinian institution. Through PNB, Ambar organized the yearly Celebration of Innovation, a Palestine-wide competition of entrepreneurs, and the follow-up support to these entrepreneurs; as well as Global Entrepreneurship Week in Palestine. 

In March 2018, Ambar was named as one of the '50 Most Influential Women in the Arab World' by CEO Middle East Magazine and '20 Women VCs of MENA' by MENAbytes.
Education/Personal Bio: Ambar has an international MBA from the Thunderbird School of Global Management and a marketing degree from Arizona State University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Sara Zulkosky
Professional Bio:
Sara is the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Recast Capital, a platform supporting and investing in emerging managers in venture. The Recast team believes that emerging managers, particularly those with diverse partnerships, represent both an underserved market and overlooked business opportunity, and is taking a new approach to meeting the need. 

Sara previously served as a Venture Partner at Greenspring Associates, a venture capital platform with over $10.7B under management. She was responsible for sourcing and due diligence efforts on fund, direct, and secondary opportunities, managing a number of Greenspring's direct investments, and leading Greenspring's impact investing initiative. Prior to joining Greenspring, Sara served as a Principal with CNF Investments, a private investment firm affiliated with Clark Enterprises, Inc. CNF focuses on venture capital and private equity opportunities (fund and direct) in technology, life sciences and energy. 

Prior to that, Sara participated in Foundation Capital's Young Entrepreneurs Program, where she helped identify promising investment opportunities in the Washington, DC area. Sara was also the Director of Product Management for SkyBuilt Power, Inc., a venture-backed clean-tech company that provided rapidly-deployable renewable energy solutions to the U.S. Department of Defense, U.S. Intelligence Community, and telecommunications industry (domestic and international markets). She was with the business from its inception, also supporting it as a Project Engineer, Project Manager, and its Director of Engineering.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sara received an MBA from Georgetown University, and an MS in engineering management and BS in mechanical engineering from The George Washington University. 

Sara is also an Entrepreneurial Advisor at Georgetown University and a Venture Partner with NextGen.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Ik Kanu
Investing Thesis: Invest in startups based in Africa and help them expand globally.
Professional Bio: Ik has over a decade of experience in various roles including engineering, consulting, corporate development, private equity, and angel investing.Ik is a Founding Partner of Atlantica Ventures. An early stage VC firm with a goal to invest in the next generation of impact driven tech and tech-enabled startups in Africa. Atlantica Ventures invests from the Seed and Series A stages, and follows through to Series B. Our fund invests with a keen focus on returns and impact.Ik was a Principal at Convergence Partners (CP), an investment firm focused on the technology sector in Africa. CP brings its skills, experience, and capital to accelerate development of infrastructure, enabling the digital economies in Africa. He sits on the board of Venture Garden Nigeria, a leading Nigerian FinTech solutions provider.Prior to Convergence, Ik was a Vice-President at Helios Investment Partners, managing the investments in Interswitch (the largest e-payment company in Nigeria) and Helios Towers Nigeria (the first independent tower operator in Nigeria).Ik started his career as product engineer and then a business analyst at Lucent Technologies, Bell Labs. He managed production in Bydgoszcz (Poland) and Qingdao (China) and built next-generations solutions for US operators. After Lucent, he joined PA Consulting, focused on the technology sector, advising clients such as the Associated Press and Cox Communications. Ik later joined Arthur D. Little as a consultant, advising companies and PE funds in the US
Education/Personal Bio:
Ik graduated from Penn State University with a Bachelor of Science in electrical engineering and a master's in management science. He also has an MBA from the Stern School of Business at New York University. 

Born in Nigeria, Ik has a global perspective gained from living and working across multiple continents. While not working, Ik enjoys movies, mentoring, Muay Thai, CrossFit, and BBQs.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Andrew Vranjes
Professional Bio:
His professional experience has focused on technology, startups, investing, and leadership. Andrew has been investing in technology startups for 9 years, with 45 investments and 8 exits over this period. Andrew is currently Head of Startup Ecosystem for Amazon Web Services, based out of Singapore. In this role, he works with entrepreneurs across Southeast Asia to help grow their businesses. 

Andrew has previously held leadership roles at Cisco Systems and Singtel/Optus. He fell into investing in technology companies while based in Australia, starting with helping a friend accelerate growth at his company and leading to the eventual sale of his software business. 

Alongside two business partners, Andrew also runs a small investment holdings entity focused on technology startups.
Education/Personal Bio: Andrew has a bachelor's degree from Edith Cowan University in Australia, majoring in Communications and Information Technology. He has held a variety of board positions at several startups, and has a Non-Executive Director role promoting technology education at the Storage Network Industry Association.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Miles Lasater
Investing Thesis: Purpose Built venture studio supports founders with ideas, coaching, resources and capital to turn good ideas into great companies. We focus on fintech, healthcare, and the future of work — and are the best early-stage partner for solo founders.
Professional Bio:
Miles Lasater is CEO and Founder of Purpose Built, a venture studio focused on human potential. Miles previously co-founded Higher One (IPO, 2010), SeeClickFix (acq 2019), and OneUni. He is a Kauffman Fellow and formerly a VC at F-Prime Capital.

Higher One was a fast-growing fintech company that served 2M+ college students and 1200+ higher ed campuses. He was founder and senior executive taking the company from idea to $200mil+ revenue, 750+ employees and public listing on NYSE. Miles served as the public company board chair and is experienced in corporate governance and M&A transactions.

Miles has invested in dozens of pre/see-stage ventures, taught a class on venture capital at Yale University and was previously on the board of Venture for America. He is on the board of ConnCorp, a $150M+ economic development project in the Dixwell neighborhood of New Haven. He is Chair of the board of Curious Learning, a tech nonprofit.

He has ideated inside 3 other ventures studios and is a GSSN Studio Launch Program graduate. Miles is the host of the podcast Startups for Good and blogs at VenturePatterns.com.
Education/Personal Bio:
Miles graduated from Yale University with a bachelor's in computer science. 

Miles is chair of the board of tech nonprofit Curious Learning, which focuses on childhood literacy via open source software. He has served on the board of other nonprofits including Yale New Haven Hospital and Venture for America. He co-founded the Yale Humanist Community and was founding board member for MakeHaven, New Haven's makerspace. He is a husband, father of four children, and a book addict.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025

Name: Matt Roberts
Investing Thesis: Growth equity
Professional Bio:
Matt Roberts is a Co-Founder & Partner at Prysm Capital where he provides growth capital to disruptive management teams across the technology and consumer sectors. Investing across stages, Matt prides himself on working with – and learning from – innovative entrepreneurs who are improving everyday lives.

Prior to Prysm, Matt spent nine years at BlackRock Private Equity Partners where he invested in market leading companies across the U.S and Asia and was a founding member of the team’s Hong Kong and San Francisco offices. During this time, he served as an Observer to the Board of Directors of Chewy, Healthchannels and Travel Leaders Group, a Director for American Express Global Business Travel and Guardian Alarm, and on the Executive Board of the NFLPA One Team Collective.

Prior to BlackRock, Matt was part of the Leveraged Finance group at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, where he partnered with middle market companies to structure credit facilities.

Matt is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 23) and earned a BSBA degree from The Kenan-Flagler Business School at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Matt is an avid traveler having been to over 45 countries and as a Chapel Hill native, bleeds Carolina Blue and is a walking wiki of the UNC-Duke basketball rivalry.
Education/Personal Bio: Matt earned a BSBA degree from The Kenan-Flagler Business School at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Matt is an avid traveler having been to over 45 countries and as a Chapel Hill native, bleeds Carolina Blue and is a walking wiki of the UNC-Duke basketball rivalry.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Erik Torenberg
Professional Bio:
An experienced entrepreneur and investor, Erik is Co-Founder and General Partner at Village Global, a $100M early-stage venture fund. 

He previously founded or was part of the founding team for Rapt.fm, a music-tech company in Detroit; Product Hunt, a discovery platform for startups (sold to AngelList); On Deck, an event series for people looking to start or join their next company; and Token Daily, a crypto content site.
Education/Personal Bio: Erik attended the University of Michigan, where he earned a BS in economics.

Name: Jessie Guo
Investing Thesis: Early-stage tech-focused venture
Professional Bio:
Jessie joined the Next Legacy team in 2014 and focuses on all aspects of fund investment activities at Next Legacy, including identifying, evaluating, and managing fund investments for the Flagship Fund as well as co-spearheading the Emerging Leaders Fund. She is an engaged member of the exclusive Society of Kauffman Fellows, the premier leadership organization for the venture capital industry. She is also on the permanent board of Bridge Funding Global, a platform and community to support women and underserved emerging managers.

Jessie brings to Next Legacy a wealth of industry knowledge and relationships from the venture capital market in China. At CICC, a leading investment bank in China, Jessie focused on private equity and venture capital fund investments. Jessie helped launch a funds research platform and several new investment products for CICC’s Wealth Management Business, at the time a novel and burgeoning business in China. She was also part of the pioneering team that initiated CICC’s fund of funds business. Before CICC, Jessie helped technology startups raise capital from venture funds at China Renaissance, a leading boutique financial institution that has cultivated many leaders in the Chinese venture industry.
Education/Personal Bio: Jessie gained entrance to the prestigious Peking University as one of China’s top young scholars, where she earned both her master’s and bachelor’s degrees in Finance with honors. She later received her MBA from UC Davis with the highest honors. After immigrating to the San Francisco Bay Area for their graduate studies in 2012, Jessie and her husband now have a young son and daughter. Jessie recently picked back up her childhood passion for martial arts alongside her son who is learning taekwondo.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ashish Agrawal
Professional Bio:
Ashish leads fintech, software, and consumer internet investments for Peak XV Partners in India.

He represents Peak XV on the board of companies such as Groww, Leap, Progcap, Pristyn Care, Stanza Living, GoKwik, payGlocal, Zanskar Research, Toddle, Lightmetrics and Osfin amongst others. He has also been involved with Peak XV’s investments in Zomato (NSE: ZOMATO), OYO Rooms, Blinkit, Go-Jek (IDX:GOTO), Rebel Foods, Porter and Clevertap amongst others.

Previously, Ashish was an entrepreneur, building travel focused mobile apps and has worked as a management consultant with McKinsey & Company.

Ashish graduated from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur with a Bachelors and Masters degree in Computer Science. He was awarded the Ratan Swarup Memorial Prize for best all round performance in his graduating class.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ashish attended the Indian Institute of Technology, Kanpur, where he received bachelor's and master's degrees in computer science and engineering. He was awarded the Ratan Swarup Memorial Prize for best all-around performance in his graduating class. 

Ashish was featured in the Forbes '30 under 30' India list of 2016.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,London Summit 2025

Name: Allan Jean-Baptiste
Professional Bio: Allan's career has been focused on technology investing across software and consumer Internet verticals. Allan joined KKR in 2016 as a founding investor for KKR's new technology growth equity fund ($3B AUM) focusing primarily on application layer software, cybersecurity, and consumer marketplace investments in North America. Prior to KKR, Allan was an early member of CapitalG (formerly Google Capital), Google's non-strategic growth equity investing arm. He started his career at Goldman, Sachs and Co. as a member of the Technology, Media and Telecommunications Investment Banking team.
Education/Personal Bio: Allan is deeply engaged in the supporting equity in education and healthcare, serving on Executive Committee and Board of Summer Search Bay Area, an organization supporting summer experiential learning and educational attainment, as well as the Board of World of Children, a grant writer for local children’s charities. Allan attended Harvard University, where he received an AB, with Honors, in economics with a secondary in global health and health policy.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: JinA Bae
Professional Bio:
JinA is passionate about supporting entrepreneurs and maximising positive impact of capital in Asia’s emerging markets. She has built her career as an investor and entrepreneur in the US, Europe, and Asia.

JinA is a Co-founder and Managing Partner of Abound Capital, a venture debt firm established in Singapore with a mission to expand access to alternative capital for entrepreneurs in Southeast Asia. Abound Capital provides non-dilutive, flexible source of growth funding in the form of venture debt to early - growth stage companies across the region.

Prior to launching Abound Capital, JinA served as the Head of Corporate Venture at Hanwha, one of the largest conglomerates in Korea, where she led global venture investments for the financial arm of the group. JinA began her career as a management consultant at McKinsey & Company in San Francisco and London and was also a founder of a London-based food tech startup. She holds a B.A. (magna cum laude, Distinction in the Major) in Ethics, Politics & Economics from Yale University and is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 23).
Education/Personal Bio:
As an undergraduate, JinA attended Yale where she received a Bachelor of Arts in Ethics, Politics, and Economics and graduated magna cum laude, with Distinction. 

JinA is a World Economic Forum Global Shaper and is passionate about the Korean reunification and aspires to be one of the first investors to grow the tech ecosystem in the unified Korea.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,Singapore Trek 2025

Name: Nnena Nkongho
Professional Bio:
Nnena is the Founder and Managing Partner at Otundi Ventures, an investor focused on supporting African, technology-enabled businesses and their founders in building regional and global category leaders. 

Prior to founding Otundi, Nnena spent four years investing as a Principal at Digital Growth Africa (DiGAME), a permanent capital vehicle focused on the digital transformation of the African continent, where she remains as an Advisor. Nnena was an early employee and Global Head of Business Development at SOLO Phone Nigeria, a Nigerian mobile device and content ecosystem. Prior to that, she worked with African businesses on corporate strategy, new market entry, and growth investments'including serving as the Head of Strategy and Business Development for Etisalat Nigeria (now 9mobile). 

Nnena has been actively evaluating public and private market investment opportunities in Africa for over 10 years. She was a member of the founding team at Nubuke Investments and was responsible for sourcing, structuring, and executing investments in the telecom, media, and technology sectors. Nnena spent 7 years of her early career at Merrill Lynch (London) and Morgan Stanley (New York, Hong Kong), working in equity arbitrage and M&A.
Education/Personal Bio: Nnena has an MBA from Columbia Business School and is a graduate of Princeton University.

Name: Maia Sharpley
Investing Thesis: At Odonata Ventures we will seek and support early-stage companies operating in the “space in-between” education and adjacent industries such as Health and FinTech that are uniquely positioned to create and lead new categories in the Learning Space.
Professional Bio: Maia Sharpley, the founder and managing partner of Odonata Ventures, has been at the forefront of innovation within the education, EdTech, venture, and start-up arenas since the early days of education reform. Maia comes to venture capital as an operator, after many years of conceptualizing, building and running successful businesses around the world. She has a proven track record of developing, optimizing and investing in businesses with robust returns. In addition to the portfolio company Boards that she serves on, Maia is a board member/advisor to multiple (non-investment related) education organizations, including colleges, research think tanks, EdTech accelerators/innovation labs, and start-ups. She is a founder of Innovation for Equity, a nonprofit dedicated to improving outcomes for Black learners of all ages. Maia is multi-lingual, a US Patent Holder, Kauffman Fellow and a graduate of both Trinity College in Hartford and the Ross School of Business, University of Michigan.
Education/Personal Bio:
A graduate of Trinity College in Hartford, Connecticut, Maia earned her MBA from the Ross School of Business, University of Michigan. 

She is an avid skier, has travelled extensively, has lived and worked overseas, is fluent in multiple languages, and is a United States Patent holder.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Wilson Lin
Professional Bio: Multi-stage VC | Enterprise, AI ML, Data Infrastructure, Cybersecurity
Education/Personal Bio: Wilson earned his MBA from the Ross School of Business at the University of Michigan, and his BA in economics from the University of Pennsylvania.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025

Name: Janet Bannister
Professional Bio:
Janet is the Founder and General Partner of Staircase Ventures which invests in Canada’s most promising early-stage technology companies.  Staircase recognizes that founders are the bedrock upon which companies are built, and therefore provides unparalleled support to accelerating founders’ development and performance.  
Prior to launching Staircase Ventures, Janet was Managing Partner at Real Ventures, one of Canada’s largest and most active early-stage investors.  Janet is also a graduate of the prestigious Kauffman Fellows program, a global network of the world’s top 1% of venture investors and innovation leaders.
In addition, Janet is very active in the Canadian tech ecosystem; she is the Co-Chair of C100 and on the Boards of the Ivey Business School and LEAP, a social venture accelerator.  She is also a mentor at Creative Destruction Lab.  In addition, Janet was Honorary Co-Chair of the Princess Margaret Ride to Conquer Cancer in 2023, the largest single fundraising event in Canada.
Janet has won numerous awards and recognition including Toronto Region Builder of the Year Award for 2023, Insider’s 2023 “Seed 30: The Best Women Early-Stage Investors in North America”, Venture Capital Journal’s 2021 “Women of Influence in Private Markets”, Pitchbook’s 2021 “Female Founders & Investors to Know”, and American Bankers’ 2019 “Most Influential Women in Payments”.
In 2004, Janet launched Kijiji.ca and grew it to become one of the most visited websites in Canada.  Subsequently, she led the Kijiji Global business, launching the website in new countries and accelerating growth in North America, Europe, and Asia.
Janet also spent four years at eBay in Silicon Valley where she helped transform eBay from a collectibles to a mainstream marketplace, growing the business 400% year-over-year for four years.  She started her career as a Brand Manager at Procter & Gamble and then joined McKinsey & Co. where she was an Engagement Manager.  She also founded and built a successful consulting business and was CEO at a venture-backed start-up prior to joining Real Ventures.
Janet was a varsity long-distance runner at Western University, where she completed her business degree at Ivey, earning the Gold Medal.  Post university, she switched to triathlons and two years later, became Canada’s National triathlon champion.  She competed internationally on the National team for several years while working full time.
Education/Personal Bio: Janet received an HBA (Honours Business Administration) degree from Western University's Ivey Business School in Canada, where she was awarded the Gold Medal for the highest standing in her graduating class. Janet also received a Western Athletic Letter for her participation on the Varsity Cross Country, Track and Field, and Nordic Ski teams. She was on the Canadian National Triathlon team for 3 years and represented Canada at the World Championships. Janet is happily married and has a 15-year-old son, who is the light of her life.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ashish Aggarwal
Investing Thesis:
we are disrupting venture capital by applying a hedge-fund-like operating model (using AI and quant via our proprietary platform - Mantis) to early-stage VC. We are fund managers with a strong track record (top 99 percentile for the last two funds), differentiated strategy, and deep domain expertise and network., At Chamaeleon, we’re disrupting the traditional VC model by adopting a hedge-fund-like operating approach, leveraging AI and quantitative strategies through our proprietary platform, Mantis. We’re proud to have built a strong track record (top 1% across our last two funds, and we also have DPI in our current fund (2021 vintage)) with a differentiated strategy, deep domain expertise, and a robust network.

How are we different?

Unique Investment strategy & operating model: AI and quant-driven early-stage multi-specialized fund combined with a distinctive operating model focusing on high-volume unbiased deal flow. We do efficient fact-based due diligence & have a significant advantage in the timing of interaction. We have built enhanced data-driven portfolio & risk management and exit/liquidation engines.

Track Record: Our previous two funds are in the top 1% of VC funds in the US. Our team has invested in many category-defining companies, such as App Annie, DraftKings (IPO: DKNG), Gusto, Outsystems, Robinhood (IPO: HOOD), Rubrik, Virta Health, and Ometria, among many other “household” names.

Mantis Engine - Technological Superiority: Chamaeleon uses a proprietary and distinctive quant & tech augmentation platform - MANTIS - for all its core areas, including deal sourcing, due diligence and portfolio management, e.g. our deal team evaluates 50x+ more deals yearly than similar tier-1 VC funds that have 10x+ more assets under management.

Exclusive Network - #KIN: Chamaeleon also has a proprietary people augmentation platform - #KIN - a uniquely "productized" community consisting of notable people such as the former CPO of Unity, CEO of Ancestry, President of Google for the Americas, Chief Architect of Slack, Founders of Accel Europe, App Annie, etc.
Professional Bio:
Ashish is a Partner at Chamaeleon, investing in seed/Series A consumer, vertical SaaS, and crypto startups. Ashish has 18+ years of experience as an operator, entrepreneur, and investor. Ashish is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 24).Ashish also sits on the board of NextGen Partners (the largest network of non-GP VCs in the US) and helps expand 256 Network (invite-only GP-LP network) in the US. 

Ashish has led investments in leading companies such as Ziva Dynamics (acquired by Unity) and many other category-defining companies. He previously worked in early-stage investing at Grishin Robotics, one of the first Robotics and AI-focused VC funds. 

Before that, Ashish led M&A and corporate strategy for Opera Software, overseeing transactions worth hundreds of millions globally. Ashish worked in marketing analytics for consumer and enterprise products at Dell. At Yahoo!, he built large-scale enterprise infrastructure for advertising products, led service-engineering teams to design dev-ops systems and architected complex advertising systems. 

Ashish started two companies for the Indian market, one in e-commerce and the other in the social live TV space. He has worked as an investor for OCA Ventures in Chicago. Ashish is an advisor to various startups, VC funds, family offices, and accelerators globally. He also has been an editor for YourStory.com.

Ashish holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management and London Business School, a MEM focusing on design thinking from McCormick School of Engineering at Northwestern University, and a BE in Information Science from RVCE, India. In his spare time, Ashish loves understanding how to develop inclusive communities, travelling to new countries, and learning about new technologies.
Education/Personal Bio: Ashish holds an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management and London Business School, a MEM with a focus on design thinking from McCormick School of Engineering at Northwestern University, and a BE in Information Science from RVCE, India. In his spare time, Ashish loves understanding how to develop inclusive communities, traveling to new countries, and learning about new technologies.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Boston,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Raghu Madabushi
Professional Bio:
Raghu Madabushi is a Director at National Grid Partners investing in early stage companies in the broad enterprise SW vertical. Raghu has 20+ years of experience with technology, capital markets, and IP/innovation. 

Raghu comes from SRI Ventures and GE Ventures prior to that, where he invested in deep tech and industrial infrastructure (SW, HW, and telecom). Prior to this, he managed a large portfolio of collaborative open-source technology projects while at the Linux Foundation and headed the startup investing business at Intellectual Ventures' Invention Development Fund, helping invest in early stage startups. 

Prior to IV, Raghu held buy-side and sell-side roles at Wall Street firms (Oppenheimer & Co, Collins Stewart) and brings extensive experience in the hardware and software design space having worked in various roles including, semiconductor fabrication, chip design, systems architecture, strategy, and marketing (Texas Instruments, Intel, Cadence Design Systems).
Education/Personal Bio: Raghu received an MBA in finance and investments from Southern Methodist University, an MS in computer engineering from Iowa State University, and a Bachelor of Engineering in electronics and communication engineering from University of Madras, India. He enjoys playing badminton and tennis with fellow investors and founders.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture

Name: Samuel Gil
Professional Bio:
Samuel is partner at JME Ventures, an early-stage, sector-agnostic VC firm based in Madrid, Spain. From idea to exit, the firm strives to support its portfolio companies through their entire financing lifecycles, helping them scale and compete on a global scale by providing strategic, operational and financial support. 

Before joining JME, Samuel was an investment manager at Faraday Venture Partners. 

Prior to his career in venture capital, Samuel worked as energy trader at Iberdrola and as technology consultant at Accenture.
Education/Personal Bio:
Samuel holds an MBA from the IESE Business School and an MS in electrical and computer engineering from the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Spain. He is also a CFA charterholder. 

Samuel is passionate about family, reading, travel, dogs, and electric guitars.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Conor Mills
Professional Bio:
Conor is a Principal with ACT Venture Capital and a member of the investment team. ACT has raised in excess of $500M across multiple funds and invests in early-stage technology companies from seed to growth stages. Conor is responsible for deal origination and execution and works closely with several teams across the portfolio. 

Prior to ACT, Conor was a member of the corporate development team at Paddy Power Betfair PLC, one of the world's largest publicly listed online gaming companies. Conor was responsible for developing and executing the group's global expansion strategy and assessing all strategic M&A opportunities. He worked closely on key components of the £6B merger of Paddy Power and Betfair, and co-led the $48M acquisition of US daily fantasy sports operator Draft. 

Before joining Paddy Power Betfair, Conor worked in commercial banking and specialist corporate finance across the technology, life sciences, and oil and gas sectors.
Education/Personal Bio: Conor is a First Class Honours business and economics graduate from Trinity College Dublin and is a CFA charterholder.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Zhizhong (Joel) Yao
Professional Bio:
Zhizhong is a Senior Associate at Sofinnova Partners, a life-science venture firm based in Paris and focused on early-stage biotech startups developing innovative therapeutics and platform technologies. In this role, he performs diligence on new Seed and Series A investment opportunities, and supports portfolio companies as a board observer. 

Currently, Zhizhong serves as a board observer for Nodthera Limited, which develops small molecule inhibitors of the NLRP3 inflammasome for the treatment of inflammatory and neuroinflammatory diseases. He is also an observer at Polyneuron Pharmaceuticals, which develops injectable glycopolymers to selectively eliminate the pathological autoantibodies in autoimmune disorders.
Education/Personal Bio: Zhizhong received his BSc in Chemistry and Molecular Engineering from Beijing University before earning a PhD in chemistry and chemical biology from Harvard University; he completed his doctoral work at the Department of Systems Biology and Systems Pharmacology at Harvard Medical School. Afterward, he was a Human Frontier Science Program Cross-Disciplinary Fellow at the French National Institute of Agricultural Research.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Healthcare

Name: Fabio Tran
Professional Bio:
Fabio is a director at Omidyar Network, where he leads the firm's education strategy and investments in Brazil and collaborates on investments in Latin America. He works directly with eduK, Agenda Edu, Guten News, and Quero Educação, among other portfolio companies. He also works with EdTech ecosystem grantees CIEB and FGV-CEIPE and is responsible for Omidyar's local advocacy and policy work in Brazil. 

Fabio also currently serves as a board member at Instituto Semeia, a Brazilian NGO working to develop sustainable management models for parks and protected areas in the country. 

Prior to joining Omidyar Network, Fabio worked for 4 years at Rocket Internet, where he last served as senior vice president of venture development, taking different leadership and C-level roles in early-stage companies of Rocket's consumer tech portfolio in Latin America and Europe. 

Fabio worked in nonprofits in Brazil as Executive Director at Fundação Estudar and interim Director for Policy and Strategy at Endeavor Brazil. He began his career in strategic management consulting at McKinsey and A.T. Kearney.
Education/Personal Bio: Fabio received an MPA from Harvard University and an MBA from Northwestern University. He earned his bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from the University of São Paulo, Brazil.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Laura McCoolidge
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | LPs,London Summit 2025
Preferred Stages: Seed,Series A,Series B,Series C+,LP Positions,Venture Debt

Name: Rob Barbara
Professional Bio:
Rob is co-founder of Build Ventures, a Canadian early-stage venture firm based in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Build focuses on the underserved Atlantic Canadian innovation ecosystem. 

Prior to Build, Rob founded Beaujolais Private Investment Management, a private wealth management firm that was part of Burgundy Asset Management. He grew the firm to $400M in assets under management. He also founded eSalveo, a messaging and transaction platform for the primary care physician market. Rob has been an investment banker and an economist as well.
Education/Personal Bio:
Rob has a Bachelor and a Master of Arts in economics from Queen's University and an MBA from Western University's Ivey Business School, both schools located in Ontario, Canada. He is also a CFA charterholder. 

Rob is married (Robin) and has three sons. He is active in his community, currently as a Board Member of the QE2 Health Sciences Centre Foundation and the Canadian Maritime Heritage Foundation; he is actively competitive in sailboat racing.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,London Summit 2025

Name: Sylwia Hadaj
Professional Bio:
Sylwia is a Principal at Evolution Equity Partners, focused on sourcing and monitoring investment opportunities across technology sectors with a specific focus on enterprise software. 

Sylwia has over a decade of experience in private equity, corporate finance, and investment management gained while working for family offices and boutique financial advisory firms in Spain and Switzerland. She advised on numerous M&A transactions, including turnaround situations, and debt and equity offerings across a diverse set of industries including retail, semiconductor, technology, renewable energy, and infrastructure. Responsible for post-acquisition management, she implemented financial and operating improvements, working closely with management teams and boards.
Education/Personal Bio: Sylwia earned an MS in international finance from the joint program of IEB, the London School of Economics Political Science, and The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She also holds an MA in economics from the Maria Curie-Sklodowska University in Lublin, Poland.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Ann Kim
Investing Thesis: Venture debt into early stage tech
Professional Bio: Ann Kim is Managing Director and Sector Head of the Frontier Technology group at Silicon Valley Bank. She focuses on VC-backed high-growth companies in aerospace, transportation, robotics, IoT, virtual reality, consumer electronics, and semiconductors. She was previously on the Corporate Finance team, advising later-stage and public tech companies. Prior to SVB, Ann was a consultant and focused on commercialization strategies for pharmaceutical and medical device companies.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ann earned a Bachelor's degree in Molecular and Cell Biology from UC Berkeley. She was President of the Korean-American Student Organization and the Korean-American Scientists and Engineers Association (KSEA).

She is a Bay Area native and active in the venture and tech community. She is currently a Kauffman Fellow, lead mentor to TechStars Starburst Space Accelerator, and member of the Asia America MultiTechnology Association (AAMA).

Name: Dia Martin
Professional Bio:
Dia has over a decade of experience in impact investing. She has a strong track record across multiple sectors, including financial services, healthcare, and agriculture. 

Dia is a Managing Director at the U.S. International Development Finance Corporation (DFC), where she originates debt financings in emerging markets. She also leads the Portfolio for Impact program, which is focused on scalable, earlier-stage companies that are highly developmental. Through the Portfolio for Impact program, DFC has provided over $150M in debt financing to innovative businesses that are committed to having a positive social impact. 

Previously, Dia worked in Germany with Finance in Motion GmbH, an alternative asset management company, and was a recipient of the Robert Bosch Foundation Fellowship in 2007-2008. Dia has also held positions with Citigroup, Moody's Investors Service covering the healthcare sector, and J.P. Morgan.
Education/Personal Bio:
Dia holds an MA in international relations from Johns Hopkins University's Paul H. Nitze School of Advanced International Studies and an MBA in finance from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She earned her BS in finance from Hampton University. 

Dia enjoys being actively involved in her community, traveling, great desserts, and distance running.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,London Summit 2025

Name: Kenneth Tom
Investing Thesis: FoF Model, $50mm fund size min
Professional Bio: Kenneth is a Senior Investment Director in Cambridge Associates' San Francisco office, and he currently works with 3 foundations, 3 endowments, and 3 family clients. He has 14 years investing experience - 8 of those with Cambridge Associates. In addition to his generalist responsibilities, Kenneth contributes to research in venture capital, mission-related investing, and cryptocurrencies. Prior to rejoining Cambridge Associates in 2016, Kenneth worked at Neuberger Berman in the Investment Strategy Group in New York and transitioned into Wealth Management in San Francisco. In these roles he advised families, nonprofit entities, and corporate plans.
Education/Personal Bio: Kenneth is a CFA charterholder and got his BSBA degree in Finance and Marketing from Georgetown University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Carina Namih
Professional Bio:
Carina has spent over a decade building and investing at the frontier of AI.

She founded HelixNano in 2013, pioneering the use of AI and lab automation to design new therapies. Backed by Sam Altman and Jeff Dean, they took one of the first AI-designed medicines into the clinic. The team now works in partnership with OpenAI on managing biorisks. 

Carina is a General Partner at Plural, the new $800m early-stage fund, backing the most ambitious founders, on a mission to scale globally consequential companies from Europe.

Her investments span AI infrastructure and applications, robotics, next-gen compute, and energy - including Sunrise Robotics, Softmax, Phasecraft, and Molyon.

Carina also serves as a Trustee of The Alan Turing Institute, the UK’s national institute for AI.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Carole Wainaina
Professional Bio:
Carole is the Senior Advisor to the CEO and former COO of Africa50, the pan-African infrastructure investment platform capitalized by African countries, the African Development Bank, two African Central Banks, and other institutional investors. She serves on the boards of Helios Towers PLC (LSE) and the Equatorial Coca-Cola Bottling Company as a non executive director. She is also an angel investor, supporting mainly women entrepreneurs through investments and coaching.

Carole is a well-respected business executive with global experience in the private and public sectors at senior levels, including strategy formulation, leading multidisciplinary teams, and driving organizational transformation. Before joining Africa50, she served as the Assistant Secretary General for Human Resources at the United Nations, leading transformational initiatives for the Secretary General and member states. Prior to joining the UN, she served on the Executive Committee of Royal Philips in the Netherlands as EVP & Chief Human Resources Officer. Before this, she worked for 13 years at Coca-Cola Company in senior roles, including Chief of Staff for the Global Chairman and CEO, Group HR Director Eurasia & Africa, and President of the Coca-Cola Africa Foundation. She started her career as a management consultant at PriceWaterhouseCoopers.
Education/Personal Bio:
Carole holds a Bachelor of Business Administration degree from the University of Southern Queensland in Australia. 

She is passionate about the economic and social development of Africa through enterprise as well as the empowerment of women and youth as agents for change. She is a board member of 3 nonprofit organizations: Discovery Learning Alliance ' Impact(ed), International Executive Service Corp (IESE), and United Success.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Luke Erickson
Investing Thesis: Using frameworks developed over 12 years in venture & growth equity, I take a quantitative approach to underwriting product market fit & helping founders scale successfully.
Professional Bio:
Luke leads the data practice on Forerunner's investment team, bringing a quantitative approach to underwriting product market fit, predicting unit economics at scale, and identifying internal workflows ripe for automation. 

Luke’s perspective is informed by his career in marketing & growth strategy, where he has consulted or personally managed growth strategy for over 60 enterprise and consumer businesses, spanning seed-stage to Fortune 500 companies. He uses the perspective gained through operating to advise on consumer investments with a focus on underwriting & informing growth & data strategy.

Previously, Luke was a Partner at Tribe Capital, a Vice President at CapitalG (the growth equity investment arm of Alphabet), and a Product Manager at Social Capital, where he worked on the automated investment service, Capital-as-a-Service.
Education/Personal Bio: Luke is a graduate of Vanderbilt University, with a Bachelor of Science in Human and Organizational Development. He is Texas-born, now living in Fairview Park, Oakland, by way of Nashville and Washington, DC. On Saturdays, you can find Luke walking his (very large) mastiff puppy in the Berkeley Hills.

Name: Carlotta Siniscalco
Professional Bio: Carlotta is an investor with Emergence Capital, an enterprise SaaS-focused venture capital firm based in Silicon Valley. She brings several years of global investing experience in the financial services and financial technology sector. Prior to joining Emergence, Carlotta spent a year at Ribbit Capital, a VC fund focused on finTech, and 3 years in the financial services group at Advent International, a large private equity fund. She began her career working in the investment banking division at Goldman Sachs in New York City.
Education/Personal Bio: Carlotta was born and raised in Italy and moved to the United States to attend The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, where she graduated cum laude with a BS in economics. Carlotta also obtained an MBA from Stanford University. She lives in San Francisco with her husband Federico and her son Leonardo. She loves skiing, live music, and making great food.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Maria Karaivanova
Professional Bio:
Maria is an operator turned venture investor backing exceptional entrepreneurs looking to disrupt industries and build products that customers love. As a Principal at Madrona Venture Group, she focuses on cloud infrastructure, SaaS & intelligent applications, security, ML/AI and voice. 

Prior to Madrona, Maria was the CxO and Head of Strategic Partnerships at Cloudflare where she joined as one of the company's first 20 employees. During her tenure at Cloudflare, the company scaled from 20 to 500+ employees and grew annual revenue from $0 to over $100M securing $182M of funding and becoming a unicorn. Before that, Maria worked at Intel Capital investing in consumer internet and enterprise software. She also served in various roles at Boeing supporting helicopter (Chinook, Apache) and fighter jet programs (F-18, F- 15), and also worked at Expedia and Citigroup.
Education/Personal Bio:
Maria holds an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BSBA in Finance with high honors from Saint Louis University. 

She co-founded and serves on the board of sea.citi, a non-profit organization providing a platform for tech workers to engage with their local communities. She is a passionate supporter and mentor of female founders and investors through the Female Founders Alliance and other organizations. Maria is a frequent speaker at technology conferences and an occasional angel investor. 

Maria lives in Seattle with her husband and son.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Karthee Madasamy
Investing Thesis: Early stage deep tech, $1M to $2M checks, can lead or syndicate
Professional Bio:
Karthee is the Founding Managing Partner at MFV Partners, a Silicon Valley based, early-stage deep tech venture fund targeting technology startups disrupting traditional industries like Logistics, Automotive, Manufacturing, and others. Karthee invests in frontier-tech startups in Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, Energy, Quantum Computing, and data platforms. He represents MFV Partners’ investments in PsiQuantum (Quantum Computing Hardware), Agility Robotics (Humanoid Robotics for Manufacturing), and Sun Mobility (EV Tech platform), among others. 

Before MFV, Karthee spent 11 years as a Corporate Vice President and Managing Director at Qualcomm Ventures, where he invested across the US, Israel, and India. He started Qualcomm Ventures' investment activities in both Israel and India. Some of his notable investments include Waze (acquired by Google), MapMyIndia (NSE: MAPMYINDIA), Validity Sensors (acquired by Synaptics), and BORQS (NASDAQ IPO), among others. He continues as an independent director at MapMyIndia.

Before Qualcomm Ventures, Karthee led technical and product marketing roles in three semiconductor and wireless startups in Silicon Valley, specializing in 3G, WiFi, and Bluetooth. 

Karthee has a bachelor’s in electronics and communication engineering from the College of Engineering, Guindy in Chennai, India, and a master’s in electrical engineering from the University of Michigan. Karthee also holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. Karthee is also a Kauffman Fellow.
Education/Personal Bio: Karthee has a bachelor's in electronics and communication engineering from College of Engineering, Guindy in Chennai, India, and a master's in electrical engineering from the University of Michigan. Karthee also holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Boston,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Neb Mela
Professional Bio:
Nebiu (Neb) Mela is a Partner at Geodesic Capital, focusing on investments in paradigm-shifting deep technologies across various industries, including AI/CV, healthcare, advanced manufacturing, energy technologies, advanced imaging, precision technologies, robotics, and more. He was previously at Tishman Speyer Ventures, where he led early-stage investments aimed at transforming traditional industries such as construction, real estate, and energy and electrification. Neb was also an Investment Director at Intel Capital, where he focused on investing in foundational technologies in autonomy, robotics, mobility, vision systems, sensing, and edge computing. Before his tenure at Intel Capital, Neb worked in the technology investment banking groups at Wells Fargo Securities and Robinson Humphrey, assisting technology companies with capital raising, M&A, and leveraged buyouts. He began his career in consulting at Accenture.

Neb holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BS in Electrical Engineering from the University of Southern California Viterbi School of Engineering. He is also a Kauffman Fellow. In his free time, Neb enjoys traveling, spending time outdoors with his wife and two boys, and exploring hidden gems and restaurants in the Bay Area.
Education/Personal Bio: Neb holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BS in Electrical Engineering from the University of Southern California Viterbi School of Engineering. He is also a Kauffman Fellow. In his free time, Neb enjoys traveling, spending time outdoors with his wife and two boys, and exploring hidden gems and restaurants in the Bay Area.

Name: David Kerr
Professional Bio:
David Kerr is Managing Director at Allos Ventures and sits on the board of Sharpen. Prior to joining Allos, David was CEO of Octiv, where he led the company to a successful exit with an acquisition by Conga. 

Prior to Octiv, David served as Vice President and GM of the home and auto channel at Groupon and served on the Angie's List executive team as GM of e-commerce. David joined Angie's List from his post as president of GHX Europe, a healthcare supply chain provider. His career at GHX began when the company acquired NoInk, a mobile sales automation solution, where he served as president and CEO. 

David also served as executive chairman of beauty e-commerce site Jada Beauty, which was acquired by Sally Beauty Holdings.
Education/Personal Bio: David graduated from Princeton University with a bachelor's degree in politics. He enjoys the occasional triathlon, masters swimming, hiking, and international travel with his wife Julie and three kids.

Name: Kirill Kozhevnikov
Professional Bio: Kirill Kozhevnikov is a Managing Partner at Conjunction Capital – $50M technology fund for frontier markets, and a sister-fund of RTP Global. He is an early stage VC investor focused on MENA, Pakistan and Bangladesh, and currently residing in UAE. Previously he was a Partner of RTP Global, lived in India for 6 years and was investing in Indian and South East Asian technology companies at seed, Series A, and Series B stages. Kirill has a Master’s degree in Engineering and Economics from Moscow Aviation Institute, an MBA from ChicagoBooth, and is a Kauffman Fellow.
Education/Personal Bio: Kirill has a master's degree in engineering and economics from Moscow Aviation Institute (National Research University), and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Dubai,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: James Brennan
Job Title: Investment Director - Innovation and Venture Capital, Ireland Strategic Investment Fund
Professional Bio:
James is an Investment Director at the Ireland Strategic Investment Fund, a '9B sovereign development fund established in 2014 to invest on a commercial basis in support of economic activity and employment in the country.




James is responsible for the ISIF's venture capital strategy, which has the objective of supporting a vibrant and diverse funding landscape for early-stage, high-potential technology and healthcare businesses in Ireland. He has led the ISIF's strategic investments across a wide range of venture capital, growth equity funds, and listed patient capital vehicles and leveraged these relationships to deliver a number of unique co-investment opportunities aligned to ISIF's long-term strategic mandate. James is currently the Chairman of the European Venture Fund Investor Network, a pan-European platform for dialogue launched in 2011 by major national investors in European VC.
Education/Personal Bio: James holds a BSc in theoretical physics and an MSc in computational science from University College Dublin. He has been a CFA charterholder since 2012.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,London Summit 2025

Name: Marc Schröder
Investing Thesis:
MGV is not just a top-tier enterprise technology venture fund; we are partners committed to turning extraordinary visions into reality. We stand shoulder to shoulder with the most innovative Founders in the enterprise software space, guiding them from their earliest stages to scalable growth and beyond.
MGV, co-founded by Marc Schröder, has built a strong reputation by being an early backer of remarkable companies like Modern Health, Observe.ai, Origin, Ascend, Leap, Recora Health, and Kolors. Our approach is hands-on and founder-focused, ensuring that each company receives tailored support, operational expertise, and strategic guidance.
At MGV, we believe that the success of our Founders measures our success. Armed with decades of experience, our team provides unparalleled support in essential growth areas, operationalizing sales and scaling businesses sustainably. We are committed to building long-term relationships, offering ongoing support, and leveraging our collective knowledge to turn visions into thriving enterprises.
Whether you're a Founder seeking a partner to accelerate your journey or a Limited Partner aiming for exceptional returns, MGV is where visions are nurtured and success stories are born. Join us at MGV, where extraordinary people build extraordinary companies, creating lasting value and lasting impact.
Professional Bio: As the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of MGV, Marc Schröder is committed to establishing MGV as the premier venture firm for accelerating the visions of world-class tech entrepreneurs. Under Marc's stewardship, MGV has swiftly ascended to a top-quartile firm, surpassing the performance of 95% of venture funds. The performance of MGV is driven by Marc’s unique approach to venture investing. He has proven that providing intensive sales training, devising robust fundraising strategies and securing follow-on investments is the best way to support founders and drive the deepest return for investors. Business Insider has recognized him as one of the Top 100 global seed investors, and his perspectives are published regularly in Forbes, Crunchbase, and TechCrunch.
Education/Personal Bio: Marc is originally from the Netherlands, grew up in Cape Town, South Africa, and graduated with a law degree in Germany. He is a husband and Father of three young children. He constantly travels between MGV office locations in San Francisco, New York and his Family in Munich, Germany. In his free time he enjoys working out, traveling the world, good food and especially spending time with his family.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Andrew Gershfeld
Professional Bio: Andrew is a General Partner at Flint Capital - an investment company formed in Boston now with worldwide offices focused on supporting entrepreneurs from Israel, Europe, and the US in the early stages of business. Andrew brings deep consumer startup expertise to the team, with his particular interest in healthTech, lifestyle, social, and marketing topics. Andrew serves on the boards of Inten.to, Flo.health, JobToday, Yva.ai, CreamFinance, and YouDo. He has also sourced an investment in ManyChat and is active with the company. Prior to his career in venture capital, Andrew was an entrepreneur who successfully built and sold one of the Groupon clones of Eastern Europe. As an entrepreneur, Andrew was keen on e-commerce business and contributed significantly to building the leaders of kids, furniture, and fashion online retailers of Eastern Europe. Previously, he was a consultant in the FMCG (fast-moving consumer goods) practice with a top management consulting company.
Education/Personal Bio:
Andrew earned a Bachelor of Science and a Master of Science in applied physics and math, and an Innovation Management professional degree from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (State University). 

Andrew is keen on alpine skiing, backcountry freeride, and yachting. He goes on exotic expeditions with the goal of finding untouched powder snow and wild bays.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Niki Pezeshki
Professional Bio:
Niki Pezeshki is a Partner on the investment team at Felicis Ventures. At Felicis, Niki has sourced and continues to work closely with the firm's investments in Guild Education, Guideline, Trusted Health, Modus, Cleo, Octave, FarmWise, DoNotPay, and SentiLink.

Prior to joining Felicis, he was on the investment team at Summit Partners, a tech-focused growth equity firm in Menlo Park. Before Summit, Niki lived in Austin, TX and was on the investment team at Vista Equity Partners, a private equity firm focused on investing in software and technology-enabled businesses. He also had a brief stint at the Climate Corporation (a former Felicis portfolio company), where he focused on sales strategy and operations.
Education/Personal Bio: Niki received a BS in Business Administration with Honors from the University of Southern California. He continues to be actively involved with the USC Value Investing Group.

Name: Jehan Chu
Professional Bio:
Jehan Chu is co-Founder and Managing Partner at Kenetic, a Hong Kong-based blockchain VC investment fund and cryptocurrency trading fund. 

A former front-end developer, he started investing in bitcoin in 2013 and in 2014 he founded the Ethereum HK community and co-Founded the Bitcoin Association of Hong Kong; in 2016 he founded the Hyperledger HK community. 

Jehan serves as co-Chairman of the Blockchain Committee at Hong Kong Fintech Association and is co- Founder and Board member of Social Alpha Foundation, a blockchain for social impact nonprofits.
Education/Personal Bio:
Jehan graduated from Johns Hopkins University, receiving a double major bachelor's degree in international relations and East Asian studies. He also received an MA in cultural enterprise from Hong Kong University and Central St. Martin's, University of the Arts London. Jehan is a Singapore University of Social Sciences Fellow and has lectured at Hong Kong University, HK Polytechnic University, and the City University of HK MBA program; he was also a Google Empowering Young Entrepreneurs (EYE) Mentor. 

Jehan sits on the boards of Global Patrons of the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, Para Site Art Space, and Design Trust HK.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,London Summit 2025

Name: Ashwin Shashindranath
Professional Bio:
Ashwin Shashindranath is a Partner at Energy Impact Partners, where he looks for and works with entrepreneurs who are genuinely excited about being agents of change in the climate tech landscape. Ashwin brings a unique combination of 15 years of investment experience and hands-on entrepreneurial experience at startups.




Prior to joining EIP, Mr. Ashwin was a Managing Director in Macquarie Capital’s Green Investment group leading venture capital and growth equity investments in energy and mobility transition. Prior to Macquarie, Ashwin was a Managing Director at Evergy Ventures, venture capital arm of Evergy Inc (Investor-owned regulated electric utility) leading over a dozen successful investments in companies focused around Digital Transformation, Energy Storage, and Distributed Energy Resources.
Education/Personal Bio: Ashwin attended Missouri Institute of Science and Technology, where he received a bachelors degree, with Honors, in electrical engineering. Outside of work, Ashwin spends most of his time with his wife and four children exploring various cultures around the world.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,London Summit 2025

Name: Areije Al Shakar
Professional Bio:
Areije Al Shakar has over 20 years of experience in banking and venture capital.  She is the CEO of BE Ventures ( Bapco energies ventures) the venture arm of the national oil and gas / energy company of Bahrain. Previously she was the fund manager and director of the Al Waha Venture Capital Fund of Funds (Al Waha Fund), with $100M in assets and Head of Innovation at Bahrain Development Bank. 

Areije has worked in other organizations in Bahrain, including Investcorp, Citibank, and BNP Paribas, as well as at Lehman Brothers in London and Dubai, where she served on the treasury, investment management, and advisory side.
Education/Personal Bio: Areije is a 'third culture person,' born in Bahrain and raised in Geneva, New York, and London. She holds a Master of Science in Public Policy and Management from the School of Oriental and African Studies (SOAS), University of London; a Bachelor of Commerce in Finance from the John Molson School of Business, Concordia University; and is a Certified Business Coach and Mentor from the Chartered Management Institute, UK. Areije is fluent in English, Arabic, and French. She enjoys reading, writing, long walks, and functional movement.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Kirill Varlamov
Professional Bio:
Kirill is an IT entrepreneur and investor, and currently serves as General Partner for IIDF (Internet Initiative Development Fund). With 400+ investments made, IIDF is the most active Russian VC fund and accelerator. IIDF invests in pre-seed, seed, and Series A stages, accumulating investments in the most successful companies while they grow, such as PM&HM, Promobot, Brandquad, Texel, and many others. IIDF provides, as a development institution, a variety of educational programs for entrepreneurs, investors, and big corporations. 

Kirill also lobbies for law changes in the Russian jurisdiction to improve the entrepreneurial ecosystem. 

From 2001 to 2013, Kirill co-founded and served as CEO of the business software development company NAUMEN, a Russia-based vendor of applications such as soft switch, help desk, and several AI-based products. In 2011 NAUMEN was recognized as the fastest growing software development company in Russia, and among the top 100 IT companies.
Education/Personal Bio: Kirill earned his master's degree in 'IT for management' at Ural State Technical University. He obtained his Executive MBA at the Moscow School of Management Skolkovo.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Vidya Vasu-Devan
Professional Bio:
Vidya leads the Gates Foundation’s $2.5bn Strategic Investment Fund (“SIF”) and chairs the SIF Investment Committee. Since 2012, Vidya has worked across sectors and geographies to source, structure, and manage venture capital, debt, and guarantee investments. SIF supports entrepreneurs and companies that have a critical role to play in achieving the foundation’s ambitious goals in global health and poverty alleviation and U.S. education and economic mobility. Vidya leads SIF’s investment efforts in the vaccines/biologics sector and has led and worked on investments in Achaogen (AKAO), AgBiome, Arsanis (ASNS), Biological E, BioNTech (BNTX), Charter School Growth Fund, Civic Builders, Curevac (CVAC), Just Biotherapeutics (acq. by Evotec), M-KOPA, Merck, and Sanofi.

Prior to joining the foundation, Vidya was an investment professional in the public markets proprietary hedge fund of Goldman Sachs (GSPS) where she led the healthcare portfolio and also invested in financial institutions. Prior to that, Vidya worked in investment banking at Goldman Sachs, advising and executing on innovative structured finance transactions for financial institution clients.
Education/Personal Bio: Vidya received an MBA and a certificate in public management and social innovation from the Stanford Graduate School of Business. She also holds a BA in astrophysics with concentrations in mathematics and economics from Columbia University. She lives in Seattle with her husband and her two young sons and enjoys reading, running, cooking and playing tennis.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Saad Siddiqui
Investing Thesis: B2B and B2C
Professional Bio: Saad is one of the founding members of the recently spun-out Telstra Ventures, a $565M global venture capital firm. He focuses on enterprise technology investments, particularly focusing on AI, data Infrastructure, next- generation SaaS, and cybersecurity. Saad has led investments in Trifacta, Subspace, Incorta, NS1, Ripcord, Cofense and Boomtown, and is involved with the investment in Asapp. In previous roles as a corporate development executive, he has executed M&A transactions valued at over $7B in aggregate. Prior to Telstra Ventures, Saad was in corporate development at Informatica and was a member of Cisco's venture investing and acquisitions team, covering cloud, big data, and virtualization. Before moving to the Bay Area, he worked in mergers & acquisitions at RBC Capital Markets and was Assistant Vice President in strategy at Merrill Lynch's Global Wealth Management division.
Education/Personal Bio: Saad migrated to the US at the age of 14 for his education. While working multiple jobs to finance his schooling, he earned a BS in finance from Rutgers University. He is a a recipient of the the President's Volunteer Service Award (awarded by President Obama), the RBS Alumni Leadership Recognition Award, and the Alumni of the Year award. Saad was a co-founder and served on the Young Leadership Board of New York Needs You, a former member of the Board of Engineers of Blue Engine, and served on the board of the Pakistan Rehabilitation of the Disabled Foundation.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Infrastructure,KF SIG | LPs

Name: Matt Harrigan
Investing Thesis: ecosystem
Professional Bio:
Matt is Co-founder and CEO of Company; he is also Managing Partner at Company Ventures. In 2013 Matt cofounded Grand Central Tech, a highly-competitive no-equity-fee, year-long accelerator program. By 2018 the value of curating and co-locating top tier companies had made itself clear and the decision was made to expand. GCT thus evolved into what is now Company, a 1.1 million- square-foot, multi-tenant tech campus in the heart of Manhattan. Tenants range from the firm's community of 150 startups, to VC firms, to divisions of Fortune 500 companies. Company Ventures focuses on the startups that inhabit Company, leveraging the advantages of time and proximity to both support and evaluate the companies. 

In addition to his role at Company, Matt serves on the boards of The Advisory Council for NYCx, New York City's municipal tech engagement program; and WiTNY, Women in Tech New York. 

Matt started his career at Booz Allen Hamilton in international economic development. His clients were primarily USAID and the World Bank, leading Matt to spend the better part of 3 years living and working in Africa: Ghana, Zimbabwe, and primarily Tanzania. After Booz, Matt worked as an innovation strategy consultant at Fahrenheit 212. From there, he moved to ESPN, overhauling the analytics infrastructure across all mobile products.
Education/Personal Bio: Matt is a graduate of Rice University, earning a BA in history and foreign policy studies. He currently sits on the board of the NYC Leadership Council for the Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence. Matt is a New York native and lives in Brooklyn with his wife, Rebecca, and their son, Henry. He is an avid skier, and a loyal, if also laboring, Mets and Rangers fan.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Amy Chen
Professional Bio:
Currently, Amy serves as Executive Director of the Board at Apollo Future Mobility Group LTE (860:HK). She isa member of the Investment Committee and the Chairwoman of the Corporate Governance Committee. Apollo Future Mobility Group Ltd is an investment holding company that mainly provides smart mobility services and automotive technology solutions.




Amy is also a Venture Partner at VHM Ventures. She is responsible for the firm's fundraising and strategic partnership efforts. VHM Ventures invests in biomedical breakthroughs that change the world of medicine, around the convergence of pharmaceuticals, devices, and technology. Our team formed VHM Ventures to mobilize capital into those opportunities when they are about to enter a major inflection point.




Previously, she served as Director of Global Partnerships of a med-tech startup Bria Medical, a cutting-edge transdermal drug delivery system with a robust product pipeline. Her role is to help Bria's global expansion as well as its fundraising effort. Earlier, she was the Managing Director of Alpha Square Group, and led the firm's investment development department, designing asset allocation strategy, sourcing opportunities in all asset classes with a strong focus on VC/PE, and forming long-term strategic partnerships globally for the firm. She also assembles and manages the firm's venture partners, outside experts, and advisor network.




Amy has backed companies in med-tech, retail-tech, Internet services, and FinTech. These investments include SoFi, an online personal finance company, and online bank; Figure, a FinTech company with the mission of leveraging blockchain AI to unlock new access points for consumer credit products; and Rani Therapeutics, a disruptive technology for the oral delivery of biologics.




A media professional by training, Amy spent four years working at international TV stations as an on-air personality, covering business and political news. Before her TV career, she worked for the United Nations in the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) Support Unit (formerly known as the Millennium Development Goals Support Unit).
Education/Personal Bio: Amy earned a Bachelor of Arts in Journalism from Nanjing University and an MA in Media, Culture, and Communication (MCC) from New York University. She is a CAIA charter holder and a Milken Young Leader.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Damineh Mycroft
Professional Bio:
Damineh Mycroft is an investing principal for Boeing HorizonX Ventures. Based in San Francisco, she works across Silicon Valley to manage Boeing's existing venture programs and discover new partnerships in the Bay Area. 

Damineh joined Boeing in 2003 and spent 7 years with the Space and Intelligence Systems program in El Segundo, California. She held positions in a variety of functions, from financial planning to business operations on government and commercial satellites. In 2010, she transitioned to Boeing Defense and Intelligence Systems headquarters in St. Louis, where she managed and led the relationships with Defense Contract Audit and Management agencies. 

In 2012, Damineh was selected for the Boeing Leadership Rotation Program, transitioning to Boeing Commercial Airplanes in Seattle. Upon completion of her leadership program, she moved to San Francisco to start her investing career.
Education/Personal Bio: Damineh earned her Bachelor of Business Administration from the University of Southern California and went on to receive a Master of Business Administration and a doctorate in organizational leadership, both from Pepperdine University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Caroline Lewis
Investing Thesis: We invest in women-led b2b saas, enterprise, and B2b2c software companies across the US at early seed stage (less than $10MM post money). Areas of interest are care economy, foundational industries (construction and supply change), health, experience tech
Professional Bio:
Caroline Lewis is a Partner at Rogue Venture Partners, an Oregon-based VC firm that invests in seed and Series A tech companies across the US. In addition, Caroline is the Managing Partner for Rogue Women, Rogue Venture Partner's fund dedicated to investing in the best pre-seed women-led startups from across the US. 

Dedicated to sharing best practices in entrepreneurship and investing, she volunteers locally and in undercapitalized ecosystems like Iraq, India, and Ukraine. She serves on the boards of World Oregon and Oregon State University's Advantage Accelerator and is a board observer for Stix, Source, and AllVoices. 

Prior to Rogue, Caroline was Senior Director of Strategy and Operations for Global Design, Product, and Merchandising at Nike where she managed a $500M portfolio of strategic programs focused on consumer experience, digitization, and Big Data. Prior to being recruited to work for Nike, Caroline was a management consultant for Propeller and Hitachi Consulting, working with Fortune 100 companies on enterprise technology implementations and organizational restructuring. 

Her love for startups comes from her early career experience as a founder of an e-commerce business and as a leader at a consumer health product company.
Education/Personal Bio: Caroline graduated as a Division 1 field hockey player with an MS in psychology from Davidson College, in Davidson, North Carolina. She then earned an MBA with a focus on entrepreneurship from Portland State University. She lives in Portland with her husband and daughter and enjoys rafting, beekeeping, and skiing.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Laura Yao
Professional Bio: Laura was a global macro investor at Bridgewater and an operator at a climate tech startup before she became a partner at EQT Ventures investing in cloud infrastructure and B2B software. She's starting a fund called Odyssey Ventures that invests in early-growth-stage climate and infrastructure companies.
Education/Personal Bio: Laura was born in China and moved at a young age to Tallahassee, Florida. She graduated from Yale with a BA in economics and mathematics, and went on to get her MBA from Stanford. She enjoys hiking, camping, going to shows, Saturdays in Dolores Park, and reading, both fiction and nonfiction.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Infrastructure

Name: Matt Boras
Professional Bio:
Matt leads venture capital activities at RXR Realty, where he is responsible for sourcing and executing investments in early stage real estate and construction technology companies. Matt also works closely with RXR's management team to incubate new business ideas and form strategic partnerships focused on driving growth. 

Prior to joining RXR, Matt was a member of the Special Situations Group at Colony Capital, focused on investing in businesses across markets, platforms, and asset classes. Matt previously was responsible for the identification, evaluation, and execution of real estate investments at NorthStar Asset Management Group and Five Mile Capital Partners.
Education/Personal Bio: Matt holds an AB in International Relations from Brown University.
