Prior to that, his career was focused on running the Mid-Market Leveraged Finance business where he advised, developed and structured innovative, multi-disciplinary and integrated financial solutions across the entire debt financing spectrum. John has a passion for working with entrepreneurs to scale their businesses by utilizing his experience of advising, capital structuring, funding and investing. By leveraging his networks, strategic partners and the Bank's distribution channels, John is well placed to assist entrepreneurs with scaling their businesses more optimally than they would otherwise be able to do on their own.
Education/Personal Bio: John has studied financial degrees and worked on his family's farm in Zimbabwe performing various farming roles from agriculture to financial, travelled and worked in London and is now growing and leading a Growth Capital Solutions business within Rand Merchant Bank. He is a proud father and husband, wants to make a difference for his country and family and ensure his children have every opportunity to lead a fulfilling and rewarding life.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Jackson Cummings
Professional Bio:
Jackson Cummings is Head of Wellington Access Ventures at Wellington Management, where he will be focused on investing in Seed through Series B+ opportunities from founders who have been historically excluded from access to capital.

Prior to joining Wellington, Jackson was an Investor at Salesforce Ventures, Salesforce's strategic investment arm that invests in innovative enterprise cloud companies, with 300+ portfolio companies across 20+ countries. While at Salesforce Ventures, Jackson has worked on or led 30+.

Previously, Jackson was an investor at Top Tier Capital Partners, a global venture-focused Fund of Funds, where he supported investments in fund managers as a Limited Partner, venture secondaries, and direct co-investments. While at Top Tier Capital Partners, Jackson worked to help develop and build an emerging micro-VC focused investment fund.

Jackson was recognized by Forbes 30 Under 30 for Ventures Capital in 2021, and in 2020 by HBCUvc for its venture capital focused 31 Under 31 List alongside other investors, fund managers, and organizational leaders. Jackson is also actively involved in the BLCK VC as a board member and Co-Creator of the Black Venture Institute.
Education/Personal Bio:
Jackson graduated from Stanford University with a bachelor's of science in Science, Technology and Society and was a member of the football team. While at Stanford, Jackson was a running back and special teams member -successfully heading to four consecutive BCS bowl appearances including Rose Bowl and Orange Bowl victories. 

Jackson lives in Brooklyn is passionate about supporting more diversity in tech and the broader VC community. He volunteers at organizations like The Hidden Genius Project and is actively advising underrepresented founders. In his spare time, you can find Jackson playing pickup basketball or discussing automotive design and engineering.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Lara Lemann
Professional Bio: Lara is a co-founder and investor at MAYA Capital. She started her career at the Brazilian Ministry of Education before transitioning to the CSR department at Ambev where she led the development of new products. Through these projects she connected with a variety of entrepreneurs and started investing as an angel. In 2018, Lara co-founded MAYA to continue investing in Latin America's most promising ventures.
Education/Personal Bio: Lara is Brazilian and Swiss and grew up in between São Paulo and Zurich. She pursued her undergraduate degree from Columbia University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Vica Manos
Investing Thesis: Application-layer AI in mission-critical industries (health, commerce, defence)
Professional Bio:
Vica Manos is the co-founder and General Partner of ByteSized Capital, a UK-anchored venture capital firm backing AI-native companies in mission-critical sectors. She was previously a Partner at Anthemis, where she ran the firm’s global early-stage strategy.

With nearly two decades of experience at the intersection of technology and regulation, Vica has built a track record of backing visionary teams who break through regulatory complexity and turn it into competitive advantage. Her board work spans companies from Currencycloud to Yulife, Numan, Hurdle and Apollo Agriculture, among many others, each reshaping their respective industries.

When she’s not working with bold entrepreneurs solving difficult problems, Vica enjoys spending time with her partner and their two children, where dog-walks, cook-outs and board games take centre-stage. She loves to travel, speaks five languages, and is an avid baker.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Clay Whitehead
Investing Thesis: Tech that changes the world
Professional Bio: Clay Whitehead is an entrepreneur turned investor, dedicated to supporting fellow founders as the Managing Partner at Pomegranate Ventures. Prior to Pomegranate, Clay founded PresenceLearning, the largest telehealth marketplace for kids and teens with special needs and mental health issues. The company has scaled to over 1,000 people and remains true to its mission of unlocking the potential of all children. Clay is especially focused on the power of coaching to accelerate company growth, working with the CEOs of companies like Databricks and Auth0 through 10XCEO and YPO. He began his investing career at Venrock. Investments include Counsyl, Uber, Gitlab, Notion, and Digital Ocean.
Education/Personal Bio: Clay received his A.B. from the the Woodrow Wilson School of Public and International Affairs at Princeton University, where he was a Shultz scholar. He also holds an MBA. from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business. He is on the board of the Pacific One Chapter of YPO.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Ginger Rothrock
Professional Bio: Dr. Ginger Rothrock is the Senior Investment Director of HG Ventures, the Corporate Venture Arm of The Heritage Group, where she invests in early to growth stage companies developing advanced materials and systems for the circular economy, energy, water, specialty chemicals, and transportation infrastructure.  Ginger has worked at the intersection of science, business, and innovation her entire career and deeply appreciates the opportunity to merge her operating experience with her desire to invest in people.  She's particularly passionate about science and engineering anchoring the next generation of transformative startups.  Before joining HG Ventures, Ginger served as Vice President of Technology and Commercialization at RTI International where she oversaw the commercialization of a $1 billion portfolio of R&D and served as a mentor and coach to numerous scientific innovators.  She is also an accomplished scientist and serial entrepreneur who empathizes with our entrepreneurs’ unique challenges.
Education/Personal Bio: Ginger holds a PhD in Polymer and Analytical Chemistry from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and completed her undergraduate work at Furman University, where she was a Truman Scholar, Goldwater Scholar and member of the Track and Field team. She is intensely passionate about mentoring female and scientific entrepreneurs through Techstars, STEM organizations, universities and more. On weekends she and her husband can most often be found outside with their two daughters and rescue dog.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Swapna Gupta
Professional Bio: Climate tech VC
Education/Personal Bio:
Swapna attended the National Institute of Technology, Nagpur, where she received bachelor's degree in Electronics and communication engineering. She also has an MBA from prestigious Faculty of Management Studies, Delhi. 

Swapna is very passionate about food, travel and technology.

Name: Bame Pule
Professional Bio:
Bame Pule is the Founder and CEO of Africa Lighthouse Capital, a private equity firm making growth equity and other investments across Africa. In addition, Bame is a founder of, and angel investor in a number of early stage African companies in technology and other sectors. Bame has a passion for developing an ecosystem that enables the interdependent success of African investors investing in African ventures that are managed by African founders and addressing Africa's most pressing opportunities and challenges. 

Bame began his investment career as a college student, working at Citigroup in California and then at Credit Suisse in New York. After college, Bame's first full time job was as an investment banker at Goldman Sachs in New York where he focused on mergers and acquisitions; equity capital raisings; and debt capital raisings in the financial services sector. Later, Bame joined ShoreView Capital, a private equity firm focusing on growth equity and other investments across sectors in the United States and globally. Most recently, Bame worked at the emerging markets private equity firm Actis, where he focused on private equity investments across Africa and across sectors.
Education/Personal Bio: Bame graduated with an MBA from Harvard Business School and with bachelor's degrees in economics and politics from Pomona College.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Zuhair Khan
Professional Bio:
Zuhair is a Vice President in the Technology group at General Atlantic where he focuses on software and consumer internet investments, and is involved with GA's investments in A Place for Mom, AppsFlyer, Riskified, and StockX. 

Previously, Zuhair was a Policy Advisor at the United States Department of the Treasury, where he focused on domestic economic policy. Before that, he was a Private Equity Associate at Madison Dearborn Partners and worked for Evercore Partners as an Investment Banking Analyst, respectively.
Education/Personal Bio: Zuhair earned a BA in History and BBA in Business Honors and Finance from the University of Texas at Austin, and an MBA degree from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC

Name: Sungjoon Cho
Investing Thesis: Fortitude Ventures is a San Mateo, CA based venture capital firm investing in the AI and Robotic enablement of automation.
Professional Bio:
Sungjoon Cho is the Founder & Managing Partner of Silicon Valley-based Fortitude Ventures, a newly formed venture capital firm focused on AI and Robotics powered autonomy.

Sungjoon has been investing in computing platform shifts for over a decade as a Silicon Valley–based VC, backing early-stage companies across multiple generations of AI and robotics—from computer vision and machine learning to today’s advances in generative AI. An engineer by training, he began his career in the mid 2000s as a technical product manager for Samsung’s mobile System-on-Chip processors during the last computing paradigm shift, and later advised companies navigating mobile disruption as a consultant at McKinsey.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sungjoon received his MBA from Columbia Graduate School of Business, MS in Electrical Engineering from Seoul National University, and BS in Electrical Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign. 

Sungjoon's second job, hobbies, and entertainment are all provided by his 8 year old twins and 2 year old daughter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Sarah Burch
Investing Thesis: Scaling social ventures that are mission driven
Professional Bio:
Sarah is a founding team member of Rippleworks where she co-leads the platform team, which connects social enterprises with world-class operating expertise. Sarah has also worked hands-on with 40+ founders and managed a portfolio of social ventures across 60 countries.




While helping founders and CEOs grow their companies, Sarah has helped grow Rippleworks from a 3-person startup into a 40+ person organization recognized by Fast Company as one of the 50 most innovative companies in the world.




Sarah has helped finance and scale emerging market entrepreneurs for over a decade. Prior to joining Rippleworks, Sarah helped launch and grow Development Innovation Ventures (DIV), an early-stage innovation fund within the U.S. Agency for International Development. At DIV, she led the due diligence and closing of $22M into 20+ deals in 10+ countries.
Education/Personal Bio: Sarah was raised in the Pacific Northwest and is a proud member of the Delaware Tribe of Indians. She lives in Los Angeles, CA where she enjoys exploring Topanga parks, eating delicious LA food, and trying to learn how to surf. Sarah holds a BA in Political Science from the University of Notre Dame.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Suman Natarajan
Professional Bio: Joining Citi Ventures in 2017, Suman invests in cybersecurity and infrastructure software startups that protect and empower companies to deliver new solutions and experiences. She is passionate about startups that leverage breakthrough technologies and keen insight into their customers to re-engineer what business looks like and how it gets done. Joining Citi Ventures in 2017, Suman invests in cybersecurity and infrastructure software startups that protect and empower companies to deliver new solutions and experiences. She is passionate about startups that leverage breakthrough technologies and keen insight into their customers to re-engineer what business looks like and how it gets done. Previously, Suman worked at Intel Capital where she drove investments in cybersecurity and enterprise IT. She also did product marketing on Intel's wearables and PC teams and on Symantec's mobile group. Before receiving her MBA, she worked at a healthcare analytics firm, Strata Decision, where she was responsible for account management, leading post-sales implementation, and product management. She began her career at JP Morgan as an investment banker.
Education/Personal Bio: Suman received her BA in economics from the University of Chicago with a minor in South Asian Studies and her MBA from the Tuck School of Business at Dartmouth. An avid traveler and novice scuba diver, Suman is also passionate about dance and enjoys classes in modern dance and classical Indian styles. She resides in San Francisco.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Edwina Cheng (nee Yeo)
Investing Thesis: Interested in AI
Professional Bio: Edwina is Co-Founder & CEO of Supermomos, a community platform for connecting with likeminded technology, business, and finance professionals through vetted and curated groups. The platform has 30,000+ professionals in NYC alone, and brings people together in real life to foster meaningful connections and knowledge exchange. Prior to this, she spent most of her career in the VC space, first at Tiger Global, and then as a Partner at Tanglin Venture Partners. She started out as a management consultant at BCG in Singapore, and graduated from the The Wharton School / University of Pennsylvania, with degrees in Finance and East Asian Languages & Civilizations.
Education/Personal Bio: Edwina graduated with a dual degree from the University of Pennsylvania. She holds a batchelor's of science in economics with a concentration in finance from The Wharton School, and a Bachelor of Arts in East Asian Languages and Civilizations from The School of Arts & Sciences. She also has a master's degree in Counselling from Monash University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Boston,KF | NYC,London Summit 2025

Name: Kenza Lahlou
Professional Bio:
Kenza Lahlou is the Founder and Managing Partner at Outlierz Ventures, an Africa- focused early-stage VC firm dedicated to Seed stage tech-enabled companies. The fund backs founders using technology to close infrastructure gaps and digitize key
traditional industries across the continent's main tech hubs. She is a pioneer ecosystem builder and VC investor in Africa with a background in Technology and investment. She lived and worked in Africa, Europe, Asia and the United States with experience spanning software engineering, management consulting and private equity. Kenza started her career as a Computer Science engineer in France, then acquired experience in Private Equity in Africa after a Masters in Business in Singapore. Before starting Outlierz Ventures, she moved to Silicon Valley to join an advisory firm providing market entry services to emerging markets tech companies looking to scale in the US market. Inspired by this experience, she returned to Morocco and co-founded StartupYourLife, one of the pioneer ecosystem builders in the country, as a leading community of tech founders
to connect to investors and mentors in the region. Kenza holds a BSc and MSc in Computer Science from INSA in France and a Master
of Strategy and International Business from ESSEC Business School in Singapore.
She completed a Leadership Executive Program at the Harvard Kennedy School in 2016. She is a Kauffman Fellow Class 25.
Education/Personal Bio: Kenza holds a BSc and MSc in Computer Science and Data Mining from INSA Rouen in France. She also completed a Master's in Business from ESSEC Business School on the Singapore campus. In 2016, she was selected by Goldman Sachs and the U.S. Departement of States to complete an Executive Program on Leadership at the Harvard Kennedy School part of the 10k Women entrepreneurs initiative. She also enrolled in a Venture Capital executive program at Stanford University in partnership with 500 Startups (VC Unlocked Summer 2016). Her personal mission is to back the next generation of African success stories that will change the continent narrative.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Thiago Maluf
Professional Bio: Thiago is a General Partner at e.Bricks Ventures, a São Paulo-based VC manager among the leading early stage investors in Brazil. Since inception, e.Bricks has raised 3 funds, invested in over 30 high growth companies and completed multiple exits. As a general partner, Thiago is responsible for the end-to-end investment execution and portfolio company monitoring, as well as actively involved in fundraising, positioning and recruiting initiatives. Since joining e.BRICKS in 2017, Thiago has been responsible for closing 8 deals and served as a board member or observer to 8 companies, including Conexa (largest independent telemedicine provider in Latin America) and Ambar (leading ConstruTech player in Latin America). Thiago also works directly with portfolio companies' mgmt. teams to tackle a wide array of challenges, from setting up international operations to closing landmark acquisitions to recruiting co-founders and C-level team members. Prior to joining e.Bricks, Thiago spent 9 years as a Private Equity investor, having worked at TPG Capital and TPG Growth, Kinea Investimentos and AIG Investments in Brazil, in addition to completed internships at Equity International in Chicago and at GIC in New York.
Education/Personal Bio: Thiago holds a B.B.A. from Fundação Getúlio Vargas (FGV-EAESP) and an MBA with Honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, with concentrations in finance, economics and entrepreneurship. In addition to his native Portuguese, Thiago is fluent in English and conversational in French and Spanish. As an individual, Thiago is passionate about running, reading and traveling, having visited over 50 countries so far.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Matt Roth
Professional Bio: Matthias is a Partner and Investment Committee member of Capmont, a privately held PE & VC asset manager with a portfolio of 26 companies.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Mohammed Almeshekah
Professional Bio: Mo is an investor and a cybersecurity aficionado. He is the Founder and Managing Partner of Outliers Venture Capital, which focuses on being the first backer of founders in the B2B and Cybersecurity/Privacy markets across the US & MENA; building a corridor between the two regions. Prior to founding Outliers, he was a founder of a cybersecurity startup, a security engineer and an advisor to number of public and private organization.
Education/Personal Bio: Mo studied and worked in three continents. He has a PhD in Computer Science from Purdue University in the US; an MSc in Information Security from University of London in the UK; and a BSc degree in Computer Science from King Saud University in KSA. His work in the intersection of Cybersecurity, Machine Learning & Cognitive Psychology earned international's recognition.

Name: Maurice Maschmeyer
Professional Bio: Maurice is an investor at BAM Ventures in Los Angeles and a Venture Partner at Maschmeyer Group Ventures in San Francisco. He focuses on guiding world-class entrepreneurs and invests in founder-first consumer businesses. His focus is sourcing and analyzing deals and providing strategic solutions to support entrepreneurs through different stages of their business. Maurice firmly believes in the global entrepreneur community and is continually an active mentor to accelerators both in Europe and the US. Earlier in his career, Maurice excelled as a designer in the yacht and automotive industry for Ferrari and Porsche, before pivoting his role towards his passion in supporting entrepreneurs, startups and their ecosystems.
Education/Personal Bio: Maurice grew up between Germany, France and Italy, graduated with a Transportation Design degree from ArtCenter College of Design, Pasadena and a master’s of science in Entrepreneurship and Innovation from USC. He constantly travels between Los Angeles and Berlin. In his free time, he enjoys traveling, surfing, skiing, weightlifting, and meeting new people.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Austin Arensberg
Professional Bio: Austin leads Okta Ventures, a $50M fund supporting Okta's mission to connect people and organizations to technology. Okta Ventures invests in enterprise software startups in privacy, security, and identity from Seed to Series C. Prior to joining Okta Ventures, Austin was Head of US Investment for Scrum Ventures, a generalist venture firm based in San Francisco. Austin began his career in Asia, investing in energy and clean technology across 4 different countries.
Education/Personal Bio: Austin is a graduate of INSEAD Business School, the University of Colorado Boulder, a 2016 Marshall Memorial Fellow, and serves on the Board of Trustees for the Princeton in Asia Fellowship program.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Maddie Callander
Professional Bio: Maddie Callander is a Partner at Boost VC, investing in pre-seed deep tech startups. As a part of the leadership team, she has invested in & supported over 450+ deep tech startups (aerospace, energy, climate, robotics, biotech, crypto/web3, virtual reality, & more), leads strategy for portfolio management and platform initiatives, and scaled operations as the firm has grown from $6M to $300M AUM.
Education/Personal Bio:
Maddie is a Kauffman Fellow, Angel Investor and Founding Member of The Council. She is a frequent speaker at tech conferences and on podcasts, sharing expertise in across deep tech sectors. She is passionate about supporting founders and bringing more women into emerging tech leadership roles. 

Maddie lives in San Francisco, docents at a local historic home, and is on the committee to rebuild Aquatic Park & Pier in her neighborhood backyard. She loves golf, tennis and skiing - and is learning how to bake with gluten free flours.

Maddie has a B.A. in Art History and Spanish from Denison University in Granville, Ohio.

Name: Antonia Rojas
Investing Thesis: Direct secondary fund
Professional Bio: Managing Partner at Attom Capital
Education/Personal Bio:
Antonia holds a Master in Social Entrepreneurship from HULT International Business School in San Francisco. Previously she studied business and economics at Pontificia Universidad Católica de Chile. 

She currently lives in Mexico City, after living in Chile, Germany and the US, for work and studies.
