Name: Charlie Petty
Professional Bio:
Charlie is a co-founder of Adjuvant Capital, a new healthcare and life sciences investment firm focused on public health. Charlie led or co-led the firm's investments in ChromaCode and Codagenix, where serves on the board. 

Charlie helped form Adjuvant Capital in 2018 with colleagues from the Global Health Investment Fund (GHIF), a private investment fund created by JP Morgan and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to invest in the research and development of life sciences technologies aimed at addressing the highest-burden public health issues. At GHIF, he helped oversee the fund's investments in Eubiologics (KOSDAQ: 206650), IanTech (acquired by Zeiss), and Alydia Health. 

Before joining GHIF, Charlie was with Artemis Capital Partners, where he made private equity investments in healthcare and industrial technology companies. Previously, he lived in Haiti and worked at the country's largest microfinance bank, Sevis Finansye Fonkoze, where he led financial and operational analysis efforts. 

Charlie remains active in Haiti and serves on the boards of Sevis Finansye Fonkoze and Fonkoze USA. Charlie is also an advisor to New Incentives, a Nigerian non-profit organization that uses conditional cash transfers to encourage infant vaccinations.
Education/Personal Bio:
Charlie is a graduate of the Virginia Polytechnic Institute. 

Charlie and his wife are erstwhile Bostonians who now split time between the Boerum Hill neighborhood of Brooklyn and the Berkshires.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Wayne Moore
Professional Bio:
Wayne has held positions in both successful startups and thriving tech firms and brings a wealth of operational experience building teams, executing deals, and developing clients. He is committed to the growth of the venture and tech community in Chicago, serves as an advisor to several startups, and is a founding board member of Great Lakes Academy Charter School. Previously, he was on the global content acquisition team at Netflix. 

Before that, he was VP of Business Development at Silver Chalice Ventures, a digital media startup owned by the Chicago White Sox. Wayne began his career in the US Navy, serving as a Surface Warfare Officer.
Education/Personal Bio: Wayne holds a BS in industrial engineering from Stanford and an MBA from Kellogg.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Adzmel Adznan
Professional Bio:
Adzmel co-founded Piva with Ricardo Angel, to invest in visionary entrepreneurs re-shaping the future of industry and energy.

Prior to this, Adzmel spent 12 years at PETRONAS, one of Global Fortune 500 energy firms, honing his technical and commercial knowledge across the entire energy value chain. At the early stage of his career, Adzmel was responsible for managing, planning and execution of major capital oil & gas projects in Malaysia, followed by a short stint as a reservoir engineer where he was responsible for the development and optimization of an oil field offshore of Peninsular Malaysia. After successfully completing the development of the project, Adzmel spent time in strategic planning and commercial roles within PETRONAS, where he served as development and subsurface specialist to develop strategies for Malaysia's upstream petroleum sector, including local industry development, strategic partnership arrangements and new fiscal model for petroleum contracts to prolong the economic lifecycle of oil & gas assets in Malaysia.

Most recently, he was instrumental in developing PETRONAS Corporate Venture Capital unit, a new approach by PETRONAS to augment its ongoing efforts in future-proofing itself by investing in cutting-edge technology across the new energy value chain.
Education/Personal Bio:
Adzmel earned a Master of Business Administration (MBA) from Harvard Business School in 2017 and a Master of Engineering (MEng) in Mechanical Engineering from University of Strathclyde in Glasgow, Scotland.

Adzmel is from Malaysia and currently resides in San Francisco.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,London Summit 2025

Name: Brentt Baltimore
Professional Bio:
Brentt is on the investment team at Greycroft, based in Los Angeles. Brentt primarily invests in B2B and enterprise SaaS platforms with open source or channel driven go-to-market strategies. He is currently interested in the convergence of cyber and physical security, edge computing, and data interoperability/automation. He has helped lead Greycroft's investments in Botkeeper, Mapped, and Agni, serving as an observer or a board director. In addition to his role on the investment team, Brentt leads Greycroft's data science strategy as it applies to new investments. 

Prior to Greycroft, Brentt was an early co-founder of Slope, a content management platform acquired by Smartsheet. He was an early employee at Operator, where he led go-to-market strategy and business development in the conversational commerce space. He also led technology commercialization at Numenta, an artificial intelligence research company developing the frontier of machine intelligence. 

Before moving to the operating side, Brentt was as an Associate at Detroit Venture Partners helping to raise the first fund and drive the investment process. Brentt started his career in Investment Banking at Credit Suisse, focusing on LBOs. 

Outside of Greycroft, Brentt is a board member at BLCK VC, leading initiatives in Los Angeles.
Education/Personal Bio:
Brentt earned his MBA from The University of Chicago Booth School of Business and his BA in Economics from Claremont McKenna College. 

He is passionate about machinery and the outdoors. His 1967 Pontiac Firebird is a continuous project that he has been working on for nearly 6 years. Driving up the California coast is his description of a wonderful day.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Ekaterina Gianelli
Professional Bio:
Ekaterina invests in early-stage tech businesses, focusing on the Nordic Bay region. She has a strong interest in healthtech (as a Venture Partner at Calm/Storm), deeptech and industrialtech, but can get as excited about opportunities outside of these sectors.

Until 2024, Ekaterina was a General Partner at Inventure, a leading seed investor in the Nordics with over $400m of assets under management. Prior to that, she was part of the team that scaled Fjord from a small consultancy into a leading design and innovation firm globally (Fjord was acquired by Accenture Interactive in 2013).
Education/Personal Bio: Ekaterina holds a bachelor's of economics from Moscow State University and an MBA in Service Innovation & Design from Laurea University of Applied Sciences.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ted Persson
Professional Bio:
Ted is a Partner at EQT Ventures, based in Stockholm, Sweden. 

Ted has worked since the late 90s in the intersection between technology and creativity, founding and running both startups and digital creative agencies, and is passionate about both frontier technology as well all things product design, UX, storytelling and branding-related. 

Since Ted was part of setting up EQT Ventures in 2015, he has led the firm's investments in about a dozen companies.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Varun Malhotra
Investing Thesis: Early stage fintech in emerging markets.
Professional Bio: Varun Malhotra, Partner at Quona Capital, has over 15 years of venture investing experience across technology, financial services and impact. Varun co-leads Quona’s investments across South and SE Asia. Quona is the leading emerging markets fintech for inclusion VC with ~$800mn in AUM and 75+ investments across LatAm, India & SE Asia, MENA & sub-Saharan Africa. Quona has backed companies like IndiaMart (India, IPO: $2.1bn MCap), Creditas (Brazil: $4bn EV), Konfio (Mexico: $1.3bn EV), Wasoko (Africa: $625mn EV) & Coins.ph (SE Asia: M&A GoJek). Quona’s latest Fund III ($332mn) was oversubscribed and backed by marquee LPs. Varun is a Kauffman Fellow and is a Forbes 30 under 30 honouree for Venture Capital in Asia.
Education/Personal Bio: Varun has an MBA from the Indian School of Business and an undergraduate degree in economics from the University of Delhi.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,London Summit 2025

Name: Pinn Lawjindakul
Professional Bio: Pinn is a founding member of Lightspeed Southeast Asia, a global early-stage investment fund. Prior to Lightspeed, she was at Insignia Venture Partners and Tiger Global Management, where she focused on consumer and financial technology across SEA, India and China. She worked closely with Flipkart (sold to Walmart), Ola, Policybazaar, Hike, Games 24x7, Razorpay, Uxin (IPO exit).??Pinn started her career as a management consultant at Bain & Company and also founded Grab’s motorcycle-on-demand in Bangkok, Thailand. Pinn graduated from Wharton Business School at the University of Pennsylvania with a double degree in Psychology and Finance.
Education/Personal Bio: Pinn is from Bangkok, Thailand. She graduated from Wharton Business School at the University of Pennsylvania with a double degree in Psychology and Finance.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ishan Sinha
Professional Bio:
Ishan is a founding member of Point72 Ventures, the venture capital arm of Point72 Asset Management. His role is to evaluate and execute investments with a focus on emerging and international markets particularly in the financial services and consumer internet sectors. Geographically, he has invested in early stage startups across the U.S., Europe, Latin America, Southeast Asia, and the Middle East. Ishan is proud to be an early investor in businesses like Ualá, Spotify, Mirror, Nav, Credijusto, Sprout Solutions, and Tonik. 

Ishan joined Point72 Ventures after working in long/short equity investing at Point72, covering public companies in the technology and financial services sectors. Before joining Point72, Ishan was an investment banking analyst at Goldman Sachs.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ishan graduated from Yale University with a BA in economics. He serves as a mentor as a part of Endeavor's Mentor Capital initiative, giving one-on-one support to international entrepreneurs. 

Through Ishan's experiences at Point72, he discovered his passion for helping develop young investors. This fall, Ishan will be teaching a for-credit course at Yale University on venture investing in emerging markets. 

Outside of venture, Ishan enjoys spending time with his fiancée, playing with his dog Ringo, biking through the city, and playing guitar. If he wasn't a venture capitalist, he would definitely be a guitarist in a heavy metal band.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Nick Washburn
Professional Bio:
Nick Washburn is a Senior Managing Director of Intel Capital located in Denver, CO.  He joined Intel Capital in 2014.

Nick is a voting member of Intel Capital’s investment committee and co-manages Intel Capital’s cloud investment domain. He focuses on early-stage investments in cloud-native infrastructure, developer tools, artificial intelligence/machine learning, and data platforms.

Nick currently serves as a director or observer on the boards of Augtera Networks, Fly.io, Freshpaint, Moderne, OtterTune, and Tetrate. He also works closely on Intel Capital’s investments in Anyscale and Upbound.

In addition, Nick currently serves as a director on the board of the National Venture Capital Association, and he is a member of the Kauffman Fellows, Class 25.  He is a proud father to amazing twin boys, he loves playing ice hockey, and he is an avid lover of all things outdoors, including skiing, mountain biking and rock climbing.
Education/Personal Bio: In addition, Nick currently serves as a director on the board of the National Venture Capital Association, and he is a member of the Kauffman Fellows, Class 25. He is a proud father to amazing twin boys, he loves playing ice hockey, and he is an avid lover of all things outdoors, including skiing, mountain biking and rock climbing.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Infrastructure

Name: Jake Ellowitz
Investing Thesis: Use data to underwrite product market fit
Professional Bio: Jake a Co-Founding Partner at Tribe Capital and Co-Founder and CTO of Termina. He was instrumental in Tribe's investments in Kraken, Docker, Shiprocket, Alpaca, Khatabook, and Hone, among others. Jake designed and built Tribe's investment system used to quantitatively evaluate startup engagement, which was incubated into the sister company Termina to expand these data capabilities among Tribe's portfolio and broader strategic partners. Before Tribe, Jake was an Investment Engineer at Bridgewater Associates, predominantly focused on Fixed Income. Jake holds a PhD in Physics from the University of Chicago.
Education/Personal Bio: Jake holds a PhD in Physics from the University of Chicago, where he studied theoretical and computational fluid dynamics, often with the aid of large-scale computer simulations. He received his BA from Clark University in Physics and Mathematics.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Rokas Peciulaitis
Investing Thesis:
Contrarian Ventures backs early-stage climate tech founders. We’re not just investors - we’re your first cheque, first call, and long-term partner. Founder-first, conviction-led, outcome-focused.

We’re building a full-stack climate platform to help our founders win - from our Energy Tech Summit to The Climate Brick and Climate50.

More can be found here: https://www.cventures.vc/about-us/
Professional Bio:
Rokas Peciulaitis is the Founder and Managing Partner of Contrarian Ventures, a leading early-stage climate tech VC firm.

He began his career as an inflation trader at Bank of America Merrill Lynch. He is also a co-founder of Emergy Tech Summit, Climate50, and Climate Brick. Additionally, he serves as a board member of Vilniaus Marathon, is a shareholder of the Vilnius University Endowment, and is the Co-founder and Chairman of the Board of the Passport Diaspora Foundation.

His alma maters include the University of Glasgow (M.A. in Economics), UCSB, and Harvard Business School (executive PE & VC course). Rokas is a Kauffman Fellow (Class #25).
Education/Personal Bio: Rokas is a founder of Energy Tech Summit and Energy Tech Network, where his goal is to build a more connected energy tech and e-mobility community. He is also Chairman of the Lithuanian Venture Capital Association, and is a board member of a non-profit organization Vilnius Marathon. Rokas graduated from the University of Glasgow with an M.A. in economics and spent a year in University California Santa Barbara. Rokas has completed additional coursework at Harvard Business School - Executive Program with a focus on venture capital and private equity.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025

Name: Monique Woodard
Investing Thesis: Cake Ventures is a pre-seed and seed venture capital firm that invests in companies creating technology products and solutions that meet the needs of tomorrow’s internet users. Cake is a thesis driven fund focused on areas of demographic change that are changing technology including: aging and longevity, the increased spending power of women, the new consumer, and the rise of deskless work.  These ‘layers’ of demographic change (yes, like a layer cake) represent one of the biggest changes to the internet user base and opportunity to invest in the next generation of internet companies.
Professional Bio:
Monique is the Founder and Managing Partner of Cake Ventures. She invests in areas where she sees the future of technology being driven by major demographic trends.

Monique started her career in venture as Venture Partner at 500 Startups where she invested in early stage companies in the US and sub-Saharan Africa. Following her time at 500 Startups, Monique became a Venture Scout at Lightspeed Venture Partners and a trusted advisor to foundations and venture capital firms like SoftBank, where she continues to advise on the Vision Fund’s Emerge program.

Before moving onto the investor side of the table, Monique spent 15+ years in the tech industry and she has been a startup founder, product-focused operator, and the founder of a national community of tech entrepreneurs.

Monique has been an advisor to private companies and technology-focused organizations including Women 2.0, Hackers/Founders, and Startup Policy Lab.
Education/Personal Bio:
Monique has a BA in Political Science from the University of Miami.

Monique grew up in rural Florida and has lived in San Francisco for 17 years. Her hobbies include traveling, collecting vintage clothing, and checking out the contemporary art scene in cities near and far.

She regularly invests, speaks, writes, and advises on areas of consumer technology, emerging demographics, and diversity. She has been interviewed around entrepreneurship and investing for USA Today, MSNBC, New York Times, Buzzfeed, NPR, CNBC, and Essence Magazine.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Megan Holston-Alexander
Job Title: Partner, Head of the Cultural Leadership Fund
Professional Bio:
Megan Holston-Alexander is a Partner at Andreessen Horowitz where she co-leads the firm’s Cultural Leadership Fund (CLF). CLF launched in 2018 with the mission to connect the world’s greatest cultural leaders to the best new technology companies and engage, empower, and elevate Black builders, shapers and creators on their journey towards excellence in the technology industry.

CLF Fund I was Silicon Valley’s first venture capital fund consisting of 100% African American Limited Partners. To date, CLF has invested in over 65 startups at the intersection of culture and innovation, and across multiple industries including consumer, enterprise, crypto, fintech, and healthcare/biotech. In turn, 100% of management fees and carry associated with the fund are donated to a select group of non-profit organizations that share CLF’s mission. The team also manages the CLF Talent Network which aims to connect Black professionals to the technology industry. 

She also co-founded When Founder Met Funder, an annual conference focused on connecting Black female entrepreneurs with peers and investors for networking and skills-building. 

Megan’s early career was spent at non-profit organizations and included projects such as conducting research on complex social issues, lecturing at San Jose State University, and managing a nonprofit startup incubator program.
Education/Personal Bio:
Megan received her MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business (GSB) and her BA from Clark Atlanta University. She also holds a Certificate in Public Management and Social Innovation from Stanford GSB and an MA in Sociology from the University of Houston. While pursuing her MBA, Megan also spent time at numerous venture capital firms including Foundation Capital, as an investment fellow and Lightspeed Venture Partners, as an MBA associate. 

She currently serves on the board of directors at HBCUvc, nonprofit organization that trains students attending Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) in venture capital, the Hidden Genius Project and All Stars Helping Kids. Megan also authors the blog A Black Girl in Venture.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Maya Horgan Famodu
Investing Thesis: We invest in indigenous African founders building high-growth, Pan-African businesses in fintech, trade tech, wellbeing sectors. With 4 exits (first being Paystack’s sale to Stripe) and another to IPO this year, we are continuing to tap Africa’s potential.
Professional Bio:
A serial entrepreneur and leader in the African technology ecosystem who is passionate about creating systemic change by democratising access to resources, capital, and knowledge for under-served communities globally, with a specific focus on Africa. 

On a mission to ensure every interested African has the necessary resources to get into technology, access upskill opportunities, build wealth, and create wildly scalable businesses. 

A consummate professional with 10+ years building businesses, finance companies, nonprofits, and ecosystems across Africa. Committed to ensuring underserved youth have the necessary resources from the time they think “I want to be in tech” until when they sell their business. Changing the Africa narrative one empowered technical talent at a time.
Education/Personal Bio: She is a two-time Forbes 30 under 30 nominee (Africa and VC), was named the United Nations' Most Influential Person of African Descent. Maya completed the Cornell Pre-Law Program and attended Pomona College.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Maggie Sprenger
Professional Bio:
Maggie Sprenger is the Co-Founder and Managing Director of Green Cow Venture Capital, where she focuses on the intersection of deep technologies and global, traditional markets. She works closely with GCVC portfolio companies through their community-centric model.

Maggie is also entering her third year as a mentor in the DeepTech cohort of NYU Stern’s Endless Frontier Labs, a nine-month long incubator program. Prior to GCVC, Maggie Co-Founded Cosgrove Capital, focused on repositioning single and multifamily assets. She continues to advise Pontifex Capital, a real estate development firm in the Intermountain West.
Education/Personal Bio:
Maggie earned an MBA from Wharton, where she studied Finance and Management. She graduated from the University of California, Santa Barbara, with a double major degree in Political Science and Environmental Studies.

Maggie is a frequent speaker, judge, and panelist, and was invited to address organizations across four continents the year prior to the pandemic, with topics ranging from ethics of algorithms to inclusive investing.

She is on the board of the Afghanistan World Foundataion, serves on the Alumni Admission Committee for Wharton, was a Young Fellow for the Observer Research Foundation’s Asian Forum on Global Governance, and lives in New York with her husband and her two children.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Annie Case
Professional Bio: Currently, Annie Case focuses on investments in early-stage consumer, healthcare, and marketplace companies at Kleiner Perkins. Before joining Kleiner Perkins, Annie worked in Product and Business Operations roles at Uber. While at Uber, she supported the SVP of Operations and helped scale the UberEats business to new markets internationally. Annie started her career as a consultant at Bain & Company in San Francisco, where she worked with clients in the Technology, Private Equity, and Education practices.
Education/Personal Bio:
Annie is passionate about diversity in tech and is on a mission to get more women involved in technology and startups. In her free time, you'll find Annie outdoors, running, hiking, biking, skiing, or camping. She is from Washington DC and now lives in San Francisco.

Annie graduated from Stanford University with a bachelor's degree in Human Biology and a master's degree in Management Science & Engineering. She was also a member of the Stanford Women's Soccer team.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Gabriela de Salles van der Linden
Investing Thesis: Early stage/ early growth healthcare specialized investment firm. Focused on digital health and tech enabled services.
Professional Bio:
Gabriela has been active in venture capital since 2007, initially CRP Companhia de Participações, a pioneering VC firm in Brazil. Subsequently, she transitioned to the healthcare sector, first at D’Or Institute, launching its Open Innovation area, and later as a founding team member of Yaya Capital, an investment firm specializing in healthcare. More recently, she has taken on the role of Partner at Aggir Ventures.

Gabriela holds an Executive MBA from Fundação Dom Cabral and a specialization in Finance. She completed executive training programs at Stanford, MIT, Berkeley, and Babson College and 
 is also a Kauffman Fellow.
Education/Personal Bio:
Gabriela grew up in the countryside of southern Brazil, and now lives in Rio de Janeiro. She graduated in Business Administration with an emphasis in leadership and innovation, earned an Executive MBA from Fundação Dom Cabral, and a specialization in Finance. Gabriela attended executive training from Stanford, MIT, Berkeley, and Babson College, in the areas of Venture Capital, Entrepreneurship, and Digital Transformation.

Passionate about innovation, entrepreneurship, and a cutting-edge science enthusiast, Gabriela is a board member of Impacto por Elas, a network of well-connected women that advocates on impact investment, diversity, and ESG practices. She is also a Reality Experience Alumni and a volunteer of Rede Postinho a NGO that provides mental health support to the most vulnerable women in Rio de Janeiro.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Michelle Scarborough
Job Title: Managing Partner, Thrive Venture Fund and the Women in Technology Venture Fund
Professional Bio:
Michelle Scarborough is a Managing Partner at BDC Capital where she leads Strategic Investments and the Women in Technology Venture Fund - one of the world's largest venture funds investing in women-led technology companies. In addition to setting overall strategy, she is responsible for strategic leadership, fund management and investments across her portfolios. She has led numerous investments, driven exits, and works with female and diverse founders to build what's next while supporting initiatives to build a sustainable ecosystem for the tech leaders of the future. 

Michelle joined BDC in 2017 from Kensington Capital Partners where she managed fund of funds and direct investment activity across Western Canada. She has co-founded and managed her own funds, managed family office investments and has been a founder or co-founder in several private and public companies in technology, energy and sustainability. 

Michelle is active in the Canadian tech ecosystem, serving on the Canadian Venture Capital & Private Equity Association's (CVCA) Diversity and Inclusion Committee, Creative Destruction Labs' Advisory Board, and Venture Capital Association of Alberta's Board of Directors. She is past Chair of the National Angel Capital Organization and a co-founder of the Women's Angel Network.
Michelle holds a Bachelor of Science and a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Calgary as well as the Corporate Director (ICD.D) designation from the Institute of Corporate Directors. She is a lover of all things sport and sand, an avid runner, cyclist and golfer. She is passionate about lifelong learning, people and other cultures, food and hosting dinner parties - rain or shine.
Education/Personal Bio: Michelle holds a Bachelor of Science and a Bachelor of Arts from the University of Calgary as well as the Corporate Director (ICD.D) designation from the Institute of Corporate Directors. She is a lover of all things sport and sand, an avid runner, cyclist and golfer. She is passionate about lifelong learning, people and other cultures, food and hosting dinner parties - rain or shine.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Chris Lerner
Professional Bio:
Chris Lerner is a Managing Partner at MSA Capital, a leading independent venture growth capital firm in China with over $1.5 billion in AUM. Lerner oversees the firm’s strategy and operations, and works with its investment partners and portfolio companies on fundraising and business development. Prior to MSA, Lerner built and ran Eaton Partners, a GP advisory and fund placement firm, in Asia Pacific, which he and his partners later sold to Stifel Financial.

He started his career with Citigroup and its predecessor firms of Smith Barney and Salomon Brothers. He was the firm’s first investment banking expatriate based in Mainland China and helped establish and build the Asia Pacific Financial Institutions Group before later taking roles in strategic planning and corporate development, and setting up his own investment and advisory firm.
Education/Personal Bio:
Lerner moved to China over 25 years ago, and is currently based in Shanghai. He loves working across cultures and helping founders realize their dreams. He believes business and technology have the power to break down barriers and bring people together. Lerner is an active member of YPO. He is a decade-long mentor at Chinaccelerator, China's first accelerator. He's also a founding director of China Heritage, a non-profit dedicated to cultural exchange and education of traditional Chinese arts.

Lerner has a wife, Avery, whom he adores, and he is a proud girl dad to Allie and Carlie. Chris received an MBA from Columbia Business School and BA from Tufts University. He has a Certificate in Mandarin Chinese from the College for Foreign Languages in Beijing and completed the joint China Senior Executive Leadership Program of Tsinghua SEM, CEIBS and Harvard Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Santosh Sankar
Investing Thesis: Supply chain- make, move, monetize the world's freight
Professional Bio:
Santosh Sankar is a Founding Partner at Dynamo Ventures. Santosh has been an early investor in several distinguished supply chain technology startups including Stord, Gatik AI, and SVT Robotics.

Prior to his career in venture capital, Santosh was at Citigroup in their Global Financial Institutions Group focused on M&A, capital raising, and risk securitization and later covering IT Hardware and Wireless Equipment companies as a public equities analyst at Wells Fargo. Santosh started his first company, an IT support business, when he was 13 years old. Santosh was named to the Forbes 30 Under 30 List in 2017.
Education/Personal Bio: Santosh is a graduate of Penn State University with a BS in Finance and minor in Information Systems Management.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Claire Diaz-Ortiz
Professional Bio:
Claire Diaz-Ortiz is a Latin America-based angel investor and bestselling author who was an early employee at Twitter.

Named one of the 100 Most Creative People in Business by Fast Company and called “The Woman Who Got the Pope on Twitter” by Wired, she has written nine books that have been translated into 11 languages. Her next book focuses on women founders and funders.

Most recently, Claire was a partner at Magma Partners, a seed stage fund in Latin America, where she launched Brava, the first initiative of its kind to invest in women founders across Latin America.

In Claire’s work, she has been called everything from “The Woman Who Got the Pope on Twitter” (Wired) and “Twitter’s Pontiff Recruitment Chief” (The Washington Post) to a “Force for Good” (Forbes) and “One of the Most Generous People in Social Media” (Fast Company). As CNN said in 2017, “If Twitter has a soul, it probably looks something like Claire Diaz-Ortiz.”

Claire nine books include One [https://www.amazon.com/One-Minute-Mentoring-Mentor-Benefit/dp/0062429302] Minute Mentoring (Harper Collins; with Ken Blanchard), Social Media Success for Every Brand [https://amzn.to/2pqXIAA] (Harper Collins Leadership), Twitter for Good [https://amzn.to/3nXphLI] (Jossey-Bass), and her next untitled book about women startup founders and women startup funders.

Claire holds an MBA from Oxford University, where she was a Skoll Foundation Scholar for Social Entrepreneurship, and a B.A. and M.A. in Anthropology from Stanford University. As one of the social media world’s earliest social justice activists, Claire used Twitter to build awareness for AIDS orphans in sub-Saharan Africa, and founded Hope Runs, a nonprofit organization in Kenya.

In offbeat superlatives, she is known for being the first and only person to ever have the terrible idea to live-tweet a child’s birth.

Claire lives in Argentina with her husband, daughter, and twin boys.

Find out more about her at www.ClaireDiazOrtiz.com or via @claire on Twitter.
Education/Personal Bio:
In Claire’s work, she has been called everything from “Twitter’s Pontiff Recruitment Chief” (The Washington Post) to a “Force for Good” (Forbes) and “One of the Most Generous People in Social Media” (Fast Company). As CNN said in 2017, “If Twitter has a soul, it probably looks something like Claire Diaz-Ortiz.”

Claire's nine published books include One Minute Mentoring (Harper Collins; with Ken Blanchard) Social Media Success for Every Brand (Harper Collins Leadership), Twitter for Good (Jossey-Bass), and her next untitled book on women startup founders and women startup funders (with Sophia Bendz).

Claire holds an MBA from Oxford University, where she was a Skoll Foundation Scholar for Social Entrepreneurship, and a B.A. and M.A. in Anthropology from Stanford University. As one of the digital world’s earliest social justice activists, Claire used Twitter to build awareness for AIDS orphans in sub-Saharan Africa, and founded Hope Runs, a nonprofit organization in Kenya.

In offbeat superlatives, Claire is known for being the first and only person to ever have the very bad, no good, terrible idea to live-tweet a child’s birth. Claire lives in Argentina with her husband, daughter, and twin boys.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Jen Richard
Professional Bio:
Jennifer Richard is a Principal at Bonfire Ventures. Prior to Bonfire, Jen sourced and executed seed stage investments at MaC Venture Capital (fka Cross Culture Ventures) and Vitalize VC.

Before beginning her career in venture, Jen was a founding member of three venture-backed startups and saw two of them through successful acquisitions. She has been responsible for building e-commerce platforms from the ground up and has scaled online commerce to reach over 30 countries worldwide. Her expertise revolves around technical product management, logistics, and (most importantly) a deep understanding of customers across a variety of verticals and geographies.
Jen has a Bachelor of Arts in English from Emory University and an MBA from UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business. She is based out of her hometown of Los Angeles where she spends her free time hiking, horseback riding, playing beach volleyball and hanging out with her dog Katy.
Education/Personal Bio: Jen has a Bachelor of Arts in English from Emory University and an MBA from UC Berkeley's Haas School of Business. She is based out of her hometown of Los Angeles where she spends her free time hiking, horseback riding, playing beach volleyball and hanging out with her dog Katy.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Dominic Briggs
Professional Bio: Dominic is a Co-Founder of Blockwall, a European venture capital platform investing in the next generation  the internet with a focus on Web3 and convergent technologies.
Education/Personal Bio: Dominic is a graduate of the European Business School in Oestrich-Winkel, Germany, where he earned his Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees. Dominic also spent two semesters between the HEC Geneva and SciencesPo Paris. Dominic was born in Munich and is currently living in Frankfurt, Germany with his wife and two kids.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: John Park
Professional Bio:
John Park founded Aevolution Investment Corp to invest in Asian disruptive growth companies, with an initial focus on Korea. Previously, he served as the CEO of Kakao Investment, a subsidiary of Kakao Group, overseeing assets exceeding 2.6 trillion won (USD 2 billion). In March 2021, he left Kakao Investment to establish and lead Aevolution Investment Corp as its major shareholder and CEO.
Before founding Kakao Investment, John held the position of Chief Strategy Officer at Kakao Group, orchestrating significant company-wide transformations. His achievements included the acquisition and merger of Daum Corp, pivotal acquisitions for Kakao, and the formation of the venture investing arm, later rebranded as Kakao Investment. One of their early successes was the acquisition of a 67% stake in Nzin, which later became Kakao Games, reaching a market capitalization of USD 6 billion through an IPO.
He also played a pivotal role in launching Kakao Group’s blockchain initiatives and held the CEO role for the holding company of Ground X, a blockchain subsidiary of Kakao Group. In a global capacity, he acquired a 50% stake in Kakao Japan from Yahoo Japan, transforming it into the manga content provider "Piccoma," now valued at USD 6 billion after a USD 600 million fundraising.
Before joining Kakao in 2014, John established Asia Evolution in 2000, an advisory and incubation firm across multiple Asian locations. His work involved assisting over 200 clients in strategic support, capital raising, and mergers and acquisitions.
From 1994 to 1999, John served as an Associate and Executive Director at Goldman Sachs Investment Banking Division in New York and Seoul. His contributions included establishing Goldman Sachs' Korean office and leading substantial corporate restructuring efforts for Korean companies. Additionally, he co-founded and funded $2 billion to create Vietnam's largest mobile telecom company, Viettel Telecom.
Education/Personal Bio: John obtained BA Honors in Economics, magna cum laude, from Brown University and an MBA from Harvard Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Brian Hollins
Professional Bio:
Brian is Managing Partner of Collide Capital and the Founder & CEO of the Takeoff Institute, an organization helping Black undergraduate students build the resources and mentorship they need to launch a successful young professional career. He is a Founding Board Member of BLCKVC, a non-profit that focuses on building paths into venture capital for aspiring black investors. He is also the founder of The Road Untraveled, a podcast that dives into real-time topics and trends across the tech and VC community.

Brian spent six years at Goldman Sachs across three divisions including investment management, investment banking, and merchant banking. He helped launch the Emerging Entrepreneurs Coverage group, an initiative to bring Goldman into the venture capital community by extending resources to early stage startups. The group was responsible for sourcing the Plaid investment for Goldman, one of the most successful venture investments in the firm's history. He also spent two years as a growth equity investor focused on enterprise SaaS and the productivity software suite, working with companies like Automation Anywhere, RingDNA and Tastemade.
Education/Personal Bio:
Brian graduated from Stanford University with a BA in International Economics, and served on the Finance Committee of the San Francisco Education Fund, as well as the Leadership Council of Sponsors for Educational Opportunity (SEO Scholars). Brian is Class of 2021 at Harvard Business School.




He is the proud older brother of Mack (wide-receiver for the Miami Dolphins) and Drew (Marine and current student at Columbia University). He is originally from Washington, D.C. and loves to travel, golf and scuba dive!
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Philip Jungen
Professional Bio: Philip is a European angel investor. He serves on the board of the German Red Cross pensions fund. Philip started his career at PwC working almost a decade for leading financial services institutions in Frankfurt & New York.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | LPs,London Summit 2025

Name: Sean Mendy
Professional Bio:
Sean is a co-founding Partner of Westbound 
Equity. He is a Bay Area native who has spent his career working to close opportunity gaps in Silicon Valley. Prior to Westbound he was an executive at the Boys & Girls Clubs of the Peninsula and an Advisor to the Chan Zuckerberg Initiative. As Venture Partner at Next Play Ventures and Entrepreneur in Residence at Sixth Street, Sean has experience building meaningful connections across the venture ecosystem and partnering with best in class founders. Sean earned his BA from Cornell University, where he played soccer, then advanced degrees in business and policy from Stanford and USC.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sean is a Bay Area native who has spent his career working to close opportunity gaps in Silicon Valley. He earned his BA from Cornell University, where he played soccer, then advanced degrees in Business and Policy from Stanford and USC

He lives in Menlo Park with his wife and two kids.

Name: Marcello Goncalves
Investing Thesis: We are thesis agnostic and stage specialists with an edge on Brasil
Professional Bio:
Marcello is the Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Domo Invest, a Brazilian asset management company focused on venture capital funds.

Domo currently has 4 funds divided on 3 early-stage theses: Domo Ventures 1 and 2 (focusing on B2C and B2B2C startups), Domo Fundo Anjo (co-investment fund for startups in the angel stage) and Domo Enterprise (focusing on B2B startups). Marcello was the Founder and Partner of Koolen & Partners, and led investments in unicorns Loggi, Gympass and Hotmart among other startups.

He developed a career in the financial markets, after serving the CEO of insurance companies Assurant and Travel Ace in Brazil. Marcello's background also includes being Partner at Banco CR2 and a Managing Partner at Banco Fator.
Education/Personal Bio:
Marcello completed his undergraduate education in Economics at Candido Mendes University in Rio and has done several executive education programs such as Leading the Global Corporation at University of South Carolina and 500 Startups VC Unlocked at Stanford. In addition to his native Portuguese, Marcello is fluent in English and Spanish.

A soccer fan, Marcello has served pro-bono as a Marketing VP to Fluminense FC (one of the main professional soccer clubs in Brasil). Marcello is also an avid golfer, cyclist and beach tennis player.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Mike McCauley
Investing Thesis: Preseed and Seed across Enterprise Software and Moonshots (deep tech, robotics, space, etc.).
Professional Bio:
Mike is Co-Founder and General Partner at Garage Capital, a pre-seed and seed venture fund based in Waterloo, Canada. Built by founders, Garage is focused on helping the next generation of entrepreneurs build category-defining businesses through experienced-based advice, operational empathy, and early stage capital. To date, Garage has invested in 200+ companies, with a collective valuation of $25B+.

Previously, Mike was Co-Founder of BufferBox, a network of automated package delivery lockers that participated in Y Combinator’s Summer 2012 batch and was later acquired by Google. At Google, Mike was a Product Manager in the Commerce division, then went on to join the launch team of Fi, Google’s US based wireless carrier. Mike was also a Product Manager at GoogleX where he worked on early stage moonshot projects before leaving to focus full-time on Garage.
Education/Personal Bio: Mike graduated from the University of Waterloo, where he studied Mechatronics Engineering.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,London Summit 2025

Name: Patrick Klas
Investing Thesis: SaaS venture fund that helps extraordinary founders build their startups into world-class companies.
Professional Bio:
As an investor at Maschmeyer Group Ventures (MGV), Patrick Klas is responsible for identifying and investing in the next generation of pre-seed and seed level startups - typically with a check size of $250,000.

Patrick is particularly focused on the Insurtech space, leveraging his experience as Director of Business Operations for Insurtech startup, Bunker, where he helped grow the company from 7 to 30+ employees and raise more than $3M in funding. Before MGV, Patrick served as an investor at American Family Ventures and operated the Connected Home Accelerator for Microsoft Ventures.
Education/Personal Bio: A graduate from the University of Wisconsin with a degree in Applied Economics, Patrick now lives in Oakland, CA with his wife Caroline. When he’s not sourcing venture deals and running his popular Insurtech Hour on Clubhouse, Patrick is either fishing, surfing, hiking or learning a new card game.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Dima Kuzmin
Professional Bio:
Dima is the founding and managing partner of 4BIO Capital, a London-based investment firm focused exclusively on advanced and emerging therapies. At 4BIO, he leads the team of scientists, physicians, and former operators responsible for sourcing, evaluation, and post-investment management of both private and public investments. He is responsible for shaping and maintaining the proprietary technology strategy of the firm, the in-house research efforts, and academic collaborations. 

Prior to founding 4BIO, Dima spent many years in academia, focusing successively on structural biology, neurochemistry, systems neuroscience, brain-computer interfaces, and gene therapy. He contributed to the foundation of the field of chemogenetics (control of excitable cells using a combination of gene therapy and small molecules). 

Dima led many of 4BIO’s investments, including those into Orchard Therapeutics (IPO on NASDAQ), ADC Therapeutics (IPO on NYSE), RetroSense Therapeutics (acquired by Allergan), and Redpin Therapeutics (acquired by Kriya). He currently serves as the Chairman of the Board at Araris Biotech AG, Trogenix, and Hornet Therapeutics, and as a Non-Executive Director at Ray Therapeutics and Code Bio. 

Apart from 4BIO, he serves as an Assistant Professor of Medicine (Adjunct) at the Yale University. Dima is a Kauffman Fellow and a Fellow of the Royal Society of Medicine.
Education/Personal Bio:
Dima holds an MSc in Biochemistry and Medical Biochemistry from the Lomonosov Moscow State University, a Ph.D. in neurochemistry from the Russian Academy of Sciences and MPIH Frankfurt, and an MSc in Experimental Therapeutics (with Distinction) from the University of Oxford. He completed his post-doctoral fellowship in clinical and experimental neuroscience at the University College London.

During his doctorate, Dima contributed to co-founding the field of chemogenetics (controlling cells in the body with gene therapies activated by small molecule drugs). His work has been published in several leading journals and is a part of several gene therapies advancing towards clinical trials. During his postdoctoral fellowship at UCL, Dima also contributed to the understanding of how information gets processed in the brain, the role of oscillations in transmission and encoding of information, and the construction of novel brain-computer interfaces. His current research interests center around clinical trial design, ethics, and access to one-time curative therapies.

Dima co-founded, funded, and led Future Biotech, a non-profit education initiative that nurtures future biotechnology entrepreneurs in Central and Eastern Europe.

Outside of work, Dima is an avid sailor, skier, and fencer, and enjoys mountain hiking and jazz.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Yao Meng
Investing Thesis: generalist
Professional Bio: Growth stage investor
Education/Personal Bio:
Yao holds an MBA from the Johnson Graduate School of Management at Cornell University and a Bachelor of Commerce from the University of British Columbia.

Outside of work, Yao enjoys travelling and hiking.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | LPs,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,Singapore Trek 2025

Name: Noor Sweid
Professional Bio:
Noor Sweid is the Founder of Global Ventures, a UAE-based, Series-A focused firm investing in entrepreneurs with a global mindset. Global Ventures is mission-driven and investor-focused with a global mindset. The firm seeks innovative growth-stage companies that are transforming emerging markets through disruptive enterprise technologies. Global Ventures has invested in 27 companies across the region, and is currently deploying from its second fund. The firm has 12 fintech investments driving financial inclusion, and is currently focused on digital health and healthcare inclusion.




Previously, Noor was the Chief Investment Officer at The Dubai Future Foundation, where she helped enable the technology and innovation ecosystem in Dubai, and a Managing Partner at Leap Ventures, a growth-stage venture capital firm based out of Dubai and Beirut.




Prior, Noor had joined her family business, Depa (NASDAQ: DEPA.DU), one of the world’s largest interior contractors. There, she developed and executed the growth strategy, achieving tenfold revenue growth and employee growth to 9500 employees, expanded from 6 to 22 countries, including four cross-border acquisitions. Noor led the region’s first listing on the NASDAQ Dubai and the London Stock Exchange reaching a billion+ dollar valuation and led all associated investor relations and regulatory compliance.




In parallel, Noor also founded ZenYoga, the first yoga studio in MENA, which grew to become the largest chain of wellness studios in the Middle East before successfully exiting to a private equity firm.




In her capacity as General Partner of Global Ventures, she is also a board director for Ogram, Munch:On, Tribal Credit, Proximie and Arrow Labs. Noor is an active board member as an independent chairwoman for Clue and an independent board director for The Grooming Company. She also serves on non-profit boards as Chairwoman of the Middle East Venture Capital Association, Board Director of MIT Sloan and TechWadi, and previously as founding board member of Endeavor UAE.
Education/Personal Bio:
Noor is a member of the Forum of Young Global Leaders by the World Economic Forum. She is also a fellow of the inaugural class of the Aspen Institute’s Finance Leaders Fellowship and member of the Aspen Global Leadership Network.

Noor holds bachelors’ degrees in Finance and Economics from Boston College as well as an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management.

Noor is a mother of 3 boys, Kinan, Jad and Karim, and loves to hike, wakesurf, and practice yoga.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Dubai,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Shubhang Shankar
Professional Bio:
Shubhang is a Managing Director at Syngenta Group Ventures, the Corporate Venture Capital arm of the Syngenta Group, the world's leading Agri-inputs conglomerate. He currently sits on the Board of Ninjacart, Greeneye Technologies, Tarfin Ltd, Jai-Kisan and BioPhero, all leading startups in the AgTech space. Shubhang joined Syngenta Ventures in 2017 as an Investment Manager and became a Managing Director in 2019. His areas of expertise include Agri-fintech, emerging markets, digital and precision technologies and agri e-commerce. He is also involved in multiple strategic projects around innovation and business development for the parent organization.

Prior to joining Syngenta Group Ventures, he was a part of Syngenta's global strategy team where he worked on developing the company's strategy for digital agriculture and was first exposed to the fast-paced world of startups and innovation. Prior to Syngenta, he worked for 8 years as a Management Consultant across the Boston Consulting Group and Kearney in their respective India offices, serving clients in multiple industries on topics on strategy as well as large scale business transformation.
Education/Personal Bio:
Shubhang has an MBA from the Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad, where he headed the Literary Society and a Bachelor's in Electrical Power Engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology Delhi. He also completed a Post-Graduate Diploma in International Relations from the University of London, where he received a commendation for the Historical Sociology course.

In his spare time, he is a voracious reader of works in the humanities and sociology fields, and counts Eric Hobsbawm and Perry Anderson as foundational influences on his worldview. He is currently making his way through the works of Max Weber to understand the linkages between innovation and cultural beliefs.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability

Name: Hiroki Matsuda
Investing Thesis: Providing startup support in the Deep Tech field in collaboration with the Japanese government and universities, while also facilitating international partnerships and identifying high-potential opportunities.
Professional Bio:
As a Founder & Managing Director at Collective Souls Inc., Hiroki Matsuda focuses on supporting the growth of startups, including principal investments both domestically and internationally, as well as assisting large corporations in their innovation efforts.

Before establishing Collective Souls Inc., Mr. Matsuda worked for Sozo Ventures. At Sozo Ventures, Mr. Matsuda was involved in investing in leading global startups, business collaboration with Japanese companies, industrial research, fund fundraising, and innovation-related educational activities. Ultimately, Mr. Matsuda took part in the management of the fund as a Managing Director.

Before joining Sozo Ventures, Mr. Matsuda worked for Accenture as a management consultant. In nearly five years in Accenture, Mr. Matsuda participated in over 10 consulting projects for Fortune 500 organizations in various industries such as IT, manufacturing, consumer goods utilities or public services. Mr. Matsuda developed transformation blueprints of control departments and he contributed to transforming organizations.

Mr. Matsuda received a Master of International Affairs from the University of California, San Diego, School of Global Policy and Strategy and also graduated from Keio University with a BA in Business and Commerce and a minor in International Relations.
Education/Personal Bio:
Mr. Matsuda has a Master of International Affairs from the University of California, San Diego, School of Global Policy and Strategy and earned his BA in Business and Commerce at Keio University, with a minor in International Relations.

When he’s not crunching data on industry momentum, he’s probably studying the tricks and techniques of "pasta tensais" (tensai is 'genius' in Japanese) like Massimo Bottura and Koji Kobayashi on YouTube.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,London Summit 2025

Name: Eric Hilton
Investing Thesis: We invest in B2B software companies across the entire lifecycle, from early-stage to pre-IPO. We have deep product and GTM expertise and provide support well beyond the board meeting.
Professional Bio:
Eric Hilton is a partner at Sorenson Capital, where he focuses on early-stage investments in B2B software. Since joining the firm in 2015, he has worked closely with entrepreneurs as they build and scale world-class organizations that can create both economic and societal impact.

While pursuing his MBA, Eric worked in corporate development at Google, where he evaluated M&A and investment opportunities across multiple product areas, with a focus on the Google Cloud ecosystem.

Prior to joining Sorenson Capital, Eric worked at L.E.K. Consulting, serving clients in the technology, financial services, healthcare, and media & entertainment industries. His case work included private equity due diligence, corporate growth strategy, post-acquisition support, and product launch strategy.
Education/Personal Bio:
Eric graduated cum laude from Brigham Young University with a B.S. in Exercise Science and minors in Business Management and Mathematics. He received his MBA at The Wharton School with distinction as a Palmer Scholar, and graduated with a dual emphasis in Finance and Entrepreneurship. 

Eric is an avid outdoor enthusiast, and loves to surf, ski, golf, go boating, ride bikes and motorcycles, and run. He also enjoys sports (diehard BYU fan), reading, woodworking, and spending time with his wife and five children.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,London Summit 2025

Name: Pavel Livshiz
Investing Thesis: We're leading Seed stage deals in companies founded by Israelis in any geography. Our focus is on the Cyber Security , Data/AI, DevOps/DevTools spaces. We even have one company in Brazil
Professional Bio:
Pavel Livshiz is currently Partner at Hetz Ventures. Prior to joining the Tel Aviv-based venture capital firm, Pavel was a Principal at Amiti Ventures, an Israeli early-stage fund. He is an aerospace engineer by education, with over nine years’ military career in Israeli elite technological intelligence units.

Previously, Pavel grew his career in investment banking, serving most recently as Consultant at Bain & Company in Amsterdam. Before that, he was the Chief Marketing Officer at a leading Israeli IoT start-up, and the Founder and President of Recanati Consulting Group. Pavel got his start as an investment banking intern at Goldman Sachs.
Education/Personal Bio: Pavel received his BSc degree in aerospace engineering from Technion – Israel Institute of Technology in Haifa, Israel, and his MBA from Tel Aviv University Coller School of Management in Tel Aviv, Israel.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Earnest Sweat
Investing Thesis: Investing in Series A companies.
Professional Bio:
Earnest Sweat, Founding Partner of Public School Ventures, has been a dynamic force in the venture capital landscape since 2016, continually innovating, building, and evolving. Under his guidance, Public School Ventures has grown into a thriving syndicate of over 750 members. This community brings together technical operators, go-to-market experts, family offices, and institutional LPs to invest in leading early-stage B2B enterprise startups.

He is a former Venture Partner at GreatPoint Ventures, where he is focused on investing in ‘value chaintech’ – startups that generate efficiency, reduce costs, or enhance the value of digital and physical assets. These software companies are improving high-tech problems, one of the greatest needs over the next decade, across real estate, retail, ecommerce, and supply chain industries. Earnest has led investments in companies such as Flexport, Flexe, Bit.io (acquired by Databricks), Lula and BookOutdoors. His entire portfolio has grown to a combined more than $14 billion in enterprise value and has increased on average 8.6x in post-money valuation, with six companies growing more than 10x. 

Today, Earnest leads an early-stage VC syndicate called Public School Ventures and is the Co-host of Swimming With The Allocators, a VC podcast with a fresh take on the VC- LP relationship, putting dynamics and insider topics on the table. For more on his background and current role check out this post here (and a twitter summary here).
Education/Personal Bio:
Earnest is a proud native of Little Rock, Arkansas, and a graduate of Columbia University, where he earned a BA in Economics and Political Science. He completed his MBA from the Kellogg School of Management as an Evan Schechter scholar and Management Leadership for Tomorrow fellow.




Earnest resides in the Bay Area with his wife and son. He is deeply passionate about increasing the number of underrepresented investors in venture capital and serves as a founding board member of BLCK VC.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Kristian Bodek
Professional Bio:
Kristian Bodek is an Investment Director at National Grid Partners, the corporate venture capital arm of the international electric & gas utility. He is responsible for making and managing fund investments for financial and strategic return, including leading and supporting co-investments and facilitating business unit engagements. His portfolio consists of investments with Energy Impact Partners, IQ Capital, Jerusalem Venture Partners and The Hive. He is also responsible for a new plank of NGP’s investment strategy, startups developing asset-based solutions that address core utility operational and decarbonization use cases.

Previously, Kristian was a senior member of the power practice at IHS Markit, a research and advisory firm. He led techno-economic, market fundamentals and policy analyses on a range of topics spanning generating technology cost and performance to electricity demand forecasting. While at IHS Markit he also developed and chaired the CERAWeek Energy Innovation Pioneers program, a platform for introducing established companies to innovative startups working across the energy value chain. Earlier in his career, he worked for a sustainable design firm, where he performed lifecycle assessments of materials and processes, and obtained US Green Building Council LEED Certification.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kristian earned dual master’s degrees in Mechanical Engineering and Technology & Policy from MIT. In graduate school, he researched alternative vehicle technologies for the MIT Energy Institute and was an early leader of the student-run Energy Club. Kristian also holds a BS in Physics from Bates College, where he graduated magna cum laude and Phi Beta Kappa.

He currently lives north of Boston with his wife and two children, and enjoys outdoor pursuits like hiking, biking and cross-country skiing.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Boston,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture

Name: Sherman Williams II
Investing Thesis: We invest at the intersection of DeepTech and Dual-Use into Pre-Seed and Seed stage companies.
Professional Bio:
Sherman Williams is a co-founder and Managing Partner of AIN Ventures. Sherman has an extensive history investing in deep technology segments, such as space technology and healthcare technology. Sherman is also a Kauffman Fellow (Class 26). Prior to becoming an early-stage investor, Sherman gathered six years of financial transaction experience as a Healthcare Technology M&A Investment Banker. Sherman started his career as a Naval Intelligence Officer.

Sherman holds an MBA from the University of Chicago and a Bachelor of Science degree from the United States Naval Academy.
Education/Personal Bio: Sherman holds a Bachelors of Science from the U.S. Naval Academy and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

Name: Siobhan Brewster
Investing Thesis: AENU is a €170M European early stage fund investing in energy resilience, industrial decarbonisation and systemic adaptation technologies. The team includes former unicorn founders (Forto), climate activists (LFCA), and investors from Earlybird, Macquarie, and Speedinvest.
Professional Bio: Infrastructure private equity across the US and LatAm with Macquarie and ING before building a sustainable travel start-up and discovering angel investing. Previously focused on early stage supply chain investing before dedicating myself to the decarbonisation of our economy and the energy transition.  Currently leading AENU's second fundraise from Berlin.
Education/Personal Bio:
Born and raised in Scotland, Siobhan studied Anthropology at University College London before spending time living and working in Indonesia, the US, Latin America, and Germany.

She currently lives in Berlin with her partner and baby Flynn but returns to Mexico City often.

Name: Anton Orlich
Professional Bio:
Anton Orlich is the Head of Alternative Investments at Kaiser Permanente (KP), which has both foundation and corporate pension capital pools totaling over $150 billion with over a 40% allocation to alternatives in the following asset classes: absolute return, buyout, private credit, real assets, and venture. KP pursues co-investments, direct investments, primary funds, and secondaries across all private asset classes.

Anton's prior experience includes tenures at Pivotal Group (a family office), CalPERS, Neuberger Berman, and McKinsey. Anton is a U.S. Navy and Afghan War veteran.
Education/Personal Bio: Born and raised in Arizona, Anton holds a BA, summa cum laude, in Economics from Columbia and a PhD in Political Science from Yale. He's lived in New York City and the Bay Area. Anton's passions include travel, history, national security issues, and sports.
Preferred Stages: Series A,Series B,Series C+,LP Positions,Secondaries (Direct),Secondaries (Fund),Venture Debt,Other

Name: Samantha Wong
Professional Bio:
Samantha Wong is a General Partner at Blackbird Ventures, Australia and New Zealand's largest venture capital fund and backer of some of of the regions biggest success stories - Canva, Airwallex, Halter, Eucalyptus, Tracksuit and Heidi Health. to name a few. Sam spearheaded Blackbird's expansion to New Zealand. Prior to joining Blackbird she co-founded the legaltech startup and was a product manager in Australia and Europe. She initially trained as a lawyer and practiced in corporate and litigation teams at Minter Ellison before career-pivoting into startups in 2010. Sam is passionate about diversity in technology and venture capital and spearheaded the release of the Model Code of Conduct for the Startup Community in Australia as well as a venture capital internship program for women. 

She focussed on early stage B2B investments, including those with a hardware component.
Education/Personal Bio: Sam holds a BA/LLB majoring in history from the University of New South Wales. She grew up between Perth and Sydney, Australia, the daughter of 2 migrant technology entrepreneurs. Since then she has lived in the UK, France, Denmark and spent good amounts of time in both San Francisco and Malaysia. She lives with her partner and two children in Sydney, Australia.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Sultan Fahd Salman
Professional Bio:
Sultan has been the Executive Chairman of Eirad Group, a family office, for the past eight years. Sultan made the switch from the public to the private sector after joining Eirad Group in 2008. Prior to joining officially, he spent a period of time as a trusted advisor using his experience in organizational strategy to evolve the firm's approach and expand its reach.

Sultan is the Chairman of the Saudi Arabian Water Sports & Diving Federation, the federation that regulates water sport and diving activities in Saudi Arabia, since 2019. He plans to continue in this role, as he is deeply passionate about contributing to the future of Saudi Arabian growth in the Red Sea and Arabian Gulf. Sultan is a Board Member of many other foundations and charities, including the Kilana Foundation, which provides key support (including medication and dialysis) to those navigating kidney disease.
Education/Personal Bio: Sultan earned a bachelor's degree in International Business from Regent's College in London. He also successfully completed the MBA program at London Business School. Sultan believes post-graduate education is key to his success, and as such regularly attends executive education programs to refresh and increase his knowledge.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare

Name: Samara Hernandez
Professional Bio:
Samara is Founding Partner of an institutionally-backed pre-seed stage fund, Chingona Ventures, which focuses on investing in technology and technology-enabled companies all over the U.S. Prior to this she was an investor at MATH Venture Partners, an early-stage venture fund investing in technology start-ups with differentiated approaches to customer acquisition. In this capacity, she led new investment review, diligence, and execution.

Prior to venture capital, Samara worked at Goldman Sachs, where she was continually ranked top 5 in selling financial products, providing market insights, advising on portfolio construction, and consulting on business practices. She started her career in the Fixed Income, Currency and Commodity (FICC) group where she led multiple technology enhancing projects across global exchanges.
Education/Personal Bio:
Samara is actively involved in the Chicago tech community and passionate about helping underrepresented groups get into STEM education, venture capital, and entrepreneurship. She co-founded the Latinx Founders Collective organization to bring together Latinx founders, investors, and community leaders to support the entrepreneurial ecosystem. She is actively involved in LatinxVCs, a group designed to grow and support the Latinx venture capital ecosystem. Samara is also an advisor to Angeles, a Chicago-based angel group investing in Latinx founders, Chicago Blend, a group focusing on diversifying the Chicago startup and venture capital ecosystem, and Camino Financial, a company providing affordable loans to Latinx small businesses.

Samara earned an Industrial and Operations Engineering degree from the University of Michigan and a master’s degree in Business Administration from Northwestern University. She lives in Chicago with her husband, also a startup CEO, and her energetic son.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Chihiro Hosoya
Job Title: Head of Venture Capital Management and BD/Partnership, Rx+ Business (Digital and device)
Professional Bio: Professionally, leading partnerships between Astellas, a Japanese pharma and digital health start-ups ecosystem.  Personally, exploring opportunities in investor role in healthcare.
Education/Personal Bio: Chihiro holds a BSc in Chemistry and an MSc in Biochemistry from Waseda University and an MBA from Tsukuba University. During her MBA program, she represented Tsukuba University at a CFA Institute Research Challenge hosted by the CFA Society of Japan.

Name: Ashley Lundström
Professional Bio:
Ashley is a General Partner at EQT Ventures where she focuses on consumer, prosumer, and SMB - businesses that impact mass market users. Since joining the firm in 2016 she has helped lead investments and ongoing work in companies such as Baller League, Anydesk, Peakon, Instabox, Kota, Anyfin, and evroc, among others.

Prior to joining EQT Ventures Ashley worked with media investments at Bonnier, a Scandinavian media house.
Education/Personal Bio: Originally from the US, Ashley earned degrees in chemistry from the University of San Diego and the University of Zurich before finally attending business school at the Stockholm School of Economics. She currently lives in Stockholm with her husband and three (wild, lovely) young children.
