Name: Jaime Zunzunegui
Professional Bio:
Jaime Zunzunegui is a former serial entrepreneur turned early stage tech VC. He has invested in many companies including: Nazca, Impulsa Generación Renovable, Actinver, Seguros Atlas, Kavak, albo, True Home, Luuna, Urbvan, Cargamos, Asistensi, Bruma, and Epiphany Clubs among others.

Jaime is Co-Managing Partner at Nazca, a venture capital firm focused on backing bold entrepreneurs that are building tomorrow’s transformative technology-enabled businesses.
Education/Personal Bio: Jaime earned his BA in Business at ITAM, an MBA from IESE Business School, and completed the OPM at HBS.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Mexico

Name: Shikha Goyal
Professional Bio:
Shikha is a Venture Partner at Imaginable Futures. She leads the firm's strategy and investments across Africa.

Over the last 18 years, Shikha has worked across the development and private sectors. Prior to joining Imaginable Futures and Omidyar Network, she worked at the Children’s Investment Fund Foundation (CIFF), where she led investment and management of programs to improve basic literacy and numeracy for children in India and Sub-Saharan Africa. She was responsible for a portfolio of over $60 million, including CIFF’s investment in Early Learning Partnership, a multi-donor trust fund with the World Bank, Educate Girls India, the world’s first education development impact bond as well as Tayari, a low-cost, early childhood education model across 1,500 schools in Kenya.

Before CIFF, Shikha was at Accenture advising European utilities on strategic due-diligence, operational improvement and regulatory strategy. She started her career as an R&D engineer in an energy meter manufacturing startup in India.

Shikha is a board member for Innovation Edge and SPARK Schools and a board observer for SmartStart in South Africa. She is also on the steering committee for the Global Schools Forum.
Education/Personal Bio: Shikha has a Bachelor's in Electronics Engineering from Thapar Institute of Engineering & Technology in India and an MBA from INSEAD France.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Vlad Estiverne
Professional Bio:
Vlad Estiverne is currently a Managing Director at Main Street (MSA) where he invests in growth stage companies. Vlad was previously Vice President, Head of Global Corporate Development and Strategic Investments at Foot Locker, Inc. Vlad was responsible for investing broadly in consumer and marketplace companies, as well as portfolio development on behalf of Foot Locker, Inc. He also lead the LP investing initiative for the company.

Prior to his current position, Vlad held a number of leadership roles at Foot Locker. Most recently he was Sr. Director on the Product and Marketing Strategy team for North America. Before that, Vlad had multiple Business Development roles, including managing Foot Locker’s partner businesses in the Middle East and Asia. Vlad also spent some time at Lehman Brothers and at Barclays Capital.
Education/Personal Bio:
Vlad holds an MBA from The Wharton School at The University of Pennsylvania.

Vlad serves as a board member for The Opportunity Agenda, a social justice communication lab that collaborates with social justice leaders to move hearts and minds, driving lasting policy and culture change. Their work is intersectional and currently organized across three primary issues – criminal justice, immigration, and economic opportunity.

Vlad currently resides in New York with his wife Lori and two sons, Weston and Walker. Vlad is an active angel investor and advisor to several emerging companies and funds. In his spare time, Vlad enjoys running, golf, and biking with his family.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC

Name: Nasir Qadree
Professional Bio:
Nasir Qadree is Founder and Managing Partner at Zeal Capital Partners, an inclusive investment vehicle that partners with entrepreneurs to narrow America's wealth and skills gaps. In his role, he defines the fund's focus, leads investment activities, manages post-value creation strategies and supports mechanisms for portfolio companies.

Prior to Zeal, he served as the Associate Director for AT&T's $400 million Aspire Social Investment Fund, where he oversaw direct investments in Education and Employment Technology, led the tech giant's investment readiness program, and spearheaded partnerships with national accelerators across the US. Prior to AT&T, he led Village Capital's US Economic Opportunity Portfolio and served as Global Head of Education Investments. At Village Capital, he evaluated and made investments in early-stage businesses in Education, Health, and Financial Services and developed investment theses across the three sectors. He began his career in the public markets, at Goldman Sachs and State Street Corporation.

Nasir serves on the board of LearnFresh Education, the official education nonprofit for the NBA. Nasir is committed to completing 51 full marathons, in all 50 states and D.C. and has already completed 18 of them to raise $1 million in scholarship funding for first-generation college students. In 2018, the Washington Business Journal recognized his contributions to the industry and his community by naming him in their '40 under 40' list.
Education/Personal Bio:
Nasir holds a BA in Marketing from Hampton University, from which he graduated magna cum laude. Nasir has also completed post-graduate certification in Front End Web Development and Python Programming from General Assembly.

The Atlanta native currently resides in Washington D.C.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Ryan Sanders
Professional Bio:
Ryan is a Managing Director at Mercato Partners and participates on the Investment Committee. He currently serves as the board member at Lambda, Atomic, Lendio, ObservePoint, Ownwell, and Stance. He held prior Board and Board Observer positions with several portfolio companies including Galileo Financial Technologies, Central Logic, SaltStack, and CloudElements. He oversees all investment team processes at Mercato Partners including sourcing, striking, and harvest. His operating experience spans technology and consumer businesses. Ryan adds public and private company operating experience, growth equity investment, and risk and credit management experience to the Traverse investment practice.

Prior to Traverse, Ryan was a Principal at Escalate Capital, a Texas based mezzanine investment firm similarly targeting growth-stage companies in underserved geographies. Prior to joining Escalate, Ryan was a Business Operations Manager at Comcast (NASDAQ: CMCSA) helping to roll out next-gen IP architecture and systems. Previously Ryan was a Founder in multiple technology businesses, including venture-backed Calixus Networks which was acquired by the Media News Group under the parent company Digital First Media.
Education/Personal Bio: Ryan received a B.S. in Finance and Spanish from Brigham Young University and a M.B.A. from the University of Texas McCombs School of Business.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF | Texas,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,London Summit 2025

Name: Sierra Peterson
Investing Thesis: Voyager invests in early-stage climate tech companies in North America and Europe.
Professional Bio:
As Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Voyager Ventures, Sierra invests in early-stage climate technology companies in North America and Europe. Prior to Voyager, she built financial technology companies responsible for more than $3 billion in sustainability investment. She started investing as an angel investor in 2015.

Sierra has worked in energy and climate tech since 2005, serving with the International Energy Agency and the Obama White House Office of Energy and Climate Change.
Education/Personal Bio: Sierra is a graduate of Harvard and Stanford. She lives in San Francisco with her husband and young daughter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Meg Paulus
Professional Bio:
Meg Paulus is a Partner at HOLT Ventures, where she provides venture funding to teams aiming to disrupt the industrial landscape. Meg focuses specifically on those teams working on the future of distribution, service and manufacturing. Meg enjoys working with founders reinventing the industries in which HOLT CAT, HOLT Ventures' parent firm, operates. Meg also leads investment activities for the Holt Family and the Holt Family Foundation.

Prior to HOLT, Meg was with BlackRock Private Equity Partners, where she executed investments across venture capital, growth equity, and late stage private equity through direct, co-investment, secondary, and fund vehicles. Prior to BlackRock, she was an Equity Research Analyst at Quantum Capital Management. Meg began her career at Harvest Management Partners, a boutique investment bank.
Education/Personal Bio:
Meg earned a BSc in Finance and BA in Spanish from Santa Clara University. At Santa Clara, she competed for the school's Track and Cross Country teams, served in the Global Fellows program through her placement in Kumasi, Ghana where she focused on microfinance for women, and studied in Seville, Spain. In 2015, Meg was selected as a member of Bloomberg Beta's second cohort of Future Founders.

Meg was born in Burlington, Wisconsin and now lives in San Antonio, Texas with her husband. She currently serves on the board of Alamo Angels, a local angel network, and enjoys her time working with San Antonio's community on various initiatives.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Mac Conwell
Professional Bio:
McKeever “Mac” Conwell II founded RareBreed VC, a pre-seed fund that invests in exceptional founders outside of large tech ecosystems, in September of 2020.

Mac is a software engineer by trade and was a former Department of Defense contractor with top-secret clearance. He was a two-time founder with an exit and a failure. Next, Mac moved on to the venture capital world via the Maryland Technology Development Corporation as part of their Seed Investment Team.During his four years there, Mac amassed experience leading an initiative to create the Minority Business Pre-seed Fund, the first (and only, at the time) state-backed pre-seed fund for women and minorities in the United States. The program institutionalized the friends and family round for black-, women-, and minority-led startups and was subsequently funded long-term by the state of Maryland.
Education/Personal Bio: Mac studied Computer Science at Morgan State University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Bryan Subijano
Professional Bio:
Bryan is an investor on the growth stage investment team at Greycroft. Based in the Los Angeles office, his responsibilities include sourcing, evaluating, and executing growth stage investment opportunities and supporting existing portfolio companies.

Prior to joining Greycroft, Bryan was an investor at Centerview Capital, a growth equity firm focused on enterprise technology companies. Prior to Centerview, Bryan spent several years in the Technology Investment Banking group at Jefferies in Silicon Valley, where he worked with technology companies on a variety of M&A, leveraged buyout, debt financing, and public equity transactions.
Education/Personal Bio: Bryan graduated from Santa Clara University with a B.S. in Finance and Economics and a minor in Management Information Systems.

Name: Shirley Speakman
Professional Bio:
Shirley is a Senior Partner with Cycle Capital, a Canadian based cleantech venture capital firm with just shy of $500M of AUM and dedicated to addressing some of the greatest environmental challenges of our generation.

Prior to joining Cycle, Shirley worked at MaRS IAF a fund which has grown to be one of Canada’s most successful seed funds. She also worked in investment banking and has had a strategic role in the formation of four seed funds created by the Royal Bank of Canada. Shirley’s investment history includes several successful exits as well as IPOs.
Education/Personal Bio: Shirley holds a Bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of Waterloo, an MBA from Wilfrid Laurier University, and ICD.d from the University of Toronto. Shirley Speakman was recognized as one of the Canada’s 'Clean16' and one of Canada’s 'Inspiring Fifty'.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Sydney Thomas
Professional Bio: Sydney is the Founder and General Partner at Symphonic Capital a Pre-Seed fund that backs companies at their earliest stages and guides them to product-market-fit. The founder and GP, Sydney Thomas, spent almost 6 years building and investing out of Precursor Ventures - a premier Pre-Seed fund - and is using that expertise to build Impressionism Capital. Symphonic Capital backs founders building technology that makes life better for the 99% - a thesis Sydney has been cultivating throughout her career and that has spurred her 15 investments in what are soon to be category-defining companies such as Aidaly, Guava, Carda, Boost, and Brightflow. At Precursor Ventures she led deals and focused her time on investing in and supporting Pre-Seed companies that democratize access to products and services for the mass market economy. To increase knowledge of these types of companies, she founded and hosts the Be About It podcast, where she profiles companies that fit this thesis. When Sydney first joined Precursor almost 6 years ago, she built the software and systems that grew the firm from a Solo Operating GP with 10 investments to a 3-person team with 100+ investments. Before joining Precursor, Sydney gained experience working in technology startups in business development and product marketing. She has done everything from writing federal SBIR grants to managing customer success teams. Prior to her work in tech, she served in the Bloomberg Administration in NYC. Over the course of her tenure, she drafted federal legislation, negotiated a multi-million dollar contract and received a full-ride scholarship to her business school of choice.
Education/Personal Bio: She also participates in several activities to increase diversity in tech and level the playing field for underrepresented populations. She is the creator of The Interrupters – a list that highlights investors committed to investing in black and LatinX founders. She serves on the Advisory Board of Invanti – a startup generator in the midwest. She is deeply involved in her community, Longfellow Oakland. In 2020, she was honored to receive the Champion of Justice Award from Esq. Apprentice, an Oakland-based nonprofit she supports that creates alternative pathways to the legal career. She was also appointed by the Mayor to serve as a Commissioner for the City of Oakland’s Public Safety and Services Commission. She is also a member of the 4.0 Angel Syndicate – a community of Black philanthropists. Sydney graduated from Berkeley with her MBA and Duke with her BA.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ruby Nimkar
Professional Bio:
Surabhi (Ruby) Nimkar is a Principal at GreenHouse Capital, a Nigeria-based early-stage investor focused on the Sub-Saharan Africa and MENA regions. Ruby is primarily focused on Fintech and Enterprise Software, and is actively involved in GHC’s investment decisioning, having backed market champions such as Flutterwave, Helium health, Migo, NowMoney, Dapi and several others.

Ruby's efforts at GreenHouse Capital also include running a women entrepreneur acceleration program (GreenHouse Lab) that not only provides women founders with capital and resources, but a 250+ -strong network of women leaders globally. The program was the first of its kind on the continent of Africa to be backed by Google for Startups. This led to Ruby co-founding a syndicate vehicle that supports under-represented, immigrant founders globally.

Prior to GHC, Ruby was a Management Consultant at Accenture, operating across New York and London to drive digital strategy for financial services clients. Some of her key projects focused on design and implementation of Digital Wealth Management initiatives targeting Millennials and Gen Z for global leaders in banking.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ruby describes herself as 'your typical third-culture kid', having grown up across 10 cities and speaking multiple languages.

She is also hugely passionate about the intersection of human development and technology, working closely with orphanages and schools across her home cities such as Mumbai and Shanghai to support technology literacy programs for disadvantaged children.

Ruby earned a BA in Economics and Finance from Boston University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Andrew O'Neill
Professional Bio:
Andrew is a Principal with Act Venture Capital, a European early-stage VC firm. Based out of Dublin, Andrew is responsible for sourcing & executing investments into early-stage technology startups, across multiple domains with a particular interest in enterprise software, infrastructure, and security.

Andrew also manages the Act platform, guiding on strategy from fundraising to operations and talent across the portfolio of over 40 companies to support growth. Act has raised in excess of $500M across multiple funds and invests in early-stage technology companies from seed to growth stages within Europe.

Prior to Act, Andrew was a founder, having founded businesses in the retail and martech industries.
Education/Personal Bio: Born and raised in Ireland, Andrew holds a BA in History & Politics from UCD, executive qualifications in Finance from Trinity Business School, and in Venture Capital from the University of California Berkeley Haas School of Business.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense

Name: Liran Grinberg
Professional Bio:
Liran Grinberg is a Co-Founder & Managing Partner at Team8, a venture group with close to $2 billion in exits and over $1 billion in AUM, from LP investors such as Microsoft, Walmart, AT&T, Moody’s, Cisco, Qualcomm, Accenture, Barclays, CapitalOne, Mastercard, Intuit, Softbank and Temasek. 

Team8 incubates and invests in early stage companies, bringing deep domain expertise in cybersecurity, infrastructure (cloud, dev/devops, data & AI), fintech and digital health. 

Liran is focusing his time on cybersecurity & enterprise infrastructure investments. He led the seed investments in Talon Cyber Security (acquired by Palo Alto Networks for $625M) and Dig Security (acquired by Palo Alto Networks for $315M), and worked closely with founding teams on the ideation (and seed investment) in Claroty (now a unicorn backed with $635M in funding), Curv (acquired by PayPal), Portshift (acquired by Cisco), Sygnia (acquired by Temasek for $250M), VisibleRisk (acquired by BitSight), Illusive (acquired by Proofpoint) and Hysolate (acquired by Perception Point). 

Liran is currently a board director at Akeyless (secrets management), Finout (cloud cost observability), Port (internal developer portal), Ionix (attack surface management), Monogoto (software-defined connectivity), Vena Security (defense optimization) and Clover Security (secure design), and observes the boards of Claroty (XIoT security, industrial and medical) and Gem Security (cloud detection and response). 

Liran co-founded Team8 in 2014, initially focusing on the design of its foundry (venture studio) model. Liran then transitioned to build and lead Team8’s Go-to-Market group across its marketing, business development and business research & strategy functions, alongside the formation of the “Team8 Village,” a tightknit community of hundreds of C-level executives from the world’s leading enterprises. Combined, the two initiatives have become a powerful and differentiated advantage of Team8 in accelerating the success of its portfolio companies.

Prior to co-founding Team8, Liran led the flagship product at fintech unicorn eToro as well as the API and developers platforms for publisher engagement unicorn Conduit. He began his career by serving as a distinguished officer in the cyber and data division of Israel’s elite military and technology intelligence unit 8200. 

Liran is a member of YPO, has been selected by Forbes for its ’30 Under 30′ list as well as by The Marker for its ‘40 Under 40 Promising Young People’ list. He holds a B.Sc. in Computer Science from the Academic College of Tel-Aviv.
Education/Personal Bio: Liran lives in Tel-Aviv, Israel, with his architect partner, and love Tennis!
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe

Name: Warda Shaheen
Professional Bio:
Warda Shaheen is a Director at OMERS Growth Equity leading their software vertical. OMERS Growth Equity is the growth arm of OMERS ($100B Canadian pension fund) launched in 2019. Warda has led investments in Coveo, TouchBistro, PandaDoc, Gitlab, Clio, Phenom People and assisted with the Dialpad investment. She is also a Board Observer for Coveo, and TouchBistro. 

Previously, Warda worked in public markets at CPP Investments where she ran a $500M public markets portfolio in their thematic investing team. She also worked at Point72 Asset Management, Bain & Company and Deutsche Bank. Warda has experience working in the United States, Canada, United Kingdom, Singapore, Hong Kong and Germany. Warda believes that investing should be borderless, global and asset class- agnostic.
Education/Personal Bio: Warda holds a BESc in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Western University and an HBA in Business Administration the Richard Ivey School of Business. She also holds an MSc in Financial Economics from the University of Oxford.

Name: Christian Jølck
Professional Bio:
Before becoming an investor, Christian spent more than a decade as an industrial B2B operator with experience in driving commercial and digital transformation and advocacy for sustainability. Prior to co-founding 2150, Christian held leadership roles in global industrial B2B companies such as Coloplast and ROCKWOOL driving changes focused on commercial development, digitalization, and sustainability.

While working in healthcare he co-founded a company that invented a novel technology to diagnose malaria in a quick, cost-effective way. He also co-founded and chaired the board of SYNERGI, an organization focused on climate and energy efficiency bringing together key industry players like Danfoss, Grundfos, Velux, and others to lobby for Danish and European policy changes to extend to the Paris Climate Agreement. Christian previously served on the board of Aarhus University, and is currently an advisor to the Foundation for Climate Restoration based in California.
Education/Personal Bio:
Christian holds a Masters in Finance and International Business from Aarhus University and is a proud INSEAD alumnus after having completed his executive degree at the institution. Christian has lived across the globe from Rio De Janeiro to London to Singapore, and likes to explore new parts of the world

When not with his wife and three kids, Christian enjoys spending time off-trail running or exploring nature. His personal commitment to sustainability in 2021 includes taking his children to kindergarten on the family's Christiania bike to further reduce his carbon footprint.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025

Name: Jenny Barba
Investing Thesis: Investing in early-stage MedTech and healthcare innovation at the first-in-human and first-revenue stages across multi-billion dollar global  markets. Supporting entrepreneurs with our deep 45 years of experience and networks with company building and value creation.
Professional Bio:
Jenny Barba, Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Features Capital, is a venture investor and board member with over twenty-five years of experience financing the growth of medical device and healthcare technology innovation. Jenny has executed over $4 billion in capital transactions across thirty lead- managed public and private equity offerings, M&A, and alternative investments. Jenny specializes in deal sourcing, portfolio construction, harvesting growth and building management teams in medical technology companies across all stages of development and a broad spectrum of diseases. Jenny has a successful track record fundraising for shareholder value creation, and strategic planning for corporate development, market expansion, commercialization growth and exits. Jenny has a broad network of trusted relationships with senior leaders in venture capital, founders, executives, board members, innovation centers and economic development.

Jenny is a Kauffman Fellow and received the Class 26 Leadership Award, Board Member of Laplace Interventional, Board Observer OCON Therapeutics, Trustee of Alice Peck Day Memorial Hospital part of Dartmouth Health, Steering Committee Member of the University of Michigan Fast Forward Medical Innovation Hub and the Northern New England MedTech Collaborative, speaker at University of Michigan, Tel Aviv University, Life Science Intelligence (LSI), Women in Venture Capital, BioUtah, BioKansas, Montreal FundFest, and University of Vermont, and an advisor to several life sciences startup hubs.

Jenny is recognized as a 2024 Ten Emerging Fund Managers to Watch in 2024, by Venture Forward, National Venture Capital Association. Jenny is frequently requested to speak as a thought leader at global healthcare and venture capital industry events. Features Capital is a member of Recast Enablement Cohort 5, Recast Accelerate Cohort 1, Bridge Global, Plexo GPx Cohort 5, Catalyze and VC+Include.

Jenny received her BA in Neuroscience from Colorado College and an MBA and MHSA from the University of Michigan. Jenny and her family live in Norwich, Vermont where they are often skiing and adventuring outside on trails.
Education/Personal Bio: Jenny earned her BA in Neuroscience from Colorado College and her MBA and MHSA from University of Michigan.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Boston,KF | NYC,KF | Texas,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Peter Ackerson
Professional Bio:
General Partner at Audere Capital, investing in American innovation through early-stage investment and active partnership with founders building in artificial intelligence, automation technology, next generation manufacturing, advanced communications, alternative energy systems, and cyber security.

Previously General Partner at Fin Capital, exploring and supporting the next wave of fintech disruptors. As GP, served on the boards of Maxwell, Teampay, Pipe, SamCart, Ternary. Served as CFO of SymphonyAI, a $1 billion investment holding company focused on building the next generation of artificial intelligence and machine learning applications in healthcare, fintech, retail, industrial, IT infrastructure, and enterprise applications markets. Served on the Board of Directors of Concerto HealthAI, a leading clinical cancer AI solutions company; Prometrics, a healthcare data analytics company; Vector Oncology, a health economics and outcomes research and real-world evidence solutions company; Precision Health Intelligence, an Oncology AI company; and Symphony SummitAI, an IT Services and Operations Management company.

Prior to SymphonyAI, worked at McKinsey & Co in the Fast Growth Tech practice; with Wells Fargo in the Global Technology Equity Research Group, including working on Facebook, ServiceNow, Marin Software, and Groupon IPOs; and with Merrill Lynch in the Technology Investment Banking group.
Education/Personal Bio:
Peter is passionate about the commercialization of frontier technologies and the disruption of legacy markets and business models. His professional experience has also included co-founding several technology companies.

Peter holds an MBA from the University of Virginia, where he was elected to the Raven Society, and a BBA in Finance from the College of William & Mary.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Daley Ervin
Professional Bio:
Daley is a Managing Director of Engage, where he focuses on enterprise investments, leads corporate partner relationships, and assists portfolio founders in partnership development and go-to-market strategy.




Engage is a collaborative innovation and corporate venture platform comprised of a leading research institution and 14 Fortune 500s in the Southeast that have joined forces to invest in startups building the future of the enterprise. Engage Corporate Partners include: Chick-fil-a, Coca-Cola, Cox Enterprises, Delta, Georgia-Pacific, Georgia Power, Georgia Tech, Goldman Sachs, Honeywell, Intercontinental Exchange (NYSE), Inspire Brands, Invesco, The Home Depot, UPS, and Wellstar.




Prior to Engage, Daley spent more than ten years leading four venture-backed startups on three continents. He was most recently Vice President of Business Development and Strategy for Amazon-backed Nucleus based in New York. Before that, Daley was General Manager and Head of North American Operations for Shanghai-based Student.com, and was founding team and General Manager of North America for YPlan based in London, which later sold to Timeout Group. He started his career as part of the International Expansion team at Airbnb and eventually led sales for North America there.
Education/Personal Bio:
As an ultramarathoner and extreme endurance athlete, Ervin set the United States’ pairs record having rowed 3,000 miles over 45-days across the Atlantic Ocean from Spain to the Caribbean in the “World’s Toughest Rowing Race.”

He earned his bachelor’s degree in Business and Communication from Arizona State University.

Name: Matt Malysz
Professional Bio:
Maciej Malysz is a General Partner at Inovo Venture Partners, a USD 60 million VC fund investing in Poland and Central and Eastern Europe. At Inovo, Maciej helps developers-turned-founders build companies that impact the world. He partners with early-stage startups with an ambition to grow 100x. Maciej took two tech companies through an IPO (Brand24, ECC Games) as a board member, is an investor at Spacelift, AI Clearing, Archbee and became one of the youngest VC Partners in Europe at age 29. He is passionate about product-led growth and believes that data beats opinion.

Before becoming Partner, Maciej climbed up through the ranks of venture capital and he spent 3 years operationally in VC-backed companies (Booksy, Brand24, PV Polska), focusing mainly on product management and business intelligence.
Education/Personal Bio: Maciej holds a bachelor's degree in Economics and a master's degree in Finance and Accounting from the Warsaw School of Economics. He also studied at HEC Paris as part of the CEMS program.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Sam Giber
Professional Bio:
Sam Giber is a Partner at Blisce where he leads the U.S. investment team and serves on the investment committee. Blisce is an investment fund focused on helping entrepreneurs build mission-driven global consumer brands and technology companies across the U.S. and E.U. He currently serves on the boards of Redesign Health, Candid, Headspace, and Dice, and his historical investments include Imperfect Foods, Harry's, and Stadium Goods.

Sam is also an Advisor to Epic Foundation, a global venture philanthropy foundation focused on funding the most impactful nonprofits that work to resolve issues that affect youth globally.
Education/Personal Bio: Sam graduated magna cum laude with a B.S. from the Economics Distinction Program at Syracuse University, where he received the JoAnn Heffernan Heisen Scholarship and RVD Idea Award. Currently, Sam lives in Manhattan with his wife Michelle.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Misbah Naqvi
Investing Thesis: To invest in bold founders solving big problems in Pakistan and out of Pakistan
Professional Bio:
Misbah Naqvi is General Partner and Co-Founder at i2i Ventures, a pre-seed and seed stage venture capital fund and the country's first female-founded VC fund, focused on high-growth tech startups solving big problems in Pakistan,

i2i Ventures has invested in Abhi, CreditBook, Oraan, Tazah Technologies, Truck It In, TelloTalk Inc., Edkasa, ezBike and more. The fund provides a unique value proposition to its portfolio companies by leveraging its GP's experience in the Pakistan startup space, and its sister entity Invest2Innovate's ongoing startup entrepreneurship support programs and comprehensive ground-breaking research on the market.

Misbah has over two decades of global experience in corporate finance, entrepreneurship, impact investing, fintech and development in Pakistan and the US.

Previously, Misbah was Head of Global Market Development at Boloro Global Limited, a US-based fintech startup licensing a multi-factor and multi-channel authentication and payment service platform, where she worked extensively with the company's partners in Pakistan, South Asia, the Middle East and Africa. She has worked at Acumen (in Pakistan and the US) an impact-focused global venture capital fund investing in social entrepreneurs, and a pioneer in the impact investing space. Misbah started her career at Citibank in 1998, where she worked in Transaction Banking and then Corporate Banking, managing a portfolio of over $100 million in credit relationships with multinational companies for the bank. She was subsequently the Public Affairs Officer for Citigroup Pakistan for several years.
Education/Personal Bio:
Misbah has been closely involved with Invest2Innovate (i2i), i2i Ventures sister company and an ecosystem builder in the startup space in Pakistan, as an Advisory Board Member since its inception in 2011 and is currently on its Board of Directors. She is also a Board Member at U Microfinance Bank Ltd, a leading microfinance bank in Pakistan, as well as Edkasa, an edtech startup and i2i Ventures portfolio company. Misbah is passionate about giving back and is a Trustee on the Board of AAS, a non-profit that provides treatment, rehabilitation and aftercare to adults and children suffering from substance abuse and/or addiction and is on the Board of Advisors for NOWPDP, a leading disability inclusion organization in Pakistan.

Misbah holds a BBA (Hons.) and an MBA from Institute of Business Administration, University of Karachi. She is also a Certified Director by the Corporate Governance Leadership Skills Program of the Pakistan Institute of Corporate Governance.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Susan Spears
Professional Bio: Susan is an investment partner with Atento Capital, the early stage strategy of the George Kaiser Family Foundation, where she supports strategic management of the venture portfolio. Her primary responsibilities include sourcing and underwriting commitments into venture fund managers and reviewing coinvestment opportunities alongside those fund managers. Atento invests at the intersection of financial returns, economic development, and equity. Susan is passionate about bridging the gap between investing and economic development and looks to support mission-driven investments that drive impact for women and underrepresented populations. Susan began her career as a CPA with Ernst and Young where she served enterprise clients operating in energy, consumer, and telecommunications. More recently, Mrs. Spears worked as an Associate with Argonaut Private Equity, a middle market buyout fund investing in the Industrial, Manufacturing, and Energy Services verticals across the Central United States.
Education/Personal Bio: Susan received an MS in Accountancy and BS in Accountancy from the University of Notre Dame. She spends her free time building magnatile houses with her two young boys and husband.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Julian Eison
Investing Thesis: Whole Spectrum Health
Professional Bio:
Julian Eison invests in whole person health, which includes preventive and acute health care innovation, both enterprise and consumer. He's passionately driven by investing in entrepreneurs who are exposing industry inefficiencies, omitted or misunderstood historical facts or processes, and closing generational gaps.

Julian's relationship with venture capital has evolved as his exposure to various modalities of value creation has expanded over time.


He believes success shouldn't always be articulated in ways that emphasize earning potential, but also value human enablement and net positive impact. Through his work, he's led investments in Humane, Vital Biosciences, Mood Health, OK Capsule, Trial Library, Terra, Juno Medical, SteadyMD, Oura, Genopets, Adaptyx, Prose Foods, and Pair Team. Julian sits on the board of virtual primary care businesses SteadyMD and Pair Team.


Julian was the Managing Partner at Next Ventures, and prior to that, he was the founder and CEO of Eison Triple Thread, a premium consumer brand where he developed FITS, a product recommendation engine that leveraged customers' musical preferences to drive product acquisition. Before his time as a founder, he spent 6 years at Golden Gate Capital, a private equity firm with $19 billion in committed capital, focused on deal diligence and technology.
Education/Personal Bio:
Julian is a Lecturer at Stanford Business School and serves as a board member for the San Francisco Boys and Girls Club. He's also a Kauffman Fellow and proud supporter and member of the Black Venture Institute. As an NCAA Division I Track & Field athlete, Julian was a Big West High Jump Champion. He's been featured in TechCrunch, Yahoo Finance, WWD, The Guardian, Adweek, NBC, and other publications.


Julian earned a BA in Sociology from the University of California, Irvine, where he was an Academic All-American athlete and research scholar.


Julian resides in San Francisco, CA, with his wife—his high school sweetheart—and their two young children.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Conrad Shang
Investing Thesis: We operate as a data-driven and product oriented VC firm. We collaborate and support our companies by leverage our data science and engineering team. which represents half our firm.
Professional Bio:
As a founder of Ensemble VC, Conrad has built a successful investment career across top tier institutions in venture capital. His institutional training has always been focused on supporting entrepreneurs as they build industry-defining businesses. Prior to founding Ensemble VC, Conrad was the Head of VC investing at the UTIMCO endowment, managing a $3B VC portfolio at one of the largest endowments in the US. Conrad invested in many of the highest performing VC funds globally, and also led direct investments in Techstars, Rover (NASDAQ: ROVR), Aqua Security, and Salsify. 

Prior to UTIMCO, Conrad was an investor at Norwest Venture Partners (NVP), a venture capital firm based in the Bay Area, with $6 billion under management. Conrad led the firm’s investments in Casper (NYSE: CSPR), Udemy (NASDAQ:UDMY), STRATIM (acquired by KAR), Good.Co (acquired by StepStone GmbH), and others. Prior to NVP, Conrad was a product manager at Yammer, a leading enterprise social network acquired by Microsoft ($1.2B) and also an investor at Bain Capital Ventures. Earlier in his career, Conrad was a management consultant at Bain & Company. Conrad holds an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania and is also a proud graduate of The University of Texas at Austin.
Education/Personal Bio: Conrad holds an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. Conrad also earned a Bachelor of Business Administration in Business Honors and Finance and a Bachelor of Arts in the Plan II Liberal Arts Honors Program at The University of Texas at Austin. He currently lives in Austin, TX with his wife and their young daughter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI

Name: Samantha Lewis
Investing Thesis: Samantha leads Mercury's fintech practice, under which she seeks to fund startups that utilize blockchain to rethink the way people access capital and transact globally.
Professional Bio: Samantha Lewis is a Partner at Mercury Fund. Her specific focus is on Mercury’s Power theme, where she seeks to fund startups utilizing blockchain, data platforms and fintech to rethink the way people access capital and transact globally. Samantha’s current portfolio includes Plasma (stablecoin payment blockchain), Profitr (private credit onchain investment platform), OpenTrade (stablecoin infrastructure), LISNR (fintech), OmniScience (vertical AI), Civitech (data platform), and Cooklist (data intelligence). She previously sat on the boards of, and recently exited, Arden (web3 infrastructure), Brassica (fintech infrastructure), and Apparatus (web3 infrastructure).
Education/Personal Bio: Samantha received her MBA from Rice University and a B.A. in Political Science and History from Texas A&M University. Samantha remains deeply committed and involved in the efforts to build diverse, robust innovation ecosystems. Outside of Mercury, Samantha actively mentors founders, teaches a Venture Capital class at Rice University, and supports Ukraine through fundraising and medical supply deliveries.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Alison Rapaport Stillman
Investing Thesis: Early stage consumer tech, market place, e-comm enablement
Professional Bio:
Alison Rapaport Stillman is a Founding General Partner at Serena Ventures, overseeing portfolio management and sourcing new investments. She was the first hire of Serena Ventures back in 2018 and has grown the business from a family office to a venture capital firm. She has spearheaded over 40 investments. 

Alison invests in Fintech, Consumer Tech, and Fem Tech. She also has a passion for e-commerce enablement tools. In addition to growing the reach and impact of the SV portfolio, Alison is the person founders turn to when they need pointed advice, detailed feedback, and tough love.
Education/Personal Bio: Alison holds a BS from the University of Pennsylvania's Wharton School and an MBA from Harvard Business School. She is a CFA charterholder. She is originally from Los Angeles but now calls San Francisco home. Additionally you can find her up in Healdsburg enjoying some nice pinots. She lives with her husband Alec and their dog Zoe.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Seth Corder
Investing Thesis: Early Stage B2B
Professional Bio:
Seth Corder is a Managing Director at Moderne Ventures.


Prior to joining Moderne Ventures, Seth was a Partner at High Alpha, a leading venture fund focused on early-stage B2B SaaS companies across North America. During his six-year tenure, High Alpha invested in over 70 high-growth B2B companies. Seth was instrumental in leading the investment team, serving as a voting member of the investment committee, and providing strategic guidance to founders across the portfolio. He served as a board member or observer for nine companies, providing hands-on support to help drive growth and success.


Before joining High Alpha, Seth spent nearly a decade advising and investing in technology companies. He began his investment career at Goldman Sachs, where he focused on private equity and venture capital. Seth also gained valuable experience in investment banking at Pacific Crest Securities, where he specialized in M&A transactions for B2B companies, particularly in the DevOps space, with a strong emphasis on Europe and Israel.
Education/Personal Bio: Seth graduated from the Mitch Daniels School of Business at Purdue University, where he studied finance and accounting. Seth's recent accolades include being recognized by Business Insider as one of the 39 Most Important VCs in the Midwest. He is deeply passionate about mentoring the next generation of venture capitalists, regularly speaking in college classrooms and serving as a mentor in programs such as Venture Forward.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,London Summit 2025

Name: Marell Evans
Professional Bio:
Marell Evans is the Founder and Managing Director of Exceptional Capital, which invests in pre-seed to seed-stage B2B focused startups. The primary areas of the fund thesis include SaaS, Cybersecurity, FinTech, Web3|Blockchain, and discipline startups with recurring revenue and clear monetization models. 

Prior to founding Exceptional Capital Marell served as a Vice President at SoftBank working across various funds from robotics to investing in minority founders. Throughout Marell's time at Softbank, he co-led investments for Quicknode, Vitable, Squire, Accel Robotics, Bear Robotics and Afriex. Prior to joining SoftBank Marell managed high-performing sales teams at IBM, and was an imperative member of the revenue team at Okta, and served as Operating Partner at San Francisco's top family office where he co-managed a portfolio of $100MM.
Education/Personal Bio:
Education, Personal, and Fellowship

Marell graduated from the University of Michigan, where he played football, starting two full seasons as an outside linebacker and winning student-athlete of the year in 2011. Marell, enjoys traveling and spending time with family and friends. He remains highly active working out, swimming, running, and weight lifting.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Caio Bolognesi
Investing Thesis: Early stage latam
Professional Bio:
Caio Bolognesi focuses on investments in early-stage fintech, Saas, and healthcare. He is a General Partner at monashees where he has led the firm investments in companies such as Conta Azul, Pomelo, Tractian,, Pipo, idWall, and Azion, among others.  ​  ​  ​  ​  

monashees is a leading venture capital firm in Latin America focused on early-estage investment and portfolio support. Caio joined the firm as an investment associate in 2014.  ​  ​  ​  ​  
Prior to monashees, Caio worked as an strategic consultant at A.T. Kearney with engagements in banking, e-commerce, infrastructure and CPG. Caio is also a co-founder and board member of 42 SP (São Paulo), a non-profit codding school that started in France and has several units around the world.
Education/Personal Bio: Caio holds a business degree from FEA-USP and a master in economics from FGV-SP.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Nathan Harroch
Investing Thesis: Asset allocation across venture, growth, buyout in US and Europe
Professional Bio:
Mr. Harroch serves as a Partner at Cutting Edge, a specialist sponsor in media music and entertainment IP royalties, primarily overseeing Fundraising & Strategic Initiatives. He joined Cutting Edge in 2025.

Prior to joining Cutting Edge, Mr. Harroch was the Private Equity Portfolio Manager at Ergeny Investments, a large Monaco-based single family office where he focused on investments in buyouts and growth companies across US and Europe.

Mr. Harroch was previously an Associate Director at Cavendish Corporate Finance, a London-based M&A boutique focusing on sell-side mandates for family-owned businesses and private equity firms.
Education/Personal Bio:
Mr. Harroch holds a Master of Science degree in Biomedical Engineering from Imperial College London. 
Mr. Harroch holds a Master of Science degree in Engineering from Institut d'Optique Graduate School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | LPs,London Summit 2025

Name: Laura Gaviria Halaby
Professional Bio:
Laura Gaviria Halaby is a scale-up and business development expert with entrepreneurial background and ample experience in leadership roles in venture capital and tech. She started her career in financial services at Deutsche Bank and left to start her entrepreneurial journey building a fintech in Colombia which focused in democratizing access to financial services through products like crowdfunding. After a successful exit she got a scholarship from MIT as a Legatum Fellow and completed her MBA program with a focused in technology. In 2015 she joined Citibank to accelerate the implementation and launch of new digital products leveraging the power of open innovation as Global Head of Fintech Acceleration. Leading programs included Citi Mobile Challenge, Citi Tech for Integrity Challenge and Data Science Challenge. Her work at Citi gave her exposure to global fintech landscape working across Asia, EMEA and LatAm. In 2017, Laura joined The Venture City as Chief Acceleration Officer focusing her efforts in sourcing companies, investing and helping companies scale. She also led the transformation of the FOMIN to what is now the IDB Lab as senior advisor CEO and Entrepreneur in Residence. Laura's exposure to crypto started in 2014 while at MIT where she became passionate about the concept of smart contracts and the new business models it would unlock. Since then she has become an active advisor, investor and thought leader in the space. Her current role as part of the leadership team of the Operating Group at SoftBank Latin America Fund, a US$10 billion fund dedicated to the region, focuses on delivering operation support to the portfolio companies in order to accelerate their growth. She also leads scalable programs for SoftBank such as the SoftBank Group Operator School who has up-skilled over 8000 professionals in over 50 countries around the world. Laura is also a member of the Fintech / Crypto Action Board for the City of Miami; is an investor and active mentor for early and growth stage startups and also serves in the Board of Banco Sol in Bolivia
Laura holds a Bachelor's in Applied Mathematics from American University (Cum Laude) and an MBA from MIT Recipient of MIT Legatum Fellowship for entrepreneurial excellence.
Education/Personal Bio:
Laura Gaviria Halaby is a tech entrepreneur, investor, and operator. She is a member of the Founding team at Faktory, a generative AI platform that enables knowledge workers to build AI Agents using plain English for increased productivity. Laura also serves as an Operator Advisor for prominent Latin American Unicorns such as Rappi, Kavak, and Konfio, and is an active angel investor.
Previously, Laura held the position of Operating Lead for the US$8 billion SoftBank Latin America Funds, where she provided operational support to portfolio companies to accelerate their growth. She has also contributed to the tech industry as the Global Head of Fintech Acceleration at Citibank, facilitating the implementation and launch of digital products through open innovation. In addition, Laura supported and invested in tech startups as the Chief Acceleration Officer at The Venture City and as an Entrepreneur in Residence at the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB).
Laura holds a Bachelor's degree in Applied Mathematics from American University (Cum Laude) and an MBA from MIT.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Camila Noordeloos
Investing Thesis: Grand Venture backs visionary founders who are disrupting massive markets through software.
Professional Bio:
Grand Ventures




Camila Noordeloos is a General Partner at Grand Ventures, a $60M early stage venture capital fund investing in B2B SaaS companies. She helps identify promising investment opportunities across Grand Ventures’ sectors of interest and works closely with portfolio companies driving strategy development and implementation. She also serves on the board of directors for Manatee, Paccurate, Knockri, Drop Mobility, and InvestNext.




Previously, Camila worked at General Electric holding management positions within finance, portfolio management, and business strategy. She spent six years at GE Ventures, playing a crucial role in building the foundation for it to become one of the most active corporate venture capital firms in the country. She also held an operational role at Zinc, a GE Ventures portfolio company later acquired by ServiceMax.
Education/Personal Bio:
Originally from Brazil, Camila earned a BBA from the Universidade Federal da Bahia and received her MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania. She speaks Portuguese, English, and French. She is part of the Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion committee at the Michigan Venture Capital Association. She also stays engaged with several organizations including VentureNext, Women in VC, Latinx VC, and VentureUp Investor Network.




Camila loves to travel and stay active. She currently lives in Grand Rapids, Michigan with her husband Justin, young son Leo, and lovely golden retriever Bodhi.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Haley Zollo
Investing Thesis: Investing in products that reimagine life for the everyday person.
Professional Bio:
Haley Zollo is a Partner at Starting Line, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Chicago. Starting Line's thesis is "consumer for the 99%" and invests at the intersection of "cheaper and better" across marketplaces, experiences, platforms and products that are democratizing access to the everyday, mainstream consumer. Haley's focus is primarily within the themes of sustainability, personalization, next-generation commerce and GenZ. 

Prior to joining Starting Line, Haley spent over half a decade leading venture-backed consumer retail startups. Most recently she was VP of Business Operations and Strategy at Mac & Mia, a personalized clothing service for children. Haley came on as one of the first 10 employees, scaled their remote sales team from 3 to 300 and helped lead their Series A of $5M. Mac & Mia was acquired by Stitch Fix Kids in the summer of 2019. Before joining Mac & Mia, Haley was an early hire at Trunk Club where she built the Strategy & Data Analytics team and was a key player in launching their Women's line. Trunk Club was acquired by Nordstrom in 2014 for $350M.

Haley started her career at KPMG in the Transaction Services practice, where she worked on financial due diligence deals for private equity mergers and acquisitions.
Education/Personal Bio:
Haley is passionate about shaking up the venture capital scene and is on a mission to bring more women into this world. She's an active member of the All Raise community and is on the steering committee for the Chicago chapter. 

Haley holds a bachelor's degree in Finance and Accounting from the Kelley School of Business at Indiana University and also earned a CPA upon graduation. She lives in Chicago with her husband, a startup CEO, along with her daughter and mini bernedoodle.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Maria Buitron
Professional Bio:
Maria came to Piva Capital from Schlumberger Business Consulting (later acquired by Accenture Strategy Energy). There she helped clients address complex problems in the energy industry while working on projects in the Upstream, Midstream, and Downstream sectors. At the energy storage provider, Stem Inc. Maria was part of the Business Development team, she focused on expanding into international markets and new product offerings.

Maria is passionate about technology and diversity in the energy space. She firmly believes in the value of investing as a driver to help address some of the world’s most pressing challenges.
Maria graduated top of her class in B.S. Chemical Engineering from Tecnologico de Monterrey, Mexico and holds and MBA from UC Berkeley Haas School of Business. She was recognized as Forbes 30 Under 30 in the Energy and Immigrant categories in 2020.
Education/Personal Bio:
Maria holds a BS in Chemical Engineering (top honors) from Tecnologico de Monterrey, Mexico and an MBA from UC Berkeley, Haas School of Business. 

Maria is originally from Mexico, and currently lives in San Francisco.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability

Name: Karen Page
Investing Thesis: strong teams and founders, clear market opportunity
Professional Bio:
Karen Page is a General Partner at B Capital Group, focused on early stage investments. She is an experienced entrepreneur, investor and board member. Known and respected as a business leader, Karen worked on the Enterprise GTM team at Apple, leading the commercial channel, strategic partners, the Mobility Partner Program and the Industry team. She was one of the founding executives at Box, leading GTM activities, defining Box's approach to partnerships and business development, cultivating C-level relationships, strategic initiatives, and was the founder of Box.org. She is on the board of Plastiq, Bright.md, Centivo, Satori, Uplift and Deputy, and board observer to Kandji, Story and Percent. She is a former trustee at the Computer History Museum and The Newseum. She is an executive committee member of the Dean's Advisory Council at Johns Hopkins Carey Business School, and Thorn. Karen's angel investments include AllStripe, The Riveter, Mutiny, HarperWilde, Okay, Glamsquad and EverLoved.

She is experienced in building businesses from zero to high growth, evaluating and deploying double-digit expansion efforts, defining and implementing net-new initiatives, passionate about executing strategic partnerships and business development plans through data driven analysis, strategic prioritization, and relentless execution. Adept at public speaking, building teams and managing people to do their best work. Described by peers and leaders as an athlete, broad-based in skillsets, creative, instinctive, driven, and with a vast network of relationships that impact business outcomes.
Education/Personal Bio: Karen holds a bachelor's degree from Towson University and a MS in Advanced Behavioral Science and Organizational Development from Johns Hopkins Carey Business School. She is a member of the executive committee of the Carey Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Boston,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Hernan Fernandez
Professional Bio:
Hernan is CoFounder and Managing Partner at Angel Ventures, the first professionally managed Angel Investor Network in the country and a Venture Capital Fund manager. With over 50 investments in different industries for well over USD 100M and Operations in Mexico City, Guadalajara, Bogota, Colombia and Lima, Peru, Angel Ventures is a leader in the early stage financing space in Latin America.

Hernan holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management and a law degree from ITAM. Prior to Angel Ventures Mexico, Hernan worked as a consultant for Booz & Co. and as a corporate lawyer for pwc in Mexico and France.

Hernan also worked as a consultant for the sustainable business initiative of the United Nations Development Program in New York and Paraguay. He also did consulting for Tecnonexo, an Endeavor company in Argentina.
Education/Personal Bio: Hernan holds an MBA from the MIT Sloan School of Management and a law degree from ITAM. Prior to Angel Ventures Mexico, Hernan worked as a consultant for Booz & Co. and as a corporate lawyer for pwc in Mexico and France. Having visited over 80 countries, Hernan is always passionate about meeting friends in the most random of places, exploring new foods and cultures, and understanding the up and coming trends of the global south where he can learn and or leverage what he does in Latin America. He lives (mostly) in Mexico City and always ready to host and travel.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF | Mexico,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,London Summit 2025
Mentees Are:: Patricio Aznar Leon de la Barra,Miguel Marshall

Name: Meera Clark
Professional Bio:
Meera supports Redpoint's early-stage consumer investing efforts where she focuses on companies facilitating physical, emotional, and financial empowerment. She joined Redpoint in 2022 from Obvious Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund and B Corp where she spearheaded much of the firm's work in consumer health and wellness, freelancer enablement, and economic opportunity. 

Prior to joining Obvious, Meera invested in and advised high-growth technology companies at Morgan Stanley. Across the firm's New York and Bay Area offices, she spent time in Technology Investment Banking supporting consumer internet and software executives through both late-stage private placements and Initial Public Offerings. Meera also scaled the firm's early-stage technology accelerator, the Multicultural Innovation Lab, focused on female and multicultural entrepreneurs. 

Prior to Morgan Stanley, Meera worked in product and marketing roles at PayPal and Stella & Dot respectively, aligning with her keen interest in consumer businesses and the solutions that enable them to scale.

Beyond her investing efforts at Redpoint, Meera is an active member of All Raise and serves as a member of the Steering Committee for the organization's annual Summit. 

In 2021, Meera was recognized in Forbes‚ 30 Under 30 List for Venture Capital and Business Insider's 55 Rising-Star VCs of 2021. In 2022 she has been listed as one of Venture Forward's Women in VC: Rising Stars to Watch.
Education/Personal Bio: Meera holds a BS in Management Science and Engineering with a focus on Entrepreneurship from Stanford University and remains active as a member of the community in her role as a Board Member for Stanford Professionals in Finance and as a member of the university's Alumni Equestrian Team.

Name: Jesse Draper
Professional Bio:
Jesse Draper is a mother of 3 boys, founding partner of Halogen Ventures and focused on early stage investing in consumer technology companies led by female and co-ed teams. Draper is a Kauffman Fellow and 4th generation venture capitalist. She is a fierce advocate for investing in women and the opportunity for using technology and innovation to solve some of the biggest issues facing women and families today. Among her 70+ portfolio companies, are the Skimm, ThirdLove, HopSkipDrive, The Flex Company, Squad (acquired by Twitter), Eloquii (sold to Walmart) and This is L (sold to P&G).

Selected as one of the top 10 early stage female investors by Business Insider, Draper was also listed by Marie Claire magazine as one of the ‘50 Most Connected Women in America’. Draper has been a contributor to Marie Claire, Forbes, and is a regular investor and tech personality showcased on Cheddar, CNBC, CNN. Following Jesse’s viral Medium piece, Investing in Women Isn’t a Fucking Charity, she’s become a leading voice of women in technology.

She proudly sits on the board of directors of Flex, Trust & Will, Preemadonna (creator of the Nailbot) and the non-profit board Bizworld and Project Glimmer. Draper supports the Parkinson’s Institute and is very involved with growing UCLA’s female entrepreneurship community. She and her team also created the ‘Halogen Fellowship in Venture Capital’ to increase diversity and inclusion in the industry.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Alicia Lenis
Investing Thesis: Step chance technology for the industrial sector that drives sustainability
Professional Bio: Alicia is a Vice President at Chrysalix based in Vancouver. Chrysalix is a lead seed investor in industrial innovation, targeting first institutional cheques into companies. Chrysalix has invested as a first round investor into notable companies such as GaN Systems, Svante, MineSense and Sortera. She serves as a Board Director with Chrysalix portfolio companies Rithmik and as Board Observer with Chrysalix portfolio companies MineSense, Novamera and VerAI. She represents Chrysalix on the National Renewable Energy Lab’s (NREL) Investor Advisory Board. Alicia is a Kauffman Fellow, Class 27.
Education/Personal Bio: A long-time industrial technology enthusiast, Alicia has close to 20 years of experience working with industrial companies in both technical and management roles. Prior to Chrysalix, Alicia worked with Bain & Company in London, UK and she started her career in heavy industry as an engineer. She holds an MBA and a MS in Mechanical Engineering from MIT, where she was a Leaders of Global Operations Fellow, focused on Energy and Environment. She is also a Professional Engineer and holds a BASC in Mechanical Engineering with Distinction from the University of British Columbia in Vancouver.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Leticia Jauregui Casanueva
Professional Bio:
Recognized as one of the most powerful women in Mexico by Forbes, Leticia is a serial entrepreneur passionate about financial health, community and technology. She specializes in fintech, insurtech, blockchain and AI applications in different industries to drive innovation. As Immersive Learning Global Lead, her current role at Meta, Leticia is leading a fund dedicated to building an immersive tech ecosystem to help develop the next generation of metaverse creators, fund high quality immersive experiences that transform the way we learn, and increase access to learning through technology. Leticia is also an angel investor and General Partner of LEAP Global Partners, a cross-border fund that invests in Latinx and Latin American founders. She is actively involved in the Mexican startup and entrepreneurship ecosystem and is a member of Mujeres Invirtiendo, WeInvest LatAm and AllRaise. She has a proven track-record as an Independent Board Director of private and public companies as well as non-profit organizations in the US and Mexico, with broad expertise in digital transformation, strategy implementation, talent and governance. During the last 16+ years, Leticia has been focused on disruptive innovation and economic development in emerging markets through several companies and organizations including Crea that has supported and trained over 200,000 women entrepreneurs from marginalized communities in Mexico and Central America.
Leticia is a champion of gender equality and volunteers time to work with women entrepreneurs and to mentor women professionals. She is an avid crafter and embroiderer who spends Thursday nights at a Cantina knitting with a group of friends. She was born and raised in Mexico City and after short stints living in the US, Europe and Asia, she's settled back in Mexico City with her partner and two dogs.Leticia graduated with honors from Economics and from International Relations at ITAM, in Mexico City. She earned a M.Sc. in Community Development and a M.Sc. in Agricultural and Resource Economics from the University of California Davis. She completed the Graduate Studies Program at Singularity University, holds an Executive Certificate in European Studies from ITAM and is a Certified Community Manager, as well as an EXO Consultant.
Education/Personal Bio:
Leticia is a champion of gender equality and volunteers time to work with women entrepreneurs and to mentor women professionals. She is an avid crafter and embroiderer who spends Thursday nights at a Cantina knitting with a group of friends. She was born and raised in Mexico City and after short stints living in the US, Europe and Asia, she's settled back in Mexico City with her partner and two dogs.

Leticia graduated with honors from Economics and from International Relations at ITAM, in Mexico City. She earned a M.Sc. in Community Development and a M.Sc. in Agricultural and Resource Economics from the University of California Davis. She completed the Graduate Studies Program at Singularity University, holds an Executive Certificate in European Studies from ITAM and is a Certified Community Manager, as well as an EXO Consultant.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF | Mexico,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Joon Sung Park
Investing Thesis: Global market scalability
Professional Bio:
JOON joined Legend Capital in 2005 as Associate, and was later promoted to Vice President, Director, Executive Director and Managing Director. He is now Co-CIO of the firm and leads cross-border investments in Korea, Japan and Southeast Asia.

Joon famously led an US$6M investment in HYBE (KOSPI:352820) formerly called BigHit Entertainment, the management agency of K-pop sensation BTS boy group in early 2016, which became a US$10 Billion market cap company.  

His investment in AnyColor (Tokyo Stock Exchange Prime market: 5032) was selected as #1 Venture Capital investment return in the Japanese stock exchange market in 2022 by Nikkei, a leading financial newspaper in Japan.

Other investments include LUNIT(KOSDAQ: 328130), Zinus (KOSPI:013890), Dexter Studios (KOSDAQ:206560), Wipam (KOSDAQ:332570), C-Channel (Tokyo Pro Market:7691), L&P Cosmetics, Bespin Global, Mathpresso, Healing Paper, PPB Studio, Saige Research and Vedantu.

Before joining Legend Capital in 2005, Joon worked in Accenture Tokyo office as an Analyst.

Joon majored in Business Administration at Yonsei University in Korea and studied at University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School as an exchange student during his sophomore year. He earned his MBA from Keio University Graduate School of Business in Japan. 

He is a recipient of the Eisenhower Fellowship and Kauffman Fellows. Joon serves as Schwarzman Scholars program Industry Mentor and as advisor for TAEJAE foundation.  As a native Korean, he is fluent in Mandarin Chinese, Japanese and English.
Education/Personal Bio:
Joon majored in Business Administration at Yonsei University in Korea and studied at University of Pennsylvania, Wharton School as an exchange student during his sophomore year. He earned his MBA from Keio University Graduate School of Business in Japan.

Joon serves as Schwarzman Scholars program Industry Mentor and as advisor for TAEJAE foundation.

He enjoys swimming, golf, and traveling. As a native Korean, he is fluent in Mandarin Chinese, Japanese and English and lives in Seoul with his wife Elina and three kids.
