Name: Sara Rywe
Investing Thesis: Early-stage tech companies across the New Nordics
Professional Bio:
Sara is a Partner at byFounders where she focuses on B2B SaaS and impact investments - particularly companies within future of work, sustainability, FinTech, and health. She actively seeks out visionary founders who are building product-led companies and is also the mastermind behind the byFounders 'impact-aware strategy'. 

Sara has led investments in Digitail, Qvin, Proper, Fuzey, Aumio, SaltoX, Bonbot, and Semper. She is also an appreciated board member in Greenely, Digitail, Qvin, Proper, Fuzey, and Aumio.

Prior to byFounders, Sara worked at a couple of different tech startups, as a management consultant at McKinsey & Company, and at Danske Bank where she led their global strategy implementation.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sara is originally from the Swedish countryside but has lived in Copenhagen, Denmark for the past five years. She holds an MBA from INSEAD and Wharton Business School, a Bachelor in Business & Economics from Stockholm School of Economics, and a certificate in International Business from State University of New York.

An entrepreneur at heart, she embarked on her first venture as a 17-year-old and has since then been supporting entrepreneurs across a range of initiatives, explored social business models in Bangladesh, and founded one of Sweden's largest networks for young entrepreneurs. She is also an experienced public speaker, food-lover, and proud adventurer.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Matt Auxier
Professional Bio: Matt is a senior portfolio manager for the university's private equity investments, focusing primarily on venture capital. He examines investments across asset classes and researches new investment opportunities. Since joining the Office of Investments in 2012, he has also served as an operations analyst and senior portfolio analyst. Before joining the University, he worked at LaSalle Bank, Bank of America, and US Bank.
Education/Personal Bio: Matt earned a BSBA from Saint Louis University with a concentration in finance and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. He is a CFA Charterholder. He is a Chicago native, where he lives with his wife and son.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | LPs,London Summit 2025

Name: Ebony Brown
Professional Bio:
Ebony is a Partner at Rethink Education, a venture capital firm focused on education technology. Brown, who joined Rethink Education in February 2019, has been a vital part of the team, pioneering Rethink Equity, a $5mm carveout to invest in underrepresented people of color, optimizing portfolio support during the pandemic by connecting CEOs to customers at scale, and unlocking new networks to improve deal flow. Brown is also a Board Director of Rethink Education portfolio companies AllHere and Anthill AI. Outside of her work at Rethink Education, Brown helped form the Mosaic Fellowship Program at Impact Capital Managers as a co-lead of their working Group on Talent & Diversity.

Before joining Rethink Education, she was the Director of US Ventures at Village Capital, where she was responsible for finding and supporting US start-ups for the fund’s five sectors. While in business school, Ebony was Education Director for Social Venture Fund. Previously, Ebony spent time in her hometown of Detroit, managing charter schools at New Urban Learning and began her career as an Account Strategist at Google. Ebony holds an MBA from the University of Michigan’s Ross School of Business and a B.B.A in Finance from Howard University.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ebony holds an MBA from the University of Michigan's Ross School of Business and a B.B.A in Finance from Howard University. She co-leads the Talent & Diversity group for Impact Capital Managers and helped to design and launch the Mosaic Fellowship to build a pipeline of diverse, skilled talent in the alternative investment industry.

She made a pandemic move from Brooklyn to Atlanta with her husband Joe, where they recently bought their first house. She enjoys swimming, baking, and exploring the rich food and culture of new places.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Allan Boruchowicz
Investing Thesis: Invest in the most outstanding entrepreneurs and early-stage companies from Spanish-speaking LatAm, prioritizing on those from the small and medium sized markets (underserved by VC)
Professional Bio:
Allan is Founder & Managing Partner at Carao Ventures. He founded the firm in 2012 aiming to offer top entrepreneurs from the small and medium markets in Latin America the same resources and opportunities to which entrepreneurs in more developed markets have access. He invests in startups that are challenging the laggard status quo of most markets and industries in Latin America.

Over the last 10 years, Allan has led investments for the firm in over 2 dozen early-stage startups from 10 different countries in the region and operating in a variety of sectors including biotech, healthtech, fintech, enterprise SaaS, insurtech, construction tech, AI, medtech, and virtual restaurants, among other. 

Allan currently serves of the board of directors of many Carao Ventures' portfolio companies as well as other relevant companies and organizations in Central America. He is also a founding member of the Central American Fintech Association and the Costa Rican Biotechnology and Medical Device Cluster. 

Before founding Carao Ventures, Allan worked at Mesoamerica Investments, a strategy consulting and private equity firm in Latin America, and at UBS Wealth Management US.
Education/Personal Bio: Allan holds a B.Sc. degree in Business Management with concentration in Finance and Economics from Babson College. He lives in San Jos√©, Costa Rica with his family after living in Bogota, Boston and Barcelona for work and studies over the last 20 years. Allan loves soccer, basketball and golf, and is an unconditional fan of Juventus and the Miami Heat.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Ita Ekpoudom
Investing Thesis: We invest in female founders and gender diverse teams and funds
Professional Bio:
Ita is a Partner at venture capital firm GingerBread Capital, which backs high growth female founded companies. Her mission is to engage, educate, and elevate the next generation of successful women business leaders and investors. In 2014, Ita founded Tigress Ventures, an advisory and consulting firm that tapped her considerable network to bring together visionary entrepreneurs with seasoned professionals to help women scale their businesses and hone their leadership skills. 

Ita also served as Venture Partner at Plum Alley Investments, where she oversaw investment opportunities and pipeline for high-growth female-founded and gender-diverse startups. Previously, Ita held product management roles at TravelClick and American Express. She began her career at Goldman Sachs as an analyst in Credit Capital Markets and an institutional trader of preferred stock.

Ita holds an MBA in Marketing and Entrepreneurial Management from The Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania; and earned a Bachelor's degree, cum laude, in Psychology, with a certificate in Finance, from Princeton University.
Education/Personal Bio: I was born in Nigeria and moved to the U.S. when I was 5 years old. I grew up from 3rd grade until the end of high school in Yorktown, Virginia. I attended Princeton University for undergrad and Wharton for my MBA.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Mario Ruiz
Investing Thesis: Investing globally in B2B fintech and commerce
Professional Bio:
Mario started his first company in middle school, an online sneaker reselling business (before StockX and GOAT), and sold over 1K pairs of sneakers in 7 years, paying for his entire college education from the profits. He learned a lot about the antiquated commerce process through this experience including payments, fulfillment/logistics, and customer support. His entrepreneurial mindset makes him an ideal investor, helping founders navigate challenges and develop their businesses.

Previously, Mario was a venture investor at PayPal Ventures and Dorm Room Fund, and a growth equity investor at Napier Park Global Capital. Mario started his career as an investment banking Analyst and Associate at Barclays in New York. Mario is currently part of Class 27 of the Kauffman Fellows program.

Alongside his investment work, Mario is a vocal supporter and proponent of diversity, equity & inclusion within venture capital and entrepreneurship. While at PayPal, he conceptualized and led PayPal’s fund investments into 19 underrepresented fund managers and co-founded Dorm Room Fund’s Blueprint Track to support aspiring BIPOC founders and investors.

Born and raised in the Bronx, NY, Mario received his BBA from Baruch College and his MBA from the Yale School of Management. When he’s not working, he’s searching for the best coffee shops to read books (but doesn’t drink coffee) and lurking on Discord channels.
Education/Personal Bio:
Alongside his investment work, Mario is a vocal supporter and proponent of diversity, equity & inclusion within venture capital and entrepreneurship. While at PayPal, he conceptualized and led PayPal's fund investments into 19 underrepresented fund managers and co-founded Dorm Room Fund's Blueprint Track to support aspiring BIPOC founders and investors. Mario is the former co-chair of the Junior Leadership Board for the Sponsors for Educational Opportunity (SEO), which helps further the mission of the SEO Scholars educational program while also developing professionals into future non-profit board leaders. He is an alumnus of SEO's Career and Alternative Investments Fellowship Programs.

Mario received his Bachelor of Business Administration from Baruch College and his Master of Business Administration from the Yale School of Management. The Bronx, NY native currently resides in Connecticut with his wife.

Name: Lomax Ward
Professional Bio:
Lomax is General Partner at Outsized Ventures, a European focussed deep tech fund. Prior to that, he co-founded Luminous Ventures, investing at the intersection of deep tech and health. He is also an active angel investor and LP. 

Before his venture career, Lomax was investment principal and general counsel at White Cloud Capital, where he focussed on growth equity investments in healthcare services in European and Asia. Lomax started his career as a corporate lawyer at Slaughter and May in London, also working in Milan and Tokyo. 

Lomax co-founded ALLOCATE, an event and active community geared around helping the venture ecosystem for emerging venture managers in Europe.
Education/Personal Bio:
Lomax graduated from the University of Cambridge with a degree in Classics. He subsequently graduated from law school in London. Then he gave up law and started life proper as an investor and venture capitalist. 

Lomax has lived in Botswana, France, London, Milan and Tokyo. He now lives in Lisbon with his family.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Patrick Arippol
Investing Thesis: Alexia Ventures is the early-stage investor of choice for transformative software and A.I. technology companies emerging from Latin America.  Its main ambition is to constantly strive to be among the highest value-add investors, at a global level.  Alexia Ventures gathers a network of founders and thought leaders who've worked together over the past 20 years, helping founders to create category leaders while taking the investor-founder relationship to new levels.
Professional Bio: Before co-founding Alexia Ventures in 2020, Patrick started and ran VC's and technology companies in both Brazil and Silicon Valley, in B2B software and AI.  He co-founded LatAm's healthtech PlanetaVida [Tivit] (1999), fintech Prosper Services (2004) and SaaS VC Delphis Capital (2007).  He also worked at Monitor Company, Level8 [Nasdaq, 1995], Banter A.I. [IBM, 2005].  He headed one of the pioneer Brazil VC's from 2010-2019, where he held boards at RD Station, Mosyle, ReclameAqui, Solides, and 9 other category leaders.  At Alexia Ventures, he and his team focus on SaaS, A.I./big-data, and core technology companies. Patrick holds an engineering degree from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from Stanford.
Education/Personal Bio: Patrick holds a BSE from the University of Pennsylvania and an MBA from the Stanford GSB.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | AI,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Michael Fanfant
Investing Thesis: Investing into deep tech, the future of computing, and AI disrupting the worlds largest indistries
Professional Bio: Michael is a General Partner at Runa Capital, a $135M early stage VC firm that invests in B2B SaaS, deep tech, and fintech in the US and Europe. He primarily focuses on fintech, and B2B SaaS startups in the US. Prior to joining Runa, Michael was co-founded Octane Lending, a $1B+ point-of-sale financing company for passion purchases, where he was responsible for the overall GTM strategy and customer acquisition. He continues to serve on Octane Lending’s Board of Directors.
Education/Personal Bio: Michael graduated from Stanford University with a B.A. in Economics and is originally from Seattle, WA. Outside of work, he also serves as the Events & Community Chair at BLCK VC, where he leads a team that creates in-person and online programming to further increase the diversity of venture investors.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Mary D'Onofrio
Professional Bio:
Mary is a partner and co-founder of the growth investment practice at Bessemer Venture Partners, where she primarily focuses on cloud software investments. She serves as a board member or observer for Teleport, Netlify, Imply Data, Hyperscience, BigID, GetInsured, and Contractbook, and she also works closely with Bessemer portfolio companies Forter, LaunchDarkly, and Zapier.

Mary is a co-author of Bessemer's Scaling to $100 Million report and the 10 Laws of Cloud, and she is a key architect of the BVP Nasdaq Emerging Cloud Index, which serves as the benchmark for public cloud companies. She also developed Bessemer's Cash Conversion Score and authors the annual Cloud 100 Benchmarks Reports. Mary was named to the 2021 Forbes 30 Under 30 List in Venture Capital.

Prior to Bessemer, Mary worked in Equity Capital Markets at Morgan Stanley and held roles at Apple and at the U.S. Department of the Treasury.
Education/Personal Bio: Mary graduated with honors with an A.B. in Politics from Princeton University and holds an MBA from the Yale School of Management, where she now sits on the Board of the International Center for Finance. In her free time, Mary enjoys cheering for the 49ers, listening to country music, and spending time with her husband, Kyle.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Noa Maiz
Investing Thesis: Investing at the frontiers of technology and backing the best technical founders
Professional Bio:
Ainhoa "Noa" Maiz is a Senior Principal at S32 where she focuses on early-stage investments in enterprise technologies, cybersecurity and fintech. Drawn to the dynamism of the startup ecosystem, Ainhoa is passionate about company-building and loves partnering with founders to commercialize and scale new technologies.

S32 is a venture fund with a mission to accelerate the discovery, development and distribution of revolutionary technologies that improve the human condition. Founded by Bill Maris in 2017, the fund invests at the frontiers of technology and healthcare broadly. Prior to S32, Ainhoa was at M12 (Microsoft's venture fund) where she contributed to over thirty technology investments globally, of which several have gone on to become unicorns. Ainhoa started her career with five years as an operator, working in Corporate Finance and supporting engineering teams at Intel Corporation. In her tenure there, she held several roles of increasing responsibility and oversaw valuation, reporting and forecasting for nearly $1B of working capital.
Education/Personal Bio: Ainhoa earned an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and BAs in Economics and Political Science from Emory University. She also spent a year studying at the London School of Economics. Basque by ethnicity, she grew up playing in the Oregon pine tree forests and makes frequent visits to see family in San Sebastian, Spain.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Amal Dokhan
Investing Thesis: Early stage, technology at core in MENA region
Professional Bio:
Amal is a seasoned professional with experience in startup investments, corporate innovation, and consulting in the MENA region. Previous to joining
500 Global, Ms. Dokhan was the Managing Director of Babson Global for Entrepreneurial Leadership. Previously, she was the Manager of Learning
and Design at the Entrepreneurship Center at King Abdullah University of
Science and Technology where she led the New Ventures Acceleration and
Corporate Innovation programs. Prior to that engagement she worked in the KAUST Seed Fund developing marketing and events, while also providing a
range of services to startup.
Ms. Dokhan sits on the board of Venture Capital and private equity association in saudi.
Education/Personal Bio: Amal holds a BA in Education management and a Masters degree in Strategic marketing from Wollongong Univeristy. Amal have done multiple executive diplomas and certification programs including a certificate in Innovation, Entreprenurship and Technology from MIT SLOAN and completed the REAP program a two year program in MIT sloan. She also attended the corporate innovation program at the design school in Stanford and completed a summer course of startup law with UC Berkeley.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Judah Taub
Investing Thesis: Hetz Ventures takes a thematic approach of investing early in distinct sectors within the Israeli tech ecosystem: AI and data infrastructure, enterprise/data software and Cybersecurity. We have deliberately focused on these sectors as we have identified them as areas where we can provide the most value through expertise and experience. Moreover, Hetz’s extensive, curated industry database and analysis has shown that these markets are primed for long-term growth and development.
Professional Bio: Judah Taub is the founder and managing partner of Hetz Ventures, one of Israel’s leading early-stage venture capital firms. He is an alumnus of the IDF’s “Sayeret Matkal” commando unit and was an officer in the elite 8-1 technology unit. At the age of 17 Judah Taub invented a round Sudoku puzzle which he subsequently sold to Israel Hayom, Israel's most read newspaper. At 23 he was awarded the IDF’s top Creative Thinking award for developing a new form of intelligence gathering. During the first few months of COVID, Judah led a team which within 4 weeks developed a new ventilator made entirely from generic components which could ventilate 8 adults in parallel. Judah has lectured at Wharton, Yale, HBS and to the IDF and wrote a book for new IDF soldiers published by Yediot, Israel’s leading publisher. He was elected as one of Forbes 30 Under 30 for 2020. He holds a B.A. degree in business and economics from the Interdisciplinary College in Herzliya, Israel, an exchange program with Wharton and Executive Leadership Qualification from Harvard Business School (PLD). Judah is the author of the book How to Move Up When the Only Way is Down: Lessons from Artificial Intelligence for Overcoming Your Local Maximum, being published in October 2024.
Education/Personal Bio:
Judah was born in London, England, and moved to Israel at age 1. He served in an Elite Intelligence Unit of the IDF. He studied business and economics at the Interdisciplinary College in Herzliya, Israel where he graduated summa cum laude and on a selective exchange program at Wharton Business School. At the age of 16 Judah invented a Round Sudoku and sold it to Israel's largest newspaper "Israel Today"

As an active member of the Israeli tech community, Judah volunteers at Tech Career, an educational NGO providing Ethiopian-Israelis the opportunity to integrate into Israel's high tech industry. 

Judah is a father of 4 based in Jerusalem, Israel, and is an avid reader, especially in the sciences. For fun Judah enjoys deep sea diving and other extreme sports.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Dario Villena
Professional Bio:
Darío Villena is the investment director of has more than eight years of experience in product and venture capital. He is an expert in deeptech and has collaborated with international organizations such as the European Commission in the field of the internet of things (IOT).

He has worked in some of the top funds in the world like Seedstars or Giza, he is currently managing Kapita a retail vertical fund in Europe and Latam.

He has worked throughout his career in deeptech. Technology evaluator in Hello Tomorrow, South Summit and Shenzhen Global Competition. He is the author of reports on the state of innovation and entrepreneurship ecosystems and professor of Information Systems in IE business school.
Education/Personal Bio: Graduate of Autonomous University of Barcelona. Nanodegree in Fog networking and Internet of things in Princeton. Executive education in the IE business school.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Alexander Chee
Investing Thesis: We harness state-of-the-art AI and data science, to invest with precision into persistent outliers.
Professional Bio: Founding member of Tribe Capital
Education/Personal Bio: Alex is on an indefinite leave of absence from Stanford University
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,London Summit 2025

Name: Jonathan Bradford
Professional Bio: Founding Partner of Dynamo Ventures
Education/Personal Bio: Jon is a graduate of Bristol University with a BSc (Hons) in Economics and Accountancy.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Dan Kimerling
Professional Bio:
Dan Kimerling is the founder of Deciens, a venture capital firm that supports early-stage financial services. He is passionate about leading investments in transformative companies at the seed stage. 



Prior to starting Deciens, Kimerling was co-founder and CEO of Standard Treasury, a YCombinator company that built leading API solutions for the financial services community and which was acquired by Silicon Valley Bank. He previously served as a journalist and analyst at TechCrunch, where he helped launch their conference business.
Education/Personal Bio:
He graduated from the University of Chicago with a BA and MA (both with honors), and studied mathematical (analytic) finance at the University of Chicago Booth School of business for a year as a Booth Scholar.

Outside of his work at Deciens, he is a co-founder of Gutenberg Capital, a Real Estate investment company based in Albuquerque, NM. He lives with his wife and their dogs in Chicago and Albuquerque.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Sandeep Bakshi
Investing Thesis: High growth
Professional Bio:
Sandeep Bakshi is the head of European Investments for Prosus Ventures where he is responsible for sourcing and executing transactions and building out the Prosus Ventures portfolio in the region. Prior to his current role, he was a director in the Prosus and Naspers group M&A team responsible for large M&A and growth equity transactions across the group. He started his career at Citigroup in New York
Sandeep is a graduate of Rutgers University. Outside of his professional pursuits, Sandeep is an avid basketball player
Education/Personal Bio: Sandeep is a graduate of Rutgers University. Outside of his professional pursuits, Sandeep is an avid basketball player
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,London Summit 2025

Name: Muneeb Syed
Professional Bio: Muneeb Syed is a Portfolio Manager for the W.K. Kellogg Foundation Investment Office (KFIO), the team responsible for strategically investing the diversified portfolio to maintain its purchasing power in support of W.K. Kellogg Foundation's mission over the long term. He is a member of the Private Investments team, where his primary responsibilities is to source, diligence, monitor, and invest in managers across the venture capital, growth equity and private equity portfolio.
Education/Personal Bio: Muneeb received his MBA from Kellogg School of Management, and his BA from New York University. He holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation from the CFA Institute and is a member of the CFA Society of San Francisco. Muneeb was born in Pakistan, raised in New York, and now lives in San Jose, California with his wife. Muneeb is an diehard sports fan, especially of his frequently struggling New York teams.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI

Name: Michael Soerijadji
Professional Bio:
Michael is an experienced energy entrepreneur and seasoned investor, based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at investment firm AC Ventures, which has made over 100 investments across early stage/ growth companies in South East Asia with an AUM of over $500 million. 

Michael started his career as a management consultant with Kearney and has over 15 years of experience building businesses in the mining, renewable energy and climate sector at Adimitra.
Education/Personal Bio: Michael graduated with honors from the University of Southern California with a bachelor’s degree in business administration. Michael is also a Kauffman Fellow and currently attending OPM at Harvard Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia

Name: Han Shen
Investing Thesis: Tech enabled transformation of the US consumer experiences
Professional Bio:
Based in Austin, TX, iFly.vc empowers exceptional founders to transform the trillion-dollar shift in consumer experiences across North America. We are passionate about merging technology enablement with market insights to provide consumers with exciting products and services. Research-led and conviction-driven, our practice has constructed a concentrated portfolio with meaningful ownership and dedicated value add. As of 9/30/25, Fund I achieved a net TVPI of 4x and a DPI of 1x. Two affiliated portfolio SPVs recorded net TVPIs/DPI of 23x/1x and 5x/1x, respectively. 

iFly.vc was founded by Han Shen, who had 16+ years of successful venture career with a track record of Oculus (acquired by Facebook), Fyusion (Cox), Motive Drilling (Helmerich & Payne), AlertMe (British Gas), Lexent Bio (Foundation Medicine), etc. Han has served on the board of multiple fast-growing companies such as Weee! and UMe Tea.

Weee!, the biggest ethnic e-grocery in the US, was turned down by all other investors when the company attempted to raise an equity round in late 2018. iFly.vc doubled down on Weee! and helped the company become a category leader. As Weee! became a unicorn, iFly.vc remains the second-largest shareholder. iFly.vc’s other representative portfolio companies include UMe Tea (a popular bubble tea chain with 27+ locations and growing), ChefUs (a next-generation Asian restaurant chain concept), Shopvidi (a B2B e-commerce platform for retailers in underserved communities), and Twirlista (a social marketing platform, by Gen Z, and for Gen Z).  

Han earned his bachelor’s degree from Nanjing University, a Ph.D. from the University of Chicago, and an MBA from The Wharton School of The University of Pennsylvania. In addition, Han is a Kauffman Fellow, holds a private pilot license issued by the US FAA, and was the Dignitary Champion of the International Cherry Pit Spitting Competition in 2002.
Education/Personal Bio: Ph.D. UChicago, MBA Wharton, BS Nanjing University
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Central - US,KF | Texas,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Sasha McKenzie
Investing Thesis: We believe the next billion and multi billion dollar outcomes are going to come from founders who’ve been historically overlooked. We focus on seed and series a rounds of companies building in B2B SaSS, Fintech, consumer and health.
Professional Bio:
Sasha McKenzie is Deal Principal at Wellington Management where she will be focused on investing in Seed through Series B+ opportunities from founders who have been historically excluded from access to capital, as well as emerging fund managers. 

Prior to joining Wellington, Sasha helped launch a venture capital firm, H Venture Partners. While at H Venture Partners, Sasha invested in science-based consumer brands, consumer technology and digital health companies working on or leading approximately 10 investments including Cerebelly, Felix Health, Parsley Health, Avaline, Prima and Hazel. 

Previously, Sasha was an investment banker at Bank of America in the Global Consumer & Retail group where she executed mergers and acquisitions, initial public offerings and debt financings for Fortune 500 companies. She also was a consultant for RR Donnelley helping enterprise clients optimize their supply chains and logistics.
Education/Personal Bio: Sasha earned her M.B.A. from Columbia Business School and a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration the Ohio State University. She is a member of Black VC, Black Women in VC and AllRaise and is deeply passionate about diversity in tech as well as the broader venture capital community.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Boston,KF | Central - US,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Zoe Chambers
Professional Bio:
Zoe is a Partner in Frontline having joined the firm in 2021.

Prior to Frontline Zoe worked as an early-stage investor and principal at Octopus Ventures where she led their deeptech investment team. During her tenure with Octopus , she made 14 investments with a leaning towards climate-focused and deeptech startups. During her career in VC 50% of Zoe’s investments have been in female-led businesses and she remains committed to over-indexing on founders who have been traditionally overlooked.

Zoe is a qualified lawyer having studied at University College London. She has eight years of experience with Jones Day as a corporate lawyer. During the early part of her career, she also worked at Goldman Sachs in the Special Situations Group.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Lucanus Polagnoli
Investing Thesis: We invest in European founders building digital health solutions (software only) in Europe, UK, Israel and North America.
Professional Bio: Lucanus is Europe’s most active early-stage healthtech investor. Investing in digital health solutions for over a decade, his new firm, Calm/Storm, invested in two out of the Top 5 fastest growing HealthTech companies in Europe: Nelly & Lindus. As a former financial consultant and private equity fund manager, he switched sides to become an early-stage startup operator before he became a partner of Speedinvest in 2014. After leading the health team there, Lucanus founded Calm/Storm in early 2020, which became one of the most prominent vertical-focused venture capital firms in Europe. Lucanus has a passion for digital solutions that improve our health and well-being.
Education/Personal Bio:
Lucanus holds a Master's degree in International Business Administration from the Vienna University of Economics and Business Administration ("WU") as well as a Master of International Management from Bocconi University in Milan (CEMS). 

In his free time, you'll find him spending time with his wife and three children in Vienna (Austria), the most livable city in the world. He enjoys racing sailing boats at Lake Attersee (his home turf) in the beautiful "Sound Of Music Land"
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Ashley Mayer
Investing Thesis: We're an operator-led firm that backs early stage startups in categories where we've built companies.
Professional Bio:
Ashley Mayer is a startup comms pro turned investor. She’s a co-founder and GP of Coalition Operators, where she backs early stage companies shaping the future of work, commerce and climate. Ashley is also on the Operating Council of Mixing Board, a collective of top comms and brand leaders, and the board at Climate Draft, an effort to mobilize talent and resources for the climate tech category.

Ashley’s first startup job was at Box, where she led communications for six years, from 50-person team through IPO, and desperately tried to make enterprise software sexy. She then joined venture capital firm Social Capital, where she led comms and marketing, helping founders tell their stories, and launching new capital products. She then entered the world of beauty, essentially the opposite of enterprise software, and was VP of Comms at Glossier for three years.
Education/Personal Bio: Ashley holds a BA from Georgetown in Government and English. She lives in Brooklyn.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,London Summit 2025

Name: Gita Sjahrir
Professional Bio: Gita Sjahrir is a serial entrepreneur for the last 12 years, and is currently a full time gender-lens investor and mentor in the Southeast Asian startup ecosystem. Currently, she holds board positions in various tech and energy companies, including EMP, a publicly-listed Indonesian oil and gas company. Previously, she held positions in finance and business development in the renewable energy space, including at AES Transpower. She is a board member for the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industries' (KADIN) Gender Equity Panel, and is on The Indonesian Ministry of Maritime and Investment Affairs' Carbon Market and Energy Transition Mechanism task force.

Name: David Guérin
Investing Thesis: The Brighteye team invests in Seed and Series A stage companies across Europe. The fund invests in founders with strong international ambition and who are building solutions that help train (learn new skills), place (find work) and empower (learning & productivity) people.
Professional Bio:
David is a Partner at Brighteye, a European Learning/Future of Work specialist VC fund that invests at Seed and Series A stages. Since joining the firm in 2018, he has been involved in 45+ investments across 10 countries and has worked at both offices in Paris and London. He moved back to France from the UK to develop the Parisian office.

Prior to joining Brighteye, David spent 6 years in Mexico, where he led the marketing efforts of a social impact healthcare startup (Salauno), and as a management consultant at EY, working with clients across LATAM.
Education/Personal Bio: David received a Masters in International Business, with Distinction, from Grenoble Ecole de Management. He has lived in 5 countries and speaks French, English and Spanish.

Professional Bio:
Roi Bar-Kat is the Israel Country Manager and Managing Director located in Israel. He joined Intel Capital in 2019.

In his role, Roi is responsible for managing Intel Capital's investment-related activity in Israel. Roi is primarily focused on investing in early-stage opportunities across multiple technology domains and market verticals including data platforms, cyber security, mobility and more.

Roi currently serves as a director or observer on the board of DustPhotonics,  EasySend, Lightbits, Neuroblade, Nexite, Umbrella, WSC and Xsight.

Prior to Intel Capital, Roi worked at the US-based fund, Liberty Technology VC (funded by Liberty Media) and was a Principal at Genesis Partners and VP at Incentive-Peregrine VC. 

Roi loves to cook, bike, play the bass guitar and spend "off-screen" time with his wife and three kids (less so when losing to them in board games).
Education/Personal Bio: Roi earned his MBA from the Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, and a BA in Economics from Haifa University. Roi graduated high school in Toronto, Canada.

Name: Brett Morris
Professional Bio:
Brett is a Managing Director at Cavallo Ventures, the corporate venture capital arm of Wilbur-Ellis, a $3.5B privately-owned business. He helps lead investments across agriculture, food, and climate, and serves as a Board Director or Observer to several startups.

Prior to Cavallo, Brett worked for TechAccel, a venture development organization where he led or was involved with several early-stage investments such as Sound Agriculture, Greenlight Bio (GRNA), and Benson Hill (BHIL). Additionally, Brett helped incubate and run two companies including Covenant Animal Health Partners (interest acquired by NovaQuest Capital Management) and RNAissance Ag, an Ag biotech startup developing environmentally friendly alternatives to chemical pesticides.

Previously, Brett worked in M&A and corporate strategy for a commodity trading and handling company dealing in agriculture and energy products and held various financial roles at other firms.
Education/Personal Bio:
Brett graduated from The University of Kansas and is a CFA Charterholder. Prior to KU, Brett attended Drake University where he played for the men's varsity basketball team.

Brett serves on the Emerging Leaders Council for the Boys & Girls Club of Greater KC and on the advisory board for the Blue Valley Center for Advanced Professional Studies. He provides mentorship to various accelerator programs and was recognized as one of the Kansas City Business Journal's NextGen Leaders in 2019. 

Brett lives in the Kansas City metro area with his wife and three children. He enjoys working out, coaching his kids' sports teams, and reading about carbon removal and human longevity technologies.

He has led investments in over 10 venture capital funds across Africa and South Asia. He has also made direct investments in several early stage companies including TeamApt, mPharma and TradeDepot. Ross is passionate about the potential of entrepreneurship and innovation to create more productive, inclusive and sustainable societies. He has over a decade of experience in emerging markets investing, ranging from seed stage venture capital to large cap M&A and IPOs. Prior to BII, Ross worked with Citigroup’s Investment Banking division in Toronto and London where he was involved in a wide range of capital markets and M&A transactions.

Infrastructure (DevOps, developer first, data infrastructure, commerce infrastructure, b2b infrastructure, etc.) and vertical software, specifically in digital health, fintech, proptech (with some interest in sustainability through the lens of proptech as an emerging category of interest.)

Gyan became co-Managing Partner of Surface Ventures dedicated to investing in seed and pre-seed stage companies, later in 2020.

Prior to joining Surface Ventures, Gyan ran Bayes Ventures, an early stage fund with a similar focus. Prior to Bayes Ventures, Gyan was a Vice President at Activate Venture Partners (first investor in Medidata, a $6bb exit) and an active angel investor.

Name: Alexandria Lafci
Investing Thesis: Hometeam Ventures invests in early stage technology serving the construction industry.
Professional Bio:
Alexandria is the founder and Managing Parter of Hometeam Ventures, a remote-first seed fund focused on companies reshaping the built environment. Alexandria believes that construction innovation is a prerequisite for solving the global housing crisis and is on a mission to find founders working to support construction's long overdue digital revolution.

She has been investing personal and scout capital since 2015 in companies like ICON, Impossible Foods, Kepler Computing, Lugg, and more.

Prior to investing full time, Alexandria spent 7 years as co-founder and COO of New Story, a non-profit focused on solutions to end global homelessness. She led a team that raised over $70M and built over 3500 homes across Latin America, including the world's first 3D printed community of homes. New Story was part of Y Combinator's S15 batch.

Before entrepreneurship, Alexandria worked in supply-chain at McMaster Carr and as a Teach for America educator, teaching sixth graders in SE Washington, DC.
Education/Personal Bio:
Alexandria graduated from Boston University with a B.A in International Relations. During TFA, she earned her M.ED from George Mason University. She is a member of the National Renewable Energy Lab's Technical Review Board and still advises New Story's executive team.

She lives in San Francisco with her husband and is the proud legal guardian of her little sister. Alexandria loves travel, board games,

Professional Bio:
Tomer is a GP at ETF Partners, a London-based VC investing in sustainability. At ETF, Tomer focuses on the intelligence layer of modern infrastructure. Tomer is passionate about working with ‘impact native’ and purpose-driven founders who are building the next generation of climate-positive companies. Tomer has led ETF's investments in Modern Milkman, Net Purpose, Zeelo, Next Sense, and Tomorrow.




Prior to joining ETF Partners Tomer trained as a lawyer at the VC and M&A practice of Shibolet&Co, one of the largest law firms in Israel.

Name: Julia Klein
Professional Bio:
Julia Klein is a Partner at March Capital, where she focuses on investments in Data Infrastructure, Ecommerce Enablement, and Enterprise AI. She serves on the board of Morty and works with March investments Acceldata, Action IQ, ASAPP, DISQO, Generate Biomedicines, Immuta, KnowBe4, ShipRocket, Tessera, and ThoughtSpot.



Julia brings experience as an investor and an entrepreneur to the firm. At Greenspring Associates (now StepStone Group), she invested in growth stage consumer and enterprise deals, including The RealReal, MoneyLion, Elastic, and Everfi. She also deployed capital into both seed stage directs, working as a Fellow at Pear VC, and seed stage funds, leading diligence for Greenspring's emerging manager focused fund.



Prior to Greenspring, Julia co-founded CareerPeer, a startup focused on utilizing technology to better match students and employers. She began her career at Deloitte Consulting, where she specialized in consumer and industrial products
Education/Personal Bio:
Julia is passionate about empowering women in entrepreneurship and venture capital through her work with Girls Who Invest. She has served on the executive board of Harvard Business School's Women in Investing organization and co-chaired the Female Entrepreneur Program at The Montgomery Summit in 2021.

In her free time, Julia loves hiking, running, soccer and all things outdoors. You can find her passionately cheering for the Steelers and Penguins, discussing a novel during book club, or exploring the world and her own California backyard.

Julia received her MBA from Harvard Business School where she was a Baker Scholar. She graduated summa cum laude from the University of Maryland, College Park with a B.S. in Finance and a B.A. in Economics.

Erica has been an active investor in early-stage companies for over 18 years. Before launching Reign, she was Founding Partner of 1000 Angels, Managing Director at DreamIt Ventures and Executive Director at both STAR Angel Network and Golden Seeds. Prior to beginning a career in venture, she practiced Investment Banking at Citigroup, Credit Suisse and Cantor Fitzgerald.

Name: Wes Panek
Professional Bio: Wes Panek is the first hire at Screendoor Partners, a fund of funds started by GPs from Homebrew, Forerunner, Precursor Ventures and others that backs underrepresented, emerging fund managers in venture capital. Wes focuses on sourcing, diligence, portfolio support, and operators and has a strong belief in the returns potential and social benefit of backing new fund managers that haven't had access to supporting capital and networks.
Education/Personal Bio: Wes previously worked as a VC at New Media Ventures, and as a strategy consultant for private, public, and nonprofit organizations at Monitor Deloitte Consulting and The Global Development Incubator. He comes from a family of Maori immigrants and loves basketball and jazz music.

Name: Akbar Poonawala
Investing Thesis: Pivot is a dedicated FinTech and InsurTech investment firm specializing in transformative B2B FinTech companies across the US, Canada, and the UK. We focus on early growth-stage investments, ideally in companies with double-digit million ARR.
Professional Bio:
Akbar Poonawala is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Pivot Investment Partners. 

He serves on the boards of Cape Analytics, Droit Financial Technologies, Cowbell Cyber, Snapsheet, OpenFin, Earnest Research, OneVest (Canada), and Jubilee Holdings (Kenya); having previously served on the Boards of Bold Penguin, dv01, and DCB Bank (India). 

Akbar was formerly MD and the Head of the Americas of Deutsche Bank Global Transaction Banking leading the growth of this business to over $1 billion of revenues in Cash Management, Trade Finance, and Trust & Securities Services targeting both Corporate and Financial Institutions clients throughout the Americas. Previously, he built the Global Equity Services business, which included Depositary Receipts, Registrar, and Post-IPO Services, into a market-leading business across ten international locations with a more than five-fold increase in revenues and over 900 Corporate and Financial Institutions clients. 

Akbar was also a member of the Deutsche Bank Americas Regional Executive Committee, the GTB Global Executive Committee, and the DB Americas Diversity Committee. Akbar also served on the Board of Directors of Deutsche Bank Americas Foundation. 

Akbar currently sits on the Investment Banking Advisory Board of Rosenblatt Securities.
Akbar is a Chartered Financial Analyst and graduated Beta Gamma Sigma with an MBA in Finance from New York University�s Stern School of Business, and in the top 1% of his class with a Master of Business Administration in Marketing and an undergraduate degree in Advanced Accounting from Poona University in India.

Outside of his role at Pivot, Akbar serves as the Chairman of the Aga Khan Economic Planning Board for the United States, Chairman of the American Ismaili Chamber of Commerce Board since July 2015.
Education/Personal Bio: CFA, MBA, B.Com.

Professional Bio:
Antonio Key is an early-stage tech investor based in San Francisco. He serves as the Managing Director of Blueprint FTC and is a founding Partner of Sunset Ventures. 

Prior to Blueprint FTC and Sunset, Antonio was the Director of Investments at Samsung Next, Samsung’s early-stage venture fund (Seed & Series A) focused on software and services. In an earlier role at Samsung Next, he led corporate development for the team that drove Partnerships and M&A specific to Ad tech, IoT, Digital Health, and Fintech. Before Samsung, Antonio was an M&A investment banker at Bank of America Merrill Lynch in NYC, with a focus on technology companies. 

Earlier in Antonio’s career, he was the co-founder of the startup K.O.T. Marketing Group—a leading LA event marketing company for millennial tastemakers—and built it into a multi-million dollar business. Out of college, he started his professional career as a Management Consultant at Deloitte, where he focused on enterprise software strategy and operations
Education/Personal Bio: Antonio has an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, where he majored in Finance and has an undergraduate degree in Science, Technology, and Society from Stanford University. He currently serves as the San Francisco chapter chair for Stanford’s Office of Undergraduate Admissions OVAL program, and previously served on the national board for the Stanford Black Alumni Association. Antonio currently lives in San Francisco with his wife and two children.

She holds a master’s from Johns Hopkins University and is a Chartered Financial Analyst. She loves to ski and participate in endurance events and lives in Mexico City with her husband and two daughters.

Investing Thesis: Accelerating global technology category-leading companies, Investing in companies with global ambitions
Professional Bio: Spencer is a Managing Director at Sozo Ventures, where he leads investments for the firm, from seed to pre-IPO. He currently sits on the boards of Leaf Logistics, Kargo, Harmonic.ai, Sparrow Financial, and Smarthop, and is a board observer at Project44, Vendr, and more. He focuses on technology investments in Logistics, Fintech, AI, and Enterprise SaaS. In 2020, just four years after joining Sozo Ventures, he made the Forbes 30 Under 30 list. Professional Bio: Hisham Halbouny is Co-Founder and General Partner of P1 Ventures, an early-stage Africa focused venture capital fund. Hisham is passionate about partnering and supporting entrepreneurs to empower emerging markets transformation through innovation and technology. During his time at Man Capital, he also launched several businesses, including, Freight Mango in the US, Echolabs in Nigeria, Almasi Financial in East Africa, and AMEL in Egypt. Hisham is an advisor and board member to several high growth companies.

Name: Phoebe Wang
Investing Thesis: Sustainability and climate driven
Professional Bio:
Phoebe Wang

Investment Partner, Head of Female Founder Initiative, Amazon Climate Pledge Fund

Phoebe Wang serves as the investment partner at the $2bn Amazon Climate Pledge Fund. She is passionate about bending the world’s emission curve and diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and leads Amazon Female Founder Initiative. Her investment focus area covers climate tech companies in transportation & logistics, energy generation, storage, and utilization, buildings, manufacturing & materials, circular economy, food & agriculture, and carbon removal. She has over a decade experience in climate-tech investing, and started her career as engineer and later startup founder.
Education/Personal Bio:
Phoebe Wang
Investment Partner, Head of Female Founder Initiative, Amazon Climate Pledge Fund
Phoebe Wang serves as the investment partner at Amazon Climate Pledge Fund, a $2 billion venture investment fund supporting the development of sustainable technologies and services that will enable Amazon to meet its net-zero carbon goal. Her investment focus area covers climate tech companies in transportation & logistics, energy generation, storage, and utilization, buildings, manufacturing & materials, circular economy, food & agriculture, and carbon removal. She has over a decade experience in climate tech with strong passion in fighting climate change for the future generations. She was also an ex-entrepreneur and built a start-up in technology commercialization. Phoebe was the recipient to Top 10 Entrepreneur by Silicon Valley Innovation & Entrepreneurship Forum (SVIEF) in 2016, Global Corporate Venturing Top Rising Star in 2020, and the US Department of Energy (DOE)’s Business C3E Award in 2022. 
Phoebe is a Charterholder of Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), with an MBA concentrated in Climate and Finance, and a BSc in Materials Science and Engineering. Phoebe has invested in frontier tech companies such as Genecis Bioindustries, ZeroAvia, Veros Systems (acquired by Baker Hughes), Ionomr, Aurora Hydrogen, Bluware, Quanterra, South 8 Technologies, Antora, Celadyne, Li Industries, Aurora Hydrogen, Connected Freight, FreeWire, Xpansiv, Zubie, and currently sit on Rocky Mountain Institute Third Derivative Corporate Advisory Board, Global Corporate Ventures Advisory Board, Counterpart Venture Council Advisory Board and Rice Alliance Energy Advisory Board. She serves as a Special Advisor to the National Renewable Energy Lab (NREL) and Department of Energy (DOE). She is a frequent guest lecturer at Brandeis University, UC Berkeley, MIT and Rice University. In her free time, Phoebe enjoys reading, working out and practicing vipassana.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Dr. Manjari Chandran-Ramesh
Investing Thesis: Investment in early stage and growth stage world changing deeptech companies
Professional Bio:
Manjari has been in the Venture industry for the last decade and since 2021 been a General Partner at Amadeus Capital Partners. Her investment focus is on AI, Robotics and Quantum Technologies. She is the Amadeus representative on several boards including Ravelin (ML for fraud, acquired by WorldPay), NuQuantum (Quantum networking), Seldon (MLOps), Photonic (Quantum Computing), Tenzo (ML for hospitality), Safe Intelligence(Verification of ML models).

On a personal capacity, Manjari advises the UK Government on its National Quantum Technologies Programme. She is a member of the Royal Academy of Engineering’s Enterprise Hub Committee, a mentor for Creative Destruction Labs and a board member of the Satellite Applications Catapult.

Manjari started her career in academia as a researcher and college lecturer at Oxford University, later moving to technology transfer at the University where she was responsible for commercialising intellectual property. Manjari then worked at IP Group plc, managing technology investments from deal origination to exit. She was responsible for the trade sale of TheySayLtd (emotional AI acquired by Aptean), secondary share sale exit in ConcirrusLtd (AI in InsureTech), and sourcing and working with the founding team to build Quantum Motion Ltd (Quantum Computing in Silicon). Manjari created and led IP Group’s Quantum Technologies investment strategy, setting up an initial £12m accelerator fund in partnership with Innovate UK.
Education/Personal Bio: Manjari holds a PhD from the University of Oxford in Machine Learning and Autonomous Vehicles, which she did on a Rhodes Scholarship. As part of her PhD, she completed an Internship at Google (now Alphabet) and has a BE in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering from the University of Madras.

Name: Jefrey Joe
Investing Thesis: Sector agnostic, SEA/Indonesia angle, Indonesia focused early stage fund
Professional Bio:
Jefrey Joe is the Co-founder and General Partner of Alpha JWC Ventures, a Southeast Asian early-to-growth stage venture capital firm that debuted in Indonesia in 2015. With deep Indonesian roots, Alpha JWC has invested in more than 70 companies and currently manages US $650m of AUM across three funds. Prior to Alpha JWC, Jefrey spent a few years as a consultant at The Boston Consulting Group and Ernst & Young and was the COO of Groupon Indonesia. Jefrey is passionate about entrepreneurship and loves working with visionary founders in their journey to building successful and impactful companies. He is an early board member in Indonesian Unicorns Ajaib, Kopi Kenangan and Kredivo.
Jefrey was born in Palembang, a city in South Sumatra, Indonesia and has traveled to Jakarta, Singapore, Melbourne, Shanghai, Los Angeles, Boston and London both for study and work. Jefrey obtained his Bachelor degree from Monash University, holds MBA from UCLA Anderson School of Management and completed Harvard Business School's Owner/President Management Program. Jefrey is an active member of Young Presidents' Organization (YPO) since 2018.
Education/Personal Bio: Jefrey was born in Palembang, a city in South Sumatra, Indonesia and has traveled to Jakarta, Singapore, Melbourne, Shanghai, Los Angeles, Boston and London both for study and work. Jefrey obtained his Bachelor degree from Monash University, holds MBA from UCLA Anderson School of Management and completed Harvard Business School’s Owner/President Management Program. Jefrey is an active member of Young President’s Organization (YPO) since 2018.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,London Summit 2025

Name: Nathaniel Harding
Investing Thesis: Invest in seed stage companies innovating in critical industries across enterprise, physical and life sciences, focused on the US Midcontinent., We invest in seed companies innovating in critical industries across energy, healthcare, logistics and movement, and advanced manufacturing, focused on the US Midcontinent., Cortado Ventures is an early-stage venture capital firm investing in solutions for the industries that drive the economy with a focus on scaling innovation from America's heartland.
Professional Bio: Nathaniel Harding is co-founder and Managing Partner of Cortado Ventures, a seed stage firm investing in the overlooked US Midcontinent across energy, logistics, life sciences, future of work. Nathaniel was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum, and a Most Admired CEO in Oklahoma by the Journal Record. Previously, he and his partner developed a midcontinent resource play which they sold in 2014 for >$100M. A lifelong operator and entrepreneur, his broad areas of expertise include operational strategy, financial modeling, statistical analysis, leveraging big data, connecting science with commercial strategy, and energy. Before starting Cortado Ventures, Nathaniel was an angel and family office investor, including seed investments in Lively, Wyvern, Novo Space, and Kafene.
Education/Personal Bio: Nathaniel graduated cum laude from the University of Oklahoma with Russian Language and Mechanical Engineering degrees, and earned an MBA from Oklahoma City University. He is a decorated Air Force Captain and veteran of Afghanistan, where he was embedded with the US/NATO headquarters in collaboration with the Afghan government. Nathaniel has published in multiple industry publications in the US and China, the latter as part of his Beijing-based joint venture with major Chinese companies. The Governor of Oklahoma appointed him Chair of the Council on Workforce and Economic Development in 2017, managing $20M/year to train and connect the most vulnerable Oklahomans to employment. In 2010 the Mayor appointed Nathaniel to oversee $777M in city infrastructure and quality-of-life projects. He is a trustee for several organizations impacting education, economic opportunity, health and social equity, in addition to mentoring students in STEM fields. He has been a Miss Oklahoma judge, track national champion, Russian orphanage translator, political party National Vice Chairman, and local TV talk show host.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Vignesh Kumar
Investing Thesis: At GD1, we invest in exceptional New Zealand-originated technology companies with global ambitions, from Seed through Series B. As a generalist B2B venture firm, we invest across SaaS, Connected Hardware, Deep Tech, Health Tech, and Internet 2.0. New Zealand’s emerging venture ecosystem—bolstered by successes like Xero, Rocket Lab, and Vend—requires a flexible, bottom-up generalist approach to uncover standout opportunities. We specialize at the Partner level and deploy a barbell strategy: early-stage software investments at Seed/Pre-A entry, and capital-intensive investments (e.g., Deep Tech) at Pre-A/Series A entry. Our model targets 15% ownership, with $1.5 reserved for follow-on per $1 initially invested in high-potential companies. This approach has already driven investments in Aerospace (HTS-enabled super magnets for space), value-based Health Tech, and Hard Tech (plasma-driven metal casting). As New Zealand’s ecosystem matures, we aim to transition to a more thesis-driven top-down strategy, further unlocking potential and helping startups go global.
Professional Bio:
Vignesh Kumar is a Co-Managing Partner at New Zealand based vc firm GD1. At GD1 Vignesh focusses on emerging platforms across Hardware enabled Software, Deep Tech, and Health Tech, where he is an investor and board member of companies such as Foundry Lab (‘metal in minutes using microwaves’), Type One Energy (Stellarator design fusion reactor), Dawn Aerospace (green propulsion for space + suborbital spaceplanes), Basis (the energy operating system of the home), Zenno Astronautics (supermagnets for space applications), Formus Labs (next gen orthopedic tech stack), and Alimetry (wearable diagnostics for the gut) among many others.


Notably, Vignesh co-led the efforts to successfully raise GD1’s first oversubscribed institutional LP based fund at c.$150M, a rare feat in the nascent New Zealand venture ecosystem. Prior to GD1, and after successfully overcoming his own 9 month battle with blood cancer, he co-founded Journey Health, a digital health patient reported outcomes platform for oncology care. Prior to this Vignesh was based in Cupertino and led hardware execution for Apple across the US and Asia for its portable line of products. Previous to Apple, he was a product design engineer at Fisher & Paykel Healthcare, working to design and bring to market several products that are now considered the gold standard in neonatal resuscitation across labour and delivery suites and neonatal intensive care units (NICU) around the world.
Education/Personal Bio: Vignesh holds an MBA from the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania, where he was both a Wharton and Kaiser Fellowship recipient, as well as a Fulbright Science and Innovation Scholar. Vignesh also earned a Bachelor of Engineering (Hons) degree in Biomedical Engineering and a Master of Engineering Studies (Hons) in Medical Device Design and Technologies from The University of Auckland. A native of India, Vignesh grew up across Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea and Auckland, New Zealand, and is multi-lingual across ‘Tok Pisin’ (official language of Papua New Guinea), Tamil, and Kiwi English. When time permits Vignesh enjoys spending time with his wife and their two girls, and spending far too much time and money on home automation projects.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Nneka Eze
Investing Thesis: Africa will become the “next East Asia”: technology, agritech, and consumer sectors will create outsized economic value. We invest in overlooked sectors delivering essential products and services for Africans, and we support African and female founders.
Professional Bio:
Nneka is a Managing Partner at VestedWorld, an Africa-focused venture capital firm investing in agriculture, consumer goods, and enabling technology startups in East and West Africa. She has over 15 years of experience working in and across Africa and believes deeply in the firm’s north star -- that Africa can become the next East Asia. VestedWorld has 34 portfolio companies and over 46 million AUM in two closed-end funds backing founders with a commitment to investing in African founders and female founders.  Since joining VestedWorld in 2021 she has led transactions in the creative industries, B2B retailtech, fintech, healtech/biotech, and mobility/logistics.

Nneka has deep experience and knowledge of mass market African consumers in rural and urban areas. Prior to VestedWorld, Nneka founded the Nigerian office of a global strategy consulting firm, Dalberg, after helping scale the business across Africa, and was co-lead the Global Agriculture & Food Security Practice. She previously worked as a Business Analyst at McKinsey & Company in Washington, DC including on a project in Lagos, Nigeria.

Nneka has been involved in building the impact investing ecosystem in Nigeria. In 2019, Nneka developed the strategy for the Impact Investors’ Foundation of Nigeria (a non-profit which aims to unlock impact investing in Nigeria and which is the secretariat for the national advisory board) and sits on the Board. She also serves on the inaugural National Advisory Board for Impact Investing in Nigeria and on the Digital Collective Africa Council. Nneka is on the Board of Directors of a nonprofit focused on public sector leadership development (AMP Health).
Education/Personal Bio: Nneka holds an AB in economics cum laude from Harvard College along with a citation in Spanish language and speaks intermediate French. Nneka has worked across Africa, and in Asia, Europe, Latin America, and North America. She moved to Kenya in 2009, living briefly in Senegal before moving to Nigeria, and has spent her professional career in Africa. Her frame of reference has been based on Black feminism, and her understanding of race and class struggles in America as an underrepresented minority. Applying this perspective to an African context helps her to understand how class dynamics work, how biases affect capital allocations, and how important it is to invest in African founders to spur economic growth. Nneka has written multiple articles and op-eds on Africa’s growth trajectory and investment opportunities in various publications.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Philipp Seifert
Professional Bio: Philipp is a Partner at 468 Capital and drives the firm’s enterprise software investing efforts across the US. He joined 468 in 2021 from Sapphire Ventures, a growth-stage venture capital fund focused on all things enterprise software. Prior to joining Sapphire, Philipp was part of Goldman Sachs’ TMT investment banking division in San Francisco and advised high-growth technology companies on IPO and M&A transactions. In 2021, Philipp was recognized in Business Insider's 25 Rising-Stars in VC of 2019.
Education/Personal Bio: Philipp graduated from Rice University with a B.A. in Mathematical Economic Analysis from and was a member of men’s tennis team. Originally from Munich, Germany, Philipp is also fluent in German.

Name: Olivier Tonneau
Investing Thesis: Leading global early stage investor in Quantum Technologies
Professional Bio: Partner at Quantonation, VC fund dedicated to Quantum Technologies. Previous experiences include 10 years as management consultant at Kearney, working on growth strategy, strategic due diligences, in industries that are in the process of deregulating (energy, postal services, transportation,…). I joined French entrepreneur Charles Beigbeder as deputy CEO at his holding company Gravitation in 2007. At Gravitation we invested in over 30 early stage companies. I founded Quantonation alongside Charles Beigbeder and Christophe Jurczak (cofounder and PhD in quantum Physics) in 2018. We have raised over 100 M€ and invested in 25 companies in the last four years, becoming the leading firm in quantum technologies worldwide. I am a board member at Multiverse Computing, Qnami, KETS Quantum Security, EvolutionQ, QC Design, KipuQuantum & Cryptonext Security. I am still involved as an alumni of my business school as I taught a strategy course at ESSEC Business School for 8 years, and belong to the school VC endowment fund jury.
Education/Personal Bio: Graduate from ESSEC business school, French Ivy League MBA Prep school to competitive exam for Ivy League business school (Institut des Chartreux in Lyon) High school in French High School of Bangkok, Thailand

Name: Eleonore Jarry-Ferron
Investing Thesis: Lead early rounds with ambitious Canadian founders and partner for the long term
Professional Bio: Eleonore Jarry-Ferron brings eight years of Venture Capital experience to her Partner role at Brightspark.She plays an instrumental role in fundraising, deal flow generation, deal making and portfolio management. Eleonore also contributes to the firm’s overall management and assumes a significant part in succession planning for Brightspark. Currently, she dedicates her time to both healthcare and climate sectors with a notable focus on portfolio companies such as Valence Discovery, Vetster, DrugBank, Elevate Farms and Deep Sky. Eleonore is involved in several initiatives to support a new generation of tech leaders in Canada. She co-founded Front Row Ventures and has been working with Canadian Women in VC and The Technovation Challenge Girls Program for many years. Eleonore helped Front Row Ventures raise more than $5M, empower 200+ future tech leaders and invest in a growing number of pre-seed companies. She continues to be a catalyst for the younger generation and devotes considerable time thinking strategically about how to change the face of the Venture Capital industry in Canada.
Education/Personal Bio: Prior to joining VC, Eleonore worked in the Assurance & Advisory department at Ernst & Young LLP, focusing on alternative investment funds and private equity firms. She studied Finance and Accounting at HEC Montréal and completed a Management certificate at Stanford University. Outside of work, she is the proud co-owner of a hot yoga studio which keeps her grounded!

Professional Bio: Abhinaya is a partner at M25, focusing on Midwest-based pre-seed and seed-stage investments. She joined the fund in 2017 and spearheads the team’s outbound efforts, along with leading deals and working with portfolio companies.

She is also very active with the 1for2 Education Foundation, which provides "pay-it-forward" college tuition scholarships. Abhinaya graduated Magna Cum Laude from the University of Illinois at Chicago with degrees in finance and mathematical computer science.

Name: Zaki Djemal
Investing Thesis: We're a first check fund investing in Israeli founders in Israel and around the world.
Professional Bio: Zaki Djemal is the co-founder and Managing Partner of Fresh Fund, Israel’s largest and most active pre-seed venture capital fund ($70MM in AUM). We're built to partner with early-stage founders from day zero, usually as their first institutional investors. Since 2019, we’ve been leveraging our unique access to the Israeli tech ecosystem to fill the pre-seed gap and back close to 50 startups across segments and verticals.
Education/Personal Bio: A Harvard graduate in Behavioral Economics, Zaki was listed among the Forbes 30 Under 30 emerging tech business leaders in 2018. He is a proud member of the Schusterman Foundation ROI and REALITY communities and serves on the boards of the Israel Harvard Club, Tevel b'Tzedek, and Kulna Yerushalayim.

Investing Thesis: We invest in great ideas, great minds, and great companies
Professional Bio: Ahmad is a digital builder and engineer turned technology investor. He’s currently at Sanabil, a financial investment company that focuses on global private investments, including venture and growth capital. Prior to Sanabil, Ahmad was a general partner at STV; where he led investments in prominent MENA startups and served on their board of directors.

Name: Henrik Wetter Sanchez
Investing Thesis: High-conviction, low-volume pre-seed, First VC round. Market, Technology, Other: Generalist tech investor with focus where a market is at or close to an inflection point for an (underserved) industry combined with a clear commercial insight
Professional Bio:
Henrik is a General Partner at Playfair. He sits on the boards of Bryo, NetFabric, Passionfruit, Protex AI, Recurse ML, Recycleye, Those Beyond, Trezy and Valarian. 

Henrik’s professional career technically began during his degree, when he founded a tech startup, a social enterprise and began angel investing through crowdfunding platforms. His social navigation and discovery startup RendezVu grew to over a thousand global users and access-led tutoring marketplace The Oxbridge Initiative was live in six countries. Henrik started angel investing in 2015 and has built a portfolio of >40 investments, including Monzo (2016), GoHenry (2016, acq. 2023), Revolut (2017), Freetrade (2017) and Pod Point (IPO 2021). 

Henrik’s professional career formally started in private equity at Ardian while living in Paris on his year abroad. After graduation, he joined Bank of America Merrill Lynch in the investment banking division where he worked on UK M&A and IPO deals for two years. 

Henrik joined Playfair for the launch of Fund II in 2019 and has since led nine investments in new companies and enjoys actively supporting their founders on and off their boards. He also helped found Playfair’s D&I initiative: Female Founder Office Hours and now runs it with the team. He was recently named one of Sifted’s Top 30 Young Venture Capitalists.
Education/Personal Bio: Henrik studied French, Spanish and Portuguese at Cambridge and graduated with a first in 2017. Outside of Playfair, you can find Henrik on the tennis court, in the mountains skiing or deep in a book.

Name: Dan Kerr
Investing Thesis: We create technology success stories beyond the traditional U.S. coastal tech hubs. Leveraging the 'Flyover Multiple,' we capitalize on less competitive markets and advantageous valuations while backing exceptional founders. By reimagining venture capital, we have built a prominent regional brand and a robust support infrastructure tailored to the strengths of the Flyover region.
Professional Bio: Dan is a Partner at Flyover Capital where he leads the firm’s new investments. Dan is a native Kansan who returned to the Kansas City area as the early-stage tech scene was picking up steam. He has found an ideal match investing in and partnering with the region's growth-minded founders. In addition to serving as director and observer on the boards of several Flyover capital portfolio companies, he is an active mentor and advisor to founders around the region. In 2022 he cofounded an event called MidxMidwest, amplifying middle America’s tech and venture community. Prior to Flyover Dan was an operator several early-stage technology companies in the Kansas City area. He spent his early career in M&A and corporate development for a regional bank and as a financial regulator at the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago.
Education/Personal Bio: Dan received his bachelor’s degree from the University of Kansas and MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. Outside of work Dan enjoys dreaming up inventions with his two young sons and planning the next trip with his wife Anna.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Justin Mak
Job Title: Managing Partner - Shanda Capital; Executive Director - Legal
Investing Thesis: Investing in highly technical founders and teams solving difficult problems
Professional Bio: Justin fell backwards into venture when the principal at the family office he works for, the Shanda Group, asked if he was interested in getting more involved in the firm’s fledging venture business about 6 years ago. Since then, Justin has been involved in over 60 LP investments across 40 managers and over 35 direct investments. Justin is responsible for helping source and diligence both fund and direct investments, and with his background as a recovering corporate attorney, has the pleasure of handling the legal aspects of all venture transactions at Shanda. Prior to Shanda Justin was an M&A lawyer at Shearman & Sterling in New York and Hong Kong. Before law school, Justin dabbled in investment banking in what was then called Credit Suisse First Boston in New York and also Goldman Sachs in Hong Kong.
Education/Personal Bio: Justin received his BA in history (French Revolution if you must know, but he doesn’t remember much) at Columbia, where he also received his JD after a stint in investment banking in between.

Name: Yasmin Ferrine
Investing Thesis: Investing in diverse founding teams at pre-seed and supporting them at going from 0 to 1
Professional Bio:
Yasmin Cruz Ferrine (she/her/hers) is a General Partner and Co-Founder at Visible Hands (VH), a venture capital firm that funds and empowers exceptional underrepresented founders launching high-growth startups. At the earliest stages of company-building, VH provides meaningful funding, personalized support, and access to amazing networks through accelerator programming, helping founders build exceptional technology startups. Yasmin's responsibilities span capital raising and investment functions of the firm.

Yasmin has 16 years of experience leading capital raising, investment strategies, and advising foundations. Yasmin's career includes cross-sector experiences from the 2020 US presidential election campaign to Head of Growth and Strategy New England region at Brown Advisory to Director of Corporate Responsibility at John Hancock. Yasmin began her career as a buy-side small-cap equity analyst.
Yasmin's current board work includes the Mass FinTech Hub Advisory Board and All Raise's Boston Chapter. Yasmin earned her MBA from Boston College and Bachelor of Science degree from Babson College. In 2023, Yasmin was named one of the top 50 people influencing technology in Massachusetts as a Tech Power Player by the Boston Globe.
Education/Personal Bio: Yasmin’s current board work includes the Mass FinTech Hub Advisory Board and All Raise’s Boston Chapter. Yasmin earned her MBA from Boston College and Bachelor of Science degree from Babson College. In 2023, Yasmin was named one of the top 50 people influencing technology in Massachusetts as a Tech Power Player by the Boston Globe.

Name: Gal Noyman Veksler
Investing Thesis: We invest in Israeli and US companies targeting the US healthcare system focused on the business of healthcare, tech enabled healthcare delivery and digitizing the science of medicine
Professional Bio: Partner @ LionBird funding best digital health innovations, researcher, and entrepreneur
Education/Personal Bio: Dr. Noyman Veksler is a behavioral researcher, investor, and entrepreneur with a deep love for technology and innovation in tech and healthcare. As part of her PhD, she developed a biopsychosocial model of chronic pain, and published and lectured regularly on chronic illness. At LionBird, she invests in the best US focused early-stage technology and scientific-driven startups looking to reset healthcare's relationship with technology. Dr. Noyman Veksler is passionate about using AI and big data to understand human behaviors and finding digital solutions to help users lead a better, healthier, and happier life, manage chronic conditions and improve general well-being. In her personal life, she enjoys Pilates, tennis, writing, and supporting female entrepreneurs in their journey to create kickass companies.
