Name: Michal Klar
Investing Thesis: Investing in early stage climate, food and agri tech startups in Asia Pacific
Professional Bio: Founding partner of Better Bite Ventures, investing in early stage climate, food and agri tech in Asia Pacific
Education/Personal Bio: Michal studied economics at University of Warsaw, dropping out to join a startup. He lived for over 5 years in Indonesia, including a sabbatical in Bali, where his daughter enrolled in Green School, a unique international school with a curriculum focused on environmental sustainability. Michal now divides his time between New Zealand, where he lives with his family, and the broader APAC region, which is his investment focus.

Name: Adrianna Samaniego
Investing Thesis: Black and Latine led Series A and B software companies
Professional Bio:
Adrianna Samaniego is a Partner at Cherryrock Capital, venture firm focused on leading an and co-leading Series A & B rounds in underinvested founding teams. At Cherryrock, Adrianna applies her extensive experience to support the best emerging technology startups in scaling from $1M to $100M+.

Prior to Cherryrock, Adrianna was a Partner at Female Founders Fund, a leading early-stage fund investing in female-founded technology companies across B2B, Healthcare, Climate, and Enterprise Saas. In this role, she managed the investment team and led over twenty-five investments in rapidly growing female-led startups. Additionally, Adrianna was instrumental in establishing and managing the FFF Scout Program, which targets early-stage Black, Latine, and Indigenous female founders, as well as the FFF Entrepreneur in Residence program. Her investment acumen and dedication to fostering diversity in tech drive her approach to building category-defining businesses.
 
Her expertise in scaling businesses is complemented by an eight-year tenure at Google, where she co-founded Emporium within Area 120, Google’s startup incubator, where she led the rapid development and launch of a B2B marketplace aimed at enhancing procurement opportunities for diverse-owned businesses. This complemented her leadership and creation of Google's Global Supplier Diversity Program, which generated over $2B in opportunities for diverse-owned companies.
 
Recognized for her trailblazing efforts, Adrianna has been honored with distinctions such as Fast Company Queer50, Business Insider Rising Star in VC, a Kauffman Fellow (Class 28), University of Georgia's 40 Under 40, an Alumni Society Class of '22 member, and receiving the Top Latinas in Tech Giants award.
Education/Personal Bio: Originally from the small border town of Douglas, Arizona, Adrianna moved with her family to Buford, Georgia, at the age of sixteen. As a proud Mexican-American, sister, daughter, and Tia to three wonderful nieces, her family roots have always been close to her heart. Adrianna is a first-generation college graduate who had the privilege of attending the University of Georgia, where she majored in Finance. Furthering her academic pursuits, she earned an MBA from Columbia Business School. She is based in Brooklyn, NY, with her partner Vanya and their beloved pets—Nala, their dog, and Timothy & Chloe, their cats.

Name: Tracy Chadwell
Investing Thesis: We are solving for the 100+ year health span. We invest in early stage technology companies in aging and longevity and support them with capital, counsel and connectivity.
Professional Bio:
Tracy is the Founding Partner of 1843 Capital, an early stage venture capital firm solving for the 100+ year healthspan by investing in technology companies focused on aging and longevity. 

She was named to the inaugural Forbes �50 over 50� list in 2021 and one of Entrepreneur Magazine�s inaugural �100 Powerful Women.� Notable investments include early investments in Beautycounter (Exited: $1 Billion valuation) and Tempo Automation (Nasdaq:TMPO). She�s a leader in the venture capital industry and a sought-after speaker including giving testimony before a US Senate Committee. She has also been a speaker for the Milken Global Institute, SXSW, MIT, and TEDx NYIT. 

Formerly, Tracy was a partner of a growth capital venture capital fund � Baker Capital � and a VP at Robertson Stephens. Early in her career, Tracy worked in Tokyo for the law firm Nagashima and Ohno and for SCM International, led by Senator Adlai Stevenson doing cross-border transaction work between the US and Asia. Currently, she serves on the Board of Recuro Health and is a Board Observer to Corsha. 
Tracy is a graduate of Trinity College, Hartford CT and has a Juris Doctorate from Loyola University of Chicago where she was the recipient of the CALI awards in Property Law and International Tax.

Her non-profit work includes the AARP Age Collective, and a Board Member of Early Stage Montana.

Name: Elana Berkowitz
Professional Bio: Elana Berkowitz is a founding partner of Springbank. A serial social entrepreneur and policy wonk, she’s a former Obama Administration technology policy official who has worked across the Obama-Biden Transition Team, the FCC and Secretary Clinton’s office at the State Department. She also served as innovator-in-residence for CARE, one of the world’s largest humanitarian organizations. She’s acted as an advisor on strategy, user insights, and impact partnerships consulting for companies and organizations, including Etsy, Kickstarter, Google, and Code for America. She also worked at McKinsey as a technology, media, and telecom consultant across 10 countries.
Education/Personal Bio: Elana holds a BA from Brown University and an MBA and MPA from Harvard University. She’s an almost lifelong New Yorker and serves on the Digital Steering Committee for the Brooklyn Public Library system.

Name: Ian Beadle
Investing Thesis: At Westbound, we invest financial and social capital into exceptional ventures led by, solving for, or built together with underrepresented people of color.
Professional Bio: Ian is a co-founding Partner of Westbound Equity Partners, an early-stage firm investing in exceptional ventures led by underrepresented founders of color, founders addressing the needs of underrepresented consumers of color, and founders with a demonstrated commitment to creating inclusive cultures and building diverse teams. He is a generalist but is particularly interested in financial inclusion, climate change and adaptation, and aging and longevity. In his role at Westbound, he manages the firm's operations, oversees investment activities, and offers strategic support for portfolio companies. Prior to Westbound, Ian served as Principal at Littlebanc Advisors where he led growth and control investments in lower middle market opportunities in the FinTech, Ecommerce, logistics, and consumer industries, while playing an active role in the management of portfolio companies. Prior to Littlebanc, he served as the first employee of GrizzlyRock Capital, a long/short hedge fund focused on small and mid-cap public companies. Ian began his career working for Goodrich Aerospace (now a part of Raytheon) specializing in operations and finance, skills that enable him to provide hands-on support throughout the Westbound portfolio.
Education/Personal Bio: Ian graduated from San Diego State University with a degree in Business Finance, completed his MBA at the University of Southern California, and is a CFA charterholder. A native of Southern California, Ian now resides in the Bay Area with his wife and three boys. He enjoys spending his free time coaching youth sports, volunteering at his local church, and playing beach volleyball tournaments.

Name: Susie Meier
Investing Thesis: Early Stage Companies across Europe
Professional Bio:
Susie is a Principal with HV Capital, Germany's largest Venture Fund with a current €800m Fund IX. HV Capital is a proud investor into companies such as Qonto, SumUp, Scalable Capital etc.
She predominantly focuses on AI-based Fintech & Enterprise solutions across Europe, with a focus on Paris. 
She is also part of the Board of the German Startup Association.
Susie is a close friend to the universities HEC & LSE, where she is teaching a variety of sessions around Venture / Entrepreneurship
Education/Personal Bio: Susie holds a MSc in Finance & Private Equity from the London School of Economics (LSE) and a BSc with Honors in Financial Management & Financial Reporting from the University of Regensburg. Susie has also taught Entrepreneurship in a number of European institutions, including LSE, HEC and IESE. Besides her involvement with universities, she is also a passionate supporter of Included VC, in line with her mission to change the face of Venture Capital. On a personal level, Susie has always been obsessed with all kinds of outdoor sports - from long-distance running to playing golf/tennis and skiing (incl. apres-ski).

Name: Kathryn Weinmann
Investing Thesis: Early stage investing in consumer and enterprise technology
Professional Bio: Kathryn Weinmann is a Principal at FirstMark Capital, where she invests in consumer internet companies. Prior to joining FirstMark, she was a VP at Norwest Venture Partners. Before joining venture in 2018, she worked in BizOps at NerdWallet, supporting small business lending. Within the venture community, she sits on the board of the Emerging Venture Capitalist Association (EVCA), a nonprofit supporting professional development for early career investors.
Education/Personal Bio: Kathryn has an BA from Vanderbilt and MBA from Stanford GSB. She grew up in Texas and now lives in New York City.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,London Summit 2025

Name: Mike Mompi
Investing Thesis: Backing Founders and teams using technology to solve large and meaningful problems across Africa.
Professional Bio:
Mike is cofounder and Managing Partner at Enza Capital, a multi stage venture capital firm backing founders and teams using technology to solve large and meaningful problems across Africa.
 

He has previous experience across 4 continents as both a venture investor and public markets investor, as well as a founder and venture-backed entrepreneur. He sits as a Director on the Boards of multiple tech companies across East, West, and Southern Africa and is based in Nairobi, Kenya.
Education/Personal Bio: Mike holds degrees in Economics and Communications from the University of California, Davis. He is an avid tennis player, skier, and painter. Mike is a Trustee at the Treebeard Trust, a social investor that supports transformational initiatives creating a fairer society, and he is a Trustee and co-founder of the Black Global Trust.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Jasmine Busson
Investing Thesis: the first women-led, gender lens venture capital fund from the MENA region. Our mission is to break the myth that opposes capital returns to impact-driven models. Championing WHO’s One Health approach, we specialize in innovative and scalable early-stage startups that drive health, social, and environmental change.
Professional Bio: Jasmine founded Globivest in 2016 as the venture arm of the family office. She built a team of experts in finance, legal and health tech respectively, and started deploying capital in companies where impact meets profit. Globivest family office fund has a track record combining 50+ companies among which Yoco, Lifebit, Legacy, Eightsleep and Karma Check. End of 2022, Jasmine decided to cap Globivest family office and raise the first women-led fund in the MENA region. The team successfully secured their first close and started deploying capital. Globivest fund II supports founders in the "One Health" thesis targeting targeting healthy humans and healthy environment.
Education/Personal Bio: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration at the Lebanese American University, Master’s degree in Negotiation with a minor in Art history at OMNES Education in Paris.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Rakan AlRashed
Investing Thesis: Early-stage MENA based companies
Professional Bio: Rakan AlRashed is co-founder of Access Bridge Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based out Saudi Arabia. Rakan is an active investor in various industries including TMT, retail, F&B, healthcare and education. He serves as a board member and chairman in numerous companies and foundations in KSA. Rakan’s last role was as a partner at Tamm Investments focusing on SMEs and startups in UAE and KSA while also serving as an LP in various VCs in the region. Prior to that Rakan was an associate at the Abraaj Group out of Johannesburg and Dubai focusing medium to large cap deals
Education/Personal Bio: Rakan is passionate about tech hardware. Rakan is very active in all types of sports, as he’s a professional racing driver participating in big global events. Rakan holds a bachelor's degree in finance from AlFaisal University, KSA

Name: Emma Cui
Investing Thesis: crypto/Web 3.0
Professional Bio: Emma is the Founding partner and CEO of LongHash Ventures, which is an Asia based Web 3.0 focused accelerator and VC fund. Longhash Ventures has invested in more than 80 leading crypto projects, including Polkadot, Filecoin, Dodo, and Astar. Emma is also a pioneer in Web3.0 ecosystem development and has collaborated with leading layer 1 protocols such as Polkadot, Filecoin, and Axelar in launching ecosystem accelerator programs. Prior to founding LongHash Ventures, Emma was a senior management consultant at McKinsey, where she helped financial institutions with their digital transformation and tech investment in Southeast Asia. Emma started her career as a banker, working for ANZ bank and Macquarie bank out of Singapore, Shanghai and Sydney.
Education/Personal Bio: Emma was raised in China before She moved to Singapore for her higher education. She holds a Master of Science from the National University of Singapore and a Bachelor of Engineering from Nanyang Technological University. Emma is a CFA Charterholder. Emma has also worked in Australia, HongKong, Shanghai
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Karim Abadir
Investing Thesis:
About BECO Capital


As the first venture capital firm in the GCC, BECO Capital has the longest track record in Gulf with two unicorn exits and a portfolio of the region's most iconic success stories. With $500M in AUM across four funds, BECO Capital is the largest non-government early-stage venture firm in the Gulf.



BECO Capital gets its name from the rocket launch event Booster Engine Cut Off, which occurs when the vessel has achieved sufficient altitude to exit the earth’s atmosphere. Our mission is to drive true innovation and progress in the region whilst being the most impactful investor, partner, and friend to the most talented founders the Gulf has to offer.
Professional Bio: Karim currently serves as an Investment Principal where he works closely with the partners and founders on new investments and existing portfolio companies. Prior to joining BECO Capital, Karim was a Senior Analyst at FIM Partners, a MENA based regional asset manager with over $2.5bn in assets under management. There, he conducted fundamental equity analysis on companies across several sectors within the MENA region and frontier public markets. Prior to FIM, Karim was at EFG Hermes Asset Management, helping launch their Frontier Equity strategy performing a similar role.
Education/Personal Bio: Karim holds a Bachelors degree in Finance from Pepperdine University and a Masters in Global Finance from Fordham University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Dubai,KF SIG | AI

Name: John Ailanjian
Investing Thesis: Majority of our strategy is focused on the FoF strategy (both established and emerging managers) and the third strategy is co-investing alongside our managers centered around the Series B.
Professional Bio:
John is a Managing Partner at Next Legacy Partners. John invests in early-stage fintech, consumer, enterprise, and vertical SaaS companies, primarily in North America. John has been instrumental in developing the firm's direct investment strategy through co-investments and dedicated direct funds. He also plays an integral role in the programming and education of Next Legacy's Fellowship program.

Previously, John was the CEO and Founder of Aspen Highland Management, sourcing and analyzing investments across various capital structures, investment stages, and industries for their high-net-worth families. His diversified portfolio of alternative investments included Loadsmart, Color Genomics, Palantir, ZipRecruiter, Unikey, Peek Travel, Uber, Facebook, New Fortress Energy, Top Golf, Coupang and Boom Supersonic.

Prior to Aspen Highland, John was at Goldman Sachs in New York for nine years, primarily in a cross-asset capacity, advising hedge funds and family offices on structured investments and hedging strategies.
John is a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles with a B.A. in Economics. John is also a graduate of the Stanford Executive Program and a Chartered Financial Analyst. He is a Board Member of the CFA Society of San Francisco, an Advisory Council Member for the Master of Quantitative Economics at UCLA, a member of the Alumni Board of Serra High School, and actively involved with the Special Olympics of Northern California. 

John and his wife Beth live in Burlingame, CA. Recent empty nesters, they adore visiting their three children in college, exploring wine country, and finding the next best dining spot in San Francisco.
Education/Personal Bio: John is a graduate of the University of California, Los Angeles with a B.A. in Economics. John is also a graduate of the Stanford Executive Program and a Chartered Financial Analyst. He is a Board Member of the CFA Society of San Francisco, an Advisory Council Member for the Master of Quantitative Economics at UCLA, a member of the Alumni Board of Serra High School, and actively involved with the Special Olympics of Northern California. John and his wife Beth live in Burlingame, CA. Recent empty nesters, they adore visiting their three children in college, exploring wine country, and finding the next best dining spot in San Francisco.

Name: Nancy Torres
Investing Thesis: en Opportunity Fund is a venture capital firm focused on investing in software companies led by outstanding, overlooked entrepreneurs. Open Opportunity Fund's portfolio spans B2B SaaS, enterprise IT, artificial intelligence, fintech, and health tech. Opportunity Fund 1 is a $100 million fund with SoftBank as an anchor LP. The firm has invested in 75 tech companies, including Atomic, Brex, Cityblock Health, Eight Sleep, Esusu, Lumu, Paystand, QuickNode, Squire, and Subject. The fund has achieved seven portfolio company exits. In 2023, the team led by Paul Judge and Marcelo Claure acquired the Fund from SoftBank and announced Fund 2 to continue to execute the thesis.
Professional Bio: Nancy Torres is a Partner at Ulu Ventures, a leading seed stage venture firm in Silicon Valley, investing in diverse teams creating industry-leading market opportunities. Prior to joining Ulu Ventures, Nancy worked in Technology Investment Banking at Goldman Sachs, advising fintech, enterprise software, and consumer internet companies on strategic financial transactions. She started her career working across data analytics, business development, and venture design roles at Google, Uber, and IDEO. Nancy is a Co-Founder and Board Director for the Latinx MBA Association, a 1,000+ member 501c3 organization dedicated to advancing Latinx business leadership.
Education/Personal Bio: Nancy is a proud first-generation Colombian-American, hailing from Prince George’s County, Maryland. Nancy obtained her MBA from Harvard Business School, MPP from Harvard Kennedy School, and BS in Business Administration from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. While at Harvard, Nancy explored her passion for deploying capital and technology in the service of social equity, working for diversity-focused VC Harlem Capital, New York City’s largest poverty-fighting organization The Robin Hood Foundation, and San José’s Mayor’s Office of Technology and Innovation. Nancy served as a Zuckerman and George Fellow at Harvard’s Center for Public Leadership. She is also a TOIGO and MLT alumna.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Tobi Coker
Investing Thesis: Back the best founders, operating in areas of high growth, worldwide
Professional Bio: Tobi is a Deal Partner on the investment team at Felicis Ventures, an early stage venture capital firm based in Menlo Park, CA. At Felicis, Tobi has deployed $350m+ in capital, sourcing 10 deals for the firm across seed to Series B. Tobi is a 2023 Business Insider Rising Star, 2022 Forbes 30u30 honoree, and Kauffman Fellow, Class of 28.
Education/Personal Bio: Tobi graduated from Georgetown University with a B.S. in Biology and Economics and is originally from Atlanta, GA. He is a board member of BLCK VC San Francisco and an active mentor for HBCUvc.

Name: Solomon Hailu
Investing Thesis: We invest in early growth companies focused on mission critical software.
Professional Bio:
Solomon is a Partner at March Capital. He works across all touch points of the investment process, including sourcing, diligence, and portfolio support. Solomon currently holds board positions at March portfolio companies Extend, Gr4vy, & Overjet and is a member of Kauffman Fellows (Class 28).

Born in Ethiopia and raised outside of Washington, D.C., Solomon is a graduate of the University of Virginia (B.S., Commerce). Before joining March, Solomon was a Principal at Tusk Venture Partners, investing in early-stage technology companies and began his career at Lazard. At Tusk, Solomon partnered with Lemonade (NYSE: LMND), Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN), Circle (NYSE: CRCL), Bird (NYSE: BRDS), Care/of (acquired), FanDuel (acquired), Radar Relay (acquired), and Sunday, among others.

Solomon is continually inspired by the entrepreneurs he works with at March. Every time he meets a founder for the first time, Solomon enjoys getting to know the new company that may improve people’s lives, create new markets, or even fundamentally change the world. Solomon was featured in Forbes 30 Under 30 for Venture Capital in 2021 and was recognized on Business Insider’s 2022 Rising Stars list. He also serves on the Board of BLCK VC, an organization formed to connect, empower, and advance black venture capitalists, and is on the McIntire School of Commerce’s Young Alumni Board at UVA.

When not in the office, Solomon is an outdoor enthusiast from skiing, hiking, to scuba diving. A committed runner, he participates in a marathon yearly—the New York City Marathon is his favorite.
Education/Personal Bio: Solomon was featured in Forbes 30 Under 30 for Venture Capital and recognized on Business Insider’s Rising Stars list. He is a member of the Milken Institute’s Young Leaders Circle and serves on the Board of BLCK VC, an organization formed to connect, empower and advance black venture capitalists. Solomon received a B.S. in Commerce from the University of Virginia. Outside of work, he enjoys exploring new restaurants in Los Angeles and is an avid runner.

Name: Andrea Araneda
Professional Bio: Andrea is Partner at Fen Ventures, a chilean fund investing early in tech founders building a better future for spanish-speaking Latam. Her career in Venture started out as a Senior Associate at Fen Ventures, at a time where the firm had only a handful of investments. She grew alongside with the firm’s evolution and became Partner after two years in. Before Fen Ventures, Andrea was briefly part of an AI company leading Business Development and before that worked for the Innovation arm of the world’s largest copper company (based in Chile).
Education/Personal Bio: Andrea holds a Masters Degree in Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Management from Imperial College London, and a MSc in Bioengineering from Universidad Adolfo Ibáñez Chile. Born and raised in chilean Patagonia, she feels at her best combining city life with hiking, and has achieved high summits such as Mt Kilimanjaro (Tanzania), Mt Toubkal (Morocco) and Citlaltépetl (Mexico). She currently lives in Mexico City with her husband and two rescue dogs Matilde and Bruno.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF | Mexico,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Anna Palmer
Investing Thesis: AI focus
Professional Bio: Partner at Flybridge. Founder XFactor Ventures. Co-owner NWSL Boston. 2x entrepreneur.
Education/Personal Bio: Outside of venture capital, Anna is a co-founder and a managing owner of Boston’s National Women’s Soccer League franchise beginning play in 2026.  Anna is a graduate of Harvard Law School and lives in Boston with her husband and son.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Boston,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Carolina Huaranca Mendoza
Investing Thesis: FCP invests in underrepresented led venture funds across the globe. We invest in both emerging and seasoned Midas Listed managers. We are agnostic on what the fund manager invests in but are currently not deploying in biotech and life sciences., FCP invests in diverse led venture funds across the globe. We invest in both emerging and seasoned Midas Listed managers. We are agnostic on what the fund manager invests in but are currently not deploying in biotech and life sciences.
Professional Bio: Carolina Huaranca Mendoza is a Co-founder & General Partner at First Close Partners (FCP). FCP invests in venture funds owned and operated by underrepresented fund managers across the globe with the goal of making the venture capital industry more equitable. She began her venture investing career as a Principal at Kapor Capital, a fund which invested in companies such as Uber, Twilio, Promise, and CareerKarma. While at Kapor she also set the first formal investing strategy into diverse emerging managers. Upon graduating Cornell University, she worked as an investment banker in M&A. But, her passion for tech entrepreneurship led to a Sales & Marketing Manager role at SchoolNet which sold to Pearson for $230.0M. She would go on to launch her own startup, Spriggle, a marketplace for education products. Carolina channeled her passion for STEM to serve as the Founding Director of the Clubs Division of Girls Who Code launching programs to teach over 2,000 girls computer science.
Education/Personal Bio: Carolina is a proud Peruvian-American with indigenous roots. Her last name, Huaranca, is Quechua, the official language of the Incas. She is also a graduate of Cornell University and a recipient of the Konolige Merit MBA Fellowship at The Wharton School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | LPs,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Marcus Stroud
Investing Thesis: Sequence Equity Partners is a multi-strategy investment firm that blends venture capital and private equity expertise to invest in and scale businesses enhancing the human experience. Their investment thesis is centered on identifying and supporting transformative opportunities in resilient technologies and sports.
Professional Bio:
Marcus is the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of TXV. TXV is a multi-stage thematic investment firm, based in Austin. Marcus oversees the firm's Evolution Strategy, overall fundraising efforts, and firm management. In addition to his role at TXV, Marcus serves on the Advisory board of Capital Creek Partners, as well as Princeton’s Faith and Work initiative. Prior to TXV, Marcus worked at Vida Capital and MarketAxess.
Marcus received his B.A. from Princeton University. He is a member of the Center for Conscious Leadership. He was recognized as a member of the Forbes 30 under 30 class of 2022, as well as named one of the 500 most powerful CEO�s in Dallas for 2020 and 2021.
Education/Personal Bio: B.A., Princeton University

Name: Evgenia Plotnikova
Investing Thesis:
Dawn Capital is Europe’s leading specialist B2B software venture fund. The firm has over $2bn in assets under management, a portfolio of over 85 companies, and a diverse 40-person team.
Dawn Capital is investing in early-stage SaaS companies looking to build global category leaders.
Professional Bio: Evgenia is General Partner at Dawn Capital leading on Dawn’s SaaS deals, with a particular focus on data, automation and cloud infrastructure, from early stage all the way to pre-IPO. Evgenia has led Dawn’s investments into businesses such as Dataiku, Firebolt, Soldo, FlowX.AI and the exit of Granulate. She was the youngest woman in Europe to be internally promoted to GP and is also a Forbes 30 Under 30 winner and judge, a TechStars mentor and one of Business Insider’s 100 Coolest People in Tech. Prior to Dawn, Evgenia spent multiple years in venture and private equity, including at Atomico, a pan-European VC, and TPG, a San Francisco based PE giant. Evgenia is a Sciences Po Paris and Wharton graduate.
Education/Personal Bio: Evgenia holds a Bachelor’s degree in Political Science and Economics and Master’s degree in Finance and Strategy from SciencesPo Paris. She also studied at the Wharton School, University of Pennsylvania.

Name: Mia Morisset
Investing Thesis: Investing in early and growth stage opportunities in vertical saas.
Professional Bio: Focused on later stage growth opportunities in B2B SaaS (focused in productivity software) and consumer marketplaces (focused in travel & hospitality).Currently involved with: Hopper, Talent.com, Super, AlayaCare, AppDirect, Workjam, BenchSci, LifeHouse

Name: Brittney Riley Gavini
Investing Thesis: Direct investments in the Care Economy, Fund investments in emerging managers, Advancing women's power and influence - investing in Funds and Companies
Professional Bio: Brittney Riley Gavini’s work focuses on driving capital to overlooked people and problems by making venture capital more equitable and effective. She has over a decade of experience focused on early-stage innovation, as an operator, investor, and LP. For the last five years, Brittney has been at Pivotal Ventures, an investment and incubation company founded by Melinda French Gates. There, she invests in emerging venture funds and leads direct investments in the Care Economy. Previously, Brittney led the US ventures team at Village Capital, where she built the process and team to source, train, and invest in early-stage companies in Fintech, Health, and Education. Brittney spent the beginning of her career at early startups, focused on growth and community in the consumer tech space.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Jerry Lu
Investing Thesis: Consumer tech
Professional Bio: Jerry has undergone a rather unconventional professional transformation from data scientist to venture capitalist. As a Partner at Maveron, a consumer-only venture capital firm known for their focus on seed and series A investments, Jerry specializes in identifying strategic opportunities at the intersection of consumer and culture. His time at Google, where he contributed to the launch and growth of YouTube's inaugural paid subscription services (YouTube Red, YouTube Music, and YouTube TV), further demonstrated his expertise in the realm of consumer-internet businesses.
Education/Personal Bio: Jerry is an individual with a strong penchant for both physical fitness and fashion. He dedicates his free time to pursuing these interests, frequently visiting the CrossFit gym in the early morning hours and indulging in weekend shopping sprees to discover new and exciting brands. Hailing from the culturally rich Bay Area, Jerry is a proud Taiwanese-American currently residing in the vibrant city of New York.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia

Name: Amer Al Ameri
Investing Thesis: We seek to catalyse the growth of early and late-stage companies that are at the forefront of technology and market disruption. We focus on tech-enabled sectors, where rapid innovation and market evolution offer substantial opportunities for outsized returns.
Professional Bio: Amer Al Ameri joined ADQ in 2020 and is Head of Venture Capital & Technology Investments. He is a highly experienced investor having successfully deployed over $3 billion throughout his career. Amer is passionate about partnering with founders that are seeking to create structural improvements in industries at a global scale. Since joining, Amer has led the firm’s push into technology, covering investments across industries including fintech, digital health, e-commerce, as well as several deep tech opportunities. Previously, Amer held investment roles at other investment institutions. He also spent time supporting the Government of Abu Dhabi’s efforts to enhance the local innovation ecosystem through public policy and fiscal measures. Amer is a board member of some of the leading technology companies in the Middle East, as well as some of the region’s most established platforms in financial services and real estate.
Education/Personal Bio: Amer earned an MBA from the University of Oxford’s Saïd Business School. His undergraduate studies focused on economics and finance, where he earned a degree from Pace University in New York City. He is an avid reader, outdoor enthusiast, and aspiring triathlete.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI

Name: Andy Will
Investing Thesis: The fund's thesis stems from our view that software businesses being built in the age of AI will look very different from those built in previous eras.  From team composition to tech infrastructure to fundraising trajectory to unit economics, software businesses will be able to scale in a more efficient way than they have historically. We believe this shift presents a unique opportunity for founders who can capitalize on it.  We aim to identify and support those founders at the early stage.
Professional Bio: Andy Will is the Founder and Managing Partner at Willpower Venture Capital.  Prior to Willpower, Andy was a founding member of Zeal Capital Partners, spending the last 4.5 years leading investments across the Fintech Future of Work Categories and Healthcare categories. Prior to Zeal, he spent 1.5 years as an investor at Listen Ventures, focused on the Fintech and Maternal Health categories. Prior to Listen, Andy spent 1 year as the Head of Trading at TOMS Capital, tasked with leading the equity capital markets portfolio as well as structuring all investments. Andy also liaised with the alternatives team on venture investments. Prior to TOMS, he spent 5 years at JP Morgan trading equity derivatives.
Education/Personal Bio: Andy holds an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, with concentrations in Accounting and Entrepreneurship. HE holds a BS from The University of Notre Dame, Finance Major. As a member of the Men’s Lacrosse team, he appeared in two final fours and one National Championship. in his personal time, he loves taking on new fitness challenges. Most recently, he completed my first Ironman 70.3.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Ines Streimelweger-Pohl
Investing Thesis: Fintech, Europe, Series A and B
Professional Bio: Ines is a Principal in Hedosophia’s Fintech team based in London, focusing on early stage opportunities across Europe and Israel. Hedosophia is a global investment firm supporting category defining Internet and technology companies. She’s also an active angel investor. Prior to this, Ines was part of Creandum’s investment team in Berlin, covering early stage companies across DACH and UK with a particular interest in climate tech. Before moving into VC, Ines worked as Chief of Staff at BCG Digital Ventures (now BCG X) and Rocket Internet in Berlin, Germany. Where she was also closely involved in the incubation of numerous new businesses.
Education/Personal Bio: Ines was born and raised in Vienna, Austria. She completed her studies in the UK, reading Modern Languages (French, Russian) with Business at the University of Nottingham (BA) and Management, Organisations and Governance at the London School of Economics (MSc). Ines currently splits her time between London and Berlin.

Name: Anderson Thees
Investing Thesis: Endeavor is the Leading Global Community Of, By, and For High-Impact Entrepreneurs
Professional Bio:
Anderson Thees, co-founder Managing Partner of Redpoint eventures. Anderson Thees was also CEO of Apontador, the leading local search startup in Brazil, and Investment Director at Naspers/MIH, being responsible for the entry of the Internet unit in Latin America. At Naspers, he invested in and served as an executive and board member in leading companies such as Movile/iFood and Buscap. At Redpoint, his team invested in +40 companies, including early stage investments in 4 of the regions first unicorns (Gympass, Creditas, Rappi, and Olist). 
Anderson Thees served as Global Ambassador and Brazil MD of Endeavor, as vice-president of the board of ABVCAP, and board member of BayBrazil, EVCF, and Cubo. 

He holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from Unicamp, has an MBA degree from Yale SOM and SEP from Stanford GSB.

Born and raised in Brazil, Anderson lived in Switzerland and USA, and visited +50 countries. Married to Fernanda, father of Carolina (17) and Rafaela (13), likes to run and pretends to sing rock.
Education/Personal Bio: He holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Science from Unicamp, has an MBA degree from Yale SOM and SEP from Stanford GSB. Born and raised in Brazil, Anderson lived in Switzerland and USA, and visited +50 countries. Married to Fernanda, father of Carolina (17) and Rafaela (13), likes to run and pretends to sing rock.

Name: Sarah Liu
Investing Thesis: Built world
Professional Bio: Partner at Fifth Wall, early stage built world investing.
Education/Personal Bio: Sarah grew up in Toronto, Canada and moved to the U.S. for college. After graduating from the University of Pennsylvania’s Wharton School, she lived in San Francisco and LA before landing in Austin, Texas. Sarah is an avid skier, hiker, baker, and ceramicist.

Name: Ajay Gopal
Job Title: Partner - prior BDC IT Venture Fund
Investing Thesis: Participation at late seed, lead at Series A, co lead at Series B, focused on Fintech and Vertical AI / SaaS primarily in North America and selectively in Western Europe.
Professional Bio: Ajay is a Partner of Framework Venture Partners, based in Toronto. Ajay is a nearly 20 year veteran in the VC, alternative investments and capital markets spaces. With an entrepreneurial background, Ajay is a partner of a healthcare services company currently in operation in Toronto. Ajay currently serves on multiple Boards of Framework portfolio companies including notable fintech companies such as ZayZoon and Countingup. Ajay’s background in engineering, business and finance is uniquely positioned to help companies across multiple functions in a truly applied manner. Ajay is keenly interested in engaging 1-1 with entrepreneurs on their scaling journey.
Education/Personal Bio: Ajay holds an MBA from the Ivey Business School, as well as Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineeringand a Bachelor of Arts (Honours) in Economics from Queen’s University. He also holds the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation. Ajay shares life with his wife and three small children in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. In his downtime, Ajay enjoys traveling, many recreational sports, including skiing, cycling and beach volleyball and is a hobby guitar player.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,London Summit 2025

Name: Jimena Pardo
Investing Thesis: Latin American founders with global ambitions building with AI
Professional Bio:
Jimena, also known as Pime, is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Hi Ventures, a leading investment fund committed to supporting founders solving Latin America's greatest problems through technology. 


The fund’s portfolio features a selection of the region’s most promising companies, including Fintual, Nuvocargo, Flink, Senzai, and many more. Their investments have led to some of the highest realized returns in the region, driven by their successful exits, most notably that of Cornershop. Specializing in early-stage, Jimena focuses on fintech, e-commerce, smart cities, and human capital sectors. 


Her most recent investments are in Mendel, and SenzAI. She holds board seats at Dentalia, Mendel, and Slang and she currently serves as a Board Member of AMEXCAP (Mexican Private Equity and Venture Capital Association). 


Before her role at Hi Ventures, Jimena was Product Growth Manager at Meta/Facebook where she oversaw user growth for Spanish-speaking Latin America. Prior to Meta, she co-founded and led Carrot carsharing as CEO, a venture-backed company that was Hi Ventures' first investment in 2012. Prior to Carrot, she was Product Manager at Hewlett-Packard.

 \n
Education/Personal Bio:
Jimena holds a degree in Industrial Engineering from the Universidad Iberoamericana, and has further specialized in Business Creation and Growth at ITAM (Autonomous Technological Institute of Mexico). 


As Carrot's founder, she became an Endeavor Entrepreneur at the London ISP in 2012. Since then, she has been actively mentoring up-and-coming entrepreneurs to build the next generation of founders in Latin America. She is passionate about her hometown, Mexico City, and is always eager to share local secrets and must-see/dining spots.

Name: Idris Bello
Investing Thesis: Early stage investing into tech enabled businesses for the everyday economy in Africa
Professional Bio:
Idris Bello, a self-described ‘Afropreneur’, is Founding Partner at LoftyInc Capital, an Africa-focused early stage venture capital firm.
 
Over the last decade through LoftyInc, Idris has led investments into over 150 of Africa’s
fastest growing startups, including three unicorns.
 
He holds degrees in Computer Engineering (BSc first class hons.) from Obafemi Awolowo
University, Nigeria, Computer Science & Data Mining (MSc.) from the University of Houston,
and Global Health Science (MSc.) from the University of Oxford, UK. He also holds an MBA
from Rice University, USA.

 Idris is a Class 28 Kauffman Fellow, further solidifying his commitment to fostering innovation and entrepreneurship.
Education/Personal Bio: Idris holds degrees in Computer Engineering (BSc first class hons.) from Obafemi Awolowo University, Nigeria; Computer Science & Data Mining (MSc.) from the University of Houston; and Global Health Science (MSc.) from the University of Oxford, UK. He also holds an MBA from Rice University, and a Certificate in Exponential Technologies from Singularity University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Nick Kim
Investing Thesis: We are a multi-thematic firm that typically leads seed and early growth investments in technology companies., We are a multi-thematic firm that typically leads seed, early growth, and secondary investments in technology companies across the US and Europe.
Professional Bio: Nick is a partner on the early-stage investing team at Upfront Ventures. Based in the Los Angeles office, he invests primarily in vertical software, aerospace, frontier tech, and national security companies. Nick focuses on leading seed-stage investments and partnering with founders throughout their long company-building journeys. Prior to joining Upfront, Nick led seed investments in enterprise, consumer, and vertical software companies at Crosscut Ventures. He also served as an Entrepreneur-in-Residence at Human Ventures and as an investor with the Dorm Room Fund, First Round Capital’s student-run investment fund. Before beginning his venture capital career, Nick was an early employee at Warby Parker, where he managed the Home Try-On product. Outside of his responsibilities at Upfront, Nick serves on the board of 9 Dots, an education nonprofit in Los Angeles that aims to enable LA County elementary schools – especially Title I schools – to offer a computer science curriculum and to inspire the next generation of Angelenos to become engineers.
Education/Personal Bio: Nick graduated with an economics degree from UC Berkeley and earned his MBA from The Wharton School. He is a CFA Charterholder and a trained executive coach. Nick was born and raised in Santa Monica, and returned home in 2018 after nearly a decade in New York. He spends most of his free time with his wife and daughters, but will put everything on hold when the Kings are in the Stanley Cup playoffs.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Guto Araujo
Investing Thesis: Latin American focused Seed/Series A venture fund
Professional Bio:
Guto is an entrepreneur turned venture capitalist as Operating General Partner at monashees, an early-stage venture capital firm with a sector-agnostic approach fostering growth in Latin America.

In his role at monashees, Guto adopts a "fractional founder" perspective, providing guidance as a board member and advisor to portfolio companies. He also leads the firm's Network Services, a team aimed at nurturing a mutually supportive community of founders and providing specialized operator advisory services.

Before joining monashees, Guto was the co-founder of Elo7, a Brazilian marketplace for handmade and custom-ordered products backed by monashees, Accel, and Insight Partners, which was acquired by Etsy in 2021. Earlier in his career, he held product and general management roles at Yahoo and DivX.
Born and raised in Brazil, Guto lives in Colorado with his wife and younger kids where they enjoy exploring the outdoors, skiing and playing tennis.

He attended Computer Engineering school at UNICAMP, received a degree in Communications from USP, and an MBA from Kellogg School of Management.
Education/Personal Bio: ⁠Born and raised in Brazil, Guto lives in the US with his wife and kids. He studied Computer Engineering at University of Campinas (UNICAMP), Communications at University of São Paulo (USP), and has an MBA from Kellogg.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | AI

Name: Mike Moradi
Investing Thesis: Cortado Ventures is an Oklahoma City based top-decile early-stage venture capital firm, led by successful, experienced operators. We target critical industries where our GPs have previously achieved $100m+ exits as CEOs - enterprise & frontier tech in physical & life sciences. While our core fund is focused in the south-central US, our spacetech-focused "Frontier Fund" emphasizes the US/Europe/UAE., Cortado Ventures is an Oklahoma City based early-stage venture capital firm, led by successful, experienced operators. We target critical industries in the US "midcontinent" (the south-central states of OK, TX, NM, CO, KS, MO, & AR), where we have exited our own companies for $100m+, including enterprise and frontier tech in the physical and life sciences. We are also raising a SpaceTech fund with a former NASA Administrator and a prominent Middle Eastern family.
Professional Bio: Mr. Moradi is a healthcare-focused VC investor and entrepreneur, who left dental school to start his first company. That company failed, but was followed by many successful ventures in the nanotech and biopharma industries. Mike is a co-founder and general partner at Cortado Ventures, a top-decile early-stage VC firm with over $110m AUM across two funds. Mike is a co-founder of Sensulin, a diabetes-focused biopharma company, and was previously a co-founder and CEO of a pharmaceutical company targeting ocular complications of diabetes, and a specialty Contract Research Organization (eyeCRO), which was the #264 fastest growing private company in the Inc. 500. He co-founded Nanopolaris (now Unidym), which was acquired in 2011 by a publicly traded South Korean company for $145M USD, and NanoSource, which was acquired by DuPont in 2002, largely considered the first major acquisition in the nanotech space. Mike was a trustee for the $13B USD Oklahoma Pension Employees Retirement System (OPERS), and a member of the audit committee. He is an advisory board member for the Health Finance Institute, a director of Grand Founders, a regular attendee of the flagship TED conference, and the World Economic Forum in Davos. He holds a degree in biochemistry from the University of Oklahoma, with additional coursework from the John F. Kennedy School at Harvard University, Oxford University’s Saïd Business School, Cambridge University’s Judge Business School, the Lee Kuan Yew School of Public Policy at the National University of Singapore, and the University of Cape Town’s Graduate School of Business. Mike was named to the World Economic Forum’s (WEF) 2017-2022 class of Young Global Leaders (YGL).
Education/Personal Bio: Mike was born in Iran, to an Iranian father and a Hispanic-American (Tejana) mother, and is the youngest of 3 brothers.  Their family fled Iran before the revolution, and he mostly grew up between Denton, TX and Bartlesville/Tulsa, OK. His wife Jennifer is a real estate attorney who is “funemployed” and they have two children, Macy (13 y/o) and Isaac (15 y/o).  They live in Norman, OK and can frequently be found traveling abroad. Mike is also very active with the World Economic Forum’s Young Global Leaders program as an alumnus, and regularly helps fund and organize YGL educational programs around startups, VC, entrepreneurship, and empowerment initiatives.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Patricio Aznar Leon de la Barra
Investing Thesis: Latam early stage technology investments
Professional Bio: Patricio is Managing Partner of Nazca and oversees the fund’s operations and investments. He started his career in equity research a decade ago and, ever since, has been in the Latin American VC industry, starting as an analyst in one of the first startup incubators in Mexico back in 2014. Since then, he has co-founded a company-builder focused on HealthTech & EdTech startups. For more than 3 years, he worked for IDB Lab, investing in VC funds and startups all over the region, while working on developing the entrepreneurial ecosystem in Latam. After the IDB, Patricio co- founder Bridge Latam, and early stage fund based in México, with some of the best founders in the region, and in 2025 they formalized a merger with Mexico based fund Nazca.
Education/Personal Bio:
Patricio is a graduate of Unioversity Iberoamericana, where he graduated with a major in international business with a specialty in finance. He has attended executive education at Haas Business School.

 \n

Name: Lucas Lima
Investing Thesis: Early-stage investments in Latin America
Professional Bio: Lucas is a co-founder and investor at Caravela Capital, a Brazilian venture capital firm focused on early-stage investments in the Latam region. He also worked at Rumo Logistics, a Brazilian rail riding company, and CWB Capital, an M&A boutique. Before founding Caravela, Lucas founded Curitiba Angels, the most prominent angel investment group in the south of Brazil, and invested in many companies as an angel investor.
Education/Personal Bio:
Lucas completed his undergraduate degree in law at Universidade Positivo in Curitiba, his master's degree in business at Hult International Business School in London, and other executive education programs, such as 500 Startups VC Unlocked at Stanford University. 


Lucas is passionate about tennis, sports, wine, and holistic health.

 \n

Name: Chirag Locham
Investing Thesis: Investing in early-stage managers and investing directly at growth stage
Professional Bio:
Chirag has been an LP for nearly a decade. 

He was Head of VC and US Tech PE at Miras Investments, a leading global family office headquartered in Dubai. Chirag built the global venture capital strategy through investing in both funds and directs. In addition to Venture Capital, he also focused on US Tech Private Equity, thereby covering the full breadth of technology investments from early-stage to buyouts.

Before embarking on his journey in the investing world, Chirag started his career as an avid coder, working on multiple programming languages. He has worked as a techno-functional consultant at Deloitte (SAP division) and a software developer at Honeywell (Aerospace division) in Bangalore, India.
Education/Personal Bio:
Chirag earned his MBA from the Indian Institute of Management Ahmedabad (IIM A) and holds a Bachelor of Engineering in Electronics and Communications from the Manipal Institute of Technology, Manipal. 

A tech enthusiast at heart, Chirag enjoys listening to music and playing table tennis and badminton. Born and raised in diverse regions of India, he now lives in Dubai with his wife and son.

Name: Evaline Tsai
Investing Thesis: Gigascale Capital backs climate-tech companies transforming the world’s largest sectors and making clean choices a no-brainer. From the lab to large-scale deployment, we act as thought partners on key scientific and technical decisions, accelerating learning rates, and establishing solid business foundations. With experience founding companies and navigating every stage of growth, we know what it takes to create game-changing technology.
Professional Bio:
Evaline is a Principal at Gigascale Capital where she brings a deeply scientific and technical point-of-view to building climate solutions. Before Gigascale, she spent two years as an investor at Fine Structure Ventures, where her investments included Commonwealth Fusion Systems, Boston Metal, Debut Biotech, Phytoform, and Hoxton Farms.
Before becoming an investor, Evaline founded a Y-Combinator-backed healthcare company; was the first product manager on machine learning at Samsara; and published multiple journal articles spanning experimental, theoretical, and applied research in climate tech and biotech.
Education/Personal Bio:
Evaline graduated from Princeton University with a BSE in Chemical and Biological Engineering. She then went on to earn her PhD in Chemical Engineering and Biotechnology from University of Cambridge.

Evaline is from the Bay Area and after spending almost a decade on the East Coast and the UK now lives in San Francisco. In her free time, she enjoys hiking, watching films, and exploring new parts of the world through travel.

Name: Brendan Mathews
Investing Thesis: Early-stage venture capital fund powered by The Motley Fool's brand, investing approach, and communities.
Professional Bio: As managing partner, Brendan is active in all aspects of Motley Fool Ventures' investing process, including sourcing, diligence, and portfolio management. He joined Motley Fool Ventures in 2018. Previously, he was a senior analyst in The Motley Fool’s U.S. investing team, where he worked closely with Motley Fool co-founders David and Tom Gardner on their stock picks. Prior to that, he was a manager in Accenture’s strategy practice.
Education/Personal Bio: He has an MBA from University of California-Berkeley and an economics degree from University of Virginia. He lives in Charlottesville, Va., with his wife and children.

Name: Mohammed Ahmed
Investing Thesis: Growth stage investing across Emerging Markets, Investing into Growth stage technology businesses in Emerging Markets, Growth stage investing in the GCC
Professional Bio:
Mohammed is Founder and Managing Partner of Chiltern Street Capital, a global asset manager that invests in technology-enabled businesses across Global Emerging Markets

Mohammed is a venture and growth equity investor and was most recently at SoftBank’s $100B Vision Fund, where he focused on Portfolio Management, Capital Formation and Investor Relations. Prior to this, Mohammed built and scaled an Education SaaS business in the UK, with a roster of global clients

He started his career in investment banking at Barclays Investment Bank in London, advising central bank and sovereign wealth fund clients on portfolio diversification within the capital markets and on asset allocation into alternatives. He originated, structured and executed on a number of one-off macro level transactions aimed at helping his sovereign clients hedge their economic and macro risk. He culminated his career at Barclays as Head of Emerging Markets for Sovereign Wealth Funds

Mohammed sits on the Executive Advisory Board of Prostate Cancer Research, the only charity that focuses solely on the advanced stage of the disease, which causes the majority of prostate cancer deaths and for which treatments are currently limited. Mohammed is also an Advisor and mentor to a handful of companies and their CEOs across the globe, spanning technology firms in Emerging Markets, to brick-and-mortar businesses in Developed Markets

Mohammed is a Kauffman Fellow, and holds an MBA from INSEAD, where he was the 2015 Class Valedictorian. He has a BA (with Honours) and MA (Oxon) from the University of Oxford, where he read Modern Languages (Russian) & Oriental Studies (Arabic), prior to which he was educated at Eton College in the UK
Education/Personal Bio: Mohammed is a Kauffman Fellow, and holds an MBA from INSEAD, where he was the 2015 Class Valedictorian. He has a BA (with Honours) and MA (Oxon) from the University of Oxford, where he read Modern Languages (Russian) & Oriental Studies (Arabic), prior to which he was educated at Eton College in the UK

Name: Eddie Lee
Investing Thesis: Early growth strategy to partner with post-revenue companies and help accelerate profitable growth.
Professional Bio:
Eddie brings ten years of venture capital, private equity, and strategy experience. Since joining White Star Capital in 2018, Eddie led investments across SaaS, fintech, digital health, mobility, and web3. He works closely with founders on growth, product, and corporate finance.

He started his career in New York with J.P. Morgan Private Equity Group and later held a strategy role with the firm's Big Data and Business Intelligence Group. Prior to his corporate career, Eddie served in the South Korean armed forces as a member of the Army's strategy and operations unit. During his service, he was deployed to Haiti as part of the UN Peacekeeping Operations.
Education/Personal Bio: Eddie graduated Summa Cum Laude from Syracuse University with a double major in Information Systems and Advertising. He holds an MBA from Columbia Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,London Summit 2025

Name: Terry Chou
Investing Thesis: deep tech AI companies
Professional Bio:
Terry is a Partner and founding member of Alpha Intelligence Capital (AIC), a deep-tech AI/ML focused VC fund since 2018.  Terry oversees  AIC's APAC region from Singapore, and quarterbacks her European team's dealflow. Terry led AIC’s investments in ReaQta (acquired by IBM in 2021), SenseTime (HKSE: 0020), AI Music (acquired by Apple in 2022), QxBranch (acquired by Rigetti in 2019), Envelop Risk, Osaro, GetVisibility (acquired by Forcepoint in 2025), Pix AI, BentoML, 6sense and Vamstar.  
Prior to AIC, Terry spearheaded technology investments at VMS Investment Group (US$2.0bn+ AUM). She deployed over US$180m investments in technology and health-tech investments, with notable investments such as iQiyi (Nasdaq: IQ), Universal Medical Group Company (2666.HK) and Talkingdata.
Education/Personal Bio: Terry was born and raised in Hong Kong. She currently lives in Singapore with her husband and their 2 boys. In her free-time, Terry passionately tends to her dying rooftop garden. She holds a BSc in Economics from the London School of Economics.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Aakash Kapoor
Investing Thesis: Software/ AI, Fintech
Professional Bio: Aakash is an investor with PeakXV Partners (formerly Sequoia India-SEA) based in Singapore. Aakash invests in early-stage companies from seed to Series B stage, particularly focused on fintech, payments and consumer internet sectors, in SEA and ANZ. At PeakXV, Aakash is also a founder member of Surge, a global early stage program.
Education/Personal Bio: I did not plan to be in venture capital. For as long as I can remember, I wanted to be an entrepreneur. I started a company right out of college. Through a series of events over 6 years, I then landed up at Sequoia Southeast Asia – now Peak XV. When asked if you'd be a founder again, I always tell people, “I am a founder. I’m just in the business of investing.”
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | South East Asia,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Matt Maurer
Investing Thesis: Startups applying AI and AI-native solutions to corporate/enterprise use cases. All industries.
Professional Bio:
A founder/operator at heart, Matt is a partner at WVV Capital. WVV is a 100M early-stage venture fund backed by four major corporations, and its hybrid structure allows the team to make strategic investments while still serving startups with the agility of a traditional fund. Matt currently serves on the boards of Blueberry, Bend Health, and Posterity, and his investing focuses primarily on AI, digital health, finTech/insureTech, and climateTech. 

Matt is a cross-industry serial founder, most recently building Stroll Health — a Silicon Valley digital health company that used machine learning to reverse-engineer healthcare pricing models in order to help patients and providers to find affordable in-network care.  They exited to eviCore, which was acquired by Cigna (NYSE: CI) where Matt went on to serve as Senior Director. Matt is also a recipient of the Alan K. Ruvelson Fellowship, and is a graduate of the John D. Odegard School of Aerospace Sciences.
Education/Personal Bio:
Matt hails from Hutchinson, MN, a small rural town outside of Minneapolis. He graduated with honors from the University of North Dakota (one of the top aviation universities in the world), where he completed two degrees and earned his pilot’s license. During his time he also helped to form, and later served as president/managing director for, the Dakota Venture Group - the first ever student-managed venture fund.

Driven by personal experience and seeking to make a difference, Matt made his way to Silicon Valley and into the digital health industry, where his founder experience led him through the NSF-sponsored Lean Launchpad for Life Sciences at UCSF, UC Berkeley’s SkyDeck, and the Texas Medical Center’s TMCx program. He is an active angel/advisor/board member, as well as an amateur pilot, overconfident ice hockey player, and an avid musician.

Name: Terhi Vapola
Investing Thesis: Accelerationg the green transition through the power of AI
Professional Bio: Terhi Vapola is a result-oriented venture capitalist with the focus on green transition, climate tech, digitalization, internationalization, and business growth.  She is Founder & Managing Partner of Greencode Ventures, a venture capital firm focusing on the most impactful European early-phase digital-first green transition startups. Most recently before this, she founded and headed Helen Ventures, the investment arm of a leading Nordic energy company Helen, where she led its creation from the initiation to a strong portfolio across Europe all the way to its first portfolio exit.  Prior to this, she has worked as Managing Director of sustainability focused investment firms, co-founded multiple startups, and contributed to the rapid global business growth of Nokia in multiple operative roles ranging from R&D, product management to sales and acquiring startups.
Education/Personal Bio: Terhi Vapola received her D.Sc. degree from Aalto University.  She also holds degrees in Technology Management and Industrial Economics, and in Electrical and Electronic Engineering.

Name: Andy Hwang
Investing Thesis: Early-stage Enterprise, Deep Tech, Sustainability in Southeast Asia
Professional Bio: Andy joined Wavemaker Partners as a General Partner in 2022. He is an angel investor, startup coach, and was a former global and regional leader at Facebook, Google, and Stripe. During his 10 years at Facebook, Andy helped the company launch in Asia and served as Managing Director for the SMB and mid-market advertising business, growing it to over 2 million customers and $6 billion in annual revenue.
Education/Personal Bio: Andy holds a bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from the University of California, Berkeley and an MBA from The Wharton School.

Name: Aaron Fu
Job Title: Director, Venture Investments, Investor, Fintech Ventures
Investing Thesis: DCG is a builder, incubator and investor. We identify pivotal, nascent technologies, and drive their advancement while developing the robust systems they need to thrive.
Professional Bio:
Aaron leads emerging market and fintech investments at DCG with a mission to enhance the world’s financial systems. He holds the belief that when cutting edge technology is applied to accessible, contextually tailored financial solutions, especially in emerging markets - exponential value is unlocked for both individuals and businesses, enabling them to scale and thrive. 


Previously, he served as a Partner at the Catalyst Fund, a pre-seed fund and accelerator, backing category champions in fintech and climatetech across Africa, LATAM and Asia including Cowrywise, Lami, Kwara, Graviti, FarMart and Octavia Carbon. He was also the Managing Director for MEST, Africa’s largest pre-seed fund and incubator with 90+ companies in their portfolio, and began his venture career as Managing Partner for Africa at Nest.vc, a seed fund and corporate accelerator - leading partner programs with Visa, MTN and Barclays in Africa and DBS, AIA, Infiniti in Asia. 


Aaron is also a co-founder of several ecosystem strengthening initiatives including Venture for Africa, a talent platform for product, finance, marketing and operations professionals to launch careers with startups in Africa and the Obuntu Foundation, a 501c3 dedicated to the growth of operator led, emerging VCs in Africa. 


He has also co-founded a number of tech companies including Lompang, a motorcycle ride-sharing startup and Verso Digital, an insurtech focused digital studio with clients including Prudential Insurance, FWD and Fullerton Health. 


Aaron began his career in financial services, spending time at Societe Generale and Standard Chartered in product, marketing and operations functions based in Europe, Asia and Africa.
Education/Personal Bio:
Aaron received graduate degrees from the University of Oxford and the University of Edinburgh with specializations in Strategy, Innovation and Emerging Markets. He also holds a BBus in Economics and Finance from RMIT University, Australia. 


Aaron’s an island boy from Singapore, a passionate scuba diver, amateur kite surfer and gamer. He’s also fascinated by the world’s cultures and their origins and has been lucky to live and work across the world (Africa, Asia, Australia and North America).

Name: Min Kim
Investing Thesis: We believe now is the time for Korean founders are well-positioned to develop services with a global reach, indicating a strong potential for Korean businesses to expand internationally and compete on a larger scale.
Professional Bio: Min Kim joined 500 Global (500.co) in 2015 as a first employee of the 500 Korea regional fund, where she was instrumental in establishing the fund&#039;s presence in Korea. An astute investor, Min has focused on investing in various sectors such as Fintech, SaaS, Healthcare, and Esports, with a particular emphasis on elevating Korean founders and helping them gain recognition in the global market.

Name: Luiz Guilherme Manzano
Investing Thesis: We partner early with software-intensive startups in Brazil and beyond
Professional Bio: Founder of big_bets, an early-stage fund dedicated to investing in "software-intensive companies" such as Unico, Conta Simples, Justos, Ume, Menten, among others. Previously, he served as a director at Endeavor, the world's largest entrepreneurial support network, in Brazil. He has been supporting and investing in entrepreneurs for over 15 years and believes he will continue to do so until his brain stops functioning.
Education/Personal Bio: Born and raised in São Paulo, Brazil, he graduated in business administration from FGV-EAESP. Throughout his career, he has taken several extension courses, such as the Executive Program at Singularity University and Innovation and Global Mindset at Tel Aviv University. The fact that he didn't become a professional soccer player is one of the main reasons Brazil has been without a world title for over 20 years.

Name: Joshua Garcia
Investing Thesis: unfair advantages
Professional Bio: Josh is an Investment Director with a decade of experience in the realms of private equity, venture capital, and co-investments. As Investment Director at Allocate, he helps lead investment efforts across venture, growth, and other private market strategies. His responsibilities include portfolio construction and management for the Firm's commingled and custom vehicles, manager sourcing and diligence, and serves a pivotal role in the firm's client experience and educational efforts.
Education/Personal Bio: A Texas native, Josh received a BA in Finance from The University of Texas at San Antonio. In his spare time, Josh enjoys exploring new motorcycle routes, weekend mornings at Barton Springs, and spending quality time over good meals with family and friends.

Name: Joyce Zhang
Investing Thesis: Concentrate portfolio with mature and emerging managers
Professional Bio: Joyce Zhang joined the investment team at Wallace in 2016. She assists the chief investment officer in the management of the foundation’s investment portfolio. Her responsibilities include the monitoring of investment managers, and risk management and analytical support.​​​​
Education/Personal Bio:
​​​Zhang worked as a senior fixed income trader at Ping An Asset Management, one of the largest insurance companies in China. There, she traded Chinese and Hong Kong stocks and international bonds for 200 portfolios with more than $100 billion in assets and was one of the firm’s top traders. Earlier, as an intern at Xin Tian Fund Management, a global macro hedge fund, Zhang analyzed global currencies and commodities, and developed computer models to monitor the Chinese fixed income markets.​​​​

 

​​​Zhang received her M.B.A. from Yale University. She holds an M.S. in global business from Pepperdine University and a B.S. in electrical engineering from Sun Yat-sen University in Guangzhou, China. Zhang is both a chartered financial analyst (CFA) and chartered alternative investment analyst (CAIA).​​​​

Name: Kin Lam
Investing Thesis: LP
Professional Bio: Same
Education/Personal Bio: A dedicated musician, Mr. Lam has performed internationally as a violin soloist and concertmaster, including with the Cambridge University Symphony Orchestra. He earned his master’s degree in business administration (MBA) from the Yale School of Management, masters of philosophy (MPhil) from the University of Cambridge, and a bachelor of arts (BA) degree with distinction and honors in Economics from the University of California, Berkeley on full scholarship as a Bill and Melinda Gates Millennium Scholar.
