Name: Kofi Ampadu
Investing Thesis: The TxO thesis is to invest in and support driven, talented founders who lack the necessary resources to scale their ventures, with a focus on software-enabled companies operating at the intersection of culture and lifestyle, including sectors such as art, music, fashion, food, and recreation.
Professional Bio:
Kofi Ampadu is a partner at Andreessen Horowitz, where he leads the Talent x Opportunity Initiative (TxO), a fund that focuses on identifying entrepreneurs who possess the talent, drive, and innovative ideas necessary to build successful consumer companies at the forefront of culture and lifestyle but may lack the traditional network and resources. Since its inception in late 2020, the TxO donor-advised fund has supported over 50 startups, providing crucial funding and networking opportunities.

As Head of TxO, Kofi selects up to 20 startups annually, providing each with $175K and a spot in TxO’s 16-week accelerator program. He provides comprehensive support to TxO founders in areas including business development, customer acquisition, and fundraising, extending beyond the duration of the accelerator.

Before joining a16z, Kofi founded SKU'd Ventures, a venture fund specializing in consumer packaged goods. He also authored 'SKU’d Thoughts,' a blog series exploring trends in the consumer and retail sectors, and served as a venture advisor at Yale University's Tsai Center for Innovative Thinking. His earlier venture roles included scouting positions at Prototype Capital, Indie VC, and Republic.

His passion for venture stems from his experiences as the co-founder of H2Melon, a health-oriented beverage company, and Par, a marketplace for trading airline miles. His roles as a fellow in the Startup Leadership Program and as Alumni Director for its New York chapter deepened his commitment to supporting under-networked entrepreneurs. In 2020, Kofi was profiled as one of Business Insider’s “100 rising-star VCs”. He currently serves on the National Advisory Board for ForbesBLK, a global community dedicated to driving systemic change in business, culture, and society through the empowerment of Black entrepreneurs and professionals.

Prior to entrepreneurship and venture, Kofi began his career as a packaging engineer at Kraft Foods and as a strategy consultant at Accenture, where he delivered sustainable business solutions to Fortune 500 clients.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kofi graduated with a BS from the Rochester Institute of Technology and later earned an MBA in Strategy and Operations from Carnegie Mellon University's Tepper School of Business, where he was a Consortium for Graduate Study in Management Fellow. 

Originally from Ghana, Kofi is deeply interested in how startups can significantly advance the development of the African continent. He currently lives in New York City with his wife.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Derek Chu
Investing Thesis: Network Effects and Early-Stage Consumer/Enterprise in US East/West & Europe, Consumer Social, Network Effects, Marketplaces
Professional Bio:
Derek is a Principal at FirstMark, where he focuses on consumer internet investments and serves as a Board Observer at Pickle and MetaLoop.

Derek was previously a business unit leader at Airbnb, where he served as Chief of Staff to the Co-Founder & CSO, helped launch and co-lead Airbnb China with the COO & President, led business operations for North America’s $10B GMV business, and first joined as Corporate Development Manager in the Office of the CFO (Deal Lead on the Series F, China M&A, acquisition of Luxury Retreats)

Before Airbnb, Derek was a Senior Associate at Menlo Ventures, where he sourced and served as a Board Observer at Tenor (acquired by Google), Synthego, and The Black Tux. Derek began his career as an Analyst in the TMT Investment Banking Group at Credit Suisse and graduated with honors from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania with a B.S. in Finance
Education/Personal Bio: B.S. in Finance, Wharton 2011
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness

Name: Avi Bharadwaj
Investing Thesis: Cloud, AI, Cyber, Robotics, Hardware
Professional Bio:
Aravind “Avi” Bharadwaj is an Investment Director at Intel Capital and is based in the Bay Area.

 

Avi led Intel Capital’s investments in Bria AI and Twelve Labs, and focuses on investments in data, analytics, artificial intelligence/machine learning platforms, and enterprise software, among other areas.

 

Prior to Intel Capital, Avi was a Principal at Innovation Endeavors, an early- and expansion-stage venture capital firm where he primarily focused on enterprise software investments. While at Innovation Endeavors, Avi served as a board director/observer for companies such as AlphaSense, RightBound, Datorama (acquired by Salesforce, Inc.), DataRails, and TuneIn.

 

Previously, Avi was a data scientist in the strategy and analytics consulting practice at IBM. Prior to that, he was a full-stack software engineer at Goldman Sachs.
Education/Personal Bio: Avi grew up in Bangalore, India and studied electronics engineering in his undergrad. He holds an MS in Information Systems from Carnegie Mellon University. In his free time, Avi enjoys traveling and landscape photography.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,London Summit 2025

Name: Tatiana Shalalvand
Professional Bio: Tatiana leads Kinnevik’s early stage practice, is an Investment Director in the Kinnevik investment team and works closely with portfolio companies such as Aira and Agreena. Prior to joining Kinnevik, Tatiana spent four years working at Inventure focusing on pre-seed and seed stage businesses in the Nordic region. She started her career as a crisis management consultant and spent several years in different commercial roles at early and scale up staged tech companies before moving over to the investor side.
Education/Personal Bio: Tatiana studied at Lund University in Sweden and ESCP Europe in France. She holds a Bsc in Business and Administration.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,London Summit 2025

Name: Kelly Goldstein
Investing Thesis: Aligning our investments with The Pritzker Org Portfolio
Professional Bio:
Kelly Goldstein is a Partner and Head of Platform at 53 Stations. Previously, Kelly played a foundational role in building HQ Digital LLC, a subsidiary of Digital Currency Group, where she established the private investment platform, launching four funds and strategic SPVs. At Harlem Capital (“HCP”), she contributed to fund development as the second full-time hire, sourced and led investments in seed stage companies, and initiated the Diversity Marketing Consortium, providing portfolio companies with pro-bono marketing services.

Prior to receiving her MBA and pivoting into early stage investing, Kelly’s career began in brand development at Edelman and Unilever. Kelly’s time at Unilever culminated in leading a partnership with Vital Voices, investing in women social entrepreneurs, which was the catalyst for her move into full time investing.
Education/Personal Bio: Kelly earned a BA in Sociology and Economics from Bowdoin College, where she also played on the varsity volleyball team. She later completed her MBA at the University of Michigan Ross School of Business where she founded and led organizations dedicated to helping women students break into VC and startups. A New England native from Stratford, Connecticut, Kelly has lived in three countries and nine US states, and now resides in Eau Claire, Wisconsin near her husband's business. Kelly enjoys practicing yoga, hiking, traveling, and spending time with her family, including her 19-month-old son and nearly 4-year-old daughter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Stephanie Choo
Professional Bio:
Stephanie Choo has served as Partner at Portage since 2016. She runs the investment team in North America., and serves on the board of several portfolio companies, including Albert, Atomic, Benepass, Conquest Planning, and Kikoff. She is passionate about partnering with the next generation of Fintech entrepreneurs globally and spends most of her time in consumer Fintech, embedded infra, payments and crypto. 

Prior to Portage, she led a team, which built and launched a leading digital advice platform in Canada, which now serves over 2M Canadians. Before that, she worked at BCG, where she nudged several large financial services incumbents to modernity. Her journey to Fintech started at a mobile payments startup, which was a lot of fun, but didn’t work.

Stephanie is based in the United States, but is a proud first generation Canadian. She holds a B.Comm. from Queen’s University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,Singapore Trek 2025

Name: Nitin Prasad
Professional Bio:
Nitin Prasad has over 25 years of experience spanning industries from Semiconductors to Energy / Clean Energy and geographies from USA, Singapore to India. Nitin holds 10 patents and has won numerous awards and recognitions including Economic Times Most Promising Business Leaders of Asia, Business Times 25 hottest young executives, Fortune 40 under 40, Economic Times–Spencer Stuart 40 under 40 etc. Nitin has delivered business turnarounds, building and scaling of new business verticals, development of energy transition / climate change strategy, launched and operated new business verticals in Semiconductors, Chemicals, Energy and Clean Energy (Electro-Mobility, Bio-Products, Renewable Power, Energy Access, Industrial Decarbonization and Sustainable Chemicals) and influencing policy change in India. 
In his previous role as Chairman of Shell Companies in India, Nitin had oversight over all of Shell’s companies and investments into India. He has spearheaded Shell India’s response to the energy transition and climate change, driving the strategy to build Shell India into a material, highly profitable multi-billion dollar low carbon business through organic growth and acquisitions while addressing legacy issues. Nitin has also built Shell’s Open Innovation platforms in India incl. conceptualizing and launching India’s leading energy and mobility incubator – Shell E4 with over 40+ investments in early-stage ClimateTech startups
delivering a 5x return, while also directing the deployment of Shell Ventures fund with 10 growth equity minority investments through Series B+ rounds and advising on the impact investing vehicle – Shell Foundation. Nitin is an independent director at NSE listed Cyient and was a Chairman / Director in multiple Shell Group JVs and other ventures in India and South East Asia.
Nitin is a sustainability champion and well recognised thought leader on climate action who is frequently invited to engage the relevant Ministries, members of parliament, IPCC, COPs and was the Co-Chair of ESG Action Council for the B20 in India.  He has published Shell’s 2050 scenarios for India (in partnership with TERI); published a guide to how India can exceed its 2030 emissions ambition launched at the G20 - T20 culmination event; released numerous policy papers on the new sunrise sectors (Hydrogen, Off-shore Wind, Carbon Markets etc.); authored several articles; been extensively featured in numerous climate and energy conferences and been frequently referenced or quoted in the media. Nitin has also co-founded multiple cross-sector, industry wide coalitions – Industry Net Zero (over 60 members, active in COPs), Build Ahead (construction decarbonization) and Carbon Capture Utilization and Storage (CCUS). Nitin is a strong advocate of collaborations and partnerships being key to solving climate change and other global systemic challenges.
Education/Personal Bio: Nitin did his schooling from the Doon School, India and Frankfurt, Germany; got his engineering degree from Georgia Institute of Technology, USA and did his MBA from INSEAD, France. He is an avid sports enthusiast who enjoys playing golf, tennis, sailing, skiing and diving. Nitin currently lives between New Delhi and Singapore with his family.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Allison Myers
Investing Thesis: Digital Solutions for Climate
Professional Bio:
Allison Myers is a co-Founder and General Partner of Buoyant Ventures, an early-stage venture fund focused on digital solutions for climate. Buoyant looks for scalable, climate-positive, technology-driven solutions that support adaptation to and mitigation of climate change using data, sensors, and innovative business models.
Allison spent almost a decade as an executive at Accenture Strategy developing transformational strategies for large corporations in the energy, mobility, and built environment. Her work focused on customer, regulatory, business model, and innovation strategies leveraging digital technologies to drive speed and scale. As a leader within her practice, she published thought capital and oversaw Accenture Strategy's MBA internship program. Allison started her career at a healthcare start-up, acquired by Walgreens focused on aligning care costs with care complexity.
Education/Personal Bio:
Allison received her BA from Dickinson College and her MBA at the University of Michigan, where she was an Associate for the Michigan Social Venture Fund. In 2021 she was a Chicago Council for Global Affairs Emerging Leader. Today Allison sits on the board of Michigan Climate Venture, a student-run climatetech fund at the University of Michigan.
Allison lives in Denver and spends her free time enjoying the outdoors skiing and hiking.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Nmachi Jidenma
Investing Thesis: Early stage/incubation
Professional Bio: Nmachi Jidenma works on the investment team at the venture capital firm, General Catalyst where she partners with exceptional founders to help build enduring companies. Prior to joining General Catalyst, Nmachi was a Senior Director at Sequoia Capital. Prior to Sequoia Capital, Nmachi served as a global strategy and business development lead at WhatsApp Inc, the world’s leader in mobile messaging with over 2 billion monthly users. She has a Masters in Applied Economics from Cornell University.
Education/Personal Bio:
\n 

Nmachi Jidenma’s life mission is to drive transformational impact and bend the arc of human progress. She was drawn to the tech industry because of technology's power to transform the lives of people and communities. Over the years, this led her to take on various partnerships and leadership roles at WhatsApp, Facebook and PayPal. As a strategy and business development leader, she forged alliances with global industry leaders, helped bring new products to market and designed dynamic ecosystems of partners and developers. Over time, she increasingly found herself advising founders on go-to-market topics. This inspired her to transition to the venture industry by joining Sequoia Capital as a Senior Director. 

She was drawn to General Catalyst’s commitment to help build enduring companies that create financial and societal impact and in 2022, she joined the GC team. 

Outside of work, Nmachi enjoys traveling, reading, and making music. She is also a trustee of her family’s foundation, which advances leadership, mentorship, and socio-economic development in Africa.

 \n 

 \n

Name: Logan Ashcraft
Investing Thesis: More efficient, lower-carbon industrial and defense
Professional Bio:
Logan Ashcraft is a Principal at Standard Investments, a multistage family office with ~$4B AUM. Prior to Standard, she held investment and operational roles at Congruent Ventures, Centrica Innovations, Plenty, and Deloitte Consulting. 

Broadly recognized for her expertise in international development and energy, Logan is a Schmidt Futures International Strategy Forum Fellow and grant recipient. She has over a decade of experience working across North America, Central America, Southeast Asia, and Southern Africa.
Education/Personal Bio: Logan earned two Bachelor’s degrees from Johns Hopkins University and a Master’s degree from Yale University. She is a competitive sailor and one of few female skippers in the worldwide J/88 sportsboat class. She resides in San Francisco and shares time across New York City and Newport, Rhode Island.

Name: Tessa Flippin
Investing Thesis: Capitalize VC invests pre-seed capital in commerce-enablement tech companies solving critical problems for retailers, brands, creators, and manufacturers as they navigate a shifting landscape., Pre-seed, commerce enablement, women and diverse founders
Professional Bio:
Tessa Flippin is the Founder and Managing Partner of Capitalize VC, a Chicago-based VC fund investing in pre-seed stage, diverse founders in the multi-trillion dollar, rapidly growing commerce industry at the intersection of commerce enablement, commerce infrastructure, fintech and consumer brands. 

Tessa began her career in venture capital as a venture investor at TechNexus, a Chicago-based fund, where she invested in enterprise SaaS technologies at the seed stage. She went on to join Genius Guild Greenhouse Fund as a Venture Partner, investing in founders in fintech, health tech and connectivity.

Prior to venture capital, Tessa founded La Plataforma, a fintech payments platform, sending international money transfers throughout Latin America. 

Tessa actively serves on the boards of BLCK VC Midwest and Chicago:Blend working to bring diversity to the tech ecosystem.
Education/Personal Bio: Tessa attended Stanford University for undergrad where she ran Track and Field and joined Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. She went on to receive her MBA from Columbia Business School where she studied entrepreneurship, venture capital and social impact.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Kerry Wei
Investing Thesis: Looking for disruptive companies at the inflection point of accelerated growth. Targeting companies going after large TAMs, with a durable business model, exceptional management, validated product market fit, attractive unit economics, and a path to profitability
Professional Bio:
Kerry Wei is a Partner at Prysm Capital where she provides growth capital to disruptive management teams across technology and consumer markets. Investing across stages, Kerry is passionate about partnering with innovative teams and being a trusted thought partner to help them achieve their vision and potential. 

Her board roles include: Replit, FieldAI, Ergeon, Chowbus, POW Interactive, and Outerspace
​

Prior to Prysm, Kerry was at Boston Consulting Group (BCG), where she led teams and executed due diligences in industries such as enterprise software, consumer technology, and services. She also partnered with management teams to transform their businesses, especially on go-to-market strategy, pricing, corporate development. In addition, she has spent some time at a consumer food start-up helping the founder across marketing, sales, finance and operations, where she experienced first-hand the joys and struggles of entrepreneurship.


Outside of Prysm, Kerry is also an active cohort lead for All Raise cohorts, as well as leading certain AAPI founder & investor intiatives around the Bay Area.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kerry earned her MBA degree from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, and a Master of Finance degree from MIT.


She currently resides with her husband and their baby boy in San Francisco. She enjoys exploring local bakeries, hiking, and rooting for Warriors at Chase Center. However, at present she is more likely to be found investigating how best to get a baby to sleep through the night.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Max Swicegood
Investing Thesis: I provide liquidity to employees of venture-backed technology companies that are scaled, growing, and capital efficient.
Professional Bio: Max Swicegood is a Principal at Savano Capital Partners, a Baltimore-based investment firm that is focused on direct secondaries in late stage, venture-backed technology companies. Prior to joining Savano, Max was a Director in the corporate venture arm of Wells Fargo where he focused on Series A through Series D technology investments. Max first began investing in technology at Vista Equity Partners as part of the firm’s credit fund and spent the first part of his career as a generalist in private credit.
Education/Personal Bio: Max is a graduate of Georgetown University. Originally from Salisbury, North Carolina, Max now resides in Baltimore, Marlyand.

Name: Vincent Park
Investing Thesis: investing in promising technology-first companies with exceptional team that build scalable and repeatable solutions to solve clear pain points and bottlenecks
Professional Bio: Vincent Park is an investor and tech enthusiast navigating between the nuanced blend of the Western and Eastern cultures, rooted in his upbringing across different countries. His two decades of experience in the finance and investment industry has helped him build a strong network in Asia, the US, and Europe. He works today as the head of investment and COO of IRONGREY, a tech-focused single family office based in Korea, whose sponsor family is linked to one of the largest domestic steel making groups. He oversees a diversified portfolio of more than a hundred assets across different sectors and geographies. Prior to this position, Vincent worked for Korean securities firms including Hana Daetoo Securities and started his career at BNP Paribas in France. He holds a master’s degree in international commerce from Seoul National University and a bachelor’s degree in international business from Ecole Supérieure du Commerce Extérieur.
Education/Personal Bio: Vincent holds a master’s degree in international commerce from Seoul National University and a bachelor’s degree in international business from Ecole Supérieure du Commerce Extérieur.

Name: Sweta Rau
Investing Thesis: early stage fintech from idea to pre-series A, Early stage fintech
Professional Bio: Early stage fintech investor India sea
Education/Personal Bio: GP at White venture capital
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | LATAM,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Renata Arauz-DeStefano
Investing Thesis: LP investing in emerging managers
Professional Bio:
Renata is an investor at Pivotal Ventures, a Melinda French Gates company.  In her role, Renata backs women-led venture capital funds and makes mission-aligned direct investments. 


Prior to joining Pivotal, she spent a decade bridging the finance and social impact sectors, having held roles in microfinance, investment banking, start-ups, and venture capital.  She most recently was based in Nairobi, first as an investor with a climate-focused fund called KawiSafi Ventures and then as an independent consultant.    


Earlier, she worked as an investment banker with Bank of America Merrill Lynch and tried her hand at entrepreneurship, launching a Malawi-based social enterprise.
Education/Personal Bio: Renata holds a BA in International Relations and French from Tufts University and an MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania.  A proud SEO and Toigo alumna of Ecuadorian descent, she is passionate about increasing access to capital for diverse GPs and founders and building a bench of future capital allocators who reflect the changing demographics of the US.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Sarah Sclarsic
Investing Thesis: Better, cheaper products to decarbonize the global economy.
Professional Bio: Sarah is an investor, board member, and former researcher and startup founder. As Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Voyager Ventures, she invests in early-stage climate technology companies in North America and Europe. Sarah has been building and investing in transformative technology companies since 2009 and brings expertise in mobility, biotech, food and materials production, and carbon removal. Prior to Voyager, she co-founded car-sharing firm Getaround and served as the founding business director of Modern Meadow, the world’s first company making bio-fabricated leather. Sarah is a technical advisor to Frontier, the $1B fund to purchase carbon removal. She earned her Master’s degree at MIT where her research focused on novel bio-based pathways to achieve gigaton-scale carbon removal.
Education/Personal Bio: Sarah is a graduate of Harvard and MIT. She lives in New York City.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Kiswana Browne
Investing Thesis: Spotlight Venture Partners is an early stage VC firm investing in financial and operational AI for small businesses and the real economy, including manufacturing, construction and energy. We back technical founders with deep domain expertise building automation that replaces decades of manual work.
Professional Bio:
Kiswana is the Founder and Managing Partner of Spotlight Venture Partners, an early stage VC fund focused on financial and operational AI for the real economy, including manufacturing, construction and energy.

Prior to Spotlight Ventures, Kiswana was an Investor at Newark Venture Partners, an early-stage VC firm founded by the founder of Audible, where she spearheaded the Fintech investment vertical. She was an Investor at Plug and Play Ventures, where she played a pivotal role in bridging the gap between major financial institutions and the most promising startups on a global scale. At the outset of her investing career, Kiswana was an Investment Banker at MD Global Partners, serving small to mid-cap companies across multiple sectors, such as Healthcare and Industrials, on transactions and capital raising.

Before becoming an investor, Kiswana operated in the tech industry, leading multi-million dollar software development projects for top financial and energy corporations such as JP Morgan Chase, UBS Investment Bank, and National Grid. She has led cross-functional teams comprising more than 100 professionals, including engineers, UX designers, and account executives, spanning three continents, to create impactful software solutions.

Inspired by this experience, Kiswana transitioned from leading teams to empowering the next generation. She recognized the critical gap in the STEM workforce pipeline and became a founder, building a platform to bridge the education-to-employment transition in technical industries. 

Kiswana’s dynamic career path underscores her unwavering passion for transforming bold ideas into reality.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kiswana earned an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business and a BA in Economics from Hobart and William Smith College.


She currently lives in Los Angeles, CA where she enjoys performing arts, scenic views, writing poetry and exploring new culinary experiences.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Siddharth Pisharody
Investing Thesis: High conviction, concentrated , category winners in SEA, sector agnostic ; focus on Series A
Professional Bio:
Sid is a general partner at Argor Capital, a Southeast Asia focused, sector-agnostic venture capital fund. Argor has two offices - in Jakarta, Indonesia and Singapore and has raised two funds to date.  At Argor, Sid is an Investment Committee member and is involved on all aspects of running the organization - including fundraising, investing and overseeing operations. Sid sits on several boards of companies within the Argor Portfolio in the areas of B2B payments, Lending, Insurance, HR tech, FoodTech and EdTech.

Sid’s primary sectoral expertise is in fintech / financial services and he has spent the majority of his career evaluating, advising and investing in the sector. Prior to joining Argor in 2021, he spent ~7 years at Temasek’s financial services/fintech investments team where he was promoted to Director. At Temasek, Sid was a multi-stage investor where he evaluated and invested into a wide range of pioneering fintech business models across the world with several investments becoming iconic winners. By straddling the full spectrum (publicly listed to venture) in terms of stage, Sid developed a deep perspective in understanding what it really takes to build a long lasting, sustainable and profitable company across variou dimensions. Sid also played in instrumental role in the ideation and launch of a venture build led by Temasek which is Asia’s first greenfield sustainable infrastructure financing platform that operates as a JV between Temasek, HSBC and Asian Development Bank.  

Prior to Temasek, Sid was a consultant at McKinsey’s Singapore office working with some of the leading enterprises and government linked organizations in Southeast Asia. 

Sid began his career at J.P. Morgan’s Investment Bank focused on the financial institutions sector in Southeast Asia, based out of Hong Kong, having spent the first few years in New York City covering US financial institutions.

Sid was named “Singapore Silent Hero” in 2021, a national recognition, for his contributions to mentoring young social enterprises in Singapore.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sid holds an MBA from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania. Sid also earned a Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering from Lehigh University, Pennsylvania where he graduated at the top of his class. He currently lives in Singapore with his wife, a young daughter and a pet dog - Cavalier King Charles.

Sid is deeply influenced by the diversity of cultures and exposure he has had having travelled to ~50 countries to date. Sid grew up in India (till age 17, across 3 cities), then spent 5 years in the US before moving to Hong Kong for 3+ years at age 22 before returning back to the US to spend 2 years during his MBA. Following the MBA, Sid has spent the last 12 years in Singapore with very frequent travel across Southeast Asia.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: David Chang
Investing Thesis: Global cross border
Professional Bio:
David, a second-generation venture capitalist, has a broad spectrum of passions and interests beyond his professional focus on technology and investments. He is deeply involved in the world of nootropics and bio-hacking, focusing on cognitive enhancement and promoting extended vitality. He is also a certified Crossfit Level 2 trainer.

In addition to his intellectual pursuits, David is an avid enthusiast of BJJ, olympic-lifting, golf, swimming, snowboarding and ice-mountaineering.

David founded MindWorks Capital in 2013 to invest and empower Asia’s brightest entrepreneurs to build transformational companies. MindWorks manages capital from university endowments, global asset managers, fund of funds, family offices as well as Asia's leading new economy entrepreneurs. The firm utilizes a Pan-Asia strategy to source direct investments in technology companies across both Greater China and Southeast Asia. The firm is headquartered in Hong Kong with offices in Beijing, Shanghai and Jakarta. 

MindWorks has been recognized by Preqin as a top-performing ASEAN venture capital firm and is also a signatory of United Nations’ Principles for Responsible Investment.

The firm currently manages over US$1.3 billion in total net asset value across its funds.
Education/Personal Bio: David graduated from the University Of California, San Diego with double bachelor degrees.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Joe Dormani
Investing Thesis: Investing in early-stage AI companies in Legal, Tax, Compliance, RIsk / Fraud, and Fintech
Professional Bio:
Joe is a partner at Thomson Reuters Ventures where he leads a team of global investment professional. In his role, Joe invests in AI/Machine Learning Infra/Apps, Enterprise Software, and Vertical SaaS. He has led investments in Datagrail, Spellbook, Materia, Fieldguide, Detected, Neo.Tax, Truewind, CentML, Wisedocs and more. 


Joe has held a variety of strategy, finance, and product roles over his 15-year career. He has led M&A deals valued in the hundreds of millions, driven strategy for multi-billion-dollar organizations, and helped scale high growth software products.  Previously, he led corporate strategy for Thomson Reuters Legal Tech business.  Joe is also active in the New York tech scene where he works with several incubators and early-stage startups as an advisor.  He started his career at a data-tech startup where he discovered his passion for the world of venture capital.
Education/Personal Bio: Joe holds an MBA from Fordham Gabelli School of Business, where he focused on Finance and Management, and a BS in Political Science and Economics from Siena College
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Kavita Gupta
Investing Thesis: Blockchain/crypto, Blockchain, crypto early stage
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Megan Ruan
Investing Thesis: Gold House Ventures backs top Asian Pacific entrepreneurs across industries and leverages its singular network of Asian founders, VCs, executives, and A-list celebrities to supercharge their growth.
Professional Bio:
Megan Ruan is co-founder and General Partner at Gold House Ventures, the first venture fund in North America built to invest exclusively in startups founded by Asians and Pacific Islanders (APIs). Gold House Ventures is the venture arm of Gold House, a nonprofit founded to elevate APIs through cultural unity, investment opportunities, and promotion. Megan principally built Gold House’s founder and investor networks, respectively the leading networks of Asian Pacific entrepreneurs (55% identifying as female) and early-stage investors (300+ Partner-level institutional VCs) in North America. \n 

Prior to launching Gold House Ventures, Megan launched the Gold House Ventures Accelerator, a biannual incubation program for API founders and the only venture-backed startup accelerator in the US with programming specifically tailored for API entrepreneurs. The program’s 115 alumni since 2020 have collectively raised more than $1.5 billion. Megan is a Forbes 30 Under 30 Honoree in Venture Capital, a Signature Block Emerging 50 Venture Capitalist, Susa Venture Fellow, and member of Global Women in VC. She has been featured as a speaker and advocate for the API community by TechCrunch, Forbes, CNBC, ABC, AdWeek, NYU Stern, Chicago Booth, Yale School of Management, Stanford Graduate School of Business, and more. \n 

Prior to founding Gold House Ventures, Megan led venture capital investments at the Johnson & Johnson family office and advised institutional and family office clients at Morgan Stanley in New York. Megan co-founded and serves as Managing Partner of Stanford Graduate School of Business’ 23 Fund, investing in startups founded by the MBA Class of 2023.
Education/Personal Bio:
Megan is a first generation Chinese American born and raised in Arden Hills, Minnesota. After spending her first 18 years in the Midwest, Megan has been a coastal ping pong ball, splitting her last decade between New York City, New Haven, and the Bay Area. She received her Bachelor’s Degree from Yale University and her MBA at Stanford Graduate School of Business. She is a passionate advocate for creating spaces where underrepresented voices can thrive and unwaveringly believes in the power of cultural affinity to promote unity and economic success. 


Megan loves travel, books, food, and music, and is based in New York City where you can find her dancing at concerts in Brooklyn, running along the West Side Highway, and spending far too much time trying to score impossible dinner reservations on Resy.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Rob Freelen
Investing Thesis: SozO helps scaling companies GTM in Asia, primarily Japan., Sozo helps scaling companies GTM in Asia, primarily Japan.
Professional Bio: Rob Freelen is a Managing Director and general partner at Sozo Ventures, co-founder of an LA-based FinTech company, and a former SVB executive. Since joining Sozo Rob has championed investments in companies transforming skin care, manufacturing, farming, early stage cancer Dx, cybersecurity, and batteries: Haus Labs & OuterBio, Atomic Machines, Carbon Robotics, Mercy Bio, Doppel, and Stacked Energy. Prior to Sozo Rob was an executive at Silicon Valley Bank where he ran multiple business units including Venture Capital Relationship Management, the Los Angeles region (‘15-’20), and the west coast healthcare team.
Education/Personal Bio: Rob was born and raised on the Stanford University Campus, spent a decade in Los Angeles and recently moved back to the SF area. On the weekends Rob and his family can be found on the trails in Mill Valley, CA.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare,London Summit 2025

Name: Rodrigo Borges
Investing Thesis: Agnostic early-stage VC focused on pre-seed and seed investments in LatAm.
Professional Bio:
Rodrigo Borges is a co-founding partner of DOMO.VC, an early-stage VC firm based in São Paulo, Brazil, since 2016. DOMO.VC manages four funds and has invested in over 100 startups within its portfolio. Within DOMO, Rodrigo's primary focus lies on the investment process, deal flow, and technological infrastructure. Additionally, he provides support to more than 30 portfolio companies across two seed funds.

In 2014, Rodrigo joined Koolen & Partners as a Partner, a proprietary fund boasting three unicorns: Loggi, Gympass, and Hotmart.


Prior to his role at Koolen & Partners, Rodrigo co-founded Buscapé in 1998 with three university friends. Over the course of 16 years, he worked across various areas including tech, product development, business development, and M&A. Buscapé evolved from a comparison shopping search engine in Brazil to a comprehensive ecommerce platform serving Latin America, offering solutions such as payment services, free classifieds, and an affiliate network. The company was acquired by Naspers in September 2009.
Education/Personal Bio:
Rodrigo Borges graduated with a bachelor's degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering from the Polytechnic School of the University of São Paulo (POLI - USP). During his time at POLI, he served as a research fellow at the Architecture and Computer Networks Laboratory, which is part of the Department of Computer Engineering and Digital Systems.


Outside of academia, Rodrigo enjoys spending time with friends and family, traveling, and watching movies. In his free time, he frequents the gym and delves into topics such as entrepreneurship, technology, innovation, and history. Rodrigo also serves as a mentor for entrepreneurs through Endeavor.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF | LATAM,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Samer Sadek
Investing Thesis: We are looking for global tech plays focused on enterprise productivity and value creation
Professional Bio: Samer is currently a Principal at e& Capital, a USD 250 million Series A fund located in the UAE. In his capacity at e& Capital, Samer has been involved in all investments made by the fund to date. Before joining e& Capital, Samer contributed to various startups as an advisor, founder, and member of the management team, collectively raising over USD 150 million.
Education/Personal Bio: Samer graduated with a Bachelor of engineering, majoring in Chemical Engineering in the American university of Beirut
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Dubai,London Summit 2025

Name: Jewel Burks
Investing Thesis: Future of Work, Care, and Community Infrastructure
Professional Bio:
Jewel Burks Solomon is the Managing Partner at Collab Capital based in Atlanta, GA. Collab Capital is an early stage firm investing in the building blocks of Black prosperity. 

​

Prior to leading Collab Capital, Jewel was Head of Google for Startups, US, where she created initiatives that have deployed over $50M in non-dilutive capital to 350+ Black and Latino-led businesses since 2020. Jewel's passion for leveling the playing field for Black founders was born from her own experience. Jewel was the Founder/CEO of Partpic, a startup that was acquired by Amazon in 2016, which streamlined the purchase of maintenance and repair parts using computer vision technology.
Education/Personal Bio:
Jewel serves on the boards of The Community Foundation for Greater Atlanta, Endeavor Atlanta and The Center for American Entrepreneurship. 


She graduated from Howard University with a degree in Business Administration. A native of Nashville, TN, Jewel now resides in Atlanta, GA with her husband and son. In her spare time she enjoys reading, painting and supporting her family’s small businesses.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025

Name: Alaina Hartley
Investing Thesis: Greycroft is a multi-stage venture capital firm with 3 strategies: Software, Sustainability, and Consumer Brands.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Jesús Salas
Investing Thesis: The firm focuses on SMB Tech and consumer companies targeting overlooked consumers in a culturally-aligned way., Our focus areas are SMB SaaS and culturally-aligned consumer tech, where we seek out founders building innovative tools and brands that support the next generation of small business owners and authentically serve diverse communities.
Professional Bio: Jesús Salas believes that making culturally conscious investments is a path to increasing opportunity and positive economic outcomes for otherwise overlooked communities and founders. Jesús is a Principal with LA-based venture capital firm Slauson & Co. and has held roles with firms such as Omidyar Network, Rethink Education, Credit Suisse, and Deloitte.
Education/Personal Bio:
Outside of Slauson & Co., Jesús is involved in a range of organizations committed to increasing diversity at all professional levels. These efforts include VCFamilia, Founder Familia and HBCUvc. Lastly, Jesús is an Advisory Board Member of Microlumbia- Columbia Business School’s student-run impact investing fund.

Jesús is from the northside of Fort Worth, Texas, and is the son of Mexican immigrants. Jesús is a proud first-generation graduate of Stanford University, holds an MBA from Columbia University, and is an alumnus of the Just Economy Institute.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Mark George
Investing Thesis: Invest in emerging managers with funds smaller than $250M
Professional Bio:
Mark George is a seasoned investor, and business leader, currently serving as the founder and Managing Partner of Atacama Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund of funds based in San Francisco. In this role, Mark strategically allocates resources to support emerging venture capital managers. Before establishing Atacama Ventures, Mark graduated from Stanford GSB in 2017.

Earlier in his career Mark was an early employee at Bizo, an advertising technology company and he played a pivotal role in Bizo's trajectory, culminating in its acquisition by LinkedIn in 2014. In addition, Mark is a board member of the Texas Rattlers, a professional bull riding team.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Rodney Appiah
Investing Thesis: Cornerstone VC is a mission driven venture capital fund focused on a ‘people first’ investment strategy, investing at pre seed and seed stage into high growth UK technology companies led by diverse founding teams operating across Health and Sustainability, Future of Work and Social.
Professional Bio:
Rodney Appiah is the Founder and Managing Partner of Cornerstone VC, an early stage fund focused on a ‘people first’ investment strategy, investing at pre-seed and seed stage in UK technology businesses led by diverse founding teams. The fund focuses on SaaS, marketplaces and platforms that seek to change the way we live, work and play. 
Prior to founding Cornerstone VC, Rodney held roles at BGF, Foresight Group and Merrill Lynch and has more than 15 years of financial services, TMT and Consumer experience across UK and Europe.
An experienced board director, Rodney is a Non Executive Director of the UK Business Angels Association (UKBAA), the largest UK trade body for angel and early stage investing, and Conduit Connect, a direct investment platform that focuses on connecting global high impact businesses with mission aligned investors. Rodney also holds committee roles at Innovate UK (Innovation Loans Credit Committee) and the London Chamber of Commerce (Black Business Association).
Education/Personal Bio: Rodney was born and raised in the UK to Ghanaian parents who emigrated to the UK in the 1980s. He holds a Bsc in Economics from Royal Holloway, University of London and lives in London with his beautiful wife and 3 sons, aged 6 and 1 (twins). Rodney enjoys reading, politics, Liverpool and music. He is passionate about faith and making meaningful change in his community.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,London Summit 2025

Name: Kat Kennedy
Investing Thesis: Pre-Seed and Seed in the Mountain West
Professional Bio:
Kat Kennedy is passionate about building - products, companies, and the startup ecosystem as a whole. Before joining Kickstart as a General Partner, Kat was President and CXO of Degreed, a company dedicated to changing how people develop skills, build expertise, and grow their careers. She was instrumental in driving Degreed’s growth, shaping its product and culture, and deepening its client relationships. She partnered closely with Degreed’s customers to accelerate innovation and ensure their ability to quickly reallocate talent to the most critical strategic priorities. 

Kat’s 15 years of operating experience give her a unique perspective as an investor - one that allows her to not only spot talented entrepreneurs from all backgrounds but also to serve as a mentor, fostering innovation through every stage of the company’s growth.
Education/Personal Bio: Kat holds a Bachelors in Information Systems from Utah State University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Women's Group,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Susannah Duke
Investing Thesis: We invest mostly in B2B software, across all sectors and at the seed, A and B stages.
Professional Bio: Pelion Venture Partners is a $420M early-stage venture capital firm that focuses on software investments across the US. Susannah (Suz) joined Pelion as an investor in 2018. Suz invests in and works with Seed, Series A and Series B B2B software companies across all sectors. A few portfolio companies Suz works with includes: Redo, Trace, MX, BigPanda and Formant. Prior to joining Pelion, Suz worked at Goldman Sachs and later in management consulting where she worked with startups, non-profits and Fortune 500 companies.
Education/Personal Bio: Suz got her undergraduate and MBA from BYU. She has 2 kids, Zoey (3) and Max (1). Suz loves to ski, play soccer and read.

Name: Eloho Omame
Professional Bio:
Eloho Omame is an Africa-focused technology venture capital investor. A Partner at TLcom Capital, a seed-to-early growth stage firm, and co-Founder and General Partner at FirstCheck Africa, a female-focused pre-seed firm.

TLcom Capital invests in Africa's best entrepreneurs tackling the continent's biggest challenges. Across two funds, with capital under management of approximately $250 million, the firm’s investment portfolio includes high-growth companies across multiple sectors in Nigeria, Kenya and Egypt. Eloho represents TLcom Capital on the boards of several portfolio companies.

In 2021, she co-founded FirstCheck Africa, one of only a few female-led and female-focused technology venture capital firms operating on the continent. FirstCheck Africa’s investment portfolio includes early-stage startups with category-defining potential in Nigeria, Kenya, Egypt and South Africa. Through FirstCheck Africa, she is committed to helping Africa's exceptional female entrepreneurial talent build great companies.

Eloho has helped shape Nigeria and Africa's technology ecosystem for many years. From 2018 to 2021, she worked at Endeavor, the world’s largest support organisation for high-growth companies at the scale-up stage. She was the inaugural Managing Director & CEO of Endeavor in Nigeria, creating the most sought-after community for technology entrepreneurs in West Africa. 

In 2017, on behalf of the Lagos State Employment Trust Fund (LSETF), under the auspices of one of Africa's largest sub-national governments, she delivered "Lagos Innovates", a first-of-its-kind portfolio of support programs for early-stage innovation-driven enterprises (IDEs) in Africa, that she conceptualised, designed and implemented. Lagos Innovates has supported hundreds of entrepreneurs and created thousands of jobs.
 
Eloho is an inaugural member of Nigeria’s National Council for Digital Innovation and Entrepreneurship, established under the provisions of the Nigeria Startup Act (2022) and chaired by His Excellency the President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, General Muhammadu Buhari (GCFR), where she represents the interests of the technology and innovation ecosystem. She’s a member of the Steering Committee of the Digital Economy Policy Commission of the Nigerian Economic Summit Group (NESG). In 2018, Eloho served as a member of the Presidential Advisory Group on Technology & Creativity, chaired by His Excellency the Vice President of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo (GCON).

Deeply committed to Africa’s technology and venture capital ecosystem, Her views have been featured numerous times in regional and global publications with respect to the African technology and venture capital ecosystem, including TechCrunch, the Financial Times, the Economist, Quartz Africa and Tech Cabal.

Eloho began her investing career in the U.K. as a Vice President at General Atlantic, a global growth equity firm. Before that, she was Head of Corporate Development at First Bank of Nigeria, leading the bank’s first cross-border M&A and executing inorganic growth projects across multiple financial services verticals. She started her professional career as an investment banker, supporting corporate finance and M&A advisory mandates at Credit Suisse and Renaissance Capital in the TMT and FMCG sectors in Europe and Nigeria.
 
She holds an MBA from the London Business School and a BSc. in Economics from the London School of Economics and Political Science.
Education/Personal Bio:
Eloho Omame is an Africa-focused technology investor. She’s a Partner at TLcom Capital, an early-stage VC firm with over $200m in capital under management and co-founder of FirstCheck Africa, one of a few female-focused pre-seed funds on the continent. She has invested in technology companies across Africa’s “big 4” VC markets — Nigeria, Kenya, Egypt and South Africa — and sits on the boards of several high-growth companies. 

A member of Nigeria’s National Council for Digital Innovation and Entrepreneurship, established under the country’s pioneering Startup Act in 2022, Eloho began her investing career as a Vice President at General Atlantic, a global growth equity firm. She was Endeavor’s first Managing Director in Nigeria and worked as an investment banker at Credit Suisse in London. She holds an MBA from the London Business School and a BSc. in Economics from the London School of Economics and Political
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Lisa Cawley
Investing Thesis: Investing in emerging managers
Professional Bio: Lisa Cawley is the Managing Director of Screendoor. Lisa is responsible for the entirety of the Firm’s operations, including portfolio management, strategy development, community engagement, and operations. Screendoor is an investment platform that invests as an LP of GPs to support new managers raising early institutional funds to build an enduring firm. Screendoor plays an active role in helping managers build their firms with a meaningful capital commitment and curated mentorship from established GPs who have all built their own firms and can assist new managers with the unique challenges that come along with firm-building. The Firm also intentionally facilitates relationships between their institutional partners and portfolio GPs, so they have early visibility and access into the next generation of leading firms as they scale. Prior to Screendoor, Lisa worked with a private multi-billion-dollar global investment firm where she was involved in all aspects of managing the firm’s private market portfolio, including sourcing and manager due diligence, asset allocation and forecasting, and creating and implementing the firm’s investment data tools and analytics. Lisa started her career at Ernst & Young where she served private equity and consumer products clients.
Education/Personal Bio: Lisa earned an MBA and MSF, as well as a BBA in Accounting with minors in Information Systems and Spanish from Loyola University Maryland. Lisa is a CFA Charterholder and holds a CPA from the State of Maryland. She spends her free time with her husband, young daughter, and chocolate lab.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Women's Group,London Summit 2025,Sao Paulo Trek 2025

Name: Pocket Sun
Professional Bio:
Pocket Sun is the Co-founder and Managing Partner of SoGal Ventures, a pioneering early-stage venture capital firm with $55M+ AUM, backing world-class women and diverse founders beyond Silicon Valley.

Since 2015, Pocket and her co-founder Elizabeth Galbut have invested in 150+ startups, identified five unicorns at inception, and delivered top-quartile returns to over 200 diverse LPs. SoGal is known for spotting what the world needs before it becomes obvious—often backing founders who go on to create entirely new categories in AI, digital health, care, sustainability, and culture-defining tech.

At the heart of Pocket’s investment philosophy is a belief in compassionate futurists: visionary entrepreneurs who build with empathy, science, and precision to transform how we live, work, and stay healthy.
Education/Personal Bio:
Pocket received her Master of Science in Entrepreneurship and Innovation degree from University of Southern California, and Bachelor of Business Administration from the College of William and Mary. She was also in the inaugural program of VC Unlocked at Stanford University. 

Pocket is currently based in Vancouver, Canada with her partner and best friend, Dongfang. She travels frequently with no jet lag. Outside of work, she enjoys snowboarding, trying new restaurants, and hunting for vintage rare finds.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Simon Sharp
Professional Bio:
Simon Sharp is a Senior Partner at Global Ventures, a UAE-based, Series-A focused firm investing in entrepreneurs with a global mindset. The firm seeks innovative growth-stage companies that are transforming emerging markets through disruptive enterprise technologies. Global Ventures has invested in over 70 companies across the Middle East and Africa region and is currently deploying from its third fund. 

Prior to Global Ventures, Simon worked in the investment team at Committed Capital, a venture capital fund based in London which focused on early-stage technology investments.
Education/Personal Bio: Simon is a Chartered Accountant with the ICAEW, a Member of the Chartered Institute for Securities and Investments and holds a BSc in Mathematics from the University of Warwick.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Chris McCann
Professional Bio:
Chris McCann is a a founding General Partner at Race Capital, a venture capital fund based in Palo Alto with a focus on early stage enterprise infrastructure companies. The fund was early investors in companies such as Databricks, Vectara, Play.ai, Groq, and others. 

Prior, Chris founded and led the community program at Greylock Partners, a San Francisco based venture capital firm with $3.5 billion under management which led investments in Facebook, LinkedIn, Figma, Dropbox, and Coinbase, among others.

Before he joined the firm, he was the co-founder and CEO of StartupDigest – one of the earliest technology focused email newsletters – which he grew from zero to over one million subscribers before being acquired by Techstars.
Education/Personal Bio:
Chris McCann is a graduate from California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispo with a degree in entrepreneurship and engineering and on a personal basis Chris was an early advisor for the Thiel Fellowship & StartX at Stanford University.

Outside of work Chris is an avid photographer won the National Geographic Photographer of the Year award in 2016.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto

Name: Ben Grabiner
Professional Bio:
Ben is a Founding Partner at Side Stage Ventures, a leading early stage venture fund in Australia.  Built by founders for founders, we write the first cheque into exceptional companies and then lean in to help the founders build and scale.  

Ben was also the Co-Founder of Platoon,  a platform for emerging creative talent that helped launched the careers of global artists such as Billie Eilish & Jorja Smith and was acquired by Apple in 2018.  Prior to that, Ben was the first employee at UK-based venture fund, LocalGlobe.  

When not helping founders create and scale transformative companies, Ben can usually be found chasing his three young kids around the park.
Education/Personal Bio: Ben is a graduate of London School of Economics, where he earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Government and Economics.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Zach Ellis
Professional Bio:
Zach Ellis, Jr. is the Founder and Managing Director of South Loop Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund backing transformative technology companies led by diverse founding teams. His investment focus spans healthtech, climate tech, fintech, and sportstech—sectors where he leverages deep experience across venture capital, corporate innovation, and university tech transfer.

Zach previously served as Managing Director at Rev1 Ventures, led investments on the corporate venture team at PepsiCo, and supported the commercialization of early-stage research at both The Ohio State University and the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation.

He is a Lecturer in Venture Capital at Rice University’s Jones Graduate School of Business and actively contributes to the broader entrepreneurial ecosystem as a board member of Lemonade Day and an advisor to the Weinert Applied Ventures in Entrepreneurship (WAVE) program at the University of Wisconsin-Madison. Zach began his career as an active duty, Surface Warfare Officer in the US Navy.
Education/Personal Bio: Zach earned a bachelors degree from the U.S. Naval Academy, an MBA from Pepperdine University and a master's degree in biotechnology from the University of Wisconsin-Madison.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Devon Gethers
Professional Bio:
Devon Gethers is the Founding Managing Partner at Meridian Ventures, where he leads investments in pre-seed and seed-stage entrepreneurs building innovative B2B software companies. He oversees all aspects of the firm, including sourcing, selection, portfolio management, firm strategy, asset valuation, and fundraising .

Prior to founding Meridian, Devon was a member of the deal team at Mercato Partners, a growth equity firm focused on software investments. Concurrently, he also founded, scaled, and successfully exited EarlyAdmit, the world’s leading admissions consulting firm for Deferred MBA candidates, which was acquired by private equity in 2023. 

Devon’s earlier experience includes investment roles across private equity and public equities at Goldman Sachs, Capital Group, and Grandeur Peak Global Advisors. On the operating side, he served as an International Operations Manager at a multinational consumer goods company, where he oversaw 150 employees and regional operations across the APAC region.

Devon is a Kauffman Fellow (Class 30) and a graduate of Coolwater Capital’s Emerging Manager Program (Cohort 6).
Education/Personal Bio:
Devon earned his received a B.S., summa cum laude, in Finance and Behavioral Science from the University of Utah and his M.B.A. from Harvard Business School.

He is originally from Tacoma Washington and loves to fish, weight-lift, drink coffee with friends, and spend time with his wife.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Pedro Vieira
Professional Bio:
Pedro is a scientist, turned founder, turned investor, with deep experience in the tech sector. Pedro has experience on both sides of the table as operator and as an investor, across the different stages of a venture - from idea to growth.

Pedro has been investing since 2016 as an angel and as a VC, including Founder and Managing Partner at Shilling Capital Partners (now IC Member only), a €50m+ early-stage tech fund focused on pre-seed & seed stage Portugal-related companies.

Prior to this role, Pedro supported Corporate Innovation and Partnerships initiatives and mentored portfolio company founders for 500 Global in Europe and Africa, and served as Program Director in 500 Global's programs across EMEA.

His first venture (GoodGuide.com, backed by NEA and DFJ, acquired by Underwriters Laboratories1 in 2012), created tools to help companies sell, and consumers buy, safer and healthier products.  Later, Pedro launched WestToWest.org as a tech entrepreneurial bridge between Western EU and US.

Pedro holds a Ph.D. in Civil and Environmental Engineering from U.C. Berkeley.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Emily Zhen
Investing Thesis: We invest in early stage companies in fintech, healthcare, and the future of learning and work closing gaps in wealth, health, and skills.
Professional Bio:
Emily Zhen is a Principal at Zeal Capital Partners, where she leads healthcare investments and also focuses on fintech and the future of learning and work investing. Zeal is a mission-driven, early-stage venture firm based in Washington, D.C., backing companies that close gaps in wealth, health, and skills.

Before joining Zeal in 2023, Emily was a healthcare investor at New Enterprise Associates (NEA), deploying over $500 million across all stages—from incubation to post-IPO. She began her career in healthcare investment banking at Goldman Sachs and has also worked in digital health startups, clinical research, and at the U.S. Department of Treasury.

Emily is a Forbes 30 Under 30 honoree in Venture Capital, a member of the Emerging Venture Capitalists Association (EVCA) where she co-leads the healthcare group, and an advisor to AAPI founders through Gold House Ventures.
Education/Personal Bio:
Originally from the Chicago suburbs of Naperville, IL, Emily Zhen is a first-generation Chinese American dedicated to expanding access to healthcare, education, and financial opportunity. She holds an MBA from the Wharton School and dual undergraduate degrees—a BS in Economics (Finance) and a BA in Biology—from the University of Pennsylvania.

In her free time, Emily enjoys exploring national and state parks, swimming, playing tennis, and trying new dance classes. A lifelong music enthusiast, she loves playing piano, singing, and attending live performances. She also enjoys traveling and discovering new cultures.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Aly El Shalakany
Professional Bio: Aly is currently a Venture Partner with A-typical Ventures, a $40m early-stage venture capital firm in Qatar backed by QIA that invests across the Middle East. Prior to joining A-typical Ventures, Aly was the Managing Director for Egypt and North Africa at 54 Collective, Africa’s most active, hands-on, early-stage venture capital investor. Aly was also the Managing Partner of Acasia Ventures, a venture capital firm that invests in early stage tech and tech enabled startups in the Middle East and Africa.
Education/Personal Bio:
Aly studied Economics and Political Science at the University of Toronto (Ontario, Canada) and read law at the School of Oriental and African Studies (London, UK). Before switching to VC, Aly was an M&A lawyer for over 15 years practicing in the UK, the Middle East and Africa.

Aly was also the cofounder of the the Cairo Angels, the first angel group to be founded in Africa. Aly is also a Founding Partner and member of the Investment Committee of Saudi Angel Investors, an angel fund that invests in startups in Saudi Arabia. 

Aly is also the author of Beyond the Rubicon, a blog that focuses on the intersection of venture capital, business and the economy across the Middle East and Africa.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Konstantin Vinogradov
Professional Bio:
Konstantin is a General Partner at Runa Capital, an early-stage VC firm with $0.5B+ AUM, investing in enterprise software and deep tech in the USA and Europe. He primarily focuses on open source, developer-focused, and infrastructure software.

Complementing his investments, Konstantin has also been publishing the ROSS Index, the global quarterly index of the fastest-growing open-source startups since 2020, and leading the development of Runa's internal data platform.

Prior to joining Runa, he headed an international startup competition, worked at a few seed-stage tech startups, and co-founded and successfully exited a hardware company.
Education/Personal Bio:
Konstantin earned his BSc and MSc degrees in applied mathematics and physics from the Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology. He was listed in Forbes 30 Under 30 (2019) and recognized among the top 100 data-driven VC thought leaders (2024).

Konstantin ideated and co-founded several next-gen nonprofits, including the Open Source Endowment Foundation — the world’s first endowment fund dedicated exclusively to sustaining free open-source software. He currently serves as the Chairman of its board.

Beyond his work and philanthropic activities, Konstantin is an avid reader and outdoor enthusiast with a love for nature, animals and hiking.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Infrastructure

Name: Igor Piquet
Professional Bio:
Igor Piquet brings over 15 years of experience in economic development, business strategy, and venture capital across Latin America. He leads Endeavor Catalyst’s efforts in the region, helping position the fund as one of the most active global venture investors in emerging markets.

Endeavor Catalyst is Endeavor’s global VentureCapital fund, with $500M+ raised across 4 funds and 350+ investments in over 30 countries. In Latin America alone, the fund has backed more than 120 companies, including companies like EBANX, Creditas, VTEX, D.Local, Ualá, NotCo, Rappi, Habi, Kavak, Clip, and Clara.

In addition to his role at Endeavor Catalyst, Igor serves on the board of Scale Up Ventures, an early-stage VC fund focused on Brazil, and is a founding partner at Beacon Founders, a private wealth platform offering tailored investment and liquidity solutions for tech founders across Latin America.

Originally from Brazil, Igor lives in São Paulo and is passionate about helping founders scale globally.
Education/Personal Bio:
Originally from Recife, in Brazil’s northeast, Igor holds a degree in Business from UPE and a master’s in Technology Business Management from Descomplica. He has also completed executive programs at Wharton, Harvard, and General Assembly, focused on strategy, venture capital, and innovation.

Fluent in Portuguese, English, and Spanish, Igor began working with the Endeavor network at the age of 21 and has since dedicated his career to building high-impact ecosystems across Latin America. He sees himself as a connector — committed to bridging talent, capital, and opportunity across a region historically underserved by venture funding.

He currently lives in São Paulo with his wife, who is expecting their first child. Igor is also an active mentor to emerging tech founders and younger venture capital professionals. In his personal time, he enjoys playing tennis and the drums.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM

Name: Andrea Gurnari
Professional Bio:
Andrea is a General Partner at 2100 Ventures, based in London. Andrea invests in new units of value, tools where the primary value sits behind the application layer. In addition to his role in the investment team, Andrea leads 2100's data science strategy.

Prior to 2100, Andrea was an investor at Atomico, investing in European early stage, and Connect Ventures, a product-focused European Pre-Seed and Seed investor.

Before moving to VC, Andrea was an early employee at Nivaura, a fintech B2B SaaS building capital markets' solutions using stablecoins.

He was an Associate at Goldman Sachs in the Asset Management Division and at BlackRock, in the technology consulting practice. Andrea started his career at Bloomberg, focusing on Alternatives.
Education/Personal Bio:
Andrea graduated with a BS in Finance from Bocconi University, a Diploma in Corporate Finance from London School of Economics and later earned an MBA from London Business School, where he was a Tech Disrupt Scholar. 

He is passionate about football analytics and the impact of data in sports. His best day is spent at the beach in south of France.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF | Italy,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Christopher Nakutis Taylor
Professional Bio: Chris is the Founder and Managing Partner at Nomad Ventures, an early stage Venture Fund. Prior to Nomad, Chris was one of the first 250 employees at Uber and spent 5 years building that business, first as the Regional General Manager of the South Region for the Rides product and then on the Founding Team of UberEats as the Regional General Manager of the 1/2 of North America. Before Uber, Chris worked in Private Equity at HIG Capital and also founded his own eCommerce startup, which he sold to a competitor in less than 18 months.
Education/Personal Bio: Chris received an MBA in Entrepreneurial Management from the Wharton School of Business, where he ran the Private Equity and Venture Capital Association, as well as a BA with Honors in Mathematics and Economics from Northwestern University.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Kalsoom Lakhani
Professional Bio: Kals is the Co-founder & General Partner at i2i Ventures, an early stage venture capital fund for Pakistan, and the country’s first female-founded VC fund, which opened its doors in 2019. She is also the Founder of Invest2Innovate, i2i Ventures' sister entity, which she launched in 2011 to support and unleash the potential of young entrepreneurs in growth markets like Pakistan. Invest2Innovate launched Pakistan's first startup accelerator in 2012, and has since supported 1000+ startups and trained 250+ incubators and accelerators in the region. She has trained young entrepreneurs, changemakers, and civil society leaders in countries like Kosovo, Nepal, Cambodia, Ireland, Bangladesh, Ukraine, and Kazakhstan, and has spoken at numerous venues, including the World Economic Forum, Aspen Ideas Festival, U.S. Chamber of Commerce, U.S. State Department, the Global Entrepreneurship Summit, and SXSW. In 2022, she was selected for the RoW100, Rest of World's inaugural list of 100 Global Tech Changemakers.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kals received her M.A. in International Affairs with a focus in Conflict Resolution from The George Washington University's Elliott School of International Affairs. She holds a B.A. in Foreign Affairs and Middle East Studies from the University of Virginia. She jokes that as a VC, she uses her Conflict Resolution/mediation background way more than she ever imagined.

Kals grew up as a third culture kid (TCK) -- she was born in Dubai, and grew up in Bangladesh and then Pakistan to a Bangladeshi mom and a Pakistani dad before moving to the U.S. for university when she was 18. Aside from her work hat, she's a mom to a 2 year old girl (Nia) and a 13 year old pup (Rosie), is an avid traveler, voraciously devours content (films, tv shows, podcasts & books) and then shares her fave recommendations via a monthly Substack, and is a diehard supporter of Arsenal FC. She also is the podcast host/creator of The Comparable, a series that looks at two startups building similar solutions in different emerging markets each episode.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Jack Taylor
Professional Bio:
Jack is a New York-based Partner who leads Cerity Partners Ventures’ Built World practice, focusing on sectors such as physical security and safety, home services, water technology,  labor management, multifamily technology, and more.

Before joining Cerity Partners, Jack was a Managing Director at Touchdown Ventures, a pioneer of the “venture capital as a service” model that merged with Cerity Partners in 2024. Prior to that, he began his venture career in roles at Laconia Capital Group and Virgil Capital, primarily focusing on early-stage investments in B2B fintech, real estate, and media startups. Jack spent the first three years of his career in the debt capital markets group at the Royal Bank of Scotland.
Education/Personal Bio: Jack graduated with a degree in history from Duke University, and earned his MBA from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania, with honors. He spent his childhood and pre-business school years in the New York metro area, and returned home after nearly 8 years in Philadelphia. Jack is an avid skier, golfer, college basketball enthusiast, and lifelong New York Giants fan.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Kanishk Walia
Investing Thesis: FinTech and Digital Asset focused venture capital fund investing in Pre-Seed to Series B stage start-ups, re-architecting the future of financial services
Professional Bio:
Kanishk is a Partner at MiddleGame Ventures, a FinTech and Digital Asset focused venture capital fund investing in Pre-Seed to Series B stage start-ups, re-architecting the future of financial services across banking, insurance, payments, capital markets, asset management and adjacent areas.

Kanishk has c.15 years of experience in the broader financial services and fintech ecosystem.  After initially training as an investment banker focused on UK mid-market M&A and capital raising activities, he has spent the past decade deeply immersed in the fintech vertical, with just under half that time as a founder and CEO of a B2B fintech, building Al driven credit risk assessment software for banks, lenders and insurers, and just over half of that time as a venture and growth investor in fintech start-ups and scale-ups.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kanishk holds a Bachelor of Science in Economics from The London School of Economics and Political Science.

He is a licensed skipper, passionate skier and lover of Jazz music.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness

Name: Mehreen Malik
Investing Thesis: for Meilin Capital : AI/ML engineers from technical companies , for Humanism (series B+ founders who want to buy a home in exchange for options in option swap model)
Professional Bio: Mehreen is the Managing Partner of MeiLin Capital and a co-founder of Humanism. Through MeiLin Capital she invests in AI and ML companies both at the application layer and next generation infrastructure. Humanism is a platform designed to serve Mehreen is also the co-founder of Humanism Co., a platform designed to provide innovative financing solutions for founders. Humanism offers groundbreaking products such as investment in individual founders and the exchange of mortgages/homes for shares. The platform has attracted interest from major global institutions. Through Humanism, investors are also able to invest in the financial future of individuals, rather than companies.
Education/Personal Bio:
In addition to her work in venture capital, Mehreen manages Chess Grandmaster and Fabiano Caruana and enjoys attending the theatre and poetry
readings.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Central - US,KF | Europe,KF | Italy,KF | LATAM,KF | Los Angeles,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Infrastructure,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Valentina Kirr
Professional Bio:
