-For the past seven years, Valentina has been running the venture arm of Social Discovery Group—the third-largest online dating company globally. 
-During this time, she executed three M&A deals in the online dating space, including the acquisitions of Once, Dil Mil, and Cupid Media. 
-Valentina has led over 10 direct investments in companies such as Revolut, Flo Health, and Patreon, as well as more than 36 LP fund investments. These include top-tier firms such as NEA, Khosla Ventures, Blockchain Capital, GP Bullhound, ICG, Bain Capital, Oaktree, and TPG, along with emerging managers like Bling, Dream Machine, and 776 VC.

-Valentina’s current investment focus includes direct investments, acquisitions, and secondary deals in businesses complementary to online dating—such as virtual experiences, digital novels, creative storytelling, AI companions, video and photo generation, chat moderation, virtual influencers, and other human interaction technologies. She is also actively exploring opportunities in the poker and iGaming space.
Education/Personal Bio:
'-Valentina is passionate about Human-Interaction Technology and Psychology. 
-She holds a Master's degree in Finance and Economics from the London School of Economics 
-Valentina has studied venture capital investments at the University of California, Berkeley. 
-Valentina has passed CFA Level I 
-Valentina is Forbes 30 Under 30 nominee
-In her spare time, she studies Psychology (Gestalt therapy) which enriches her decision-making in the investment field and significantly improves post-investment relationships with founders and teams
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Nicole Jang
Professional Bio:
Nicole Jang is a venture capitalist with deep cross-border experience and a sharp instinct for identifying transformative technologies and disciplined founders. Backed exclusively by Rakuten Group, she leads strategic early- and growth-stage investments across Asia and the U.S., with a focus on AI, software, and consumer platforms.

Nicole has spent over a decade navigating the intersection of corporate strategy and venture capital, helping bridge institutional capital with fast-moving innovation. Known for her clarity in high-stakes decision-making and her ability to build trust with founders and stakeholders alike, she brings a rare mix of empathy, precision, and execution.

She splits her time between Tokyo and Singapore, and is fluent in English, Korean, and Japanese. In both boardrooms and portfolio trenches, Nicole is recognized as a thoughtful, high-conviction partner — equally adept at zooming out for strategic clarity and rolling up her sleeves when it matters.
Education/Personal Bio:
Nicole Jang is a curious soul at heart — a venture capitalist by profession, but an artist’s ally in spirit. A graduate of the University of Southern California, she brings a global perspective shaped by her life between Tokyo and Singapore and a deep appreciation for creativity, connection, and craft.

Nicole is moved by art, drawn to wine, and energized by meaningful conversation — especially with people building something from the heart. She’s especially passionate about early-stage consumer brands and enjoys partnering with founders to co-build identities that endure over time.

For Nicole, investing is more than capital — it’s about emotional resonance, shared belief, and the quiet confidence to play the long game.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Anita Sonawane
Investing Thesis: Best in class emerging and established VCs
Professional Bio: Anita Sonawane is a Principal at Performance Equity Management (PEM), where she focuses on primary and secondary investments, as well as co-investments across venture capital, growth equity, and middle-market buyout strategies. Prior to joining PEM, she was a Vice President at Bessemer Trust, responsible for sourcing, selecting, and managing a diversified portfolio of private market investments. Earlier in her career, Anita was a member of the Global Alternatives team at J.P. Morgan Asset Management. While at J.P. Morgan, she also launched the Guide to Alternatives, a flagship publication that examines the evolving role of alternative investments in institutional portfolios. Anita began her career as an economist at Moore Capital Management, focusing on global macroeconomic research.
Education/Personal Bio: Anita holds an MBA in Finance from Columbia Business School, a Master of Science in Financial Economics from the University of Oxford, and a Bachelor of Arts in Economics from Queens College at the City University of New York (CUNY), where she graduated as valedictorian. She serves on the boards of the F.D.R. Presidential Library and Museum, the Roosevelt Institute, and the CUNY Macaulay Honors College. She is a proud first-generation immigrant to the United States.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Charlie Graham-Brown
Investing Thesis: Emerging market-focused, investing in pre-seed and seed-stage B2B startups. The fund backs fintech, marketplaces, and SaaS companies in the growth economies of the future.
Professional Bio:
Charlie is the General Partner at Seedstars International Ventures, where he leads a contrarian, emerging market-focused strategy investing in pre-seed and seed-stage B2B startups. The fund backs fintech, marketplaces, and SaaS companies in the growth economies of the future.

Following a two year entrepreneurial experience launching his own venture, Charlie joined the founding team of Seedstars in 2014. He played a key role in expanding the group’s activities to over 90 countries and in launching its first institutional venture capital fund, which has invested in more than 100 startups and is backed by the IFC, The Rockefeller Foundation, Symbiotics, and Visa Foundation.

Previously, Charlie spent four years at BlueOrchard Finance, where he invested over $100 million into financial institutions across Africa, MENA, and Asia. This experience cemented his belief in the power of capital markets to address some of the world’s toughest challenges and sparked his conviction that talent is everywhere, ready to unlock emerging market opportunities.
Education/Personal Bio:
Charlie received a Master of Engineering First Class Honours from The University of Leeds, UK and the Georgia Institute of Technology, USA. Transitioning into finance following an MBA at the Collège des Ingénieurs, Paris, Charlie later became a CFA charter holder. 

Charlie lives with his wife and two daughters in the mountains outside of Geneva and is an avid ski tourer, trail runner and gravel biker.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Danny Brown
Professional Bio: Danny is a Principal at MaC Venture Capital. Prior to MaC, he was Chief of Staff at Atom Factory, an LA-based talent management firm and angel fund founded by Troy Carter. There he focused on leveraging their unique position at the intersection of media and technology on behalf of their portfolio. Simultaneously, Danny joined the Cross Culture Ventures team, where he cut his teeth in early stage venture capital while identifying the next generation of culturally impactful technologists. Danny has a wide scope of focus, geeking out on the future of digital infrastructure, emerging tech ecosystems, and creating opportunity and access to venture capital.
Education/Personal Bio:
Danny attended the Argyros School of Business and Economics at Chapman University, where he earned a Bachelors of Science in Business Administration and Entrepreneurship. During his time at Chapman, he participated and led several community organizations and productions, including award-winning philanthropies.

Passionate about technology and inclusion, Danny continues to engage with a variety of communities, working with organizations such as PledgeLA, BVCC, and others that are focused on creating pathways into venture capital for underrepresented investors. Based in Los Angeles, he enjoys spending his free time going to concerts, comedy shows, and trivia nights.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Jeff Todd
Professional Bio:
Jeff is a vice president at Sorenson Capital where he invests in B2B enterprise SaaS companies. As part of the investment team, Jeff has helped make investments in LiveView, LearnLux, SmartSuite, Safe Security, Oyster, Traceable, ZeroEyes, GreenCabbage, Sight Machine, and Moov. He serves as a board member at Lumio and a board observer at Green Cabbage and LinkSquares.

Prior to joining Sorenson, Jeff focused on investing in special situations for technology companies at Vector Capital where he was a board observer for companies in the cloud CPQ and live event ticketing industries. Prior to investing at Vector, Jeff was an analyst with Citigroup where he advised some of the world’s largest technology companies in the software, internet, semiconductor, and tech distribution industries.
Education/Personal Bio: Jeff earned his BS in finance, magna cum laude, from Brigham Young University. Outside of work he enjoys playing soccer, watching college football, and working on Sourcehive, a social venture he co-founded focused on helping individuals in Ghana earn an income by performing data entry for US-based businesses.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | AI

Name: Timothy Krysiek
Professional Bio: Tim joined MassMutual Ventures as a Managing Partner in 2023 to lead the Climate Technology Fund, an early-stage fund focused on climate intelligence, sustainable cities, and clean power.  Prior to MMV, Tim was a Managing Director at Equinor Ventures, where he was responsible for a portfolio of over 25 direct investments and several fund investments across the energy and climate space. Prior to venture capital, Tim spent over a decade in the global energy industry, working on projects in over a dozen countries. His previous positions at Equinor included CEO Advisor, Corporate Strategy Manager, and Business Development Manager. Earlier in his career, Tim held research and consulting roles at Cambridge Energy Research Associates (now part of S&P Global), the Oxford Institute for Energy Studies, and Google.
Education/Personal Bio: Tim received an MBA from the Fuqua School of Business at Duke University and completed the Venture Capital program at The Wharton School. He studied international affairs in the UK as a Marshall Scholar, earning degrees from the University of Oxford and the University of St Andrews. Tim holds a BA in intelligence studies from Mercyhurst University.   Tim lives near Boston with his wife and two children.  He enjoys playing ice hockey, reading history books, and cooking Eastern European food.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Boston,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability

Name: Marcin Nowak
Professional Bio:
Marcin is the Investment Officer at EIB, managing the EIC Fund, the largest European deep tech VC fund, currently with EUR 4bn AuM and close to 300 portfolio companies. As one of the first onboard he was deeply engaged in setting up the fund and its operations. He is responsible for managing an extensive portfolio of deep tech direct equity investments in Europe and Israel focusing on space-tech, quantum and semiconductors.

Marcin is one of the co-founders of PFR Ventures, the largest fund of funds in Central and Eastern Europe, currently with EUR 1.4bn AuM, 80 portfolio funds and close to 1000 indirect portfolio companies. He was responsible for structuring of the fund’s operations and he was Head of the fund of funds co-investing with Business Angels. Before setting up PFR Ventures, he was the Investment Director at PFR, responsible for Private Equity investments.

Previously at UniCredit Group he was leading the largest Private Equity sponsored leveraged buyouts in Central and Eastern Europe and within numerous roles he earned extensive Investment Banking experience on the advisory and financing side.
Education/Personal Bio:
Marcin is the graduate of Warsaw School of Economics, where he obtained Masters degree in Finance and Banking. During his Masters at Warsaw School of Economics, he participated in dual degree program in cooperation with Johannes Gutenberg University in Mainz, Germany. He also earned the CFA, Chartered Financial Analyst designation. 

Outside of work, he loves travelling, with 100+ countries visited, diving and motorcycle rides. He enjoys spending time actively on his road bike and mountain hiking. He has also the 3rd Dan in Aikido.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability

Name: Carlos Murguia
Professional Bio: Carlos holds a Master of Science in Industrial Engineering from New Mexico State University and a Bachelor of Science in Industrial Engineering from the Instituto Tecnológico Superior de Uruapan (MX). He is also certified as a Lean Six Sigma Black Belt by the Lean Six Sigma Institute.
Education/Personal Bio:
Carlos Murguia is a Partner at Audaz Capital, an early-stage venture capital firm investing in startups that are disrupting industries where opportunity disparities persist. Strategically based in the Southwest, Audaz maintains a national outlook while driving inclusive innovation that enhances economic prosperity for founders and their communities. At Audaz, Carlos leads sourcing, diligence, portfolio support, ecosystem engagement, and reporting.

In addition to his role at Audaz, Carlos serves as Director of the Hunt Center for Entrepreneurship and leads the Technology and Innovation Gateway at New Mexico State University's Arrowhead Center, where he supports the development of innovation-based startups and technology commercialization efforts. He is a board member of the New Mexico Angels and is deeply involved in advancing the entrepreneurial ecosystem across New Mexico.

Carlos is a Fellow of both HBCUvc (Class 2) and the Material Change Institute (Class 2), and a graduate of the Center Leader Academy Certificate Program and ANDE’s Investment Manager Training. He was named to HBCUvc’s “31 Under 31 to watch in the VC industry” and received the Outstanding Graduate Award from the NMSU Alumni Association, the highest honor bestowed on a graduating master’s student.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Texas,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Corporate Venture,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Impact,KF SIG | Infrastructure,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness

Name: Christine Giam
Professional Bio:
Christine is a Partner at EDBI, focusing on early-stage and fund-of-funds investments. She played a pivotal role in creating and growing the New Ventures division at the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) - a business unit that venture builds and invests in promising business ideas and early-stage companies and do so, in partnership with funds, MNCs and experienced founders. As a hands-on investor, Christine enjoys collaborating with founders to shape their product development, go-to-market, and fundraising strategies.

With over a decade of multi-industry experience, Christine previously worked at GIC Private Equity and Advanced MedTech, a leading medical technology company in Southeast Asia, where she gained experience in investment, corporate strategy, and operations. She also held business development, marketing, and sales roles at EDB’s Singapore and London offices, focusing on the healthcare sector.
Education/Personal Bio: Christine studied in Biomedical Engineering at the National University of Singapore and is an alumna of the NUS Overseas College Program at (Stanford University). She enjoys reading non-friction, music, hiking and painting with her 2 active sons.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | South East Asia,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Healthcare

Name: Julian von Eckartsberg
Professional Bio: Julian is Managing Director Europe at Burda Principal Investments (BPI), one of the most active early growth capital investors specializing in Series B and later-stage rounds. He invests across Europe, with a strong focus on marketplaces, consumer subscriptions, and health tech. Prior to joining BPI, Julian served as CEO of Stylight, a fashion and home platform backed by General Atlantic and ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE. Earlier in his career, he led the Group Strategy department at ProSiebenSat.1, founded a couple of startups, and worked as a strategy consultant at Altman Solon, advising tech and telecom companies as well as TMT investors.
Education/Personal Bio:
Julian studied Business Administration with Mechanical Engieering at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) as well as HEC in Paris.

Originally from Germany, Julian spent much of his childhood living in Mexico, Spain, Colombia, and the United States. In his free time, he enjoys playing tennis, skiing, going to the gym, gardening, boating on Lake Ammersee, and - most of all - spending quality time with his family.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI

Name: Juan Diego Briceno
Investing Thesis: Strategy involves targeting top decile managers in both established and emerging funds in Venture Capital, Private Equity and other asset classes in the US and abroad as well as significant direct and co-investment opportunities in breakout companies.
Professional Bio:
Juan Diego Briceño is the founder and CEO of Pomifer Capital, an outsourced chief investment officer (OCIO) for family offices, focused on differentiated venture capital and private equity funds, co-investment opportunities from those funds, and other distinctive opportunities that arise in the private markets.

Prior to founding Pomifer, Juan Diego spent six years at a Costa Rica-based single-family office, where he helped lead the firm’s alternative investment strategy across venture capital and private equity. Before that, he spent four years in New York City in wealth management at Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley, advising ultra-high-net-worth individuals and family offices on portfolio construction.
Education/Personal Bio: Juan Diego was born in Miami, grew up in Nicaragua, and currently resides in Austin with his wife and two children. He holds a B.A. in International Business & Management with a minor in Economics from Dickinson College.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF | LATAM,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Ryan Fitzpatrick
Professional Bio:
Ryan is the co-founder and Managing Partner of Glitch Capital, Australia's first founders fund. Glitch invests in high growth technology companies globally with a focus on B2B software and AI and machine learning from Seed to Series B.

Prior to Glitch, Ryan was the Head of Venture at Saniel Ventures, the family office of Aconex co-founder Leigh Jasper. Saniel has a venture portfolio of over 80 companies and 15 fund managers and is one of the most active investors in the region.

Ryan was also on the founding team of Firmable, a venture backed B2B sales intelligence platform and was the first employee and portfolio manager at Skalata Ventures, a Seed focused Australian VC firm. Ryan started his career as a corporate, mergers and acquisitions lawyer at King & Wood Mallesons after working in various startups in Australian the US.
Education/Personal Bio: Ryan grew up in Perth, Western Australia where he graduated from the University of Western Australia with a Bachelor of Laws (first class) and Economics. Ryan has lived in Vancouver, Washington D.C. and is now based in Melbourne, Australia.

Name: Lisa Pallweber
Investing Thesis: The direct investment strategy focuses on early-stage opportunities across Europe. Fund investments are selected to complement the direct portfolio—whether by geographic scope, sector focus, or stage—providing broader exposure and strategic alignment.
Professional Bio:
Lisa manages the Family Office of Austrian angel investor Hansi Hansmann and is responsible for all new investments made by the Hans(wo)men Group. The Group focuses on pre-seed stage opportunities across Europe and currently holds a portfolio of over 50 active companies, with past exits including Runtastic, mySugr, and Busuu.

Her role includes managing the existing portfolio, working closely with founders on strategic topics, and serving on company boards. She also oversees the Group’s fund investments in VC and PE, and occasionally represents the Group on fund advisory boards.

Before joining the Family Office, Lisa held investment roles at Uniqa Ventures and Speedinvest, with a focus on early-stage fintech, insurtech, and healthtech investments.
Education/Personal Bio: Lisa was born and raised in Northern Italy and is currently based in Vienna. She holds a Bachelor's degree in International Business, Management, and Finance from Bocconi University in Milan. She is fluent in Italian, German, and English, and conversational in French and Spanish. Outside of work, she enjoys spending time in the mountains—hiking in the summer and skiing in the winter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Fernando Carranza
Investing Thesis:
Cleveland Avenue’s CAST US Fund invests in high-growth, Series A+ companies led by under-capitalized and underrepresented founders who are building scalable solutions that drive both financial and social returns.

Investing across the U.S., the fund targets four thematic areas - Lifestyle Industries, Human Capital Enablement, Next-Gen Infrastructure, and Business Acceleration. We back proven entrepreneurs with market traction who are transforming overlooked markets, expanding access to ownership and quality jobs, and creating enduring economic impact through innovation, inclusion, and disciplined execution.
Professional Bio:
Fernando Carranza is a venture professional with experience investing in Seed to Series B companies across future of work, fintech, and enterprise technology. He is currently a Venture Investor at Cleveland Avenue, where he backs early-stage, tech-driven businesses through the firm’s CAST US Fund, supporting overlooked founders driving systemic change.

Prior to Cleveland Avenue, Fernando was Director of Venture at Digital Currency Group / HQ Digital, where he helped launch four funds and invested across blockchain, DeFi, and Web3 infrastructure. Earlier in his career, he led the first Latinx-focused incubator in the U.S. in partnership with the Illinois Hispanic Chamber of Commerce, helping entrepreneurs raise catalytic capital. He also worked as an impact investor with Agora Partnerships in Mexico City, backing social enterprises across LATAM. Fernando began his career at Société Générale, advising industrial and consumer clients on cross-border financings and M&A across the U.S. and EMEA.

Fernando is deeply committed to building more inclusive ecosystems. He serves as a Braven Professional Mentor, is a member of the Turner MIINT Alumni Council, Chicago Lead for La Familia Foundation, and a mentor for P33’s TechRise program. In 2024, he was recognized as one of the Toigo Foundation’s Top 35 Rising Leaders in Finance.
Education/Personal Bio: Fernando is a proud Mexican-American and lifelong Chicagoan. He earned his BS in Finance from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and later completed his MBA at Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management, where he became a Youn Impact Scholar, Toigo Fellow, and ICM Mosaic Fellow. Today, Fernando lives in Chicago with his wife, newborn daughter, and their scrappy Boxer-Chihuahua mix. Outside the office, he competes in Ironman 70.3 races, pursues mountaineering expeditions, and is a purple belt in Brazilian jiu-jitsu.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Boards,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Bukie Adebo Umeano
Professional Bio:
Bukie is an Investment Principal at Anthemis, where she leads deals across Fintech, embedded finance, and AI. Bukie invests primarily in Pre-Seed and Seed stage businesses and serves as a board director/observer for 6 Anthemis portfolio companies. 

Bukie began her career in consulting. She was a Strategy and Operations Consultant at Deloitte, helping organizations explore growth strategies like global expansion and digital transformation, and a Brand Strategy Director at Ogilvy Consulting, advising senior-level clients on brand positioning and go-to-market. She made her way into Fintech, by co-founding a credit-building business called Liza that was designed to help people build credit by formalizing loans between friends and family. Prior to joining Anthemis, Bukie was an investor at WomensVCFund where she invested in Series A and B businesses with women in senior leadership.
Education/Personal Bio:
Bukie holds an MBA from Harvard Business School where she served as Co-President of the African American Student Union and received the Dean's Award. She also earned a BBA from Emory University Goizueta School of Business. 

A native of Austin, Texas, she currently lives in Brooklyn, New York with her husband where she enjoys all things wellness, art, design, and travel.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Charlotte Palmer
Professional Bio:
I'm Charlotte Palmer, Vice President at Integra Global Advisors, where I focus on private markets with a strong emphasis on venture capital. Over the past five years, I’ve worked as a limited partner, fund investments across the venture ecosystem.

I began my journey at the British Business Bank, the UK’s largest LP in venture capital, where I had the opportunity to partner with a wide range of managers, across stages, strategies, and geographies. Now at Integra, I help ultra-high-net-worth families and institutions access top-tier venture opportunities across Israel, EU, US and LatAm, build long-term relationships with GPs, and navigate the nuances of portfolio construction in an ever-changing market. I’m particularly interested in how emerging managers are reshaping the VC model and in backing those who bring fresh perspectives to innovation.

I'm thrilled to join the Kauffman Fellows community to grow alongside and learn from some of the most thoughtful and driven investors in the world. Venture capital is ultimately a relationship driven people business, and I see Kauffman as a rare opportunity to sharpen my judgment, expand my global network, and deepen my understanding of what it means to be not just a capital partner, but a catalytic one. I’m excited to both contribute and be challenged as I take the next step in my investing journey.
Education/Personal Bio:
I studied at the University of Sheffield, graduating with a BA in Business Management and Social Policy, a degree that shaped how I think about capital allocation, systems change, and the role of business in driving impact. Since then, I’ve continued to build my expertise through professional qualifications, including certifications in Investing in ESG and Investing in Climate with the UK CFA Society.

Outside of work, I enjoy staying active, whether that’s through weight training, trail walking, half-marathons or the occasional reformer Pilates class. I'm also a fan of travel, learning new cultures and cuisines and expanding my knowledge through documentaries.

Name: Brendan Marshall
Professional Bio: Brendan leads investments at StartX Ventures, the venture fund supporting the StartX founder ecosystem. He was previously the founder and CEO of Flow, a private markets infrastructure platform that streamlined fundraising and investor relations for venture firms and fund managers, supporting over $17 billion in assets before being acquired by Apex Group. Earlier in his career, Brendan founded Kitchit, a consumer experiences startup. His work bridges entrepreneurial execution with a passion for fostering meaningful human relationships and long-term value creation.
Education/Personal Bio: Brendan earned an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business and holds a degree in Finance from Fordham University. Outside of work, he enjoys playing golf, curating unique experiences, dancing to live music and deepening his practice of Transcendental Meditation.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Dylan Ketcham
Professional Bio:
Dylan Ketcham is a Principal at Moderne Ventures, a Chicago-based strategic venture and growth equity fund.

Prior to Moderne, Dylan spent over a decade in financial services and fintech. Most recently, he was a founding team member and Vice President of the Emerging Fintech investment banking practice at Barclays. In this role, Dylan advised fintech, proptech, and cryptocurrency clients on strategic actions, including M&A and capital raising. His investment banking transaction experience includes over $5B of transaction value, including a role as a lead bookrunner for Silvergate Capital's initial public offering, the first cryptocurrency related offering on a U.S. stock exchange. Preceding Barclays, Dylan worked in investment banking and strategy roles at HSBC and Credit Agricole.
Education/Personal Bio: Dylan holds a BS in Finance and Accounting from Elon University, where he currently serves as an Advisory Board Member at the Doherty Center. He also earned an MBA from Northwestern’s Kellogg School of Management, where he was a Zell Fellow. Dylan is a native Texan and loves living in Chicago. He enjoys traveling, scuba diving, cooking and being a girl dad to his 2 year old daughter.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Sayiddah McCree
Professional Bio:
Sayiddah is a graduate of Illinois Institute of Technology, where she earned a Bachelor of Architecture with a minor in structural engineering and a Master of Integrated Building Delivery. She also holds an MBA from Harvard Business School. 

Sayiddah enjoys spending time with family and friends, creating and appreciating visual art, and morning walks in the park.
Education/Personal Bio: Sayiddah has a decade of experience in impact investing through private markets across a range of asset classes and impact strategies, including housing, financial inclusion, and climate. She is the Senior Impact Investment Officer on the MacArthur Foundation’s Impact Investments program team.

Name: Heeeun Park
Investing Thesis: Founder oriented and power law
Professional Bio:
Heeeun is a Partner at Altos Ventures, where she leads Korea operations and focuses on investments across Asia, particularly in consumer tech, AI, content, and emerging consumer brands. Prior to joining Altos, she founded and exited a mobile dating startup, which grew into Korea’s largest mobile dating service with over one million subscribers—representing roughly 10% of all Koreans in their 20s and 30s.

After concluding her chapter as a founder, Heeeun felt drawn to new horizons. In 2014, she joined Altos Ventures with a mission to help reshape Korea’s entrepreneurial landscape, which at the time was still largely dominated by inherited wealth rather than self-made innovation. Since then, she has been an early and active follow-on investor in many of Korea’s most prominent startups, playing a key role in the rise of over half of Korea’s unicorns and establishing Altos as a leading force in the Korean startup ecosystem. Notable startups in her portfolio include Azar(Online dating) Danggeun (community classifieds), TOSS (fintech), and KREAM (fashion e-commerce).

Under her leadership, Altos has built a diverse portfolio of over 80 companies in Korea and Asia, investing in 8 to 10 new startups annually, with cumulative investment volume surpassing $1 billion. For the past seven years, founders have consistently ranked Altos as their most preferred investor.

Heeeun’s deep appreciation for technology and entrepreneurship, combined with her unique perspective as a former founder, allows her to build strong, trust-based relationships with founders. She is known for her empathy, insight, and dedication to supporting founders not only in business but in their personal growth as leaders.
Education/Personal Bio:
Since her college years in Seoul National University , Heeeun has been fascinated by how technology and digital platforms can meaningfully shape people’s lives—a passion that continues to guide her work in venture capital.

She is also deeply committed to advancing women’s leadership and breaking glass ceilings across industries, and she frequently speaks on founder empathy, gender dynamics, and the evolution of Korea’s startup ecosystem.

Outside of work, Heeeun enjoys jazz, discovering great restaurants, and searching for hidden gems in vintage markets around the world. She is also an avid reader and a passionate traveler who finds inspiration in exploring different cultures and cities.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Haroon Saqib
Professional Bio: Haroon Saqib is a Director at Lexington Partners focused on secondary opportunities including partnership and GP-led transactions primarily in venture capital, growth equity and technology buyout. Haroon was previously an Associate at Carlyle AlpInvest.
Education/Personal Bio: Haroon Saqib graduated from the University of North Carolina with a BS in Business Administration and from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania with an MBA. Haroon resides in New York, NY.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC

Name: Kristine Harjes
Professional Bio: Kristine is a Vice President at Motley Fool Ventures, a sister company to The Motley Fool. She helped raise MFV's first fund in 2018 and has been involved in all aspects of investing and firm-building since then. MFV is currently deploying its second fund and has $250M under management.
Education/Personal Bio: Kristine graduated summa cum laude from McDaniel College with a major in math and economics and minors in business administration and art.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Kotai Gen
Job Title: Director in SMBC / Scholar in Sozo Ventures
Current Firm: Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation / Sozo Ventures
Professional Bio:
Kotai is a translator between the worlds of megabanks, venture capitals and startups.
He is Director of LP Investment at Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation (NYSE: SMFG), where he leads strategic investments into both seasoned and up-and-coming GPs, nurtures LP-GP relationships, and drives business development by bridging Japanese finance with frontier technologies—particularly those in Silicon Valley. 
He also moonlights as a Sozo Scholar at Sozo Ventures, rolling up his sleeves to contribute to the daily hustle of the venture capital world. The dual lens of GP and LP keeps him curious, sharp, and occasionally over-caffeinated.
In addition, Kotai serves as a global advisor to the Fintech Association of Japan, working to connect nimble fintech innovators with some of Japan’s most established institutions. His mission? Make those meetings less awkward and more meaningful.
Prior to all this, Kotai was an investment banker at SMBC Nikko Securities, where he covered financial institutions and fintech. He survived—with the help of way too many Red Bulls.
Education/Personal Bio:
Kotai holds a bachelor’s degree in International Liberal Studies from Waseda University, and is a proud alumnus of Wakeijuku—a historic all-male dormitory known for producing Japanese prime ministers, as well as Kotai’s favorite novelist, Haruki Murakami. 
Off the clock, Kotai is a basketball enthusiast inspired by Michael Jordan and the manga Slam Dunk, These days, he brings that passion (and a decent jump shot) to local late-night dad leagues—where deals and dad jokes somehow coexist.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area

Name: JF Liu
Professional Bio: JF serves as a partner at Grandis Capital, a Hong Kong-based family office managing over USD 2 billion in assets. The firm specializes in private market investments, including venture capital, private equity, and private credit, with a portfolio encompassing both fund investments and direct deals. Grandis Capital has a distinguished track record, with prior investments in leading companies such as ByteDance, Kuaishou, and Meituan, among others.
Education/Personal Bio: JF holds an MBA from the University of Michigan and spent eleven years of his teenage years in the United Kingdom. He maintains an active lifestyle, engaging in various forms of exercise, including CrossFit, Hyrox training, squash, basketball, pickleball and running. Additionally, JF is an avid Texas Hold’em poker player and a passionate collector of watches, sneakers and Maotai.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness

Name: Alana Ackerson
Professional Bio:
Dr. Alana Ackerson is a technology entrepreneur, venture investor, and author of the new release 𝘾𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚 𝙃𝙪𝙢𝙖𝙣𝙨: 𝙃𝙤𝙬 𝙏𝙚𝙘𝙝𝙣𝙤𝙡𝙤𝙜𝙮 𝙞𝙨 𝙏𝙧𝙖𝙣𝙨𝙛𝙤𝙧𝙢𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙃𝙪𝙢𝙖𝙣 𝙉𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙣𝙙 𝙋𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙞𝙗𝙡𝙚 𝙁𝙪𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙨.

She co-founded 𝗙𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗿𝗲 (𝗡𝗔𝗦𝗗𝗔𝗤: 𝗙𝗜𝗚𝗥), a multi-billion-dollar public FinTech company, and 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝘃𝗲𝗻𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗕𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗸𝗰𝗵𝗮𝗶𝗻, the leading public Layer 1 for real-world assets. She later built 𝗛𝗤 𝗗𝗶𝗴𝗶𝘁𝗮𝗹, a next-generation investment platform and multi-family office under Digital Currency Group, where she partnered with the world’s top digital assets, blockchain, and DeFi entrepreneurs and investors. Most recently, she was an Investment Partner with 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗰𝘂𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗻𝗼𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, the state’s strategic venture arm.

Earlier in her career, Alana served as CEO of the 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗹 𝗙𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻, where she launched and scaled programs that redefined how entrepreneurial talent is discovered and funded. She oversaw the 𝗧𝗵𝗶𝗲𝗹 𝗙𝗲𝗹𝗹𝗼𝘄𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽, backing young founders with $100K grants to pursue breakthrough ventures outside academia, and 𝗕𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗸𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗟𝗮𝗯𝘀, which financed radical, high-risk scientific innovation beyond the reach of conventional VC.

A recognized thought leader, she is a Member of the 𝗖𝗼𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗶𝗹 𝗼𝗻 𝗙𝗼𝗿𝗲𝗶𝗴𝗻 𝗥𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀, where she contributed to the Independent Task Force on U.S. Innovation Strategy and National Security and spoke at the Council’s National Conference on “The Future of FinTech.” She also serves on global nonprofit boards, including Opportunity International and SFTS, and is a YPO Member.
Education/Personal Bio: Alana earned her B.A. with Honors in Science, Technology, and Society from 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗱, an M.A. in Philosophical and Systematic Theology from 𝗚𝗧𝗨 𝗕𝗲𝗿𝗸𝗲𝗹𝗲𝘆, and a Doctorate in Ministry with a focus on technology and faith from 𝗦𝗮𝗻 𝗙𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗶𝘀𝗰𝗼 𝗧𝗵𝗲𝗼𝗹𝗼𝗴𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗲𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗿𝘆, where she also trained as a spiritual director.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF | Texas,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Blockchain & Crypto,KF SIG | Creator Economy,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Denise Miller
Professional Bio:
Denise Miller is a Partner at WovenEarth Ventures. She oversees investment and operational diligence, analytics and investor reporting, and the firm’s business operations. As a member of the WovenEarth Investment Committee, she provides input and guidance on portfolio construction process and investment strategy. 

Denise has a deep background in strategy and systems that ranges from work in India for the Clinton Foundation to serving as a strategy consultant for leading US utilities and oil and gas companies with a focus on impact and decarbonization. In her role prior to WovenEarth Ventures, she managed acquisition and divestiture activities, drove alignment on the long-term business strategy with the board, and directed the annual business planning process for Aera Energy, the second largest oil and gas producer in California and a joint Venture between Shell and ExxonMobil. Within this role, she led the efforts to chart the path to reduce the carbon intensity of brownfield oil and gas assets.
Education/Personal Bio: Denise has an MBA and an MS in Environmental Policy and Planning from the University of Michigan and lives in California with her husband. She is an endurance sports enthusiast and has completed four full Ironman triathlons and eight half distance races. A lover of the outdoors, she now focuses on gravel biking and aspires to spend more of her time in her home state of Montana on the family ranch.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Susan Moring
Professional Bio:
Susan in a General Partner at Cortado Ventures, a seed stage venture capital firm investing in B2B startups in the US Midcontinent region. She joined the firm as an Associate and is the firm's first and only promoted Partner. 

Prior to investing, Susan spent her career building and supporting startups and tech innovation in the Heartland. She spent time doing university-based tech transfer, operating the state of Oklahoma's first coding bootcamp, and launching a social impact accelerator.
Education/Personal Bio:
Susan holds a BBA in Entrepreneurship from the University of Oklahoma. 

She currently resides in Oklahoma City and is passionate about building the next hub for tech workers in the Heartland.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Central - US,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Tim Lynch
Professional Bio:
Tim Lynch is a Principal at Prysm Capital where he provides growth capital to disruptive management teams across the technology and consumer sectors. Investing across stages, Tim is passionate about partnering with teams to help radically reshape their industries and accelerate the adoption of innovative products and services globally.

Prior to Prysm, Tim spent two years as an Associate at Morgan Stanley Expansion Capital, a private equity platform targeting late-stage growth investments in technology, healthcare, consumer, and other high-growth sectors. While there, Tim partnered with visionary management teams across the growth equity spectrum in industries such as enterprise software, internet marketplaces, medical devices, travel technology, and organic baby food.

Tim began his career at BlackRock Private Equity Partners, where he spent three years as an Analyst and Associate. While at PEP, Tim helped support the firm’s private equity investments across industries including travel services, enterprise software, medical services, and energy.
Education/Personal Bio: Tim earned a BS degree, summa cum laude, from Fordham University and an MBA degree from Columbia Business School, with honors. During his time at CBS, he interned with an early-stage venture capital fund in NYC and also spent a summer on the finance team of IBM during a period when IBM completed its acquisition of Red Hat. Tim is originally from upstate New York and has also lived in Princeton, Austin, and San Francisco. He currently resides with his wife and two children in New York City. He enjoys spending time running in Central Park, ski trips out West, and exploring new countries and foods.

Name: Colleen E. Heidinger
Professional Bio:
Colleen leads 43North, a Buffalo-based nonprofit accelerator committed to attracting and retaining high-growth startups in Western New York. Now in its eleventh cohort, 43North invests $5 million annually through its startup competition and yearlong mentorship program. Colleen has been with the organization for over a decade, serving as its leader for the past five years. Funded by New York State, 43North has become a powerful example of how venture-backed economic development can revitalize a city—transforming mindsets, building momentum, and cultivating a lasting culture of innovation, optimism, and growth for generations to come.

Before returning to Buffalo, Colleen began her career in management consulting, working with nonprofit clients seeking to adopt entrepreneurial strategies. She then spent a decade in New York City and Los Angeles in the film and television industries.
Education/Personal Bio:
Colleen holds a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from Babson College.

In her spare time, she teaches yoga at her studio in her hometown of Buffalo, NY. Deeply committed to the city’s ongoing resurgence, Colleen serves on several philanthropic boards, contributes to shaping entrepreneurial curricula at both the high school and collegiate levels, and has even restored a historic 1906 building with her father.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Self Care & Wellness,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Carli Sapir
Professional Bio:
Carli Sapir is the Founding Partner of Amboy Street Ventures, an early-stage venture capital firm that invests in high-growth women’s health and sexual health startups. Amboy Street Ventures backs bold founders solving significant care gaps affecting half the world’s population.  Her fund’s recent investments include vaginal microbiome testing and care platform Evvy, male birth control portfolio Contaline, and at-home fertility treatment Bea Fertility. 

 

In 2023, Carli was recognized on the Forbes 30 Under 30 list in venture capital. She also started the Female Founded Club (FFC), a global platform that introduces venture capital investors to high-quality female founded startups. Carli has a background in private equity and engineering and graduated with honors from the University of Virginia in Civil and Environmental Engineering. 

 

She currently resides in Los Angeles, CA and Jackson, WY.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Lina Lisbona
Professional Bio:
Lina Lisbona is a Partner at Vox Capital, Latin America's leading climate and impact investment firm. At Vox, she leads capital raising across the platform and plays a central role in developing new investment products and LP engagement strategies. Her focus is on building institutional infrastructure for impact investing in emerging markets — bridging global capital with purpose-driven companies across the region.

With over 15 years spanning venture capital, private equity, and impact investing, Lina has built her career around a core question: how do you create enduring investment platforms in markets that matter? Previously a Partner at Astella Investimentos and Barn Investimentos, she has experience across firm formation, fundraising, and portfolio strategy in sectors ranging from agriculture to climate resilience.
Education/Personal Bio:
Lina earned her degree in Economic Theory from American University in Washington, D.C. and holds executive education certifications in Financial Management (Insper) and ESG Investing (CFA Institute). Born in Switzerland and based in São Paulo, she is fluent in Portuguese, English, and French, and thrives in globally collaborative environments.

She is passionate about investing in people and ideas that create lasting value for the environment and society. Outside of work, she writes, mentors, and builds communities at the intersection of capital, ethics, and innovation.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Climate & Sustainability,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers,KF SIG | Impact

Name: Charles March
Professional Bio:
Charlie manages Never Lift, investing across resilience themes in Europe and America. 
Previously Charlie has held roles at Thrive and 8VC. He was MD of Strategy for Afiniti, an AI company in London prior to starting Never Lift. He also sits on the board of his family business, Goodwood.
Education/Personal Bio: Charlie studied for his MBA at Columbia and completed his undergraduate at The University of Oxford in Theology and Religion. He spends his free time racing cars.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Aerospace & Defense,KF SIG | Deep Tech,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Ashlie Tyler
Job Title: Vice President | Global Strategic & Sustainable Investments
Professional Bio:
Ashlie is an investor at Bank of America, where she has been catalytic in backing emerging managers whose platforms are purpose-built to create economic opportunity across the US. She joined the firm’s investment bank in 2020, where she covered large-cap global industrials companies, primarily in the maritime sector. 

She has 15 years of proven expertise building transformational platforms and driving success across multiple domains. Ashlie’s comprehensive skillset includes fund investing & portfolio management, investment banking, business development, operations, and human capital management.

Ashlie began her career at two of the world’s leading financial institutions, where she immediately noticed the dearth of people of color and women in core finance roles and firm leadership. Ashlie tied the lack of representation to the linkages between childhood socioeconomic status, educational opportunities, and future employment prospects. Ashlie sought an opportunity to level the playing field at scale and pivoted to the education sector, where she worked for five years to close the achievement gap for low-income students. During this time, Ashlie led recruitment, operations, and business development for two nonprofits that helped pioneer and scale a highly effective high-dosage tutoring model. She oversaw program expansion across multiple major public school systems and supported rigorous research efforts to evaluate the model’s impact on student achievement. Her work contributed to the rapid growth and national reach of the initiative, including capital raising, launching new sites, and negotiating partnerships with additional school districts. 

Ashlie’s early experiences at the edges of poverty had a lasting legacy on her. She is keenly aware of the perfect storm of circumstances that have enabled her success. As such, she aims to amplify her lived and professional experiences in service to others.
Education/Personal Bio:
Ashlie is a “Double Dukie.” She received her MBA from Duke University’s Fuqua School of Business. She also received her undergraduate degree from Duke, where she became the first in her family to graduate from college. In addition to being a diehard Blue Devil, Ashlie is a Toigo and Forte alum and a dedicated member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated. 

Ashlie is based in New York City, but is a proud Boston native.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Manish Patel
Investing Thesis: High conviction, low velocity investing in companies that go from market taking to market making.
Professional Bio:
Manish is a Silicon Valley veteran who solves problems at the intersection of business, technology, and human experience. He follows his passion for technologies that address deep needs and evolve to products which become part of everyday life.  t Google, Manish was fortunate to lead and collaborate with teams that designed, developed, and scaled products with global impact including Google Ads, TV, and Maps. In addition, he built a few products that were brilliant failures. He also worked closely with the co-founders on special projects including running Google’s corporate strategy and goal setting process: OKRs. As the company scaled from private to public, Manish held several other strategic roles and spent significant time overseas as Google established its global presence. After Google, Manish joined Highland Capital and helped expand the firm’s offices in California. Manish is certainly the “accidental” venture capitalist but grew to love the craft. He focuses on early stage investing. Manish was able to partner with a number of exceptional entrepreneurs over the years who have scaled their businesses to public companies and multi billion dollar acquisitions.

Manish's passion for building extends to many aspects of his life. He has taught in the Stanford School of Engineering for years as well as serving as a Fellow at the University of Toronto - CDL. He was also recognized as a Distinguished Fellow by IDEO CoLab. And when he can, he loves to find excuses to go to his local machine shop.

Manish has spent his career at the edge of innovation as an operator, inventor, and as a venture capitalist. He deeply believes in the idea that the best products, those that truly impact us, shift from being novel technologies to becoming commonplace, disappearing into our daily lives.
Education/Personal Bio: Manish holds a BS and BA from Stanford University and has taught there for over a decade.  His family is originally from East Africa and he grew up in rural Kentucky and Virginia before going west for college.  Early access to a Commodore 128 led Manish down a path to study engineering and a passion for technology.

Name: Samer Yousif
Professional Bio: Samer is a Director at Insight Partners, where he leads the 20/20 Vision Capital Fund, a $118M fund of funds investing into underrepresented, emerging fund managers. He oversees sourcing, diligence and portfolio management of the Vision Capital Fund. Prior to Insight, Samer was CEO at BLCK VC, the professional organization for Black venture investors. Samer was the first hire at BLCK VC, building the organization’s strategy, programs, internal operations, and the State of Black Venture Report to increase diversity and inclusion in the venture ecosystem.
Education/Personal Bio: Samer holds a Master’s in Global Policy Studies from the University of Texas at Austin Lyndon B. Johnson School of Public Policy and a bachelor’s in economics from the University of Texas at Arlington.

Name: Lauri Kokkila
Professional Bio:
Lauri Kokkila is a Partner at Inventure, the Nordic and Baltic seed and pre-seed specialist. Lauri focuses on early-stage opportunities in deep tech, quantum technologies, and marketplace platforms. He has served on the boards of several high-growth companies, including Swappie (raised €108M Series C), Umbra (acquired by Amazon), Nordigen (acquired by GoCardless), and Material Exchange (raised €25M Series A).

Lauri joined the firm as an intern in 2015 and has since risen through the ranks to become one of the youngest partners in European venture capital. Along his journey, he deepened his operational expertise through a one-year secondment at Material Exchange, where he served as VP of Strategy.
Education/Personal Bio: Lauri holds a Master’s degree in Information Networks from Aalto University in Helsinki, a multidisciplinary program combining technology, business, and design. Outside of work, he enjoys staying active through tennis and kitesurfing.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Europe,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Deep Tech

Name: Sanja Partalo
Professional Bio:
Sanja is a Co-Founder and General Partner of S4S Ventures, a venture capital firm focused on early stage (Series A onwards) companies exploiting opportunities presented by the next wave of technology transformation of the advertising & media sectors. A hands-on investor recognized for her deep domain expertise, Sanja has invested in a range of applied AI, marketing technology and advertising technology companies such as Runway, Captiv8 and 4screen.

Prior to founding S4S Ventures, Sanja was a long time WPP (NYSE: WPP) executive, working directly with WPP’s C-suite in a variety of roles focused on driving growth through development of strategic partnerships, venture investments and M&A. Most recently, in her role as Global Head of Strategic Development & Partnerships, she led WPP's channel strategy with technology platforms that are transforming the value chain of advertising, media and consumer experience orchestration – Google, Meta, Adobe, Salesforce, Microsoft, Snap, ByteDance and Amazon, among others – and oversaw a $$B+ strategic partnership portfolio. She spearheaded numerous market-leading partnerships at WPP, including the first global agency partnership with TikTok, Waze and Snap. Sanja started her investing career at WPP in CVC capacity, where she was fortunate to back a number of industry defining companies such as Gimlet (acquired by Spotify) and SuperAwesome (acquired by Epic Games). 

Sanja has extensive experience serving on boards, both as an investor and in an independent capacity, and has had the pleasure of serving on the boards of Stitch, Tenovos, 4screen, Tracer, ID5, Provenance, Captiv8 (acquired by Publicis), Gimlet, Fatherly (acquired by BDG) and YouEarnedIt (acquired by Vista), among others.
Education/Personal Bio:
Sanja holds an MBA from Columbia Business School, where she serves as a Lecturer and Adjunct Professor of Marketing, Media & Technology. She holds a BA, magna cum laude, in international affairs and economics from the George Washington University, where she was a recipient of the Honors scholarship and graduated in three years. 

Sanja was born in Bosnia and came to the US as a teenager through a refugee resettlement program, having spent 3 years living in a war zone and two years in a refugee camp. Her story was captured in President George W. Bush’s book “Out of Many, One” and in accompanying exhibit of portraits painted by the President to inspire understanding and highlight contributions by refugees and immigrants to the United States.

Sanja is passionate about human rights and serves on the board of Human Rights First.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | AI

Name: Nora Alsarhan
Professional Bio:
Nora is the Deputy CEO and Chief Investment Officer at Saudi Venture Capital Company (SVC), a government-backed investment firm focused on developing the private capital ecosystem in Saudi Arabia. She leads the firm’s investments in funds and direct investments, and plays a central role in portfolio strategy, governance, and value creation.

Nora serves on multiple advisory and investment committees, including fund LPACs and the investment committee at Bupa Arabia. She is also Vice President of the Saudi Padel Committee and a member of the Nomination and Remuneration Committee at the Saudi Pro League.

Prior to joining SVC, Nora worked in Transaction Advisory Services at EY and was part of the founding team at the SME Authority, where she helped build the infrastructure for Saudi Arabia’s VCPE landscape. She was instrumental in the creation of the VCPE Association and in launching SVC.
Education/Personal Bio: Nora AlSarhan holds a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Information Systems from Prince Sultan University. She earned her MBA with honors from Alfaisal University and completed the Program for Leadership Development at Harvard Business School.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Ali Nahm
Professional Bio:
Ali is a Partner at Tribe Capital -- a generalist venture firm that leverages data in ways that are grounded by deep industry, investment and operating expertise. She's passionate about using data and AI to simplify workflows, both in the companies she looks to invest in and internally at Tribe.

Prior to Tribe, Ali was a machine learning software engineer at Airbnb and an early employee at B2B HR tech company Humu. In both roles, she had the opportunity to wear many hats as an operator across tech, business, and operations, which allows her to empathize and support founders today.
Education/Personal Bio: Ali holds a bachelor's degree in Computer Science and Applied Math from Harvard and an MBA from Stanford Graduate School of Business. She loves gravel biking and trying new ice cream flavors.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Healthcare,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Julian Fialkow
Professional Bio:
Julian Fialkow is the Co-Founder of 186 Ventures, an early-stage venture capital firm dedicated to backing exceptional entrepreneurs across industries. Prior to launching 186 Ventures, he was a founding team member of Drive by DraftKings, a multi-stage venture capital firm investing in sports tech and entertainment. At Drive, he focused on sourcing, investment diligence, portfolio management, and fundraising.

He began his career at DraftKings in its early stages, joining as one of the first 200 employees. In his role as Project Manager to the Chief Business Officer, he contributed to the company’s explosive growth, later joining the Strategic Ventures team to help lead marquee partnerships, customer acquisition initiatives, and new revenue generation strategies.

Drawing on firsthand experience scaling a hyper-growth technology company, he brings a unique operator’s lens to venture investing. At 186 Ventures, he leads sourcing efforts, ecosystem engagement, and platform development, leveraging a broad network to support the next generation of transformative founders.

He holds a degree in Digital Arts & Entrepreneurship from Colgate University and later pursued studies in Entrepreneurship and Clean Energy at Copenhagen Business School. A former Division I hockey player at Colgate and professional athlete in Copenhagen, he remains active in his community as Co-Chair of the Boston Winter Ball and a longtime participant in the Pan-Mass Challenge.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | NYC,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Rodrigo Baer
Investing Thesis:
14B is a very opinionated early stage fund, with a very concentrated Seed / Series A portfolio with which we engage it deeply.
We support experienced founders from LatAm into building original companies  that can either become local giants or global players. 
We lean very strongly B2B.
Professional Bio:
Rodrigo is one of the pioneers of venture capital in Brazil, actively investing since 2010.   He serves on the board of EVCF ( Emerging VC Fellows)
Rodrigo is managing partner of 14B, an early stage fund he co-founded after leaving Repoint eventures in 2021. 
At Redpoint, Rodrigo lead investments in multiple unicorns (Olist, Pismo, Rappi Creditas) and also spearheaded the creation of Cubo, Brazil's largest startup hub. 
Prior to Redpoint, Rodrigo co-founded Warehouse investments where he lead the investment in Ifood and also made the direct investment into Frete.com.
Prior to becoming a VC,  Rodrigo was a Management consultant at McKinsey.
Rodrigo also runs Brazil's largest VC focused Youtube Channel ( Pergunte ao VC) and educational programs to teach founders about the VC industry ( VC para founders)
Education/Personal Bio:
Rodrigo hold and MBA from the Kellogg School of Management and a BBA from Fundação Getulio Vargas
He has traveled to 63 countries and is a foodie at heart
Rodrigo has 2 kids, Daniel (12) and Andre (10)
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community

Name: Tomas Denecken
Investing Thesis:
30N Ventures is a pioneering investment firm that blends the entrepreneurial agility of venture capital with the liquidity strategies of private equity. The GP focuses on fast-growing economies, partnering with top-tier entrepreneurs across emerging markets.
With a presence in Mexico City, Santiago, Miami, and Paris, 30N Ventures brings a global perspective to identify and back exceptional talent in Fintech, Foodtech, and Retailtech (e-commerce, marketplaces, and logistics).

The firm will invest from Pre-Series A to Pre-Series B, focusing on liquidity and market consolidation for its portfolio through its own M&A area. With the experience of its partners and the support of its network of experts, 30N Ventures positions itself as a strategic fund for international expansion and cross-border growth of companies seeking to strengthen their operations at a regional level.
Professional Bio:
Seasoned entrepreneur and investor with over fourteen years of experience in the emerging markets ecosystem. 

Before founding 30N Ventures, he was a venture capital investor at Capria Ventures, a global VC fund supported by notable figures like Bill Gates and Michael and Susan Dell. At Capria, Tomas invested in top VC funds and startups in Latin America, Africa, and Southeast Asia, gaining a global perspective on business innovation and a thorough understanding of diverse startup ecosystems. 

His career also includes executive roles as Chief Investment Officer, Country Manager (with an exit to OLX group), Operations Manager, and Investment Director in different LatAm venture capital firms and companies in both Latin America and the U.S.
Education/Personal Bio:
Tomas Denecken grew up in Santiago, Chile, and has a worldwide viewpoint shaped by more than fourteen years of investing and operating across the US, LatAm, and the rest of the EMs. He earned a degree in Business and Economics from Universidad Finis Terrae and has participated in executive education programs in New York, which enhanced his knowledge in global strategy and venture investment.

In addition to his career, Tomas is a father to three young boys and a passionate football fan (or soccer, as it's called in the US).
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | LATAM,KF | Mexico,KF SIG | AI,KF SIG | Emerging Managers

Name: Ashtan Jordan
Investing Thesis: We invest up to $500K in pre-seed and seed rounds of $4 million or less, backing North America-based founders at the early stages of building product-market fit. As a sector-agnostic firm with a balanced B2B and B2C portfolio, we look for exceptional founders building companies where modest capital can unlock key insights about the business model, product, or market. While we primarily invest in North America, we make select global investments in fintech. We maintain a strict conflict policy and do not invest in companies competitive with our active portfolio. We do not enter at the Series A stage.
Professional Bio:
Ashtan is a Principal at Precursor Ventures, a classic pre-seed and seed-stage venture capital firm based in San Francisco. She leads investments across B2B software, healthcare, and consumer technology, with a focus on backing exceptional founders at the earliest stages. 

Prior to joining Precursor, Ashtan was the Founder and Managing Partner of The MVX Group, a product management staffing agency supporting legacy businesses undergoing digital transformation. She was also on the founding team of SAMPLEit, a beauty discovery platform that was later acquired by a private equity firm. Ashtan began her career as an investment banking analyst at Citigroup.
Education/Personal Bio: Ashtan is a proud third-generation graduate of Howard University and an alum of Stanford Graduate School of Business. A native of Detroit, Michigan, she  splits her time between San Francisco and Los Angeles. In her free time, she enjoys meditation, working out, watching documentaries, record collecting, and drawing inspiration from art and design.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Bay Area,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | Women's Group

Name: Hyun Koo
Professional Bio:
Hyun Koo is a Partner at March Capital where he primarily focuses on vertical AI applications, identifying inspiring tech entrepreneurs who are solving mission-critical problems in large, growing markets. Hyun has board responsibilities at March portfolio companies Altana, Luminance, and Rosie.

Growing up in Seoul, Singapore, and New York, Hyun developed people skills and an interest in global markets early in life. After completing his undergraduate degree at the University of Michigan (BBA, Finance; BS, Mathematics), Hyun began his career in investment banking covering media, consumer internet, and enterprise software. Prior to March, Hyun was at Allen & Company, where he executed M&A, equity financing, and various strategic assignments for some of world’s leading technology companies. Throughout his career, Hyun has had the privilege of working with many market-leading companies across all stages (seed to large cap public) and alongside many successful CEOs, which has helped him build a deep understanding of various business models, financials, successful leadership qualities, and the private & public markets.

In 2020, after close to a decade in investment banking, Hyun was looking for a new way to leverage his expertise in technology and rapidly transforming industries. This search led him to March, with whose leadership team, exceptional track record, and company values he was already familiar. Hyun was recognized on Business Insider’s 2023 Rising Stars of VC list.
Education/Personal Bio: Hyun received a BBA in Finance and BS in Mathematics from the University of Michigan’s Stephen M. Ross School of Business and College of LSA, respectively. Hyun is actively involved in programs in support of growing the broader AAPI community and is an aspiring scratch golfer. He is also a passionate restauranteur, having co-founded the award winning omakase restaurant, the Office of Mr. Moto, in New York City.
Groups In: Kauffman Fellows Community,KF | Los Angeles,KF SIG | AI

Name: Marianna Bonechi
Investing Thesis: Dnipro VC invest in pre-seed and seed stage AI and cyber companies co-founded by Ukrainian tech diaspora.
Professional Bio:
Marianna Bonechi is the Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Dnipro VC, a Silicon Valley-based venture capital fund investing in early-stage AI and cybersecurity companies with Ukrainian ties. She brings a global perspective and deep cross-sector experience to early-stage investing, shaped by a decade in corporate development and investment banking M&A covering TMT sector.

Before launching Dnipro VC, Marianna founded Slava Ventures, where she began backing mission-driven founders in frontier technology. Her path into venture was preceded by her role at Open Austria, the Republic of Austria’s diplomatic mission in San Francisco, where she led the global AI initiative in 2018. There, she built bridges between tech executives, AI researchers, diplomats, and early-stage AI-native founders—gaining early conviction in the transformative power of generative AI. This work laid the foundation for her angel investments in GenAI startups, many of which she helped scale from inception.
Education/Personal Bio: Marianna holds an MSc in International Finance from SKEMA Business School in Sophia Antipolis, France, and a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration from FH Burgenland in Austria.

Name: Ashley Lewis
Professional Bio: Ashley Lewis is the Managing Partner and Head of DPI’s Venture Capital Platform. Before joining DPI, Ashley was a Partner focused on the Africa region with Accion Venture Lab, Accion’s venture arm focused on FinTech for the underserved. Ashley has 18 years of experience across financial services, investments and social ventures, and has dedicated her time to investing in and scaling social ventures across sub-Saharan Africa and Southeast Asia. In addition to her time at Accion, Ashley was also an investment consultant and early-stage venture accelerator manager with LGT Venture Philanthropy in Thailand and Uganda. Ashley also brings experience from her time in the institutional asset management arms of Goldman Sachs and Vanguard.
Education/Personal Bio: Ashley holds a bachelor’s degree from the HBCU Morgan State University and an MBA from HEC Paris. She is a fellow of the Finance Innovation Lab of London.

Name: Althea Wishloff
Professional Bio:
Althea is a General Partner at Raven Capital, the first venture fund focussed on investing in Native-led and Indigenous-led companies. Humbly, Althea was the first Indigenous woman of Canada to become a GP at a venture firm. At Raven, Althea leads their U.S. practice and, while Raven is a generalist investor, Althea loves spending time with health and technology companies. 

Prior to Raven, Althea was the co-CEO of Koble (acq: Dialogue Technologies), a perinatal digital health solution, and a pre-seed/seed-stage investor with Panache Ventures. 

While startup boards occupy much of her time, she also loves working with community organizations: Althea is a Venture Partner at Adrenaline, an Advisory Leadership Member at MIT's Indigenous SOLVE Program, a Director for the Indigenous Leadership Circle, and a Instructor at the Rematriating Economies Apprenticeship.
Education/Personal Bio:
Althea is an Indigenous person of the Gitxsan First Nation and currently resides in New York City (traditional homelands of the Lenape Peoples) with her family. 

Althea graduated from the University of British Columbia and later went on to pursue her CFA, completing Level I and II. Althea was also an Adjunct Professor for five years at the Schulich School of Business, teaching private equity classes.

Outside of computer-land, Althea loves reading, biking, and playing bonus-mom to her young siblings.
